column1: ProfileIndex looping issue
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Check out insertNoCache() in profileStoreDB…We have a infinite loop happening because we are not catching an exception like we should. This line of code keeps getting thrown: throw new LearnerException("LE-00001: Cannot INSERT due to ProfileIndex Key Violation. Profile with key '"+key+"' in table '"+tablename+"' is already there.");…This exception keeps getting hit but we don’t post it to our logs. All we do is throw it then it gets propagated and masked in our logs. So what happens is we keep trying to insert a new profile in profilestoredata but can’t because we have it is already in the profile index table. 

1) we need to have this error go to the logs (can’t believe this was tested and no one checked if it was being written to the logs).
2) we need to handle this exception better.
3)We can use the loop to our advantage and before we throw a expection we can delete the profileindex so that when it loops again it inserts into the correct tables without a error and moves on to the next account.

The following loop will happen in the logs:

 27-Feb-2017 21:36:24,134 - - ERROR ProfileStorageBase:1296 - Cannot decode Profile. Reinitializing Profile with key	007051712383@@Customer_Account@@1006_1006 
27-Feb-2017 21:36:24,157 - - INFO ProfileStorageBase:1354 - Wrote Profile that cannot be decoded to archive at /opt/bae/processing4/ApplicationHome/profilearchive/007051712383@@Customer_Account@@1006_1006.exception.txt 
27-Feb-2017 21:36:24,158 - - ERROR ProfileStoreDB:1431 - Illegal ProfileData. Cannot decode for Customer_Account/007051712383. Profile will be Reinitialized! 
27-Feb-2017 21:36:24,178 - - ERROR ProfileStorageBase:1296 - Cannot decode Profile. Reinitializing Profile with key	007051712383@@Customer_Account@@1006_1006 
27-Feb-2017 21:36:24,181 - - INFO ProfileStorageBase:1354 - Wrote Profile that cannot be decoded to archive at /opt/bae/processing4/ApplicationHome/profilearchive/007051712383@@Customer_Account@@1006_1006.exception.txt 
27-Feb-2017 21:36:24,182 - - ERROR ProfileStoreDB:1431 - Illegal ProfileData. Cannot decode for Customer_Account/007051712383. Profile will be Reinitialized! 
27-Feb-2017 21:36:24,185 - - WARN ProfileLock:199 - Processing Exception: Related profiles and source vectors are as : 007059391701@@CurrentBeneficiary_CurrentBeneficiary@@1006_1006 => (related profiles need to be rebuilt!)
column352: Delete a row from profilestoredata table. Keep the associated row in profileIndex table. Go into service manager and send a JMS message with a account associated with the profile.

column1: CLONE - Non thread safe code in java.text.SimpleDateFormat caused scenario engine failure at AIB
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Edited on 29/09/14 to record the correct description and title for the issue. Originally it was thought that profile corruption was happening when this issue occurred. Following investigations by Kieran Mc Kenna of CE it was found that the profile output to the profilearchive folder was a valid profile and could successfully be decoded by the code. The actual issue was an exception thrown when formatting dates that was causing complete scenario engine failure. This was sometimes manifesting as a failure to decode profiles, but this was due to a problem while decoding the profile rather than a problem in the profile data.

==================================================================================
Client reported that processing stopped completely after promoting a new processing model to production. I have requested an export of the old and new model from the client.

Profile corruption is reported in the attached logs( [^RTLogs.zip] ), including a stack trace which seems to explain the reason why.

Also, I have attached a wily report ( [^Detica_Prod_20140815.pdf] ) which shows all web threads stalled from when this issue occurred.

The profile corruption is reported at the following points in the norkom logs:

column352:
Random - seems to depend 
on machine spec - the faster the machine, the more likely these symptoms will occur.

Fix is to use the Apache FastDateFormat in DateUtil.java instead of SimpleDateFormat (FastDateFormat is thread-safe, whereas SimpleDateFormat is not)
column369:
21/Mar/2017 10:39 AM;kmackenna1;This P1 (production) issue occurred back in 2014 with AIB-OLPF and, recently, in NFCU (again, Production).

The original AIB fix, carries this SVN comment

{code}
[NRNA1094-1057] Checking in implementation of FastDateFormat class, in DateUtil.java. FastDateFormat is a thread-safe, faster version of SimpleDateFormat, according to the Apache documentation. Of the six tests run, thus far, by the customer, they have experienced no ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsExceptionS.
{code}

Unfortunately, this issue is rare and multi-threaded in nature.

However, it has now happened twice in 2 separate production environments, which merits consideration as a Platform candidate.

The AIB hijacked class, DateUtil.java, is attached - relevant changes are any references to FastDateFormat,

Thanks,

Kieran
column370:
21/Mar/2017 10:42 AM;kmackenna1;Hi Paul,

As prompted by Vikram, cloning this from the AIB_OLPF project to Platform, so it won't get lost.

See my foregoing comment for more details.

Thanks,

Kieran
column371: 21/Mar/2017 10:47 AM;Pnolan;Dejan, can you review this proposed fix and comment on the JIRA? Thanks...
column372:
21/Mar/2017 01:22 PM;dejanlazic;There are a few options to fix this well known Java problem:

Date formats are not synchronized. It is recommended to create separate format instances for each thread. If multiple threads access a format concurrently, it must be synchronized externally.

1) Modifying existing code in a way to safely use DateFormats in a multi-threaded environment by using a *ThreadLocal* variable to hold the DateFormat object, which means that each thread will have its own copy, i.e. doesn't need to wait for other threads to release it.

2) Replacing current implementation of SimpleDateFormat with Apache commons-lang *FastDateParser* class, that is a thread-safe substitute of SimpleDateFormat for Gregorian calendar.
Since version 3.2 it supports both parsing and formatting, before 3.2 only formatting.

3) Upgrading to *Java 8*, which introduces the new java.time package, including *DateTimeFormatter* which is thread-safe (immutable alternative to SimpleDateFormat)

column1: CLONE - Fuzzy Abbreviation Scores are incorrect (rounding)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column352:
The Fuzzy Abbreviation scores seem to be rounding incorrectly

 

Looking at the following example

 

Input                                     f g henderson

Factiva record                    arthur frank gabriel Henderson

 

gives 100 for Henderson matching, 0.8 for initial g matching Gabriel, 0.8 for initial f matching frank and 0.8 for no match for Arthur

(100+80+80+80)/4

= 85%

 

The actual score given by the tool is 0.84999996 

This is a very important difference as 85% is a common rule threshold

 

In this example an Alert should trigger as the score should be 85%

No Alert is generated as the tool returns 84.999996 %

A difference of 0.000004%, but a very important difference

column1: WLM-PROCESS for swift doesn't take into consideration provided datasource variable

'acquisition.swift.datasource.I'
'acquisition.swift.datasource.O'
 

The bug is that if you provide your desired datasource in the wlm-process, the application will overwrite it by the system parameters...

so logic way would be that the provided datasource prevails to the system parameters or at least warns client that you forcefully change it.

- within that sequence define a WLM-process to another datasource than swift
- application will send the message to SWIFT data source.

column370:
06/Jan/2017 11:35 AM;carolinetoland;Guys, I have raised the priority of this ticket. This extra white space:
* Makes the screen look awful
* Means the user has to do an unacceptable amount of scrolling to get to the content below the list
column371: 06/Jan/2017 12:07 PM;Pnolan;It's possible that the white space can be reduced but I don't think it can be eliminated. If there is no white space, then the bottom of the section will start moving up and down as the user enters values in the filter fields. Filtering the data shouldn't affect the screen layout in this fashion so we will always need some kind of buffer to prevent this.
column372: 06/Jan/2017 12:24 PM;carolinetoland;I disagree Paul - filtering reduces the content - it does not extend it - so why is a buffer required?
column373: 06/Jan/2017 12:31 PM;Pnolan;With no buffer, if you filter the data to reduce the amount of rows then the bottom of the section will start moving up with each key press (or down again, if you start deleting the characters in the filter field). That would affect the layout of the screen, since any sections below the list would have to move up and down as well.
column374:
06/Jan/2017 03:23 PM;carolinetoland;Hi Paul - ok - I see what you mean... but in that case, why don't we dynamically override the page size of the list if necessary before we first render the section?

For example, if the page size is set to show 5 rows, and there _are_ 5 (or more) rows of data, then the section should have enough space to show 5 rows - and if the user filters to bring back 2 or 3 rows only, the extra space at the end is fine, and understandable.

But if the page size is set to show 5 rows, and the initial query only brings back 2 rows, then why can't we dynamically re-set the section to have a page size of 2, since the user might filter down to 1 or 0 rows, but they can never filter 'up' to 10 rows....

If the page size could be dynamically reduced in this way, we would not have to hard code 'extra' space at the end...

Regards,
Caroline.

column1: CLONE - Datasource conditions are duplicated on import.
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When importing a filtering config the datasource conditions are duplicated on the database.
In the application only one is visible.
But when trying to delete a condition after, it will only delete 1.
This has a high risk if a config with a removed condition is imported on a production environment that the condition is not removed.
column216: Code merge sub-tasks have been created.
column352:
Import attached filtering config.
Import it again.
Execute the below query to see that the datasource condition is duplicated for all checks that use it.

select c.check_name,ds.DATA_SOURCE_CONDITION_ID,dsf.field_name,ct.DESCRIPTION_KEY,ds.value,ds.is_deleted,dsf.IS_DELETED, ds.*
from check_definition c, data_source d, data_source_check ds, compare_type ct, data_source_field dsf
where c.data_source_id=d.id
and c.id=ds.check_definition_id
and ds.compare_type_id=ct.id
and ds.DATA_SOURCE_Field_ID=dsf.id
and d.id=dsf.data_source_id
and d.name='SWIFT_OUT_AUSTRALIA'
and field_name='trade_message'
order by check_name,dsf.field_name,ds.value,dsf.is_deleted;
column357: Manual tests passed (fix was done in 7.4 trunk)
column369:
24/Jan/2017 01:47 PM;MvanLaere1;Hi,

Issue is related to the DataSourceCeck class that doesn’t include the id in equals, compareTo or hashCode methods.
As a result, none of the duplicates are accessible using Sets (because they have same key) so they are not shown on GUI and not used during processing (that is ok).
Another consequence is that if two (or more) checkDefinition of same DataSource have the same dataSourceCheck condition (ConditionID, DsField, Comparator and Value) duplicates are created during import because DataSourceCheck sets of such checkDefinitions have same key when added to checksToDelete set so only first one is really added in that set and so only first one is deleted. As DataSourceCheck are recreated during import, this result in duplicates being created (except for first one that has really been deleted).
The solution is to include the id in DataSourceCheck‘s equals, compareTo and hashCode methods.
Please note that currently, although duplicates exist in data base, they are not seen in the GUI nor are they evaluated during processing (because they all have the same key for the Hibernate sets and so again only one is added in the set).
With the fix, existing duplicates will be seen in GUI and will be evaluates during processing so *{color:red}it is important to clean up an already corrupted configuration{color}* (= having already duplicates), 
One way to do this is to first *export* the configuration using the *{color:red}non-fixed code{color}* (so that duplicates are not exported) and *re-import* it using the *{color:red}fixed code{color}* (so that duplicates are not created). 
Should the user later creates duplicates using the GUI is his own responsibility.

Marc
column370:
28/Apr/2017 04:22 PM;AManayangath;Fixed as ticket: https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/WLM-905
Confluece page: http://confluence/display/Eng/WLM-905+-+Generating+Duplicate+Datasource+Condition+-+An+Issue

Migration Risk: See confluence page for additonal steps if upgrading.

column1: CLONE - Property settings in the database incorrectly override local settings from file after reload
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Property file settings in the database incorrectly override local settings from file after reload.

I am seeing that a property in the database that differs from the value in the file is being applied instead of the file value.

The reason seems to be that the second load of the file in the *PropertyManager* class does not take place if the file has not been modfiied. Therefore, the database properties take precedence.

This has a potentially severe/fatal impact as the properties control many important aspects of the system.
column352:
Property file settings in the database incorrectly override local settings from file after reload.
I am seeing that a property in the database that differs from the value in the file is being applied instead of the file value.
The reason seems to be that the second load of the file in the PropertyManager class does not take place if the file has not been modfiied. Therefore, the database properties take precedence.
This has a potentially severe/fatal impact as the properties control many important aspects of the system.
column370: 07/Apr/2017 03:22 PM;Pnolan;Giuseppe, this method is unchanged since a number of performance updates were applied in 2009. I am not certain of the original intention of the design, but this is how the application has behaved from 5.8.3 onwards.
column371:
07/Apr/2017 03:40 PM;RHome;Originally (in 5.something) the system parameters were loaded only from a file, so the "only reload if the file has changed" logic was valid. 

When the system_parameters database table was introduced the file was retained, partly for bootstrap purposes, but also so that (I understand) it was possible to have system local properties in the file overriding the database settings (which are global).

So the sequence is:
1. Load from file (bootstrap in case there are database settings in the file)
2. Load from database
3. Load from file to overwrite global settings with local settings.

But (3) is done only if the file has changed since the last modification date. So the first time it is called it does overwrite the global settings, but subsequently, it is not reloaded unless someone touches the file.

Clearly, the behaviour at the moment is not consistent. You have one set of settings after the system boots and then all of a sudden for no well explained reason it changes.

I am not sure if it is stated somewhere that file settings override database settings, but I think it is well believed in Services that it does.

I think we need a statement has to how it should work, and then that needs to be implemented to work like that consistently.
column372: 10/Apr/2017 12:39 PM;Pnolan;Andy, can you review this issue? Thanks...
column374:
18/Apr/2017 09:34 AM;RHome;Andrew,

Concerning your last paragraph.

I think the  com.norkom.base.web.util.WebPropertyManager class is just plain wrong.

My understanding is that the file should override the database settings. This is because the file is local to a node whereas the database is global. Therefore, for the override function to work, the file has to be read last. However, it is also read first in order to bootstrap the system in case of standalone, etc where the database connection settings might be in the file.

In the PropertyManager:

The problem is that *we don't want to prevent the file from being re-read*. It has to be re-read, otherwise you get different results between the first and subsequent times the properties are loaded. Recall that recently the system was modified to dynamically reload properties periodically.

The first time the file is loaded (on boot time):

Properties loaded from file
Properties loaded from database overwrites file
Properties loaded from file overwrite database

The second and subsequent times:
Properties loaded from file
Properties loaded from database overwrites file

So you can see that the behaviour is different in each case, and I believe the second case is wrong.
column375: 17/May/2017 10:58 AM;RHome;Is there any progress on this?
column376: 17/May/2017 11:04 AM;andrewredmond;Assigning to Paul
column377:
31/May/2017 12:48 PM;AByrne1;I'm adding some updates to the sequence of events here,  after observing the behaviour in a local environment

 *Application startup - Bean instantiation*
* AlertMatch - calls com.norkom.common.util.PropertyManager to set it's properties which holds an static variable to com.norkom.base.util.PropertyManager
** loads from File initially,  Database,  File again
* PropertyManager
** loads from Database, File  ( unlike the initialLoad Boolean which controls loading the file initially, the configFileLastModifiedTime is not static so the value from the previous AlertMatch instantiation did not get retained so the File is reloaded
*PermissionLogicFacade - This loads, permissions, domains, menu etc..  and properties so calls the initialize method on com.norkom.base.util.PropertyManager each time.
** loads from Database.  Then File only if last modified time has changed.

*Initializing Applications*
** ScreenHelper.initialize() calls WebPropertiesManager.initialize()
*** loads from File,  then Database

*com.norkom.base.business.jobs.ApplicationStateController*
* A quartz job that executes to reload permissionValidator but initializes the load of permissions, domains, orgunits, menu, and Properties
** loads from DB,  then File only if last modified time has changed.

*Other Events*
* Login, Application Reload, Logout are other events that trigger the initialize method on the WebPropertiesManager.
** the sequence is load from DB, then File only if last modified time has changed.


So there are multiple times/paths when the DB can reset any duplicated properties

column1: CLONE -  There are services manager functions that present the user with a comma separated string (e.g. alert keys->ALERT_KEY_LIST) which are not compatible with SQL prepared Statements.
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Ross Nathan added a comment - 22/Feb/2017 08:20 PM - Restricted to Detica
Hi Jonas,
The issue with this is not that we have been forced to used prepared statements, this part is fine.
the issue is that there are funcitonns within services manager that present the user with a comma seperated string of alert keys ALERT_KEY_LIST.
A lot of projects currently use this as part of a SQL in clause to retrieve more details on the alert that was fired, or to post update the alert with more details. This is pretty standard project practice for real time.
The issue here, is that this change is not backwards compatable and now stands to break every single project that currently uses this, and it now puts us in a position where no project can make any use of this in the future.
If backwards compatability is key for changes like this, we have failed in that respect and the issue needs to be treated as such.
Rgds
Ross.

column377: 14/Jun/2017 02:37 PM;CFinnegan;3 Story points
column378:
22/Jun/2017 03:40 PM;jonasfolgado;Hi Gambhir,

I've spoken with APPS department to clarify why this has been detected before. The standard product (APPS) doesn't need this kind of replacement but we think it could be a good idea to include it, actually we use that kind of replacement for some workflow action functions.

The only way to allow this kind of replacement, respecting backaward compatibility, is to include a new parameter for the functions DatabaseUpdateRealTimeFunction and DatabaseQueryRealTimeFunction .
 The new parameter will be called "useMultiValueStatements" and it will make the replacements as below:

- We guess there is a csv parameter in the sequence context like "ALERT_KEY_LIST"="1,2,3,4,5".  In the case of having the data in an array , the function ConvertStringArrayRealTimeFunction can be used to convert it.
- In the case of having a query like "select * from APPLICATIONS where alert_id IN ([ALERT_KEY_LIST])", this will be replaced by "select * from APPLICATIONS where alert_id IN (?,?,?,?,?)" setting the proper values in the prepared stament.

I am still in discussion with APPS about the best solution, but we'd like to know your opinion as well. Do you agree with this design?

thanks and regards
column379:
22/Jun/2017 11:33 PM;RNathan;Hi Jonas,

Agree that Apps dont use this, but its a very common function for services projects to use. There are alos a lot of existing projcets that have used this in the past which makes this a difficult migration task on any future upgrades.
Really, we dont care how its resolved, just so long as we can make use of the comma seperated values.

Rgds
Ross.

column1: CLONE - Context sensitive period normalisation does not work correctly if there are two matching patterns in the input
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
A reminder.

With context sensitive period normalisation enabled, a sequence of single letters followed by dots followed by a word is normalised differently from a sequence of single letters followed by dots.

E.g.

"r.mugabe" should be normalised to "r mugabe"

whereas:

"i.s.i.s" is normalised to "isis"

However, the code is not correct and it always checks for the first matching regular expression anywhere in the input, even when evaluating whether to apply the rule to a second pattern. This code worked in 6.1.2 but seems to have been changed for the new normalisation framework.

So the input:

"r.mugabe works for i.s.i.s" should give "r mugabe works for isis", but in fact gives "r mugabe works for i s i s".

There is therefore a risk that the second expression will not match with a watch-list entry.

Note:
There is the question: how should "o.b.laden" be normalised?

The documented rule that a dot is removed if surrounded by two single characters implies it should be "ob laden". However this does cause problems with the abbreviation match algorithms. We could insist that a space needs to follow the abbreviations before joining them, but then we have different normalisation results for "o.b.laden" and "o.b. laden" and also "i.s.i.s.levant" and "i.s.is. levant".

At Rabobank (who were using the 6.1.2 code), a variant was used to replace periods with spaces for abbreviation match.

Probably the only effective solution is a new concatenated abbreviation match algorithm.
column352:
Use the normalisation tester to try the expression

o.b.laden works for i.s.i.s

with the reference default rules and context sensitive period matching.
column370:
24/Feb/2017 03:47 PM;RHome;I have been looking at the unit tests for this. These were updated for PLAT-18618, and it seems that the unit tests were written to pass with the bug in it.

So if this is fixed, the unit tests will need to be updated, and failures should be expected with the ones as they stand.

For example, these are the tests:

{noformat}
"S...R...L" should g to "srl"
"S..R..RL" should go to "s r rl"
{noformat}

So in the first case, consecutive periods are removed between S & R and R & L. In the second case, they should be removed between S & R but not R & RL, but they are not removed because of this bug and the unit test expectation reflects the bug.

So probably the second one is wrong, unless you want consecutive period to always be treated as spaces.

column1: db2 - WLM List Filters based on numbers cause indexing to fail
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The WLM list filtering does not work correctly on db2 when a filter is created on a number field. The same issue does not occur on Oracle.

As it stands, list filters cannot be used in db2 on number columns.

I suspect the problem is caused by the structure of the list_data and list_data_value tables, as all list data values are contained in a single column (data_value) on the list_data_value table, which leads to the filtering SQL query calling "to_number" on non-number values.

The relevant part of the error log is the following, which suggests that we are attempting to call a "to_number" cast on a non-number value.

column372:
23/Jul/2019 11:27 AM;RHome;Also happening at DNB.

 

We can’t build indexes on start-up due to this failure (well – we build one, then it fails).

 The WLM cluster topic logic tries to execute a procedure from the application configurator cache after it has built an index (I guess this is a new thing). Trouble is that the application configuration isn’t loaded yet so it fails.

 Actually, the ScreenHelper class which holds the application configuration does have a locking mechanism so that it prevents stuff being accessed while it is initialising.

 It creates a write-lock during initialisation and any readers need to acquire a read-lock which will cause them to block waiting for the initialisation to finish.

 The flaw in the plan is that if someone tries to get a read-lock before the initialisation method is even started they will succeed and get access to the empty configurator cache.

 A possible fix would be to lock the configurator cache as soon as the ScreenHelper is created (in the constructor) so that it is created in a locked state and only unlocked when initialisation is complete.
column373:
23/Jul/2019 02:47 PM;AManayangath;Hi Richard,

Also this ticket is in the GEP Jira: https://engineering/jira/browse/WLM-2166

thanks,
Ashok.
column374:
24/Jul/2019 08:45 AM;RHome;Ashok, I haven't implemented that fix (actually, it is not my project really). I can see that the ScreenHelper is already initialised from the ConfiguratorInitServlet, but I suppose that it is not invoked quickly enough.

Is it guaranteed that this bean will be initialised quickly enough to prevent the problem? I don't see anything directly linking it to the WlmClusterTopicPlugin.

It seems like this is a workaround as it isn't guaranteed to work and maybe it would result in the procedures cache being loaded twice.

But we can try it out as a workaround.

column1: Generic Query section - Clear button doesn't properly clear the section form
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
In recent versions of the Platform the Clear button on the Generic Query section stopped working properly (compared to 7.3, for instance).

On the UI, the section fields are being cleared, but the HTML form seems not to be cleared properly, because when the form is submitted (after clicking a submit button), the data set before "clearing" is still being submitted.

However, when the user manually clears all the fields (delets text from text fields, selects null options from dropdowns), and then clicks the submit button, the data is properly cleared and a clear form is submitted.

The impact of this issue on the APPS configuration is that the "Clear" button functionality doesn't work, so we have a functionality gap because of this. In particular, it prevents WLM-225 from being properly QA-d and delivered.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
1. Log in as wlminvestigator/Password1
2. Go to Group Work -> Transaction Worklist
3. Click the "Transaction Worklist Preferences" button in the screen toolbar
4. On the Preferences screen, select some values for the fields present on the screen, then click the "Save and Perform" button; this will bring you back to the previous screen.
5. Click again the "Transaction Worklist Preferences" button.
6. This time click the "Clear" button and then the "Save and Perform" button.

Expected Result: the Transaction Worklist screen should not have any fields pre-populated apart from the "Alert Date Between"

Actual Result: the fields that have been previously set on the "Preferences" screen are still pre-populated on the Transaction Worklist screen.

column1: Date and Date Time columns cause Interactive Lists to load indefinitely
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The Date column and Date Time column, when displayed in an Interactive List, cause the list to never stop loading. When the user hides all the Date and Date Time columns, the problem disappears.

This problem affects many screens in the APPS configuration (not only the Transaction Worklist mentioned in the "Steps to Reproduce", but also, for instance, All Alerts and My Alerts screens).
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
1. Log into the application with wlminvestigator/Password1
2. Go to Group Work -> Transaction Worklist
3. Make sure that "Alert Date/Time" or "Value Date" columns are turned on.

Expected result: the results section should initially show an empty result set ("No rows found" information)
Actual result: the list doesn't stop loading - the "Processing" spinner never goes away.

column1: CLONE - duplicate replacement container "whereCondition"
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi Tatiana,

we experience an issue with duplicate replacement container "whereCondition" which prevents the search from being executed. 
!wherecondition.jpg!

It is added everytime a standard list was imported.

Our workaround is to logout and login again, but this is not practicable.

Please help us.
Thank You

BR Peter

Many thanks in advance,

column372:
13/Jun/2017 11:35 AM;EKilleen;Hi, 

After investigating this issue below are my findings:

1. The issue is a platform issue. 
2. The issue occurs in the workflow functionality WorflowRequestHelper -> handleWorflowSteps.  From what I can see an additional where condition is added in this code when one already exists in the replacements container in the whereCondition map.  Any changes will have be carried out by the application builder team as this code is called through the application on a number of screens not just wlm.  

*Steps I carried out to test on core platform*
1. Create a standard list 
2. Select import data button at the top of the table.  The first workflow screen is displayed, one whereCondition exists in the RC. 
3. Select next, view the RC using debug, two whereConditions now exist in the RC.  
@Application Builder team:  Is the correct?  Should two whereConditions exists?

Thanks
Ethna

column357: Inline browser should now work when SSL is enabled

column380:
17/Jul/2017 10:20 AM;andrewredmond;Hi David

Thanks for this. I can see the issue occurring on the https environment now but unfortunately there are no errors in the console of the browser that would indicate why the section is not rendering. I'm wondering if something is going wrong on the server.

Are there any errors in the logs? Would you be able to turn on debug logging for the following class and retest to see if anything appears in the logs that would help diagnose what is happening here?

com.norkom.configurator.web.screens.sections.impl.UrlSectionController

Also I'd like to confirm what type of inline browser is in use here. The UrlSectionController contains functionality to support two distinct types of browsers; the first uses a third party library called webrenderer which uses an applet whilst the second is javascript based and uses an iframe.

There was a section parameter called "urlType" that controls which one of the above browsers is rendered. This parameter was deprecated however and the section controller should now default to using the javascript based browser.

I'd like to confirm that this is the case for both of your environments. The only way I can do is is by querying the database. Can you provide database connection details for both also please?

Thanks

Andy
column381:
18/Jul/2017 12:14 AM;ddechent;Hi Andrew,

I've added the requested debugging to the log4j.properties file, restarted the environment, but it still is not sending any debugging when this error is encountered. I also did not find anything in the java console. 

I would like to defer to Vikram on wheher it is using the webrenderer or javascript. I know that when http:// is used, it is utilizing bing, instead of google.

column382:
18/Jul/2017 12:40 PM;andrewredmond;Hi Vikram/David

From my investigation into this issue I can now confirm that the in line browser in use is not the Webrenderer one but our own IFRAME/Javascript implementation. This make sense as I believe the Webrenderer browser is no longer supported in browsers due to it being an applet.

I have reworked the code slightly and I believe this will resolve the issue. I hope to commit it to trunk tomorrow.

Is there a plan for how you will deliver this fix to the client? Will you merge the fix from trunk into a client project?

Thanks

Andy

column1: SE processing exception handling fails due to "Illegal attempt to associate a collection with two open sessions"  Hibernate exception
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The problem is related to integration with the Batch Framework . 
When a processing exception occurs, it is caught at high level in ProcessingAction.executeMessage(ControlMessage) and error handling is delegated to AcquisitionAction.handleError(Exception) method.
This method tries to update the BatchProcess instance but if that object was created (by another thread) in a context of a transaction an  "Illegal attempt to associate a collection with two open sessions" Hibernate exception is thrown causing error handling to prematurely stop.
column352:
Configure SE to be run from external trigger (i.e.: using service function  TRIGGER)
Generate an SE exception: (i.e.: put null in time field )
column369:
27/Jun/2017 02:56 PM;MvanLaere1;When DirectSourceProcessJob is started in the context of a transaction (i.e.: external trigger),he created BatchProcess instance remains linked to the hibernate session associated with the thread running the job.
When the processing thread handling the error tries to update the BatchProcess instance, the   "Illegal attempt to associate a collection with two open sessions" is thrown because the BatchProcess's parameters collection is still linked to the Hibernate session associated with the thread that created the BatchProcess instance while the processing thread handling the error tries to link it to the Hibernated session associated to it.
Due to that exception, the error handling is not complete and as numberOfPathsInError and acquisitionException are not set, the loop waiting for the end of processing path execution doesn't end and the Processing error handler is  not called (apparently the DirectSourceProcessJob  doesn't end).

This doesn't occur when the DirectSourceProcessJob is created by a scheduler MDB thread ('i.e. interval trigger) because in that case, there is no active transaction and so the Hibernate template automatically close the session and so objects are unlinked.
 Note that simply adding a explicit flush is not enough because in a context of a transaction, the flush doesn't unlink the object from the session.

The same error would probably occur when pause/abort would be used. 

The code fix at project level consist of doing an explicit "evict" of the BatchProcess instance.
Maybe a better solution should be to let BatdhProcess instance be updated only by the thread that monitor the processing paths execution §as part of its waiting loop) instead of having potentially concurrent updates done by different threads.

Marc

column1: Application Triggers implementation affecting WLM Config import process performance
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
It has been identified that there is a workaround, introduced for the Hibernate issue (https://hibernate.atlassian.net/browse/HHH-2763), is slow to an un-acceptable level, which is affecting WLM import process performance. 
This workaround has been implemented as part of Application Triggers, a feature development against PLAT-20240 for 7.3.1 release. 

See: " !longest-running-methods-while-importing.png|thumbnail! " and " !entity-event-listener-while-importing.png|thumbnail! " for details about the time taken by the "markCollectionsAsProcessed method of com.norkom.configurator.business.trigger.EntityEventListener.class" while importing WLM configuration in REFRESH mode. 

For further details about the performance figures, consult the confluence page of WLM-1903: http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=63995960 

Test data - WLM config exported from standard QA environment:  [^filtering-export-with-list-data.zip] ,  [^filtering-export-without-list-data.zip] 

Note: The impact of this workaround is not only specific to WLM import process, it looks like that EACH area in the product where Hibernate's onSaveOrUpdate and onDelete methods invoked, are affected. 

Implementation hints:
----------------------------
1. Revisit the design of the Application Triggers feature (http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/display/apps/Application+Triggers) and find out a way, how can we generate Hibernate events conditionally.
2. Upgrade to Hibernate version 4.0.x, this upgrade should make it possible to remove this workaround. Assuming this upgrade shall not create any additional bottleneck otherwise performance should be improved across the board. Large scale testing should be planned to verify regression.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352: Profile WLM Configuration import. 50% of the total time is taken by the EntityEventListener.markCollectionsAsProcessed() method.

column1: Can't print a Case report
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:

{panel}28-Aug-2017 14:36:51,821 - User-1158 - Session-1484 WARN  RequestUtils:200 - No FormBeanConfig found under 'viewScreen'
28-Aug-2017 14:36:52,047 - User-1158 - Session-1484 WARN  NorkomRequestWrapperWhiteListFilter:142 -     Dropped unencrypted request parameter [reportName]
28-Aug-2017 14:36:52,048 - User-1158 - Session-1484 ERROR ExecuteReportServlet:117 - Unable to generate report
CFG-10081 - Report parameter 'reportId, reportName' not specified - CFG-10081
{panel}
I believe this issue is caused by url encryption enhancements in 7.4
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
1. Login
2. Open a Case from My Cases or Active Cases
3. Hit Print button in Assemble and View Case Information

Expected result: Case report displays and user can print
Actual result: Blank tab opens and no report is generated
column369:
28/Aug/2017 04:25 PM;JVanAms;Moved the issue from APPS over to PLAT.
Seems 'reportName' is missing from whitelistedParameterNames in ApplicationConstants.java and gets dropped if encryption is on.
column370:
28/Sep/2017 01:09 PM;smielcarek;The "Print" report link for case causes blank screen, because it currently uses Navigation Action Button, which doesn't encrypt URL intentionally, so unsafe parameters in URL (raportName here) are removed from request. The fix can be introduced by adding raportName URL parameter to "white list" in the platform code so that is is accepted, but the URL will remain unencrypted.

Much better solution is to change the button type from Navigation Action Button to Report Button, which encrypts URLs and displays case report correctly. Can we therefore treat this issue as misconfigured button and change it's type in the configuration?
column371:
28/Sep/2017 01:44 PM;SHanley;Hi Sebastian,

Also, this pattern adopted by Apps is likely to be extensively used in Services projects. I've asked Lloyds team to see if this would work for our similar issue. It may otherwise be necessary to do a hijack on the Lloyds project to workaround if our needs differ from Apps.

Regards,

Stephen

column1: CLONE - Reporting mechanism doesn't scale well due to poor memory management and no usage of stream buffers
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The report plugin mechanism handles memory somewhat inefficiently and will probably have difficulty scaling up to large amounts of users.  The area that concerns me is that the entire report is passed from method, to method down the line in the stack trace, rather than printing to the response buffer, or other file buffer or email buffer if the report isn't printed to the screen.

For very large reports, that can be very large amounts of data, like 17 Megs passed from method to method.  Get 50 users in there requesting reports at the same time and I suspect the server will crawl to its knees.

I would recommend that this area be refactored sometime in the future so that the ExecuteReportServlet:lines 97-123 be refactored to pass in the response object to the reporting mechanism to allow the report mechanism to write to the response stream, and stream the results little by little, rather than trying to build everything and then push the entire report in one go.

Neil has already run into this a little bit, and it is at the root of his problems with ticket PLAT-5060.

column1: CLONE - EIM screen history issue
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi,

I wanted to raise what I believe to be a bug within EIM and SNA integration for GI 2.0. (as part of implementation for ICBC)

The behaviour I’m seeing that is causing problems is as follows:
1. Login to EIM.
2. Do a few operations in EIM, then open Visualizer. Visualizer will open in new window.
3. Open Doc viewer from Visualizer – this will also open in new window. Tentatively close the doc viewer.
4. Now go back to EIM screen and use the “go to previous screen” functionality. This will open the Doc viewer accessed from Visualizer. 

Doc viewer part of application does not have “go to previous screen” functionality, so it does not allow to use the application in proper way. This will cause a lot of confusion for the investigators as well, as it really should not be the expected behaviour.

From my perspective 2 solutions would be valid for this:
1. Make sure that doc viewers opened from Visualizer do not account to screen history on EIM
2. Make possible to navigate to previous screen from Visualizer Doc viewers.

Let me know if there are any questions to this.

column1: CLONE - [RNL-296] Narrativewithoptions transformer does not extract the narrative text correctly
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
{panel:title=Executive Precisé by NB|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#F7D6C1|bgColor=#FFFFCE}
I was blinded-by-the-science here at first but if I have understood correctly the TL/DR is the output is as follows:
|Observed|71B:</AGENT/EUR12345,67ROBERT MUGABE>|
|Expected|71B:<ROBERT MUGABE>|
That is going wrong for several fields that are all using the same transformer. So if I fix it for one I should fix it for all.
{panel}
For fields 71B / 73 / 74 / 77B the narrativewithoptions transformer is being used by Rabobank.

Test message:
{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Message>
    <Id>AD-HOC-101</Id>
    <Type>SWIFT</Type>
    <Channel>Swift_IN</Channel>
    <Data><![CDATA[{1:F01RABONL20AXXX2017082401}{2:I103RABONL20XXXXN}{3:{108:AB}}{4:
:20:Tags 70
:71B:/AGENT/EUR12345,67ROBERT MUGABE
:73:/INTEREST/EUR12345,ROBERT MUGABE
:74:/HOLDCEP/ROBERT MUGABE
:77B:/ORDERRES/DU//ROBERT MUGABE
-}
]]>
    </Data>
</Message>
{code}

As per "Watchlist Manager SWIFT Messages Reference Guide" (6.7.21 NarrativeWithOptionsTransformer)

{noformat}

The NarrativeWithOptionsTransformer Extracts the code, currency, amount and text from the fields 71B, 72, 73, 74 and 77B. 

The format is: 

6*35x 

The following line formats may be used for all but 77B: 

line 1: /8a/[3!a13d][add. info] 

lines 2-6: [//add. info. continuation] 

[The Swift documentation states: 

"The integer part of Amount must contain at least one digit. 

A decimal comma is mandatory and is included in the maximum length."] 

For 77B, the following line formats MUST be used: 

line 1: /8a/2!a[//add. info] 

lines 2-6: [//add. info. continuation]

:71B:/AGENT/USD50NARRATIVETEXT 

//text_a 

//text_b 
  

The NarrativeWithOptionsTransformer extracts this information to the following data source fields: Data Source Field 

Value 


71_code: AGENT 


71_currency: USD 


71_amount: 50 


71_text: NARRATIVETEXT 

text_a 

text_b 


{noformat} 

As per the logs (attached), the behaviour in our environment is: 

:71B:/AGENT/EUR12345,67 TEST Bank
:73:/INTEREST/EUR12345, ROBERT MUGABE
:74:/HOLDCEP/Quackquack
:77B:/ORDERRES/DU//BANKQQ01

73_amount:<12345>
73:</INTEREST/EUR12345,ROBERT MUGABE>
74:</HOLDCEP/ROBERT MUGABE>
71_amount:<12345.67>
receiverbic_iso2:<NL>
sessionnumber:<2017>
77B:</ORDERRES/DU//ROBERT MUGABE>
mti:<103>
_$TRXHEADER:<AD-HOC-101>
senderbic_bic:<RABONL20>
senderbic_iso2:<NL>
senderbic:<RABONL20>
*71B:</AGENT/EUR12345,67ROBERT MUGABE>*
receiverbic_bic:<RABONL20>
77_code:<ORDERRES>
*77_text:</ORDERRES/DU//ROBERT MUGABE>*
account:<NA>
receiverbic:<RABONL20>
_$TRXID:<AD-HOC-101>
*73_text:</INTEREST/EUR12345,ROBERT MUGABE>*
73_code:<INTEREST>
*71_text:</AGENT/EUR12345,67ROBERT MUGABE>*
71_code:<AGENT>
77_country:<DU>
20:<Tags 70>
direction:<I>
column352: Send a SWIFT message using Narrativewithoptions
column369:
20/Sep/2017 12:28 PM;NBresnan;Apologies - I cannot alter the description from the very long description from the CES ticket. None of that is really needed. 

I am submitting this ticket to harvest the change made in revision #589809. It is a small change to alter how narrative texts is handled. Currently it is not doing what the documentation says it should do at all and AFAICT this is wrong in every version up to the current CoreDev trunk. But harvesting it should be easy.

Currently the entire first line is used as the narrative text. That is incorrect. All my changed is doing is using a previously-existing index number to correctly snip the narrative text out of the longer string.

column1: EIM Application Import Issue
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Whilst attempting to import the EIM application configuration on the WebSphere server HSBC are receiving the following error in the importexport.log (see attachment for full stack trace):

“java.lang.VerifyError: JVMVRFY012 stack shape inconsistent; class=com/norkom/configurator/business/facades/helpers/dataload/ApplicationManager, method=<init>(Ljava/util/List;Log/springframework/orm/hibernate3/HibernateTemplate;Ljava/util/Map;Lcom/norkom/base/resources/model/User;Ljava/sql/Timestamp;)V, pc=22”

This occurs every time applications are imported and it does not matter which applications. These applications have previously been imported in the environment successfully however since then HSBC have patched their WebSphere instance from 8.5.5.9 to 8.5.5.12. I imagine this issue is related to this however as we say we support 8.5.5 (minimum patch level 5) HSBC do not want to revert back to 8.5.5.9.

We were advised to try setting the below JVM parameters in WebSphere, however this did not solve the issue.

* *com.ibm.ws.cdi.enableImplicitBeanArchives = false*
* *com.ibm.ws.cdi.enableCDI = false*

column1: CLONE - Profile rebuild does not support schedule variables
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Variables and properties are not supported by the ProfileRebuildJob. For example, the use of *$profileStartDate$* and *$profileEndDate$* variables in the following configuration will cause the job to fail to initialize:

{code}
<job name="CB_ProfileRebuild">
  <type> ProfileRebuildJob </type>
  <depends> CB_ProfileRebuildWriteKeys </depends>
  <error-handler>ErrorHandler</error-handler>
  <parameter name="domainCode">CORRESPONDENT_BANKING</parameter>
  <parameter name="concurrency">2</parameter>
  <parameter name="historyConfigFile">./conf/acquisition/historyconfig_cb.xml</parameter>
  <parameter name="profileKeysFile">./conf/acquisition/rebuild_keys.txt</parameter>			
  <parameter name="dateFormat">yyyyMMdd</parameter>
  <parameter name="startDate">$profileStartDate$</parameter>
  <parameter name="endDate">$profileEndDate$</parameter>			
</job>
{code}

so is the use of *$norkom_home$* in the following instance:

{code}
<job name="CB_ProfileRebuild">
  <type> ProfileRebuildJob </type>
  <depends> CB_ProfileRebuildWriteKeys </depends>
  <error-handler>ErrorHandler</error-handler>
  <parameter name="domainCode">CORRESPONDENT_BANKING</parameter>
  <parameter name="concurrency">2</parameter>
  <parameter name="historyConfigFile">$norkom_home$/conf/acquisition/historyconfig_cb.xml</parameter>
  <parameter name="profileKeysFile">$norkom_home$/conf/acquisition/rebuild_keys.txt</parameter>			
  <parameter name="dateFormat">yyyyMMdd</parameter>
  <parameter name="startDate">20140701</parameter>
  <parameter name="endDate">20150120</parameter>			
</job>
{code}

The ability to supply dynamic properties to the ProfileRebuildJob is needed by the project since it will be called as part of the KYCC/SNT processing.

column1: CLONE - CDD_CustomerUpdateRisk - Error if Customer has entries in CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE for multiple OrgUnits
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
To reproduce, find a Customer who has more than one entry in CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE
{code}SELECT CUSTOMER_ID, COUNT(CUSTOMER_ID) FROM CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE GROUP BY CUSTOMER_ID{code}
and click Force Risk to run the WFA on the Customer at least once.

Something similar was found in another project - FOB-38. Where a Customer is valid for more than one OrgUnit, two entries validly exist in this table. Function CDD_CustomerUpdateRisk in WFA CDD_ChangeCustomerRiskAssignment (A_CDD_CU_002) tries to update both, including trying to change the primary key, ID. I don’t see any reason to change the ID at all and suspect it was erroneously copied and pasted from an INSERT statement.

 !image-2017-11-03-14-44-46-205.png|thumbnail!

column1: CLONE - Page running slow in IE due to javascript function
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Rabobank report extremely poor performance with the Group Work -> All Alerts screen from users in their China branch only.

These users are using 64 bit IE. Other users using Chrome or Edge did not have the same problem.

We are not able to reproduce the same problem on our test system.

An AWR report did not show any evidence of problems with the database.

Using developer tools in IE the request was profiled and it was discovered that most of the time seemed to be consumed by a script *BinaryArrayToAscCSV*.

This script is unusual in that it is written in vbscript. It is only called if the browser is IE.

The script converts data for ajax requests, so the execution time will also be related to the amount of data retrieved, although since it works for Chrome, that is not the only issue.

We suspect there is an issue with the script.
column352:
Some customers experienced issues related to the IE compatibily mode.
Even when using a new IE browser version ( >= 11) the document mode used is always an old one (i.e. 7).

This has been noted so far in two areas: CC screens (BTEXTERNAL-75 6.7.0.5) and Group Works -> Alerts Screen (RABO032-1123 6.7.2.17).

I think there are more but I can't find the jira tickets.
column369:
01/Dec/2017 12:20 PM;GRusso;
The root cause is that the the for some reason, the "X-UA-Compatible" meta tag that IE to work with the latest document available (i.e. IE=Edge) is not always working as expected (PLAT-18922).

I have fixed this issue on two or three projects by replacing the html tag with a jsp instruction to set the header directly on the server side response object.

<% response.setHeader("X-UA-Compatible","IE=Edge"); %>

column1: Plaintext Password leakage
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Passwords are being leaked in plaintext when DEBUG is enabled and (at least) when using External Authentication against LDAP, as per the attached log from a v7.5.0.6 build:
{noformat}
08-Mar-2018 13:26:47,665 -  -  DEBUG BeanUtils:795 - BeanUtils.populate(com.norkom.base.web.forms.LoginForm@3ad072a9, {secure_hidden_values_digest=[Ljava.lang.String;@1d01b6c9, password=[Ljava.lang.String;@699b66f0, secure_hidden_fields=[Ljava.lang.String;@3d537140, loginToken=[Ljava.lang.String;@537bb7de, username=[Ljava.lang.String;@435ce486})
08-Mar-2018 13:26:47,665 -  -  DEBUG BeanUtils:876 -   setProperty(com.norkom.base.web.forms.LoginForm@3ad072a9, secure_hidden_values_digest, [9ZaLXe--xO0pXjawwC6HRZk_Qw8Xy64BM3xc4Z_2_vw.])
08-Mar-2018 13:26:47,665 -  -  DEBUG BeanUtils:876 -   setProperty(com.norkom.base.web.forms.LoginForm@3ad072a9, password, [Norkom098])
08-Mar-2018 13:26:47,666 -  -  DEBUG ConvertUtils:418 - Convert string 'Norkom098' to class 'java.lang.String'
08-Mar-2018 13:26:47,666 -  -  DEBUG ConvertUtils:426 -   Using converter org.apache.commons.beanutils.converters.StringConverter@17ba80d2
08-Mar-2018 13:26:47,666 -  -  DEBUG PropertyUtils:1756 - setSimpleProperty: Invoking method public void com.norkom.base.web.forms.LoginForm.setPassword(java.lang.String) with value Norkom098 (class java.lang.String)
{noformat}

It should not be possible to leak/expose sensitive information - such as passwords - in log files/audit logs even with {{DEBUG}} enabled.
column352:
1. Enable External Authentication. 
2. Configure DEBUG in log4j. 
3. Login to application 
4. Review log file

13/Sep/2018 11:24 AM;andrewredmond;Hi Wang

I think the issue here is why is the HomePageAction not always encrypting the launch action. It seems to be due to the second clause in the if statement:

if (homePageLaunchAction != null *&& (request instanceof NorkomRequestWrapper)*)

Should the incoming request not have been converted to an instance of a NorkomRequestWrapper once the user has been externally authenticated?

If not then we should at least be able to determine in the HomePageAction that this is an SSO login request that has already been verified by the LoginPerformAction and therefore we should be encrypting the home page launch action.

Thanks

Andy

column1: NPE due to wrong value passed in to a method while fetching a BatchProcess
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
*+ROOT CAUSE+*

Once the abort is clicked UI server creates an group batch event for abort using update data action named {{updateInsertBatchEventAbort}} and then update the status of batch group to aborted with another data action {{updateBatchGroupAbort}}. A third data action updates the value of {{NEW_STATE}} field of the {{SERVER_STATES}} table entries with {{TOPIC}} as {{ACQ_SCHEDULE_EVENT}}. In case of OCBC where this issue is actually found, two entries are updated, one for UI and other for Batch. Then Batch server picks the server state updated value and it is executed by the class {{AcquisitionClusterTopicPlugin}}. Then the flow of execution reaches the {{consume}} method the class {{com.norkom.wlm.business.jobs.BatchManagementWatchJob}} and here is where the actual issue happens.

In the consume method we try to fetch the process related to the group with the following code. 

{code:java}
this.process = (BatchProcess) this.batchComponentController.getBatchProcessDao().getBatchProcess(
							group.getName(), group.getServerName());
{code}

The signature of the {{getBatchProcess}} in the class {{BatchProcessDao}} is {{getBatchProcess(String processName, String serverName)}}, from which we can clearely understands that we have to pass the batch process name and server name as parameter. But from the calling (which is given above) we can see that we are passing group name instead of process name which in turn returns null if group and process have different names.
This is will cause {{NullPointerException}} when we try to access any method from process object in the {{abort}} method (like {{process.getStatus()}}). NullPointerException is caught and suppressed by the general Exception catch statement in {{consume}} method. So execution continues without aborting the batch process and updates the CURRENT_STATE field of SERVER_STATE table entry silently.

*+POSSIBLE SOLUTION+*

We need to find the process that has to be aborted in a proper way inorder to abort it. At that point of execution, we won't have any reference to the current batch process executing from the batch group. So we might need to find the process using group id and server name. But the problem here is that one group may have multiple processes. By the time user clicks abort, some process might have already got completed. We need to know which all process should be aborted. 

Options are
* All of them in a group.
* Only the one currently in progress.
* Only those are currently in progress or in the execution queue.

I am not sure of which one is the ideal option to use here. Already discussed this with Ethna Killeen and she is also not sure about it. Hence we are raising a PLAT ticket to sort it out in platform level. This issue is never fixed and still continues to exist in Coredev trunk as well.
column352:
1. There are only 122 records to be executed in the batch.
2. User clicks on the abort button in the GUI.
3. The job continues to run until status shows completed (presumably that field is visible in the GUI)
4. The log file shows that the job continues to execute detection rules to check on each of the 122 records until the ASE manually updates ACQ_BATCH_PROCESS.STATUS to "failed".

28/Mar/2019 03:16 AM;VSavkoor;I made the following change for OCBC to address the issue:
- Backported fix from PLAT-18948 to the project, which allows the BatchManagementWatchJob.initialize() method to have separate batch name and group name.
- Modified BizAreaProcessingJob to call BatchManagementWatchJob.initialize() method with the process and group name.
- Modified BatchManagementWatchJob.consume() method to use to the process (or batch) name to get access to the BatchProcess object and process the event.

We don't see the NullPointerException when the process or group is aborted. CS is currently testing this change.

# The XSL Message Transformer does not have the 'outputFunctionNameAndType' parameter exposed.
# The XML Message Transformer has this parameter defaulting to 'false' in the code, but defaults to 'true' in the UI. So it appears from the looking at the config that both function name and type should be included in the output result but only type shows up.

Note that I provided a fix to Santander (see cloned ticket) which could be harvested.
Regards,
Vikram

column1: CLONE - Email inbound_additionalParameters doesn't work for more than a single parameter
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Email inbound_additionalParameters doesn't work for more than a single parameter
When trying to configure and add either imaps properties or additional parameters such as mail.imaps.timeout , the app throws an exception while trying to parse the integer parameters  as follows

{noformat}
        at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:573)
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "5001^M"
        at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65)
        at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:580)
        at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:615)
        at org.apache.geronimo.javamail.util.ProtocolProperties.getIntProperty(ProtocolProperties.java:149)
        at org.apache.geronimo.javamail.util.MailConnection.getConnectionProperties(MailConnection.java:270)
        at org.apache.geronimo.javamail.util.MailConnection.getConnection(MailConnection.java:243)
        at org.apache.geronimo.javamail.store.imap.connection.IMAPConnection.getConnection(IMAPConnection.java:244)
        at org.apache.geronimo.javamail.store.imap.connection.IMAPConnection.protocolConnect(IMAPConnection.java:132)
        at org.apache.geronimo.javamail.store.imap.connection.IMAPConnectionPool.createPoolConnection(IMAPConnectionPool.java:211)
        at org.apache.geronimo.javamail.store.imap.connection.IMAPConnectionPool.protocolConnect(IMAPConnectionPool.java:177)
        at org.apache.geronimo.javamail.store.imap.IMAPStore.protocolConnect(IMAPStore.java:156)
        at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:251)
        at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:105)
{noformat}

The properties are added as follows

{noformat}
mail.imaps.host=somehost.xx
mail.imaps.timeout=5001
mail.imaps.connectiontimeout=5000
{noformat}


The cause of this the StringUtil.stringToProperties method is expecting to delimit the properties by the JVM's line.seperator which should be LF.

the problem is that the external connector input and the browser converts the line spacing to a CRLF and this is what breaks.


If you export the base platform you can see the CRLF.

A quick and dirty workaround is to edit the XML and change the CRLF to a LF and import back in.
column352: See main ticket
column369:
12/Jul/2018 06:17 AM;RNathan;Note:
A more sensible way to delimit these properties is with a pipe, its also consistent with what we do elsewhere in the platform, services manager, app builder etc
column370:
12/Jul/2018 06:26 AM;RNathan;Some additional details on how we should be trreating CR + CRLF with regards to browser handling and user input

https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec19.html

http://jkorpela.fi/HTML3.2/5.56.html

column1: Interactive List Pagination Issues ([CIPFA-1404]/[NESD-1940])
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
There is an issue with the pagination of Interactive Lists updating following a refined search query - see "Steps to Reproduce" for details.

The team have been unable to find any solutions for this in the configuration options.
column75:
This issue has been reproduced in multiple environments:
- CIPFA environment provided by their hosting provider UKFast
- BAE Systems Datalab dev environment (where we test/develop on real data)
- BAE Systems NKMD EIM configuration environment (where our EIM configuration work is done)
(We also checked this on the HSBC UCM project's dev environment and the issue can be reproduced under a different configuration)
column352:
User executes a search query that returns many pages worth of results in an interactive list  (OriginalQuery.PNG) 

User refines search terms and hits submit (RefinedQuery.PNG) - whilst the number of actual results is reduced, the page count in the bottom right of the interactive section still display the same number of pages of results as the previous query.

Clicking on the later pages shows empty sections of results (RefinedQueryPage55.PNG).

Please see the attached images.

Please note that it seems like this issue will only surface once enough results are returned for the pagination to have in excess of 5 pages, and the page list at the bottom then includes an ellipsis ("...") e.g.:
 Previous | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 | ... | 55 | Next
column369: 02/Aug/2018 12:46 PM;DStobbs;[~will.needham] can demonstrate the issue with a screen share or provide access to our NKMD dev/QA environments as required.
column370: 02/Aug/2018 12:48 PM;DStobbs;The CIPFA customer have stated that a fix for this issue is required for them to accept the solution into production.
column371: 02/Aug/2018 12:49 PM;DStobbs;Initially an NESD ticket was raised (https://engineering/jira/browse/NESD-1940) and we were informed that this was an EIM platform code defect and should raise a platform ticket in this Jira for either the EIM platform or customer engineering team to address.
column372: 02/Aug/2018 02:40 PM;Pnolan;This issue was resolved in the Platform 7.5 release under PLAT-20391. Defect Title: Buttons are not displayed in Disclosure page of Netreveal EIM after clicking CTRL+Insert+B 

Description: 
--------------------- 
Accessibility testing tool JAWS should display all button with name after using CTRL+Insert+B.This helps the visually impaired people to access the application in a convenient way. 

Path: Netreveal EIM Group workAll casesCreate Disclosure 
For above mentioned path, JAWS tool does not display the form field properly.

column1: HTML5 equivalents for all legacy Graph types
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Several graph types can only be created/displayed if {{command.and.control.applet.graph=true}}. However, this should be set to {{false}} by default and since Java applets represent a security concern for most organisations, it is unlikely that most clients will have permission to use applets. 

The requirement is to create HTML5 equivalents of these chart types, or alternatively remove them from the application and all documentation.
column352: Deploy default application (with {{command.and.control.applet.graph=false}}) and try to create a Gauge chart in C&C.

column1: CA-I : Security vulnerabilities detected during customer assessment
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi,

While performing a security assessment of NetReveal, CA-I Cybersecurity team found some vulnerabilities through our NetReveal web application. Please find attached the report of the vulnerabilities.
These issues are blocking the go-live.

Regards
Nizar
column352:
* Text Fields sanitization : It has been possible to inject javascript source code inside different user text fields without any sanitization.
* Lack of user segregation : It has been possible to realize unexpected actions or to access forbidden application functionalities through low privileges user profiles.
* Self-Signed Certificates : It has been possible to use self-signed certificate on the web application.
* Information leakage : several error on the web application are leaking technical information.
column369:
04/Sep/2018 09:50 AM;FAjenjo;Hi Paul,

customer has requested a feedback on this demand, can you tell what is next? They expect this issues to be fixed quickly in order to go live soon, Swiss regulator is very strict about data protection and this a blocking point at the moment.

Regards
column370: 04/Sep/2018 09:59 AM;Pnolan;Nizar, if these issues can affect the go-live date then they will require an initial review by the RSA for this customer. If potential product vulnerabilities are confirmed by this review, then PE will be available to provide further support - thanks.
column371:
18/Sep/2018 10:03 AM;nizarbaslih;Hi Paul,

What is the process to involve RSA in the security review? 
Who's supposed to contact them and what is the point of contact?

Thanks
Nizar
column372: 18/Sep/2018 11:58 AM;Pnolan;Nizar, CS needs to pass the report onto the project's RSA for initial review. If the RSA identifies any new potential product issues in the report, these should be passed on to Product Engineering for further investigation. I am the point of contact for Product Engineering on this and I believe Emmanuel Clarke is the RSA.
column373:
18/Sep/2018 03:26 PM;nizarbaslih;Hi Paul,

For info, the RSA role is fulfilled by me for this project.
My initial review has resulted in the bellow conclusions : 
* Text field sanitization has been enhanced in plat 7.6 but still not fixed on plat 7.4 (XSS injection still possible).
* Lack of user segregation : Services team analysis is required to establish whether the accessed functionalities should not be crafted by the given users, i.e, Services have to check the alignment between base platform configuration and validated specifications.
* Self signed certificate : This is client responsibility to enforce the usage of a certificate signed by their internal root CA.
* Information leakage when it comes to display error codes via the web application. This could be worked around by mapping generic error description to the key resources enclosed in error.properties files.

PE involvement is required for the 1st defect (Text field Sanitization), it's still to confirm for the 2nd one (User segregation) depending on Services feedback, the 3rd one is Client responsibility (Self signed certificate) and the last issue can be handled by Services team (Info leakage).

Regards
Nizar
column374:
20/Sep/2018 05:36 PM;Pnolan;On the text field sanitisation issue...

In general, we don’t see input validation as the most effective mechanism for preventing malicious action. IInstead, we ensure that all output to the browser is encoded to prevent any input-based attack from succeeding. This also has the benefit of providing a level of protection against novel attack types and covering malicious data entered directly into the database.

In this case, however, it appears that the output has not been appropriately encoded which allows the embedded script tag to execute. I'm a little surprised by this issue, as I would have expected this to be handled correctly in Platform 7.4. Have we reproduced this issue in our own testing on the project?
column375:
10/Oct/2018 03:41 PM;nizarbaslih;Hi Paul,

Indeed, this was tested was tested on http://iedc1nkmdevv0389:9081/netreveal/login.do and has resulted in the same permissiveness observed by Customer auditor! 
"LAST NAME" fields within all screens of adding a new subject to an entity (alert/Case/Counterparty/...) is not filtering html chars...

Can you please propose an action plan as this being escalated by the customer.
Thanks

Regards
Nizar
column376: 10/Oct/2018 04:01 PM;Pnolan;Nizar, can you provide steps to reproduce the text field issue on that server (http://iedc1nkmdevv0389:9081/netreveal/login.do)? I would like to reproduce the specific issue to determine the root cause, but there are no steps listed in the document - thanks.
column377:
10/Oct/2018 04:26 PM;nizarbaslih;Paul,

Page 6 of the document explains how to reproduce the text field issue.

Regards
Nizar
column378: 10/Oct/2018 05:03 PM;Pnolan;Nizar, the document mentions "Access to Alert or Folder/Add-Connected-Party", but it doesn't specify how the user navigated to that popup - that's what I need to properly reproduce the issue.
column379:
10/Oct/2018 06:18 PM;nizarbaslih;Please find attached the steps to reproduce
 [^Steps-To-Reproduce.docx]
column380:
11/Oct/2018 02:44 PM;Pnolan;OK - I have reproduced the issue now. It is necessary to create a connected subject with a LAST_NAME that contains a script tag and then navigate to another page which has a popup link to that subject. It appears to be related to a defect where the popup title parameter is not being properly escaped before being sent to the browser. It was not previously identified that this parameter could be configured to contain user-supplied data.

This defect will need to be resolved in the next platform release - it has been raised under [FCENG-3548|https://engineering/jira/browse/FCENG-3548].
column381:
17/Oct/2018 08:33 AM;FAjenjo;Hi Paul,

Customer is going live soon and this isuue is a blocking point as he is based in Switzerland, and we cannot ask him to wait and later to upgrade, this fix needs to be done asap in the current 7.4/4.6 release, otherwise customer won't go live and will be fined by the Swiss regulator who is awaiting him to go live for almost a year now, this issue is a major issue for the customer and cannot be awaiting a future release upgrade.

Regards.

Francisco
column382: 17/Oct/2018 05:26 PM;Pnolan;Francisco, PE will be resolving the issue in the Platform 7.7 release only. You will need to follow up with CE to have that fix applied directly to the project, if this is a priority for the customer.
column383:
20/Nov/2018 08:34 AM;FAjenjo;Hi Jerome,

can you create a CE Jira about this and follow progress??

F.

column1: CLONE - CDD Scoring does not kick off without stopping and starting both batch and UI servers
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
We are having problems getting our cdd scoring to run automatically.  

I had Raja stop and start the application only on the batch server last night, doing so caused CDD to stop and did not start back up once the application came back up. I had him then stop the application, stop the batch server, and bring the server and application back up, still CDD did not start. CDD would only start back up when we shutdown both the application and servers on UI and Batch.
column216: Code merge sub-tasks have been created.
column352:
1. Nightly batch bridge processing stopped because of the one of records failed (e.g. a bad email records), this batch job can not be resumed from UI since 'Resume' button is not available. So batch server has to be restarted to kick off batch processing.
2. Once batch server restarted, CDD processing job can not kick off automatically.
3. At this point, CDD processing job will only kick off by restarting both UI and batch servers.
column363:
Please refer this env, it is service QA env. 

http://172.27.20.132:9080/netreveal/screen/view.do

nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'samlWebSSOProcessingFilter': Unsatisfied dependency expressed through method 'setSAMLProcessor' parameter 0; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'processor' defined in ServletContext resource [/WEB-INF/securityContext.xml]: Cannot resolve reference to bean 'artifactBinding' while setting constructor argument with key [2]; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'artifactBinding' defined in ServletContext resource [/WEB-INF/securityContext.xml]: Cannot create inner bean 'org.springframework.security.saml.websso.ArtifactResolutionProfileImpl#bf830547' of type [org.springframework.security.saml.websso.ArtifactResolutionProfileImpl] while setting constructor argument; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'org.springframework.security.saml.websso.ArtifactResolutionProfileImpl#bf830547': Unsatisfied dependency expressed through method 'setMetadata' parameter 0; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: Error creating bean with name 'metadata': Unsatisfied dependency expressed through method 'setTLSConfigurer' parameter 0; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'org.springframework.security.saml.trust.httpclient.TLSProtocolConfigurer#0' defined in ServletContext resource [/WEB-INF/securityContext.xml]: Invocation of init method failed; nested exception is java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org.bouncycastle.x509.extension.SubjectKeyIdentifierStructure
{noformat}

The SAML authentication code is instantiated in the Spring XML configuration file called securityContext.xml in the norkom.war file (in WEB-INF), as seen in the error above. 
Without the saml module, the file does not get loaded so there's no issue.

The errors point to the missing class *org.bouncycastle.x509.extension.SubjectKeyIdentifierStructure*

This class is present in the Bouncy Castle jar file called bcprov-jdk15on-149.jar but not in the newer version bcprov-jdk15on-158.jar which is now used in the latest Core versions (since 7.5 from what I can tell).

Looks like the move to the more recent version of Bouncy Castle has caused a third-party version incompatibility regression in the SAML module.

I was able to get passed these errors by adding the missing class from the 1.49 version directly into the bcprov-jdk15on-158.jar file but presumably this is not an acceptable solution. I had first tried adding the class directly in the norkom.war/WEB-INF/classes folder of the EAR and in the application home shared_libs directory but this did not work. 

Found the following link containing a list of deprecated classes where org.bouncycastle.x509.extension.SubjectKeyIdentifierStructure is listed:

http://javadox.com/org.bouncycastle/bcprov-jdk15on/1.50/deprecated-list.html

column1: CLONE - Import fails using scheduled import
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Import fails using scheduled import

While importing a WLM config using a scheduled import (as opposed to importing now) the import fails with an all too common error :

{noformat}
org.hibernate.StaleStateException: Batch update returned unexpected row count from update [0]; actual row count: 0; expected: 1
{noformat}

The import completes when the normal "import now" is performed.

The code that is executed for each option is slightly different, but cannot work out what the cause is here. see full log in comments

Env details

Westpac Release
UI
http://mykmbnkmdevv02:9084/netreveal
admin/password
DB
mykmbnkmora01
WESTPAC_UPGRADE_SIT/WESTPAC_UPGRADE_SIT

/opt/NR_Home/Westpac_NPP_Release/UI/

column373:
06/Feb/2020 02:35 PM;AManayangath;Hi,

WLM team investigated this issue in trunk, and we were unable to reproduce this issue (in trunk), so we are not uplifting any of the fix suggested by CE in various versions. Trunk uses ojdbc8.jar and Oracle 18/19c, and it was already observed in this ticket that the issue was not observed wtih ojdbc7.jar.

Please let me know if there's any other concerns to be addressed under this ticket, if not, we will look to close this ticket.

thanks,
Ashok.

column1: SAA receiving Function FLTS_mpf_wait with result failure (Intermittent Failure)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi Team,

FLTS version: 7.2

Client OCBC getting intermittent message failure while sending the message to norkom. First attempt of the message seems to be failed and SAA Team is receiving FLTS_mpf_wait with result failure. The subsequent message did go through and successfully generated a HIT.

The flts_swift.log show as below:
{noformat}
18/11/18 16:16:23 /tmp/flts_to.c:415    FLTS_TO    [INFO ] - Message sent <IOCBCVNVXXXX103TESTING01>-<4137460>-<240EDF56FFC0DE0B>-<0> (timings: available:9 prepare:0 treat:389 route:23 addshm:0 total:421)
18/11/18 16:16:23 /tmp/from_flts.c:408  FLTS_WAI   [INFO ] - Message received <IOCBCVNVXXXX103TESTING01>-<4137460>-<240EDF56FFC0DE0B>-<0> result:22 rc:0
{noformat}

From the above log, we noticed the request being processed less than 1 second (message sent and message received). Client has checked the norkom.log and they didn't see any errors generated from norkom. Can you please advice what is the potential cause of the issue?

Please refer to the attachment:
- Message history for succesful and unsuccesful request
- flts_swift.log

Thanks.

Do you have any update for this issue?
