column371:
22/Nov/2018 09:11 AM;MvanLaere1;Hi,

It is not possible to find the cause in the provided log.
Failure can be:
- response not received in configured time out
- error during screening by norkom application

From the log we can say that it is not response timeout because the response is received one or two seconds after the send
On the other hand, if we look the time needed to process the successful message it appears to be couple on *minutes*
So my feeling is there is failure in norlom application probably at the beginning of the processing of the message (could be during transformation).
So I suggest to check  the norkom logs.
You can also set debug  in the java part to see content of sent message and received response .

Marc

column1: CLONE - SWIFT MX Exclusion Rules fail if more than one multi-value field is used
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
During unit testing of new BIC exclusions, it is noted that some unexpected scenarios cause a NOHIT response, despite an expected hit.

 

Issue appears to occur when the exclusion relies on more than one multi-value field.
Examples using the following exclusion:
{quote}Do not generate an alert when
there is an entry in the SWIFT MX Exclusion List list where
the index Name is equal to the data source field bicfi
and the index Cmid is equal to the data source field id
{quote}
Where "id" contains one value (not matching the value on the exclusion list) and bicfi contains multiple values (any one of which matches the exclusion list) then there will be an alert as expected: *bicfi matches, id doesn't.*

Where "id" contains multiple values (not matching the values on the exclusion list) and bicfi contains one value, there will be an alert, as expected: *bicfi matches, id doesn't*

Where "id" contains *more* than one value (none of which match the exclusion list) and bicfi contains *more* than one value (any one of which matches the exclusion list) then there will *not* be an alert.  *bicfi matches, id doesn't*

*THIS LAST SCENARIO IS AN ISSUE!*

 

This issue was found in a CLS product but is platform related.

The issue relates to when the detection exception logic is configured to run against more that one multi value field.

And there is a match in one field and not in the other.

The match is being suppressed when it should not be.

 

Engerer  

 

 

 

*See Cillian comment in support ticket for more info: https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/EGB002110-388?focusedCommentId=23778102&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-23778102*
column352:
1. Add a row to SWIFT MX Exclusion List with CM_ID=ZZA, WATCHLIST_ENTRY_ID=00000032529, NAME=KGTBKPP1, BICFI_CODE=NUBKLYLT
2. Rebuild indexes
3. Send attached message (Bicfi_2.txt) through "Send Test Message"

No alert is generated when one is expected
column369: 29/Nov/2018 08:47 AM;CMurphy;While this issue was found while testing SWIFT MX exclusions, the issue may be present for any exclusion relying on more than one multi-value datasource field.

When a transaction is entered where 2 matches occur (on different entries) on the same check, then this causes in the system :

All match exclusion rules are set to save ONLY exclusion.

Now, if one of the alert match datas is excluded but the other one is not, then the match is marked as excluded, but not removed if under the same WLM Rule alert.

It still appears and the exclusion is recorded but not removed from the alert.

column1: CLONE - Messages are ingested off of MQ before the Processing Core/Schedule is initialised resulting in Error in Schedule initialisation
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
This issue was uncovered as part of the following jira logged by BOI:
https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/EGB002530-165

Originally thought of as a DHC issue, it seems that the real issue is with the application ingesting messages off of MQ before the Processing Core or Schedule is initialised. This causes an error in schedule initialisation from which it never recovers.
From speaking with Trevor, he believes we are telling the application the processing core/schedule it ready before it actually is initialised or before DHC is ready to distribute the incoming message.

The issue then means that when we or BOI send further RT messages into NetReveal the issue manifest itself via DHC complaining that there are no node available:
{noformat}
8-Nov-2018 12:23:13,088 -  -  ERROR RealTimeLogicFacadeImpl:1994 - Unable to execute function [PFET-DispatchSynch (SCM-HTTP-DISPATCH - 1)]: Cannot initialize Remote Node Connections
SRV-30012 - Cannot initialize Remote Node Connections - SRV-30012
{noformat}

See attached logs where issue occurs at approximately 08 Nov 12:23

In BOI's case, it seems Scenario Manager tried to recover from a database connection loss while there were still messages being ingested from the input queue. So as Scm and DHC is still re initialising and the app is consuming messages, and is unable to recover.

We can simulate in our test environment by bringing down the two DHC nodes (it’s a two node DHC cluster), dropping messages on the input queue and bringing the application back up.

The sense is that it is related to how the schedule runs on JBoss 7.0. When we stop and restart the application via the JBoss GUI (soft restart) as opposed to completely stopping the JBoss service (hard restart), the problem will persist.

It’s like it needs to flush something from maybe the schedule queue or something before it can recover and re initialise. 

FYI: ScheduleQueue is set to durable..
{noformat}
<jms-queue name="ScheduleQueue" durable="false" entries="java:jboss/queue/Norkom/ScheduleQueue"/>
{noformat}
column352:
Stop the two DHC Nodes
Drop some Real Time Payment messages onto the MQ input queues.
Start the NetReveal EPF Application back up
Monitor the start up logs
Attempt to send additional RT Messages to NetReveal
column363:
https://connect/teamshare/Customers/Environments/Pages/default.aspx?View=%7b7F065D58-D958-408B-8C23-E4662B33316A%7d&FilterField1=Customers&FilterValue1=Bank%20of%20Ireland%20%28BOI%29

Dev RT node:  http://iedc1nkmdevv0308:9091/netreveal/login.do
Dev UI node:  http://IEDC1NKMDEVV0306:9091/netreveal
column369:
20/Dec/2018 11:19 AM;MvanLaere1;I done some investigation on this for the project and found that under JBoss > 6, the quartz scheduler appears to remain active even when the application is stopped (soft stop = JBoss server not stopped).

In addition, the com.norkom.acquisition.business.scheduler.ScheduleInterface.cleanUp() method although implemented in com.norkom.acquisition.business.scheduler.Schedule is never called.

As the cleanUp method "unregister" the triggers from the quartz scheduler, it is needed (at least under JBoss) so that triggers stop being fired.

I first tried to call that cleanUp method during a PreDestroy  annotated method on com.norkom.acquisition.services.mdb.ScheduleMdb but although working on JBoss  6.4 it was not working on JBoss7 because the PreDestroy  annotated method  was not called.

So to fix it @project level, I called the cleanUp method during com.norkom.base.web.listeners.InitParamInitializer servlet's contextDestroyed method. This is probably notthe best place but at least it worked.

Please that I also had to fix  another issue: the com.norkom.acquisition.business.scheduler.basic.CronTrigger doesn't use that same name during registration and un-registration to the quartz scheduler.

Marc

column1: AlertTagging job doesn't end
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Business calendar not progressing:

 

Alert Tagging is throwing an error at the end of alert generation which is pausing the AML schedule and not letting it move to the next day.
column352:
Generate an exception (other than ScheduleException and MonitoringException, i.e. a NPE) during TaggingThread's processGroup method.
The AlertTransactionTagging2Job won't end.
column363:
QA Env:
http://iedc1nkmdevv0365:9080/netreveal/login.do UI
http://iedc1nkmdevv0364:9080/netreveal/login.do Batch
IEDC1NKMORA04 1521 PERF122 NCBC_QA_DELTA/NCBC_QA_DELTA
column369:
24/Jan/2019 08:05 AM;MvanLaere1;Hi,

 

When an exception other than currently caught ones (ScheduleException and MonitoringException) during TaggingThread's processGroup method is thrown, the tagging thread end but the batchId is not reported as failed. The consequence is that AlertTransactionTagging2Job will not detect all batches are finished.

The solution is just to add a "catch (Throwable t)" and set {color:#6a3e3e}success{color} = *{color:#7f0055}false{color}*; is that case as well.

Notes:
 * At project level, a NPE was thrown in VectorSourceNetwork.initialize (see https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/EIE000052-867?focusedCommentId=23802768&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-23802768) probably because the datasource input spec was not defined in tagging configuration. This could maybe be checked and clearly reported in log.
 * In case of error during TaggingThread's processGroup method , additional information about the TagAgendaGroup causing the error would be appreciated by support team to help diagnostic.
 * Probably all versions are effected

Marc

column1: full SWIFT message highlighting concurrency issue in TagTransformers
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Swift tag transformer objects returned by SwiftRegistry are singletons.  This means that for each class implementing the TagTransformer interface, only one instance is created and so potentially shared by concurrent swift messages transformations. This was not a problem until a member has been added to GenericSwiftTagTransformer (the base class of all tag transformers) during full Swift message highlighting implementation 

Related Ticket: https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/RZB-224
column352: As usual for concurrency issues, can only be reproduced using breakpoint in debugger

column1: CLONE - After kill/terminate the active user session still not able to access
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
After kill/terminate the active user session still not able to access. Seems like the terminate session function is not working properly. 

Access Administration > Session Management > Active Sessions
column352: Access Administration > Session Management > Active Sessions
column369:
18/Mar/2019 09:42 AM;AHMTalib;*Background*

Refer  [^CIMBMYUPG-465.docx] 

Kill active session

- user A logs in, do some work, forgets to log off and left for lunch.
- Admin logs in and monitor active sessions. Found user A is still logged in but not at his desk. Decides to terminate the session.
- Next day, user A notice that he did not logged out. He selects the menu item and immediately the systems logs him out and redirects
  to the login screen with an warning message. System responded that the user session has been terminated.
- User A enters his login credentials and hit submit. System responded that the user concurrent login has exceeded. System redirects user A
  again to the login screen.
  

What's happening behind the scene

- When the admin terminates user A session in the system, the flow will go SessionControl.terminateUserSssion()
- Within this function, the following activity will happen
  a) usersession is updated (remove NrSSOToken, CSRFToken, insert current logout timestamp, insert reason key - KILLED BY ADMIN)
  b) user is updated (Session instance count is reduce by 1)

What was expected:
a) user A record in table USER shows that the session instant count = 0. After the session is killed by Admin.
b) usersession A record in table USER_SESSIONS shows that all session associated with usersession A is updated (NrSSOToken =null, CSRFToken = null)
c) user A is able to login into EIM again after being booted out. (because system_parameters - concurrentMaxlogin setting is 1).

What had happened
a) user A record in table USER shows that the session instant count is still 1.
b) usersession A record in table USER_SESSIONS shows that all session associated with usersession A is NOT UPDATED. ((NrSSOToken = not null, CSRFToken = not null)
c) user A is not able to login into EIM after being booted out.
  
What could have caused it
a) UserSession entity is configured as a cached hibernate entity using second level caching with ConcurrencyStrategy.NONSTRICT_READ_WRITE
b) Second level caching is an optional cache mechanism to store objects that are heavily referred from the application. It was meant to save time
   in terms of retrieving values directly from memory instead of database. 
c) NONSTRICT_READ_WRITE is a cache concurreny strategy that makes no guarantee of consistency between the cache and database.
d) Because of reason (c), the debug logs produced from SessionControl shows that the session instance count from user object does not tally with
   the values from USERS table for record A. 
   Usersession object has a reference to User object which is kept in cache as well. So, when the session instance count is updated and saved,
   the updated user object did not commit entirely into the database due to the caching strategy adopted.
   
Why is UserSession configured as cache object
a) https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/PLAT-14955,
b) http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=54206394 (Find "Second Level Cache" section)
   
Consideration
1. Change configuration settings on EnCache.
   Based on confluence page, it was advised to change the EhCache timetolive settings in order to allow the cache objects to be synchronized with the database frequently.
   Desmond has pointed out that there was no evidence of the instance count being updated after the user session has been terminated.

2. Update the SessionControl.java to utilize DaoHelper class. 
   a)Utilise the DaoHelper to help synchronize the hibernate session. If this does not work, then proceed to item b.
   b)The DaoHelper class has a method that is able to evict the 2nd level cache, so that it will force to clear
   the sessionuser entity from cache memory and get the latest update from database.
 
3. Change the usersession concurrency strategy from NONSTRICT_READ_WRITE to READ_WRITE. This is because, the project does not utilise SNA Visualiser.
  
4. If all options above does not resolve the issue, then the final approach will be to introduce a new security valve plugin where it will perform the following
   a. Based on the user id, it will detect if there were failed user sessions. 
   b. If there are, then update the instance count back to zero. After that, proceed with normal login procedure.
   
   Item 3 will have to be discussed with Solution Architect for impact on security.


*Findings*
1. None of the code changes strategy above has worked.
2. Services has to extended the administration screen via configuration in order to force the SQL to update the user and usersession table directly.

Appreciate that this defect be investigated and resolve urgently.
column370: 18/Mar/2019 09:44 AM;AHMTalib;Appreciate Product to have a look into this defect urgently
column371:
11/Apr/2019 09:45 AM;AHMTalib;Hi Paul,

Below are recurring reports of terminated user sessions that are unable to login again into EIM version 7.6.0.5 and 7.6.0.10

CIMBMYUPG-465 (CIMB Malaysia)
CMSX3502-782 (CIMB Singapore)
RHB Malaysia
Appreciate if this ticket can be expedited into critical list for fixing.
column372:
13/May/2019 01:08 AM;faisal.abdulghaffar;Morning, all. We attempted to fix the issue affecting our CIMBSG customer sometime last week, and generally we found that the user lockout may have happened due to the following scenario:
# Active session 'kill switch' 
# Application restart

From our investigation, we found that both of the above actions will not reset the session instance count attribute in the USERS table, hence in case where the max concurrent user login property is set to 1, there's a possibility that users of the application may be locked out. More details of our findings, + the details of the fix that we applied, can be found in the following journal:
- http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/x/MwSoB

Hope that this helps to give a bit more context about the issue, let us know if there's any question around our findings or the fix that we applied. 

Thanks.
column373:
16/May/2019 06:26 PM;AHMTalib;Based on the discussion between CE (hatta, srinivas), CS (Faisal) and Solution Architect (Guru) on Wednesday 15th May)

- With reference from http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/x/MwSoB, it is found that there multiple scenario that could happen which could lead to the EIM user unable to log into the system after a terminate event occurs
1) System Admin terminates the user session via kill session screen in EIM application
2) Application server time out event or restart events that triggers the process to kill users session who are have logged into the system.
3) User decides to close the browser window while still being logged into the system


- Findings on how does the current 7.6 core handles these events
1) SessionControl - where the terminateSession method resides (This class will be called upon during the kill user from screen level)
2) HttpSessionListener - where based on logout or browser refresh, the SessionDestroy method is called to ensure that users are logged out and entities are unlocked properly. 
3) SessionTerminatorClusterTopicPlugin - where the EIM scheduler will call this class based on intervals and let the execute method do the session termination.
4) Both HttpSessionListener and SessionTerminatorClusterTopicPlugin handles the removal of user sessions from TERMINATED_SESSION_MAP which is essentially a map that resides within the EIM application context.  SessionControl does not handle the TERMINATED_SESSION_MAP, instead rely upon the hibernate session factory to update the user instance count.

- There are 3 aspects to cover when a user session is terminated
1) the user instance count is reset or decreased after the session terminate process has completed. (So that the security valve can evaluate during the user re-entry)
2) entities associated to the terminated user is not release or unlocked
3) occurrences of stale hibernate user session objects (not able to synch current state with the persistence level) 

Approach taken by CS to handle those aspects are as follow
1) Update the sessionControl to ensure that upon application restart, all session count are nullified (users terminated)
2) Update the SecurityControl to ensure that the authenticated user has no stale hibernate user session.
3) Update the ConcurrentUserLoginValve with an additional condition which also checks the user has any active session based on the logout type and logout date

reference: http://proddev-svn:8070/cru/CSD-9

The concern raised by the Solution Architect is whether will these updates takes care of all 3 aspects of the user state while the EIM application is running. Put it simply, in an event when the terminated user is not able to log in, the system should have the ability to purge the stale session and allow the users to re-enter again after successful authentication - without the need for Sys Admin intervention or Application restart.

Action taken
1) CS will take a look at the concern raised by Solution Architect 
    - Current approach is update the SessionTerminatorClusterTopicPlugin with additional instruction to release the entity locking during the termination of the user. Since this class has also taken care of instance count update and purging the stale user session objects.

reference: http://proddev-svn:8070/cru/CSD-10

2) CE has also put forward some similar approach that has been implemented in NORDEA. It seems that the kill session feature that was introduce in PLAT-20407 failed to resolved another aspect when EIM is deployed in clustered environment. The additional fix provided in NORD013-1655 has not been harvested into platform. CE recommends CS to consider this fix as well in case the client would want to have a clustered environment for the 7.6 as well.

reference: https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/NORD013-1655?focusedCommentId=23628514&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-23628514

column1: CLONE - ORG Searches Using reserved.funciton.call.FilterGenerator have a Limit of 1000
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Summary: Phosphorus uses 1150 orgs in their org list. Using the reserved.function.call to search these orgs results in stability issues. The IN clause used within this function issue, while the BETWEEN clause would likely be more performant given the number of results. See the email trail below for additional information.

 

+Email Trail+

 

 

I could try to figure something out to fix it in the code, it might be very custom for AMO. I’ll need a day or two to try it out first and see if it’ll work. Let me know.

 

*From:* Gillmore, Joshua (CA Ottawa) *Sent:* Wednesday, March 13, 2019 12:52 PM *To:* Savkoor, Vikram (US Washington); Gunapati, Rupesh; Banuso, Kola (CA Toronto) *Cc:* Gillmore, Joshua *Subject:* RE: Issue in Orgs list - Urgent

 

Please make sure to include my client email. Again, I’ll be in a ton of meetings for the rest of the day. Apparently, project managers are really helpful for TLs.

 

Josh

 

*From:* Gillmore, Joshua (CA Ottawa) *Sent:* March-13-19 12:42 PM *To:* Savkoor, Vikram (US Washington); Gunapati, Rupesh; Banuso, Kola (CA Toronto) *Subject:* RE: Issue in Orgs list - Urgent

 

We indeed have a complex web of orgs and their hierarchies. The good news is that the majority of those users under those orgs only have one role.

 

The nine areas I listed are those I’m most concerned. Here’s how they’re working:

 

The user will select an originator using the following core free text fields –
 * User Name
 * Agency – Top level org below Group
 * Org Unit – The Organization that the user is assigned
 * (Rupesh, please feel free to add remaining fields or send a screenshot as I am on the BAE side)

 

Users who use this functionality are -

 

User Role: Submitter

Display/Return: Only users within their organizational hierarchy. For example, FBI -> Terrorist Financing Unit -> Middle-East Bureau

 

User Role:
 * PSO
 * QA

Display/Return: They are able to search and return all orgs and users within the system.

 

User Role: Analyst

Display/Return: They are able to search and return all orgs and users within the system.

 

The majority of users returned across the 1000+ orgs have a single role of Submitter.

 

How do we skip this function to allow for the same functionality above? This is a question for everyone.

 

Thanks,

Josh

 

*From:* Savkoor, Vikram (US Washington) *Sent:* March-13-19 11:46 AM *To:* Gillmore, Joshua (CA Ottawa); Gunapati, Rupesh; Banuso, Kola (CA Toronto) *Subject:* RE: Issue in Orgs list - Urgent

 

Josh – The logic in the function is very complex and it will be very difficult to code BETWEEN in a generic way. Org Units and Domains are hierarchies and assigned to users through Roles and Permissions, which in most cases ends up being a very complex web. So it’s not as simple as it seems here, where this user has one Permission assigned in all Org Units. If you know that all your users will have all Org Units assigned to them then you can skip the function. How many Roles does this user have?

 

 

*From:* Gillmore, Joshua (CA Ottawa) *Sent:* Wednesday, March 13, 2019 11:37 AM *To:* Gunapati, Rupesh; Banuso, Kola (CA Toronto); Savkoor, Vikram (US Washington) *Subject:* RE: Issue in Orgs list - Urgent

 

Instead of changing the function, can we get a new function for EIM that we can add to our codebase that uses the BETWEEN statement?

 

Josh

 

*From:* Gunapati, Rupesh [[mailto:Rupesh.Gunapati@fintrac-canafe.gc.ca]] *Sent:* March-13-19 11:31 AM *To:* Gillmore, Joshua (CA Ottawa); Banuso, Kola (CA Toronto); Savkoor, Vikram (US Washington) *Subject:* RE: Issue in Orgs list - Urgent

 

Hi Kola / Josh,

 

I have tried with IN and BETWEEN clauses in the section, both are working but we have more filters within the alerts / cases result section such as *reserved.funciton.call.FilterGenerator* where it will filter domains and orgs in one filter.

 

SELECT ID as FIELD_KEY, ORGUNIT_CODE as DISPLAY

FROM ORGANIZATION_UNITS

WHERE (ID BETWEEN 0 AND 5000)

AND DELETED <> 'Y'; - -1059 entries

 

 

SELECT ID as FIELD_KEY, ORGUNIT_CODE as DISPLAY

FROM ORGANIZATION_UNITS

WHERE (ID IN (SELECT ID FROM ORGANIZATION_UNITS))

AND DELETED <> 'Y'; - -1059 entries

 

 

At this moment reserved functions (OrgUnitFilter and FilterGenerators) are using IN clause, if we modify the function to BETWEEN clause as above it might work but not sure about the consequences. Just for this one screen I had modified 12 filters to make it work, I am thinking it might be easier if we can do something by splitting the security model instead of keeping all entries into the main orgs table.  Let me know your thoughts.

 

Example reserved function which we are using in section queries:  

*[=reserved.funciton.call.OrgUnitFilter(‘ID’,’/eimOrgDomainFiltering’)]*

*[=reserved.funciton.call.FilterGenerator(‘DOMAIN_ID’órgunit_id,’/eimOrgDomainFiltering’)]*

 

Thanks,

Rupesh

 

*From:* Gunapati, Rupesh *Sent:* March-13-19 10:36 AM *To:* 'joshua.gillmore@baesystems.com'; [kola.banuso@baesystems.com|mailto:kola.banuso@baesystems.com]; [vikram.savkoor@baesystems.com|mailto:vikram.savkoor@baesystems.com] *Subject:* RE: Issue in Orgs list - Urgent

 

Josh,

 

We are using *[=reserved.funciton.call.OrgUnitFilter(‘ID’,’/eimOrgDomainFiltering’)]* to filter across the board which means where ever we have the results section we are adding this filter function to filter Orgs/SubOrgs. I checked client’s SVN and “=reserved.funciton.call.OrgUnitFilter” appeared at 75 places in the custom configs and we have 175 entries from OOTB configs (I don’t know whether we need to modify full OOTB functions – just checked for safety). We have approximately 300 Agencies and 750 units but I will have to double check with Kiran, entire list does exit in orgunits table and we are using hierarchy for submissions but we have the full list to access through admin screen.

 

Example:

This is one of the queries but we have similar filters in alerts, cases, sidel, submissions etc…

 

SELECT ID as FIELD_KEY, ORGUNIT_CODE as DISPLAY

FROM ORGANIZATION_UNITS

WHERE (((ID IN column1: CLONE - Workflow action buttons - not considering org unit and domain permissions
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The permission for 'WLM_CaseSummary_UPDATE' workflow action button is not considering the org unit and domain unlike the key actions buttons.

*ALL the workflow action buttons are not considering org unit and domain permissions. This has to be fixed throughout the NetReveal application.* 

Could you check this ?
column352:
VM 4.6

ALL the workflow action buttons are not considering org unit and domain permissions. This have to be fixed throughout the NetReveal application. An example scenario for ' Update Case Details' button is explained below -

1. Login to NetReveal UI
2. Assign user with Read only permissions for case on Org A and Edit permissions for case on Org B
3. Navigate to Group Work -> All Cases
4. Open any case belonging to Org unit A
5. 'Key Actions' section is not visible as user do not have edit permissions for cases on Org A ( permissions for key actions is driven from org unit and domain)
6. But 'Update Case Details' button is visible to the user even though the user has only read permission for cases on Org A

column371: 22/Mar/2019 03:54 PM;Pnolan;Harika, the platform team are fully allocated to Platform 8.x development and will not have any capacity to review this issue. You may need to follow up with CE to address it directly on the project if this is a priority for the client.
column373: 11/Jun/2019 09:29 AM;Pnolan;Charminda, can you review this proposed fix from CE to determine if it is suitable to resolve this issue? Thanks...
column374:
11/Jun/2019 04:35 PM;CBandara;Hi Hatta

 

In your example (i.e work doc) you are referring to two different types of section controllers. They are rendered in two different ways.

 

If we look into the section where you have this issue, I agree with your proposed solution but you need to test this thoroughly. Reason for that is, you need to make sure this change get applied only to Workflow Action Buttons but all the other buttons like Navigation, Submit, etc. remain unchanged. Also, make sure this restriction doesn't break any buttons in other sections types. Remember you are applying a change to AbstractSecionController.displayConfigurableSectionButtons() method which get called by many places. 

If you look into the PermissionLogic interface you can see there are other methods you can use to call checkPermission() with domain and orgunit. You can use them and do this conditionally as you have proposed above. 

e.g

boolean checkPermission(UserInformationDTO userInformationDTO, long permissionId, long domainId, long organizationUnitId) throws NorkomBaseException;

 

I have one question for you, is this button you are going to restrict added as part of services configuration (i.e not a standard button)?

Thanks

Charminda.
column375:
12/Jun/2019 01:48 PM;AHMTalib;Hi Charminda,

Its good to hear from you again!

Question:  Is this button you are going to restrict added as part of services configuration (i.e not a standard button)?
Short answer: No, this button is not part of services configuration. 

As long as the button is of type "Workflow Action Button", and there is input value from the domain/organization/unit parameters, the validation for permission based on those parameters will happen. If not, then it will be business as usual.

I agree with you point that once this validation is put in place, a thorough testing on known sections will have to be done. Since the implementation is performed at the AbstractSectionController.

I hope this answers you question.
column376: 17/Jun/2019 08:18 AM;CBandara;Yes. Thanks Hatta.

As per the steps, when a setter has the parameter 'Update value at end of' to 'month(s)', the configuration can't be productionized.

Please see attached a log and the configuration. The setter is supposed to remember value of an alert weight and then used as a scenario condition. We cannot use a memory field as an alternative, because its value cannot be set to zero after a period of time.

Also, attached you'll find some code my teammate found that seems to be related to this issue (code.java).

This functionality is crucial for two of our monthly scenarios on BNPP FRB. They are supposed to be delivered Fri 12th Apr, but obviously can't, so it'd be great if this issue could be resolved by next release, i.e., May 14th.

 

Thank you.

Lukasz

column369:
15/Apr/2019 11:24 AM;AHMTalib;*Background*

NPE found at the point of AlertMatch initialise processing. During the comparison of dates, there is an additional method known as *existDateMatch()* which checks for date compatibility. Before the check can occur, a reference is made to the AlertMatchDatas. A null pointer exception occurs when the AlertMatchData are getting accessed without the proper null validation checking.

This was introduce in WLM-3798 \\ *Remote comment create date: 09/May/19 03:56 PM*

column1: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: Currently the application doesn’t validate that the Interactive List Section view specified in the HttpRequest from the browser is a view associated with the currently logged in user. Thus if the HttpRequest is tampered with prior to being sent to our application, and an arbitrary view is specified in the request, the application doesn’t validate the view belongs to the current user. In this situation a user can see the view meta-data that another user defined.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352: Using a browser dev tool or man in the middle attack toll (e.g. Burp) edit the HTTP request fom the browser to alter the userId request parameter value to a user id different from the logged in user.  The view meta data used is now that of the altered userId.
column357: I used Burp to launch a man-in-the-middle attack and change the userId httpRequest parameter value.

I couldn't find any additional hint on the real cause of the database connection closing.

I tried to watch for a connection dropped by the local firewall, but I saw nothing. The firewall keep alive settings are not suspect too.

I couldn't see any error on the database alert trace file.

Here is the details of the technical stack:
 * Netreveal : please see the attached version_info.txt
 * App server: Websphere 8.5.5
 * Database: Oracle Database 12c Standard Edition Release 12.2.0.1.0 - 64bit Production
 * JDBC Driver: /opt/JDBC_Drivers/oracle/12c/ojdbc8-full/ojdbc8.jar (version: 12.2.0.1)

 

The DEV environment is built in AWS.

The DEV app server VM is :
 * hostname: ip-10-227-4-55.eu-west-2.compute.internal
 * IP: 10.227.4.55
 * URL: [http://10.227.4.55:9080/netreveal]
 * Websphere console: [http://10.227.4.55:9060/ibm/console/login.do]

the database server is an AWS RDS instance:
 * hostname: prj-casa-v4-ora122db-enc.cvac4ekm441s.eu-west-2.rds.amazonaws.com
 * Service name: ORCL
 * Port: 1521
 * Schema: CASAV4_LCL_DEV

If you need SSH access, please ping me via email or skype. I'll send you the certificate required for authentication.

Thank you!

column372:
23/May/2019 02:22 PM;AManayangath;Stephane,

The environment where it's working, is that also a WebSphere environment? The error points at the incoming config file issue / stream null etc. Can you also try another / fresh configuration file?

We do config import regularly and haven't noticed any issues in 7.7 or newer versions.

thanks,
Ashok.
column373:
23/May/2019 03:17 PM;stephane.baudet;yes, the working one is also a websphere environment, same version.

the consultant who's working on WLM tried to import and modify lots of configs, with no success.

And even found something very weird: he exported the default config from the non-working machine and imported it again, then it raised an error: The config file could not be parsed due to an error on line 2377: Error at line 2377 char 30: null - The config file could not be parsed due to an error on line 2377: Error at line 2377 char 30: null .

I inspected the XML config file, and it was valid, no error. It's really weird.

You can inspect and debug on this machine. We saw that there are other Jira tickets with the same error, but they were never fixed because your team was not able to reproduce the issue. Now there is an internal BAE machine that you can inspect indeed.
column374:
27/May/2019 02:24 PM;stephane.baudet;Hi Ashok, please can you give a feedback ? It's really a blocking issue and we need help on this.

You can inspect our VM as I stated above, it's an internal BAE VM. Thanks.
column375:
27/May/2019 04:59 PM;AManayangath;Notes:

Tried changing the WAS connection pooling properties to following. It did NOT help.
{{PurgePolicy: FailingConnectionsOnly
Validate existing pooled connections: Selected
Retry Interval: 5 seconds
Validation Query: select 1 from dual}}
Looks like CP  'Aged timeout' is set to 1 second anyway, so the validation probably never kicked in.
Also the exception does not point at stale connections, but hints at problem accessing lob.

Things to check: Are there any large values in CLOB/BLOB fields in the db at the moment. Is the code falling over at particular hibernate generated query - enabling hibernate debug logging will help this somewhat.
column376:
31/May/2019 10:47 AM;AManayangath;Stephane, 

Can you please find the ulimit from both the environments (where import is failing and where it's working). Commands are:

ulimit -Hn
ulimit -Sn

Is the database also running on same/another AWS vm? If so can you check there as well please? In the past, we have noticed that the low ulimit (number of open files that the OS allows) has the potential to cause issues with configuration import, and we believe it might be related to the number clob/blob file that gets handled by the SQL query.

You could try increasing these ulimit values system-wide and see if that helps the situation. 

regards,
Ashok.
column377:
03/Jun/2019 09:59 AM;stephane.baudet;Executed the commands:

ulimit -Hn
ulimit -Sn

On IEDC1NKMDEVV0480 (working):
{code:java}
[root@iedc1nkmdevv0480 ~]# ulimit -Hn
500000
[root@iedc1nkmdevv0480 ~]# ulimit -Sn
500000{code}
On 10.227.4.55 (DEV) and 10.227.4.38 (TEST) (both not working):
{code:java}
[centos@ip-10-227-4-38 ~]$ ulimit -Hn
4096
[centos@ip-10-227-4-38 ~]$ ulimit -Sn
1024{code}
Obviously, the difference is significant, will try to set the ulimit to 500000 and restart.
column378:
03/Jun/2019 10:55 AM;stephane.baudet;In IEDC1NKMDEVV0480 (working), the file /etc/security/limits.conf contains:
{code:java}
hard nofile 500000
* soft nofile 500000
root hard nofile 500000
root soft nofile 500000{code}
I copied it to DEV and TEST environment, then logged out and logged in to apply it in my session.

After restarting the TEST app server, the error remained unfortunately.

Then I rebooted the whole VM, and retried to import a config, but still the error is there.
column379: 03/Jun/2019 10:58 AM;stephane.baudet;The database is running on a seperate server as an Amazon Web Services RDS instance ([https://aws.amazon.com/rds/).] It allows us to build a DB server in a few minutes, but we have no access to the underlying OS, so I can't access the ulimit values.

column383:

column385:
24/Jun/2019 02:38 PM;AManayangath;Thanks Adrian. That was very helpful, thank you.

So far I have not seen an issue with import / export process or list management screens that would leave the LIST_DEFINITION table in an unusable state. I can only assume that some network / db related error left the table in a locked / unusable / stale data type situation which later seems to have caused the application to misbehave. I wonder if some sort of dba level intervention (clear locks, sessions / connections etc) would have helped.

Please let me know if this occurs again.

thanks,
Ashok.
column386:
10/Jul/2019 06:28 PM;AManayangath;Resolving as 'Cannot reproduce' for now as we haven't been able to reproduce this at will. Happy to review if this occurs again.

thanks,
Ashok.

column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
A rule needs to be created in Match Exclusion to reproduce this issue.

For example:

Exclude the term 'AAI' from every list in the system.
 * Create a rule to exclude 'AAI' from all list entries.
 * Ensure AAI is excluded but Alert is still generated. (AAI needs to be on  a list and Match Exclusion flag will be displayed as red)
 * Change the setting on the rule to ensure that exclusion is saved but no alert is generated

 

Error will happen after third step.

 

Note: Every change to Match Exclusion rules requires a reload of the rules.
column369:
21/May/2019 07:23 AM;KOReilly;Hi Edward,

This is a major issue in our project due to go-live on June 14.  Are you able to assist us to determine root cause?

column1: Issue Sync Test - Match Exclusion - save exclusion no alert throws error
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When generating an alert with a match exclusion and selecting "save exclusion, no alert" there is an error thrown in the logs and the alert is not generated.  If you save, exclusion and create alert the alert is created and there is no error in the logs.

column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
A rule needs to be created in Match Exclusion to reproduce this issue.

For example:

Exclude the term 'AAI' from every list in the system.
 * Create a rule to exclude 'AAI' from all list entries.
 * Ensure AAI is excluded but Alert is still generated. (AAI needs to be on  a list and Match Exclusion flag will be displayed as red)
 * Change the setting on the rule to ensure that exclusion is saved but no alert is generated

 

Error will happen after third step.

Note: Every change to Match Exclusion rules requires a reload of the rules.

The Suncorp environment used to reproduce this issue is:

[http://10.167.11.137:8282/netreveal/screen/view.do]

 

The match exclusion rule in question is:

DJ_UID_625863

Test message is attached.

column1: CLONE - WLM - FuzzyAbbrevation scores are lower than expected
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
In some scenarios the FuzzyAbbreviation matching produces scores lower than expected.
According to Trigamm matching doc, algorithm scores each Initial to word match at 80%. 
Peter John Mary Jones should match P J M Jones at (80+80+80+100)/4 = 85%
but the alert score returned is 84.999996% 

Using the SQA test set this alert score is quite common, meaning that a lot of legit alerts would be missed.

column1: CLONE - [WCM2-1988] ME Data Source Fields back to default value after importing Rule Set
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Situation: 
A Rule Set is registered, a Rule (containing a specific data source field) is added and then the Rule Set is exported.
Next this exported Rule Set is imported (some environment or other, doesn't matter) using the refresh option.
After checking the imported Rule Set the data source field has been adjusted back to the defaultvalue ('20').
Since this value was not present in the exported Rule Set this issue seems to be caused by the import job.

See attached screenprint.

column1: CLONE - Error when storing alert and using Match Exclusion rules
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
In some cases WLM engine is throwing an error where an integrity constraint is violated (SWIFT20_DEV.WLM_ME_AMD_FK1).

The root cause is mixing the rule ID and rule set-rule link ID by configuration loader. Loader takes link ID as a rule ID and when (after combination of importing rules and creating new rules) IDs in ME tables are mixed (importing causes changing the base of numbering to next 1000) then some gaps are possible and ID is set to non existent rule. The same mechanism may cause, that rules will be improperly linked to rule sets.

 

Initially raised by Rabobank and tracked in [https://engineering/jira/browse/RBSAN22801-3155]

For technical details please contact Richard Home
column352:
Because reproducing such configuration may be not easy, there is manual workaround to simulate this situation.
 # Create or chose ME rule and link to rule set
 # Set on the rule option Store Matches but no Alert
 # For chosen rule change ID of its link (table WLM_ME_RULESET_RULE_LINK) to value not existing in column ID in table WLM_ME_RULES
 # On single lookup execute screening with *Store Alert=Yes* (the same result will be for batch processing and for real time)

column1: Ruleset validateUserScreenAccess behaviour depends on order of groups assigned to user
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When rulesets validate user access, they look at the domain of first assigned group. Even when user has a required set of groups assigned, it doesn't work until the proper one is assigned first.
See related tickets for examples.
column352:
1. Split WLM Supervisor into 2 groups with separate domains - PEP and TF
2. Create new user and assign those groups in order 1.PEP 2.TF
3. Go to Transaction Filtering dashboard and click on Alert ID
4. Error message appears
5. Go back to user groups and reverse assigned order
6. Dashboard links work as expected

This may be happening for the same reason so fixing one may fix the other.

If required, the replication steps form the UI are:
 # Export the base config
 # Import the base config but check the box to import the External Connector and also the box to delete the existing external connector details.

column1: CLONE - [SR2019] Tags with 8 characters BIC are parsed and stored in xx_bic11 and not in xx_bic (Specific to TagTransformer: GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Issue 1: Bic with 8 charactes parsed as bic11 
Issue 2: At parsed field xx_bic did not parsed

Expected Result: bic with 8 characters matched as bic and parsed as xx_bic

This happens mainly for the new TagTransformer: GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer
column352:
1)Prepare sample test data, feed file at Hermes

column369:
14/Aug/2019 08:57 AM;sangarganesan;Tag transformer (GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer) is not parsing and storing the 8-Character BICs into xx_bic field. 
Instead they are stored only in xx_bic11 fields.

!xx_bic11.png|thumbnail! 

However if the field has 11 character BICs, then system is parsing them correctly into the respective fields (8 character into xx_bic and 11 characters into xx_bic11).
 !xx_bic&xx_bic11.png|thumbnail! 

 \\ *Remote comment create date: 15/Aug/19 01:04 PM*
column370:
15/Aug/2019 06:21 AM;AHMTalib;Hi Ethna,

Services and QA has managed to produce a scenario on the GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer that could not parsed 8 character BIC into xx_bic tag.

CE has provided the solution based on advise given by Sangar (Senior Tech Consultant for NAB Sanctions). Appreciate your views on this.
column371:
22/Aug/2019 04:09 PM;EKilleen;Hi Hatta,

 

Apologies I don't see any comments on this portal at all unless I go into it.  At a quick glance at the code the GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer  is populating the BIC tag from the code in GeneralOptionJFieldTransformer.  The population of the BIC tag in GeneralOptionJFieldTransformer hasn't changed with the implementation of GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer.  

After speaking to Edward and looking at other transformers how the BIC tag is populated is inline with how it is populated with other tag transformers in the product. 

Thanks

Ethna
column372:
23/Aug/2019 08:21 AM;ilynroseabletes;So far, this is what we understood from the current flow:
OOTB:
if BIC > 8 characters --- _for example: *ABCDEFGHIJ*, it will populate into_
* xx_bic = ABCDEFGH
* xx_bic11 = ABCDEFGHIJ

else --- _for example: *ABCDEFGH*, it will only populate into_
* xx_bic11 = ABCDEFGH

and it's not populating into xx_bic field.

Services reported that the 8-Character BIC should also be stored in xx_bic field.
This is the screenshot of the document Services is referring to:
 !SWIFT_2019.png|thumbnail! 

Thanks,
Ilyn

column1: CLONE - DUPLICATE - Extra Processing time for payments due to Normalizatiosn cache reset in backend
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi

Could you take a look on ticket DNBPLATMIG-623 (this is continuation of DNBPLATMIG-616).

DNB reported problem with Resetting ehcache for WLM normalization. This happens every time when index on Standard List is rebuilt. During this process the response time for WLM RT messages is longer than 5s. and the time-out is reported.

WLM normalization is quite stable, and I think that they accept the situation that after changing normalization they will have to restart server.

Or maybe there is another way to avoid this resetting every time.

Regards

Jarek

 

Link to Marc van Laere's analysis

column1: CLONE - 675: PEN Test: Weakness in Session Management may allow Session Hijacking
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Source: Affected Page: /netreveal/login.do
 
Description:
Session hijacking is an attack that permits an attacker to hijack a  user's authenticated session. It is discovered that after successfully authenticating a user, the application doesn't assign a new session ID to the user. An attacker that have acquired the victim's pre-authenticated session ID by physical means could perform session hijack attack by patiently waiting the victim to be authenticated.
 
Impact:
An attacker having momentary physical access to the victim's machine can navigate to the vulnerable application to note down the preauthenticated session ID, then wait for the victim to authenticate later on to perform session hijacking.
 
Details:
Below is the PoC to reproduce the issue:
1. On Chrome browser, note down the pre-authenticated session ID. (Attacker perform physical attack to steal pre-authenticated session ID on victim's PC.)
2. Perform authentication on the Chrome browser. (Victim performs authentication, the session ID remain unchanged after logging in)
3. On Firefox browser, attacker edit the cookie settings to use the stolen session ID acquired at step 1 (Attacker perform this action at the attacker PC)
4. Attacker navigate to the application, session hijack is success (Refer SessionHijack.mp4)
Refer attachment for Screenshots
 
Recommendation:
There should be native library functions available to the programming language to refresh the user's session token after they authenticate so that their JSESSIONID does not remain the same after authentication.
  
PEN Tester comment:
[Jasper][6 September 2019] - Similar issue was identified in the previous round of pentest, and it has been verified as fixed in that round of test. However, this issue was found to be resurfaced at this round of test, as demonstrated in the video attached.
column131: 04/Oct/2019 12:27 PM;AHMTalib;Copy of Reproduction Steps in Local environment.xlsx;https://support.ai.baesystems.com/secure/attachment/22639444/Copy+of+Reproduction+Steps+in+Local+environment.xlsx
column216: Code merge sub-tasks have been created.
column352:
1. On Chrome browser, note down the pre-authenticated session ID. (Attacker perform physical attack to steal pre-authenticated session ID on victim's PC.)
2. Perform authentication on the Chrome browser. (Victim performs authentication, the session ID remain unchanged after logging in)
3. On Firefox browser, attacker edit the cookie settings to use the stolen session ID acquired at step 1 (Attacker perform this action at the attacker PC)
4. Attacker navigate to the application, session hijack is success (Refer SessionHijack.mp4)
column369:
03/Oct/2019 08:39 AM;AHMTalib;Hi Paul,

Project: RHB MY
SVN: http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/RHB_MY_Upgrade/CodeRepository/trunk
Coredev: 7.6.0.10
APPS: 4.8.0.0

SessionHijack.mp4 is located within  [^675_ ASC File (PRJ82619) 20190912 (2).xlsx] . Once the excel file is open, go to column G.

*Summary of video*
1. Penetration test for RHB MY shows that a session hijack vulnerability exist when a cookie id (JSESSIONID) of an active session is copied from one browser (chrome) to another (firefox).
2. The severity of that scenario shows that the attacker is able to get into EIM alert page with the csrf token security (PLAT-22811) in place.

The APAC project team would appreciate if this item is considered within the immediate sprint planning as it will also impact the following projects which is on core (7.6)
1. CIMB MY (7.6.0.10)
2. RHB MY (7.6.0.10)
3. NAB SANCTIONS (7.6.0.5)

Appreciate your views on this.

Regards
Hatta
column370:
04/Oct/2019 12:33 PM;AHMTalib;Hi Paul,

Attached is the reproduction of the issue in BAE's environment (Test performed by Jie Basir - tech consultant/engineer) -  [^Copy of Reproduction Steps in Local environment.xlsx] . Application server utilise is Jboss EAP 7.

*Observation*
1. Attacker is able to transact with hijack session as long as the original session is still active.
2. By monitoring the user session screen, surprisingly, the system is able to identify only one active session when there could be multiple occurrences of the hijack session. (Test performed by customer support engineer - faisal)
3. Initial code debug reveals that, at the point of the session hijack, the logic flow does not got through loginPerformAction.java instead it bypass the flow. The reason for this is due to the HttpSession object was able to provide a copy of the active session based on the hijacked jsession id.
column371: 04/Oct/2019 02:37 PM;Pnolan;Thanks for the details, Hatta. This vulnerability occurs essentially because the session ID is unchanged after login - this issue has already been resolved for Platform 8.0.1 under [FCENG-9566|https://engineering/jira/browse/FCENG-9566] and the same fix is applicable here.

column369:
18/Oct/2019 04:26 PM;Pnolan;Ramyanisha, can you check the other interactive list sections in the project to see if they have the same paging issue? We need to determine if the problem is only occurring on this page - thanks.

Note that the *Long* paging style is not supported by the interactive list section type, so it should be unaffected by the value of *list.pagination.style.default*. You should also be aware that the *Long* paging style is typically not recommended for generic lists due to the performance overhead required.
column370:
21/Oct/2019 06:08 AM;ramyanisharamanan;Hi Paul,

   The pagination in other Interactive list sections are working fine . The query behind the other working Interactive List Sections is  of type *Prepared Statement Database Query*
 
    Only in this 'List View' Section , pagination is not working. For this 'List View' Section , which is also an Interactive List Section , the query behind the section is of type *Buffered Database Master Query*.  I modified the section type to be 'Generic List' Section. Pagination did not work in that either.

    I have not tried modifying the query type  from Buffered Database Master Query to Prepared Statement Database Query , as the query  type Buffered Database Master Query seems intended for large volume result set.

     The Customer is particular about the Long paging style to have a view of the record volume in the result sets.

Regards,
Ramyanisha
column371:
21/Oct/2019 10:35 AM;Pnolan;Info submitted - thanks, Ramyanisha.

From these details, it appears that the problem is specific to the use of the *Buffered Database Master Query* to populate lists when the paging style is set to *Long*. You could test this by using a *Generic List* section on the screen instead and explicitly setting the *paginationStyle* to *Short* for the section - this may have better results.

The platform team is fully allocated to Platform 8.1 development until the end of November, so they will not have any capacity to investigate this issue before then. If this is a priority issue for the customer, you may need to follow up with CE to request an earlier investigation.

column1: Swift Tag 59F Fail With 2/ or 3/ In Line 1
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
MT103s failed due to specific data value (2/ or 3/ ) present in the 59F tag line-1. If the substring 2/ or 3/ present  in the line-1 of tag 59F, the system assumes that as start position for the address field and fails parsing. 

This seems to be an major issue with the possibility of this occurring in production anytime (for messages having similar data pattern) and urgently needs a fix.

column369:
01/Nov/2019 09:17 AM;waichungkhoo;Hi Ashok, 

Appreciate you could take a quick look on this as customer insist it's our product defect since Swift is allowing the format to get through. Any number other than 2/ or 3/ in line-1 will fail the messages. 

I have read the technical implementation logic behind 59F - http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=Eng&title=SWIFT+MT+2015+Support 
It seems like a special validation is in place to consider 1/ will appear together with header. Could it be the reason this logic fail 2/ or 3/ in line-1? 

Please let us know if you need any discussion on this. 

Thanks.

column370:
04/Nov/2019 02:18 PM;AManayangath;Khoo,

Given the spec is like this:
[/34x]   (Account)
4*(1!n/33x) (Number/Name and Address)

In the example above is the account number "BSB777112/669566" or is it "BSB777112" - I am trying to understand NAB's expectation here.

We discussed this within the team here and we can not see how NAB's version of the message is valid. Can you please review the ref guide we are looking at see the spec for 59F:  

https://www2.swift.com/knowledgecentre/publications/usgf_20190719/1.0?topic=con_sfld_Bguvio48EeiRFupLWiBCUQ_691422706fld.htm

If NAB is sure that the format they are suggesting is correct, we can try asking SWIFT support about it.

thanks,
Ashok.
column371: 04/Nov/2019 02:19 PM;AManayangath;As above
column372:
04/Nov/2019 10:32 PM;mat.bangasan;Hi Ashok,

We have asked the account manager to get NAB's confirmation in option F's formatting.

I already had reviewed the link you provided before, on Oct 10. See [customer-facing comment here|https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/NAB-288?focusedCommentId=23969030&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-].

Will let you know once the account manager came back with updates.

Thanks,
Mat
column373:
05/Nov/2019 09:57 AM;waichungkhoo;Hi Ashok, 

NAB use BSB (6 digit code to identify bank branch & city), follow with '/' then account number in line-1 instead of pure account number only. Therefore, we will see their message come in this format 'BSB777112/669566'. BSB777112 is their BSB code while 669566 is the account number. We fully understood that they should use the account number but they have also challenge us that SWIFT allow the format to go through. 

We then review the document "Watchlist Manager SWIFT Messages Reference Guide 7.6", under section 3.3 - SWIFT Tag Format Key. It mentioned '/' is the allowed character and it should be handled accordingly.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

example: 
|4*35x|Value contains up to 4 lines of up to 35 characters each|

If we interpret [/34x] (Account), it will be "start with / and follow with 34 characters where the characters are the account number". In this case, regardless of customer using any format, as long as they are allowed characters, it should be handled by Netreveal. 

Please correct me if my understanding is incorrect. I think a clarification with SWIFT support is needed since it's a grey area. Also, another important point from Services is that NetReveal is allowing ‘/’ in other tags (like 50K), which also has same /34x line format. I think the validation logic behind for option F is causing the problem as we don't see any issue with parsing other combination(E.g. '/BSB777114/669566', '/BSB777115/669566', etc.).

Thanks.
Khoo
column374: 05/Nov/2019 09:58 AM;waichungkhoo;Attached "Watchlist Manager SWIFT Messages Reference Guide 7.6".
column375:
07/Nov/2019 09:56 AM;waichungkhoo;Hi Ashok,

May I have your update on this please?

Thanks,
Khoo
column376:
07/Nov/2019 03:38 PM;AManayangath;Hi Khoo,

We tried running values for 59F from the example above, and we can see the code is handling it correctly in most situations...

"59_acc" -> "BSB777113/669566" 

and rest of the fields are being handled correctly as well.

We were able to reproduce the failure with value with "2/" in the line1, and it seems to work fine for "1/" and "3/" - we are trying to understand the root cause at the moment. Can you please confirm if that the client has the issue only with "2/" appearing in the account line-1 (not /1 or /3).

Thanks,
Ashok.

{code:java}
 //a lenient date algorithm match can produce a match for a null date on the match list

}

column1: Assigned Risk is not resolved correctly when Risk Model has changed
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
We've found some issues with CDD Customer scoring, when new model has been imported.

Originally the issue was found in Suncorp production, where Customers have been missing alerts after review period (6 months). It appears that only customers who had manual risk assigned have this problem.
{code:java}
18-Dec-2019 00:28:10,933 -  -  INFO  LogJob:132 - Rescoring customer [CustomerId = CC-SN111-2-N017]
18-Dec-2019 00:28:11,276 -  -  WARN  CDDScorePersister:1727 - CDD: RiskLevel for id:[1237] Not Found
18-Dec-2019 00:28:11,276 -  -  WARN  CDDScorePersister:1259 - CDD: re-scoring but old Risk level [1237] not found. Continuing as there wasn't oldLevel before.
18-Dec-2019 00:28:11,280 -  -  WARN  CDDScorePersister:1328 - Transition not found for following values: orgUnitId[1005], newLevel[High].
{code}
Looking at the CDDScorePersister class, model and assigned risk ids are taken from previous score. If there are model changes and multiple scores, it's not resolved properly, resulting in above error message in the logs and a missing alert.

Attached is the screenshot of variables at a time when it happens. Risk Model Id and Assigned Risk ID don't match, resulting in null response.

 

Issue can be reproduced on Suncorp Test or NROD Dev environments:

[https://engineering/confluence/display/services/Suncorp+NROD++Environments]

[https://engineering/confluence/display/services/NROD+Base+Environments]
column352:
1st scenario:
1. Find a customer with some cdd score
2. Import new Risk Model (could be the same)
3. Manually change customer CDD Risk to High
4. Import new Risk Model
5. Score a customer
2nd scenario:
1. Find a customer and manually change risk to High
2. Import new Risk Model
3. Score that customer
4. Score that customer again (fails this time)

column377:
06/Jan/2020 09:54 AM;kmackenna1;Hi Ragulan,

Tried Lyncing you but Lync is showing "Presence Unknown" against your name.

Can you let me know the WBS code for this issue and the status on it? Have you had a chance to test the suggested configuration fix?

I've reproduced the symptoms described in this JIRA, using a modified JUnit (CDDScorePersisterODDTest) and can confirm that setting the GENERATE_ALERT of the High RISK_LEVEL to true, will cause the expected alert to be generated.

Unless there is a good reason why this level's RISK_LEVEL.GENERATE_ALERT field cannot be set to true, this is the preferred approach.

Note that, the logic only defers to RISK_LEVEL.GENERATE_ALERT if a specific RISK_LEVEL_TRANSITION cannot be found, so there should be no undesirable side-effects to setting RISK_MODEL.GENERATE_ALERT to true for the [High] level (and any others that need it).

Please try this and let me know the results.

Thanks,

Kieran
column378:
07/Jan/2020 04:50 AM;arturrajski;Hi Kieran,

Risk Models for High risk have this flag set to Y, so this condition is true.
||ID||RISK_MODEL_ID||ORGUNIT_ID||LOW_SCORE||HIGH_SCORE||RISK_LEVEL||GENERATE_ALERT||REVIEW_PERIOD||ENTITY_NAME||
|1202|1010|100|301|700|High|*Y*|180|CustomerCDD|
|1204|1010|100|51|100|Low|N|0|CustomerCDD|
|1203|1010|100|101|300|Medium|N|0|CustomerCDD|
|1205|1010|100|0|50|Standard|N|0|CustomerCDD|

You're right that if *Old Level* is not found and *New* one has Y flag, Alert will get generated.
However, the problem in this case is that the previous Risk was set to High manually and that value is lost (oldLevel=null).
If a customer's calculated score is Standard (and doesn't alert), but Investigator marks it as High, it should alert in the next score, regardless if there was new model imported in the meantime. 

Regards,
Artur
column379:
07/Jan/2020 06:24 PM;kmackenna1;Hi Artrur, All,

I have designed and JUnit-tested a potential fix (pre-existing and new JUnits all pass) for this issue. It is fairly high-risk and would need to be properly tested and, also, regression tested (i.e. tested as robustly as possible).

*1) The issue*

The issue was/is that, on each scoring, the CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE.RISK_MODEL_ID is updated with the model that is currently in production. So, when a risk is manually assigned and then a new model is put into production, the old risk level is successfully retrieved only on the first scoring. The system fails to retrieve the old level on subsequent scorings because the RISK_MODEL_ID has now been updated. (and ASSIGNED_RISK_ID refers to the previous model ID which has now been lost).

*2) Suggested Fix*

To introduce a new field to the CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE(_HISTORY) tables, ASSIGNED_RISK_MODEL_ID (Integer), which would be updated, along with the existing ASSIGNED_RISK_ID, via the Change Risk WA (WorkflowAction). The CDD process would then always use this new ASSIGNED_RISK_MODEL_ID field to retrieve the ASSIGNED_RISK_ID level.

CDDScorePersister.java would be modified to incorporate and process this new field.

*3) Key Points*
 * The new ASSIGNED_RISK_MODEL_ID should either default to -1 (for technical reasons) or the existing RISK_MODEL_ID value.
 * The WA would need to be enhanced to populate ASSIGNED_RISK_MODEL_ID into the relevant record of CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE.
 * If you would like to proceed with this suggested fix, rigorous systems-testing would be required to cover all bases and to confirm that existing functionality is not affected.
 * It is envisaged that the only way the new ASSIGNED_RISK_MODEL_ID field would be changed will be through another manual risk-change at the UI, through the Change Risk Workflow Action. This gives pause for thought - bear in mind that the system will always have access to, and therefore will use, the ASSIGNED_RISK_ID, when available. There may be maintenance implications here for the end user.

Please let me know how you would like to proceed...

Thanks,

Kieran

column387:
14/Jan/2020 01:27 PM;MKolaczkowski;If the old risk level is not present in the current model, we have a problem regardless of the solution...

I think we should live with a fact that risk level's are not removable if you want to use manual risk setting.

The logic could look like this:

IF oldScore.assignedRiskId is not part of the current model THEN get the new id from the current model, using the old lavel name.

After that, everything can be implemented as before.
column392:
16/Jan/2020 05:36 PM;kmackenna1;Hi Kate, All,

Based on Ragulan's response earlier in this JIRA, I have hijacked CDDScorePersister.java from the 7.6.0.13 Core.

This is now checked into the Suncorp trunk (http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/Suncorp_NROD/CodeRepository/trunk/src-hijack/com/norkom/cdd/business/monitoring/score/CDDScorePersister.java) with the following comment

{code}
[PLAT-22924] Assigned Risk is not resolved correctly when Risk Model has changed

1) The issue

The issue was that, on each scoring, the CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE.RISK_MODEL_ID is updated with the model that is currently in production. So, when a risk is manually assigned and then a new model is put into production, the old risk level is successfully retrieved only on the first scoring. The system fails to retrieve the old level on subsequent scorings because the RISK_MODEL_ID has now been updated. (and ASSIGNED_RISK_ID refers to the previous model ID which has now been lost).

2) Fix

Ensure that during each re-score, the ASSIGNED_RISK_ID is realigned, if necessary, with the new model. This is accomplished by searching the
current model's levels for the same name, entity and org-unit as the old level. If found, the ASSIGNED_RISK_ID is updated. If not found, the loop takes no further action and the logic proceeds as before.

In this way, we ensure that both CALCULATED_RISK_ID and ASSIGNED_RISK_IDs come from the same mode for each score record.

3) Log
There is a new DEBUG level log line

 oldLevel ID was ... Updating ASSIGNED_RISK_ID with corresponding current-model level of ...

Example

 oldLevel ID was 4. Updating ASSIGNED_RISK_ID with corresponding current-model level of 9

4) Outstanding Query
What to do - if anything - when the old level is not found in the new model?

File Affected

 CDDScorePersister.java
{code}

Thanks,

Kieran

There are a few of them and all of those customers are going to require a rescore after they have been fixed and I imagine the fix is going to be manual (sql)  to do something similar to what is being done in the code. 17/Jan/2020 04:35 PM;kmackenna1;Hi Artur,

For the purpose of your testing, you can manually remove or rename the following classes in norkom_cdd_business.jar
{code:java}
com/norkom/cdd/business/monitoring/score/CDDScorePersister.class 
com/norkom/cdd/business/monitoring/score/CDDScorePersister$CDDScorePersisterResult.class
com/norkom/cdd/business/monitoring/score/CDDScorePersister$Score.class 
com/norkom/cdd/business/monitoring/score/CDDScorePersister$ScoreCommon.class  {code}
Ordinarily, hijacked classes are removed automatically from the Core jars during the build process by simply specifying them in the ConfigRepository version.properties, viz;
{code:java}
# List of hijacked classes to be removed from the Core jars during the build process (see include of macrodefs in Stage2Build.xml)
hijack.CDDScorePersister=norkom_cdd_business.jar:com/norkom/cdd/business/monitoring/score/CDDScorePersister.class 
hijack.CDDScorePersister1=norkom_cdd_business.jar:com/norkom/cdd/business/monitoring/score/CDDScorePersister\$CDDScorePersisterResult.class
hijack.CDDScorePersister2=norkom_cdd_business.jar:com/norkom/cdd/business/monitoring/score/CDDScorePersister\$Score.class 
hijack.CDDScorePersister3=norkom_cdd_business.jar:com/norkom/cdd/business/monitoring/score/CDDScorePersister\$ScoreCommon.class  {code}
However, Suncorp are on an older version of Apps which does not support this feature. I am also unsure how the project is even building successfully on the CI Server because the SVN ConfigRepository is incomplete - when I checked out the ConfigRepository and tried to do a Stage-2 build, it failed with basic errors (e.g. missing configuration.xml).

As a POC, I used an ABSA ConfigRepository and finally got the expected renamed classes in norkom_cdd_business.jar

Now, ABSA are on scripts 3.1.19, Apps 4.7.0 so one option might be for Suncorp to upgrade to these versions?

If they are unable to upgrade, can the SVN ConfigRepository be updated with whatever the CI Server is using? Then I will be able to make a true Suncorp local build and remove these Core classes another way during the build process.

Thanks,

Kieran

column402:

column403:
21/Jan/2020 10:00 AM;kmackenna1;Hi Artur, Michal,
{code:java}
As you've mentioned, risk level and model id should match for the fix to work, so I cleaned up those values and tested the code again, with positive results this time. {code}
The 'should match' terminology is confusing here.

RISK_MODEL_ID is precisely that - the model ID, while ASSIGNED_RISK_ID is a risk level ID. They are both different IDs (the former for a model, the latter for a risk level within that model).

If these 2 different IDs happened to ever match, it would be by sheer coincidence.

Artur - it's also unclear why/where the CUSTOMER_SCORE_HISTORY (history) table should impact anything?

Thanks,

Kieran
column404:
21/Jan/2020 10:28 AM;MKolaczkowski;Hi Kieran, 

By 'matching' we mean - ASSIGNED_RISK_ID should belong to the model with id = RISK_MODEL_ID.

So if they don't mach it means that Level is from a different Model than the one assigned to Score - this should never happen.

M.

column369:
06/Jan/2020 09:44 AM;JKerkhofs;Hi Edward,

Can you have this issue we have at DNB be investigated? \\ *Remote comment create date: 06/Feb/20 02:21 PM*
column370:
06/Jan/2020 10:16 AM;RHome;Relevant part of stack trace:
{quote}at com.ibm.ws.rsadapter.jdbc.WSJdbcPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(WSJdbcPreparedStatement.java:844)
 at com.norkom.wlm.business.helpers.Configurator.processQuery(Configurator.java:5519)
 at com.norkom.wlm.business.helpers.Configurator.removeExistingListTextNormlizationMappings(Configurator.java:5427)
{quote}
The *processQuery* method does not close the prepared statements. It can't as it returns the result set (if used to query rather than update) and if you close the statement you will also close the result set. There was an attempt to handle this by passing in an empty statement parameter and then closing that statement after processQuery is executed which doesn't work as you can't pass back a changed reference using a parameter in Java.

This method needs to be rethought. Since we have Java 8 now you could pass in a closure to consume the result set and then close the statement in the method. Alternatively, split the method into one that does updates and one that does queries. The query case always just generates a set of ids and names, but the ids are just used for debug, so just return an array of ids (instead of the result set) and close the statement in the method.

The query mode of the method is only called from two places anyway. \\ *Remote comment create date: 06/Feb/20 02:21 PM*

column1: NPE during WLM processing when Match Exclusion Cache is refreshed
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When a payment comes for processing during the WLM Match Exclusion Cache Refresh, Teh payment fails with 'WLM-10000' error due to a NPE.

Attached logs and Payment Information (without actual message)
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352: Process a Payment during the WLM Macth Exclusion Cache Refresh (It only takes few milliseconds)

column369:
08/Jan/2020 12:25 PM;MvanLaere1;Since Match Exclusion cache refresh (topic WLM_MATCH_EXCLUSION_CACHE) has been implemented (Core 7.7.0.8) there is a risk, of NPE during processing when the cache is refreshed.

The reason is that currently, the cache (in com.norkom.wlm.business.helpers.MatchExclusionLoader) is first reset (to an empty map) then it is reloaded. No sync is done so if processing calls getMatchExclusionRules between the reset and the reload, a null list is returned causing NPE in ArrayList constructor.

The solution is to not reset the map, reload in a temporary map then assign that map to the real cache  (with synchronized method to set and get the cache map)

See attached patch

  \\ *Remote comment create date: 14/Jan/20 11:53 AM*

column1: Unable to Export CSV Report
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
This issue happens when multiple user login concurrently and click on Export to CSV button at almost the same time (in milliseconds different). When system hit the error, it throws Null Pointer Exception (NPE) and the issue can only resolved until the application server is restarted.

From: M Talib, Hatta (MY Kuala Lumpur)

Subject: RE: PLAT-22948

Hi Kate, Wai Chung, 

Initially this issue was found in RHB MY upgrade (7.6.0.10) circa 2019 via EMY000148-1180. A platform ticket has been raised via PLAT-22884 after the fix has been confirmed to work.

CE can provide the service to hijack the solution from RHB MY and propagate it to SNROD if that is an option. If not, then its best to use reference to PLAT-22884 which was raised back in Nov 2019 for Product Engineering reference.

Hi Alan,

It is one line fix on the velocityReport.java that stops the velocity class from re-initialising itself again. Crucible Reference: http://proddev-svn:8070/cru/CE-1178#CFR-60475

Regards
Hatta

Paul Nolan wants to confirm that CE has looked at this – can you please let me know what we need to do here?

Kate

column1: Can't open a SM config in DUX if no profile fields are defined
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi,

we are working on a CDD configuration for Scenario manager in Netreveal core version 8.0.0.2.

But this config, that was inherited from another project, don't open in DUX.

When choosing the menu : Scenario Manager CDD > Scenario Manager, then click on a config (any config version, whether it's in production or development), the DUX screen keeps on showing the list of configs, and we can see the upper-right corner link "back to the configurations" as show here:

!2020-02-03_093436.jpg!

There's neither no error on screen, nor in norkom.log.

It's not a global DUX issue, as we can open some other AML and Insurance configurations.

If we click again on the config, instead of "back to the configurations", we get the "error: CFG-10011 - L'écran demandé n'existe pas. Nom de l'écran = null, ID = -1." 

 

You can see this behaviour in all project environments, which proves that it's the configuration that has a problem with DUX. But this config can be opened in the old fashioned java applet. 

Here is a sample config: [^Configuration_1701 (1).zip]

 

Please:
 * Can you give us some guidance for having more logging about DUX?
 * How can we get hint about what's happening in DUX?
 * Can you try to see what's wrong with this config?

 

Thank you for your help!

Kind regards,

Stephane
column352:
* Open our DEV environment: [http://10.227.7.226:8080/netreveal/login.do]
 * Log in with default admin password
 * Open Scenario manager CDD->Scenario Manager->Configuration 1701
 * The config is not opened and DUX keeps on showing the configs list screen, but no errors are shown
You can see the link "back to configurations" on the upeer-right corner.
column369:
13/Feb/2020 05:28 PM;MvanLaere1;When using DUX sm ([smc-webapp-eim-8.0.0.2-SMC.war|http://iedc1gd0bldv03.dublin.norkom.com:8080/nexus/content/repositories/nr-smbd-releases/com/netreveal/smc-configtool/smc-webapp/smc-webapp-eim/8.0.0.2-SMC/smc-webapp-eim-8.0.0.2-SMC.war]) , it is not possible to view/edit a SM configuration if there is no profile fields defined. This is often the case for CDD configurations.

The issue was not present when using 7.7.7.2-SMC

Marc

24/Feb/2020 06:52 PM;AManayangath;From: Fitzgerald, Edward (IE Dublin) 
Sent: 24 February 2020 10:50
To: Ramanan, Ramyanisha (SG Raffles Place); Manayangath, Ashok (IE Dublin)
Cc: Sundaram, Mani (SG Raffles Place); Soma Raj, Vysakh (MY Kuala Lumpur)
Subject: RE: PLAT Issues raised for GELHU-Harmony

Hi Ramyanisha,


For PLAT-23012 how are you importing the list data into the system.
Are you using the standard list  csv import method?

Please not when you are importing a list and it is a multi-value field the character used to denote multivalue should be placed after the column name in the import file.  

ENTITY ID            EU REF NUM~    LASTNAME~        WHOLENAME~

The above is an extract from a exported standard list.
Entity id is single value the other columns are multi value.

Base on the information in the ticket you need to put a ; after the the all_names column.

Regards,
Edward

column1: log4j DEBUG for WLM causes WLM batch failure
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When log4j is set at DEBUG for WLM, it causes WLM batch failure.

Once the DEBUG is modified to INFO, the WLM batch is able to progress and complete to success.

The Reference JIRA  *EAU00068D-202*  is linked to this JIRA.

column1: WLM confgiuration import using "Refresh" mode is getting failed (Double deletion)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: We tested WLM Config import process, the import process got failed.
column352:
You need to use latest oracle jdbc driver (ojdbc8.jar)
Re import, using Refresh mode, an exported configuration containing  Normalization filter conditions or  DataSource Field Transformation Parameters or List Column Transformation Parameters
column369:
24/Feb/2020 03:06 PM;MvanLaere1;When using ojdbc8.jar,

org.hibernate.StaleStateException: Batch update returned unexpected row count from update [0]; actual row count: 0; expected: 1)

occurred.

The issue was related to double deletion of list filter conditions for normalization filters belonging to standard lists.

A similar issue was present for DataSource Field Transformation Parameters and List Column Transformation Parameters.

Marc
