column1: WLM rollup by checkname is missing Transaction.InputRecord. from container
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
hi,

 

client is facing an issue with the WLM rollup.

if we define a roll up as being checkname only the the replacement container doesnt contain information about Transaction.InputRecord. which prevent retrieving information for customer_id.

 

if we setup checkname,transaction then it is populated so it seems application is preventing the right population of the replacement container.

 

can you please advise what need to be done or fix it.

 

thank you,

Thomas Romano
column352:
* create a data source
* make the roll-up to checkname only
* generate an alert with field customer_id

no transaction field are reachable in the container which cause the customer id to be -1

column1: AML Processing: ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
After AML implementation changes (from v3.1.15 to v4.0.4a project versions) the client is getting such errors for a very small number of transactions (a few transactions per 2/3 days).

Java errors:
{code}
        ID REASON                                                                           SOURCE_TXN_UNIQUE_ID RUN_DATE
---------- -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -------------------- --------
      1100 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  -0201057752001       30/10/19
      1101 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  -0201058399001       30/10/19
      1102 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  19513843256001       30/10/19
      1103 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  47151488578001       30/10/19
      1104 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  49651452560001       30/10/19
      1105 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  49651452563003       30/10/19
      1107 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  69051065812001       30/10/19
      1106 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  49651452398001       30/10/19
      1001 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  62150574536001       29/10/19
      1000 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  16530841559001       29/10/19
      1002 java.lang.ClassCastException: java.lang.Long incompatible with java.lang.String  69051065401001       29/10/19
{code}

I checked the differences between AML configuration in those versions ([+here+|https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/CASAV41-326?focusedCommentId=23984705&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-23984705]) and I did not found any type change from Long to String.

I suppose it is similar issue to PLAT-15063 and it is also connected to some configuration change which was done in project config but I need to know the exact cause. We were not able to reproduce this issue on our site, the client is getting it in production environment so not so easy to change log level to DEBUG but maybe it will not be necessary for you to investigate.

AML configs from both versions enclosed ( [^configuration.7z] ).

Regards,
Adrian

column1: CLONE - Modifying user queue's displays 'no rows found' till you press the username hyperlink
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Modifying user queue's displays 'no rows found' till you press the username hyperlink again.  Pressing the user name hyperlink results in a reload of the users queue listing.  This issue occurs when you remove a queue from the listing or when you change the priority of a queue.

Please see attachment 'EUS000119-574.docx'.
column352:
Login as Admin
Administration > Queues and Routing > Manage Subscribers
Search for users in Group WLM EMEA L3
Choose user Erline Eustice
Check the checkbox of one of this users queues and press the Unsubscribe button
Review listing in tab labeled 'Erline Eustice is subscribed to the following queues'
Press users name hyperlink in tab labeled 'Matching Users'

column1: CLONE - WLM Block / Release final sequence to use configured sequences
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
What you use the services framework to send a block / release for real time, the final sequence gets called but its only used to determine the outut queue.
We need for the final sequence to execute the services sequence functions that are configured in the final sequence.
There is a roadmap item for this, but PE confirmed that we can implement for product and not charge to the product
https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/RM-1726
column216: Code merge sub-tasks have been created.
column352:
From the description of WBCUPGV7-97:

What you use the services framework to send a block / release for real time, the final sequence gets called but its only used to determine the outut queue.
We need for the final sequence to execute the services sequence functions that are configured in the final sequence.
There is a roadmap item for this, but PE confirmed that we can implement for product and not charge to the product
https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/RM-1726

Thanks and regards
column374:
11/Jan/2017 07:06 PM;RNathan;Hi Jonas,

Thanks, yes Im aware of this functionality, however, the block and release functions are heavily built and relied upon in Swift / WLM rt screening. These workflow actions handle the alert and txn status changes within WLM, including the block / release statuses, checking for all matches etc.

This is our dev env,http://mykmbnkmdevv02:9083/netreveal/ , but it wont be much use to you as there is nothing configure. This will be an issue for any Apps environment as they all use the same workflow functions for block / release and they all operate in the same way, i.e. calling the final sequence to fetch the output queue only.

Rgds
Ross.
column375:
12/Jan/2017 03:19 PM;jonasfolgado;Hi Ross,

I didn't check your environemnt since you said it doesn't contain the configuration. Anyway, I wanted to be sure that the parameter "useServicesFramework" is set to true since this parameter specifies that the message will be send to a sequence. Also if this parameter is set to true, I'd like to know what is the result in your system. My understanding of this parameter is that it sends a message to a sequence in our system, the name of the sequence must be specified by the transaction (sequenceName or finalSequenceName). 

Reading the description of this ticket, I understand that the message is sent to the sequnece but the functions aren't executed, which doesn't make sense to me ... that's why I asked you for the environment. Could you clarify this point? 

thanks and regards
column376:
12/Jan/2017 08:34 PM;RNathan;Hi Jonas,
useServicesFramework = true.
This comes as standard from all apps configurations. Its needed to lookup the output queue for the final response.
>>which doesn't make sense to me 
Me neither. I only discovered this when I was doing a POC, added some additional functions to the final sequence and they didnt get executed. So when I went digging in Jira I found a related roadmap ticket.
I then did some digging in the code and could see whta it actually executes. Its just a product gap really and hopefully not to complex to implement.
Thnaks 
Ross.

column378:
17/Jan/2017 05:20 PM;jonasfolgado;Hi guys,

I have some time assigned for this ticket but I don't know if we'll implement somthing or not, the requirement is not clear. I have to clarify the following points:

- Be aware that there is a workflow action function that executes any sequence (instead of sending a message), probably that action function could do what youy need.
- After some comments with Ross, I still don't know what is failing because there is not environemnt to check your configuration or a test case. I saw the roadmap ticket but it doesn't clarify enough. Ross, could you explain the suggested changes and the configuration you currently have?

thanks and regards
column379:
19/Jan/2017 12:55 AM;rmcintyre;Hi Jonas,

I've not spoken to Ross about this recently, but my understanding is that we need for the sequence called to actually execute - at the moment, the sequence is really only used to work out what queue to return on.

I'm aware we have the ability to call sequences from workflow now (we've always been able to do async calls, now we can just do direct synchronous calls which is better), but there are 2 reasons I can immediately think of where we want to be able to tweak/execute the sequence:
 # is that we may need to augment/transform the message, or we may need to do other database updates etc.  This was the original use case in the roadmap item raised by Richard Home.
 # It is a lot safer/portable/maintainable for us if we can do this in services manager, rather than having to mess around with injecting additional config into the workflows that come from apps.

Regards,
Rob.
column380:
19/Jan/2017 04:13 PM;jonasfolgado;Hi Rob,

- Firstly I have to clarify your comment:  " the sequence is really only used to work out what queue to return on". I disagree, after having a look to the code we are setting the sequence name for the message, as well, and then sending the message. (see RealTimeLogicFacadeImpl.processFinalResult).

Anyway, I guess what you want is the possibility of add/modify the content of the message before is sent, and for that you want to execute a sequence firstly and then to send the final response.

In that case, I think the best option is to add a new parameter (i.e. sequenceToExecute) to the 2  workflow action functions. In case this parameter is set, we'll execute the sequence using the existing final response message.

Please let me know if that is correct.
column381:
20/Jan/2017 10:17 AM;jonasfolgado;Hi guys,

could you confirm that the option described in the previous comment is OK with you?

I won't start implementation up to you confirm the design.

Thanks and regards
column382: 23/Jan/2017 02:58 PM;Pnolan;Info requested by Jonas...
column383:
25/Jan/2017 09:42 AM;JPerek;The output sequence is used to determine the following things:
1) Output Queue Adapter and JNDI name for an output queue
2) Message Transformer

So what the com.norkom.acquisition.business.facades.impl.RealTimeLogicFacadeImpl.processFinalResult(RealTimeResult, String, String, String, String) method does is as follows:
1) Creates a dummy RealtimeInputMessage (sequence name is set in this message but this is required property)
2) Adds a FinalResponse parameter value into a Sequence's result container under a dummy function "FINAL-RESULT"
3) Determines a Transformer and passes this RealtimeInputMessage through it which creates RealtimeOutputMessage
4) Setups a new JmsTemplate object based on Sequence's output queue settings
5) Determines a QueueAdapter and passes the RealtimeOutputMessage through it
6) Sends to a given queue a result of the above QueueAdapter execution

The idea behind this ticket is to extend the existing functionality by calling a logic similar to 
com.norkom.acquisition.business.facades.impl.RealTimeLogicFacadeImpl.processJMSMessage(Message)

There will be a need to refactor code in the RealTimeLogicFacadeImpl to share common logic between the processJMSMessage and new version of the processFinalResult. 

I don't think any new parameters are required for existing workflow action functions which sends responses.
column384:
26/Jan/2017 10:44 AM;Pnolan;Info submitted through email by Ross...

----

Hi Jonas,

I agree with Janusz.

If we still feel the need for a parameter to maintain backwards compatibility, my preference is to avoid having to change the workflows.
I know this leaves us with a system wide parameter, but in reality, If anyone was to decide to use this new feature and they happen to have other sequence functions that they don’t want this to happen to, they shouldn’t have sequences functions configured in their final response anyway.

Thanks & regards,
Ross.

From: Folgado, Jonas (IE Dublin) 
Sent: Wednesday, 25 January 2017 11:30 PM
To: Perek, Janusz (Poznan); Nathan, Ross (New Zealand); Nolan, Paul (IE Dublin); Joyce, Maria (Australia Melbourne); Sharma, Anurag (IE Dublin); Manayangath, Ashok (IE Dublin)
Subject: RE: Review design proposal on PLAT-20483

Many thanks for your comments and help, Ross and Janusz,

•	I agree with Ross that a system parameter could be another solution to be backward compatible.
•	Regarding the implementation suggested by Janusz, I was thinking in calling RealTimeLogicFacadeImpl.processMessage(id,messagetype, ….) instead of the step 3 in your logic , which will return a RealOutputMessage, and all the rest of the process will be the same. I am not sure about this solution because I am missing  which solution is best from a project perspective.

Please, tell me your opinions.

column1: LinkProcessingJob doesn't use transaction
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The LinkProcessing Job have two issues:
* It uses a mix of JDBC connection and Hibernate Template to perform DB operations. There is no encapsulating transaction so JDBC connection DB actions and Hibernate template DB actions are not part of same transaction. This may result in inconsistent DB.
* The JMS send operations and DB operations are not part of a unique transaction so send operations won’t be cancelled if there is an issue updating the DB. Next time the job is executed, the responses may be send again.
column352: None
column369:
22/Dec/2016 04:15 PM;MvanLaere1;Those issues have been found investigating code for EBE0000410-606.
Using  transctionTemplate to execute the findLinks() and ageingProcess(); in a transaction context should solve the first issue.
The second one (JMS) would requires Db actions and JMS actions be part of an XA transactions.

Marc

16-Dec-2016 14:10:17,440 - User-0 - Session-1421 ERROR RuntimeExceptionInterceptor:41 - CBP-10200
 java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.norkom.apps.configurator.business.plugins.workflowactions.CopyEntityAutomaticLink.audit(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Lcom/norkom/base/resources/model/User;Ljava/lang/String;)Lcom/norkom/configurator/resources/model/EntityActionLog;
 at com.norkom.apps.configurator.business.plugins.workflowactions.CopyEntityAutomaticLink.access$000(CopyEntityAutomaticLink.java:27)
 at com.norkom.apps.configurator.business.plugins.workflowactions.CopyEntityAutomaticLink$1.audit(CopyEntityAutomaticLink.java:90)
 at com.norkom.apps.configurator.business.facades.helpers.impl.AppsEntityLinkLogicHelperImpl.createNewEntityInfoLink(AppsEntityLinkLogicHelperImpl.java:174)

*Feedback from CE Team provided in JIRA OCBCBANK-24*

The root cause of the problem is due to APP 4.3.0 jar files are compiled using coredev 7.2.1.20. Build version information is retrieved from the MANIFEST.MF file from the APP 4.3.0 jar files. Based on PLAT-20045 discussion see https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/PLAT-20045?focusedCommentId=23358154&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-23358154 (Findings from Jerome Gedge)


Specifically the implementation of the method was changed as part of revision 483108 in June this year for PLAT - 19384, so this looks very recent.
 This would affect projects on Apps 4.2 and 7.2 tags from 7.2.1.10 and after.

The reason why Jerome version was working coredev 7.2.1.24 was due to APP 4.2 jar files were compiled using coredev 7.2.0.6 (which still refers to BaseWorkflowAction.java audit method with no return parameters. Therefore the compiled CopyEntityAutomaticLink class file is able to retrieve the existing method signature.

Therefore

Please request a new recompile copy of APP 4.3 using the coredev 7.2.1.24 or higher.

column1: WLM Generic List auditing BULK insert is not updating the updated timestamp for a delete action
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Generic list auditing is not displaying the correct timestamp for BULK delete actions.

When a list is loaded all of the records that are new or updated have their last updated timestamp set to the date the list was loaded. Any records that were deleted during the list load have a deleted entry in the audit log but the last updated timestamp does not change. The timestamp stays at the last time the record was either added or updated.

If a record is manually deleted then the last updated time stamp gets updated to the correct date and time. I have attached a screen shot showing 2 records that were delete, one manually, one in bulk. The manual record updated to the correct timestamp but the bulk record still has the old timestamp
column352:
Open a generic WLM list
Load a list file with some records to be deleted
Open the list audit screen
Search for records with a status of deleted 
The Last Updated Date value will not have been updated to the new time stamp

column1: finishLock needs to be called in ProfileStoreMemory.insert method
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column352:
1) Process a batch through SM and leave SM up
2) Take a heap dump - heapdump-1
3) Process a different batch, involving new profiles
4) Take a second dump - heapdump-2
5) Use a memory-profiler (e.g. MAT - EclipseMemoryAnalyzer, which is a free download) to inspect the
ResourceAccess.trxmap member in both dumps. This member can grow without limit and never gets cleared
down, ultimately resulting in a OOME (OutOfMemoryException)

column1: [Merge to 7.1] WLM - Factiva Import not storing DOB Date notes
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When importing DJ list, the DOB data can contain Date Notes.
Those are NOT stored in the fpfa_dob_data table.

E.g. UID 621687 has 29 DOB values coming in from the XML. 15 on them contain Notes, but none are stored in the FPFA_DOB_DATA table.
{quote}
<DateValue Year="1972" />
<DateValue Year="1972" Dnotes="Hasnaoui Mellit, born in 1972 in Morocco; Hasnaui Mellit, born in 1972 in Morocco" />
<DateValue Day="01" Month="Apr" Year="1966" />
<DateValue Day="01" Month="Apr" Year="1966" Dnotes="Adnan Salah, born 1 Apr. 1966 in Tunisia" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Apr" Year="1966" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Apr" Year="1966" Dnotes="Ben Salah Adnan, born 2 Apr. 1966 in Tunisia; Salah ben Anan, born 2 Apr. 1966 in Tunisia" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Feb" Year="1963" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Feb" Year="1963" Dnotes="Salam Kamel, born 2 Feb. 1963 in Tunisia" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Jun" Year="1964" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Jun" Year="1964" Dnotes="Farid Arouri, born 2 Jun. 1964 in Tunisia" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Jun" Year="1966" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Jun" Year="1966" Dnotes="Ben Magid, born 2 Jun. 1966 in Lebanon" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Jun" Year="1972" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Jun" Year="1972" Dnotes="Maci Ssassi, born 2 Jun. 1972 in Libya" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Mar" Year="1965" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Mar" Year="1965" Dnotes="Arouri Faisel, born 2 Mar. 1965 in Tunisia" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Sep" Year="1964" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Sep" Year="1964" Dnotes="Arouri Taoufik, born 2 Sep. 1964 in Tunisia" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Sep" Year="1966" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Sep" Year="1966" Dnotes="Aboue Chiba Brahim, born 2 Sep. 1966 in Libya; Sassi Adel, born 2 Sep. 1966 in Tunisia" />
<DateValue Day="02" Month="Sep" Year="1966" Dnotes="Abouechiba Brahim, born 2 Sep. 1966 in Lebanon" />
<DateValue Day="04" Month="Feb" Year="1965" />
<DateValue Day="04" Month="Feb" Year="1965" Dnotes="Salah Adnan, born 4 Feb. 1965 in Algeria" />
<DateValue Day="09" Month="Feb" Year="1964" />
<DateValue Day="09" Month="Feb" Year="1964" Dnotes="Arouri Taoufik ben Taieb, born 9 Feb. 1964 in Tunisia" />
<DateValue Day="09" Month="Feb" Year="1965" />
<DateValue Day="09" Month="Feb" Year="1965" Dnotes="Bentaib Amour, born 9 Feb. 1965 in Morocco" />
<DateValue Day="20" Month="May" Year="1969" />
<DateValue Day="20" Month="May" Year="1969" Dnotes="Place of Birth: Manzil Tmim, Tunisia" />{quote}

Likewise these FPFA_DATE_TABLE has a column called DATE_NOTES, but similar, there is NO data populated into this.
Not sure whether DateNotes may only apply to DOB data. (looking at an DJ XML I didn’t see any for other date types.)


Could you please check whether this is a product design decision not to persist this info, or a bug. If the latter, we will raise a defect for PE.

In the FpfaListDataImporter.java code we check if datetype is DOB, but then seem be looking at FPFA_DATE_DATA for DATE_NOTES somehow....

{code}
if ( dateType.equalsIgnoreCase(FpfaDateData.DATE_TYPE_DOB)){
fpfa_dob_data_pstmt.setLong(colIdx++, ((Long) wlmDaoHelper.getIdentifierForObject(idGen_FPFA_DOB_DATA, null)).longValue());
fpfa_dob_data_pstmt.setLong(colIdx++, rowId);
fpfa_dob_data_pstmt.setDate(colIdx++,  date);
fpfa_dob_data_pstmt.setString(colIdx++, day);
fpfa_dob_data_pstmt.setString(colIdx++, month);
fpfa_dob_data_pstmt.setString(colIdx++, year);
String dateNotes = (String)datedetailsMap.get("PERSON:ENTITY-DATEDETAILS-DATE-DATEVALUE_NOTES");
dateNotes = left(dateNotes, "FPFA_DATE_DATA.DATE_NOTES");

fpfa_dob_data_pstmt.setString(colIdx++, dateNotes);{code}

column369: 12/Jan/2017 03:57 PM;brianprall;Eclipse debugger screenshot of incorrect data copying \\ *Remote comment create date: 30/Apr/19 04:25 PM*
column370: 12/Jan/2017 03:57 PM;brianprall;File created to generate error in Paypal Env. \\ *Remote comment create date: 30/Apr/19 04:25 PM*
column371:
12/Jan/2017 03:59 PM;brianprall;Paul,

This ticket is in reference to an issue found on the Paypal environment.  

Within the Queue subscribers import, there is a for block (WorkflowQueue @ 472) that was designed to copy over details of existing database queue subscription entries over top of newly imported ones to prevent data loss (example: if the queue already existed, use existing timestamp data instead of the new imported one).  

However, there is no logic to ensure that the code is copying the correct queue subscriber information on top of the new one.  This can cause constraint violations, as the code does an incremental commit that will cause it to have two queue subscriptions with the same userId and queueId, as well as the potential to mix up data.

I've attached a screenshot for clarity. \\ *Remote comment create date: 30/Apr/19 04:25 PM*

column1: Scenario Chaining doesn't work for time based scenarios
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When making a time base scenario dependent on another time based scenario, the scenario chain doesn't get updated when the "independent" scenario is triggered, hence the dependent scenario is never triggered.

To verify and reproduce, I created a very simple test configuration (attached) with these scenarios (plus a debug scenario to log each transaction processed):
# Multiple credits in single day
Daily scenario. Just checks if there were more than one credit transaction during that day and saves the result in the scenario chain for 5 days
# Multiple debits shortly after multiple credits
Daily scenario. Checks if there were more than one debit transaction during that day and depends on scenario “Multiple credits in single day” in the scenario chain.
# Multiple debits in single day
Same condition as “Multiple debits shortly after multiple credits” but without the scenario chaining. Used to verify that the condition is met, i.e., that missing alerts for “Multiple debits shortly after multiple credits” are due to chaining.
# TX Multiple credits in single day
Identical to “Multiple credits in single day” but defined as a “for each transaction” scenario.
# TX Multiple debits shortly after multiple credits
Identical to “Multiple debits shortly after multiple credits” but defined as a “for each transaction” scenario, depends on scenario “TX Multiple credits in single day”.
# TX Multiple debits in single day
Identical to “Multiple debits in single day” but defined as a “for each transaction” scenario.

I processed five transactions: two credit transactions on day 1, no transactions on day 2, two debit transactions on day 3 and one credit transaction on day 4 (just to make 100 % sure there was no end-of-day processing pending from day 3).

I got exactly what I expected, but not what I wanted (see attached screenshot):
* On day 1, I got alerts for “Multiple credits in single day” and “TX Multiple credits in single day”
* On day 3, I got alerts for “Multiple debits in single day”, “TX Multiple debits in single day” and “TX Multiple debits shortly after multiple credits”.
* I did *not* get “Multiple debits shortly after multiple credits”.

Looking at the profile sink (see attachment), I see that _TX_Multiple_credits_in_single_day_chain_ equals 1.0 as soon as the scenario is triggered but _Multiple_credits_in_single_day_chain_ remains 0.0 throughout. This confirms that the scenario chain isn’t updated for the daily scenario (after all, I did get an alert for the scenario).
column352: Created test configuration, see Description

column1: Build number field for version.html
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The CS team would like for the addition of a new field (build number) to the version.html. The intent is that would be automatically filled with the build-number of the build.

The justification for this is that it will allow us to identify a particular build much more definitely. The date field is useful but if there have been several builds on the same day then it can be difficult to identify the exact build in question. It can be done but it is time-consuming and a build-number would be much faster and far more definite.

column1: CLONE - When importing Queuing&Routing configuration, the the list of users subscribed to a queue is not being updated
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When importing Queuing&Routing configuration, the the list of users subscribed to a queue is not being updated.

This happens if you have a queue and there are some users already subscribed and you try to import new queue_and_routing configuration where you have for instance less user subscribed to the queue.
In general the import of new / amended subscribers fails if there are already any subscribed to the queue.

See the steps to reproduce.

Request to CE team, once you confirm this is a bug , could you verify pleas if this is a PLAT issue and if so , could you raise a PLAT ticket for this (if not already existing). Thank you in advance.
column352:
# Log in to the GUI as admin user
# Navigate to: Administration -> Queueing and Routing -> Manage Queues
# From drop down lists select 'HSBC Alert Queue Entity 1' entity and press the "Search" button. 
# Click on the "AML UAR Alerts" queue to see its details
# Click "Queue Subscribers" button (located at the top side of the page)
# On the "Candidate Subscribers" section , select 5 users and press "Subscribe" button
# Repeat the action: on the "Candidate Subscribers" section , select another 5 users and press "Subscribe" button
# You should have now 10 users being subscribed to a queue
# Check the records in the database, e.g. by running:
{code:sql}
select wqs.*, q.name, u.first_name, u.last_name, u.login from WF_QUEUE_SUBSCRIPTION wqs, WF_QUEUE q, USERS u
where wqs.WF_QUEUE_ID = q.ID
and wqs.USER_ID = u.ID
and q.name = 'AML UAR Alerts'
order by login;
{code}
# 
# Write down the name of the user who is a candidate for a subscriber of a queue, you need to look up its login in the USERS table. It will be used later on.
# Now go to Administration -> Queueing and Routing -> Reload Configuration
# Go to Administration -> Queueing and Routing -> Export Configuration
# Do not select any domain (all will be exported) and press "Export Configuration" button. Save the file locally
# Edit the file. Find the 'AML UAR Alerts' queue definition and its subscribers. a) Remove user e.g. on position 8 b) change the login id of user on position 9 to the login you have previously written down. In effect you should have a list with 9 subscribers and one being changed and one deleted.
# Navigate to dministration -> Queueing and Routing -> Import configuration
# Select 'Import Queue Subscribers' tick-box
# Browse to the amended q&r configuration file and press "Import" button.
# The action will be completed
# Check the records in the database, e.g. by running:
{code:sql}
select wqs.*, q.name, u.first_name, u.last_name, u.login from WF_QUEUE_SUBSCRIPTION wqs, WF_QUEUE q, USERS u
where wqs.WF_QUEUE_ID = q.ID
and wqs.USER_ID = u.ID
and q.name = 'AML UAR Alerts'
order by login;
{code}
# The list of subscribers will not be changed. What we are expecting is we should see the amended list of subscribers.
# This is very problematic as we are not able to import any subscribers if the queue has already got any.

column1: DBAgeInDaysTillToday function fails in DB2 for the queries where it is used
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
1) When a PF supervisor logs in  vml-1046:9080, then his home page shows error, db2 systax error for the DBAgeInDaysTillToday 
2) Authorization Details page is also showing error, the same db2 error for the DBAgeInDaysTillToday .
there is 9 places where this DBAgeInDaysTillToday is used in queries.

Checked in db2 and found that the query is giving syntax error after translating the query for DB2 but for Oracle they are working fine.

After transforming the query for DB2,the DBAgeInDaysTillToday becomes

CAST(TIMESTAMPDIFF(16, (CURRENT TIMESTAMP) - ww.CREATION_TIMESTAMP AS INTEGER) AS age_in_days which is giving error in DB2.

where DB2 expects a ")" after the ww.CREATION_TIMESTAMP.

Please see the attached files for error log and screen shots where the error occurs.

column371:
21/Mar/2017 05:37 PM;AManayangath;Gambhir,

Can you please explain what is the problem here? Checks without check conditions are not a valid configuration, is there a reason why you have such a configuration?

thanks,
Ashok.
column372:
06/Jul/2017 11:17 AM;GJat;Hi Ashok,

This check without check condition was just created during development and so it is failed but there is no such restiriction or kind of validation where in you can not not have check without check conditions. So our assumtpion is if there is not check condition under any check it should be even considered for screening. This thing is nowhere mentioned in any product guide which says no check without check conditions.

Thanks,
Gambheer

column1: Discretization is incorrect when NaN values are present
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: The discretization intervals in the resulting model overlap due to problem with sorting.
column352: Train Naive Bayes model on a dataset containing NaN values.

column372:
31/Jul/2017 05:28 AM;achopra;*+Investigation Inputs+*

The Add Document on the Customer Detail > Content tab – Triggers a Workflow junction function : which at the base hits at *A_EIM_CU_003*

This has two action functions associated to it.
Issue with the Action Function - *EIM_AttachFile1*

*_If we add the fileName parameter to have the replacement value [DOCUMENT_URL] > the attach document is working fine now._*

*+Some Other Inputs+*
For all other entities – Alerts, Cases, Assoc Party - these have the [DOCUMENT_URL] tagged to fileName parameter on Add Document workflow type.
To give it a try - I added this to the Customer related action function & the attach document worked.

PS Note – 
*_The configuration on 7.2.1.19 Vs 7.3.1.6 for all entities around attach document is the same._*
*_On Tag 7.2.1.19 – The customer attach document has the same configuration as on 7.3.1.6 (does not have the filename parameter populated) and it does not error out._*
column373:
30/Aug/2017 02:44 AM;achopra;Ran DEBUG on the following class - *log4j.category.com.norkom.configurator.business.facades.helpers.WorkflowActionContainer*
It was found that the NPE come up from *AddDocumentAction.java* during the initialise() call.

Note - _We need the following parameters for Add Document - documentIdName, filename, fileDescription, documentName & documentType_

The APPS configuration around A_EIM_CU_003 - does not have the parameter filename set.
It is the code that handles the check on the filename during the initialise() call by getting the value from actualFileName (reserved.passthru.
uploadFileName)

If the configuration parameter filename is not set (_*APPS never sets it for Add Document on Customer entity*_) - The code is supposed to check if the filename is null and derive the value from actualFileName.
The condition for the check was there but the assignment was missing.

Below code added to com.norkom.cm.business.plugins.workflowactions.*AddDocumentAction*
*fileName = FilenameUtils.getName(actualFileName);*

Generated the build and deployed the EAR to Dev and ran the tests again.
Tests successful.

Also below the feedback from customer:
{code:sql}
This one error is not a big issue.. we see it a few times a week. We can ignore it with our log parser.
The problem is that the number of errors in the logging has increased substantially since WLM7. And I would like to prevent a state where the logging is riddled with error messages with no real impact. As I have seen with other applications, the commitment by ops engineers for an application with many errors is less than with an application that has smart logging. I hope to get WLM improved with tickets like these.

In general: I would like better error handling by WLM. Both in the logging, and in the GUI.
While we could propose that as an RFC or something, I think that feedback on actual production errors would be a far more efficient way to do so. Hence these tickets.
provided that your engineering dept picks these up and provide improvements, likely valuable for all your customers. 
{code}


Regards

Jurgen

column1: Variable of type Map won't go through workflow junctions with 'strict variable scoping' enabled
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.

Replacements Container variables of type Map are not being passed through Workflow Action Junctions that use strict variable scoping, regardless of whether they are added as Input Parameters to the junction or to the route.

Impact for APPS of this issue is that for one Workflow Action in the WLM project we needed to disable Strict Variable Scoping in order to make the workflow action work properly.
column95: creation of a sample screen and workflow configuration;28/Mar/2017 11:15 AM;TKazmierczak;10800

column352:
1. Create a workflow action with junctions that use strict variable scoping.
2. Add a wizard screen that puts a Map into the Replacements Container
3. Add an input parameter to the junction with strict variable scoping, which would pass the Map variable through the junction
3.a Alternativaly to the above step, add a similar input parameter to the junction's route instead
4. In the implementation of the action, make use of the Map variable

column1: CLONE - Files in Platform and in services are checked-in with cp1252 enhcoding instead of UTF-8.
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
We have constant problems with source and test files being checked-in with cp1252 encoding. This wastes a lot of time.

This can cause various problems from corrupt properties files, non-compiling sources and bad test data.

One solution adopted is to stop using non-ASCII characters (e.g,. ©) and to use some ASCII replacement (e.g., (c)), but this is a workaround and isn't really necessary. Look - the © symbol works fine.

A secondary problem is DOS line-feeds, which is less serious, but not ideal.

The problem is caused by incorrect encoding settings in the workspace of Eclipse.

TO FIX FOR ALL NEW WORKSPACES:
The problem can be fixed in a workspace by changing the encoding (go to preferences and search for encoding), but a more permanent solution is to amend the eclipse.ini and add an defaults.ini file as follows:

Create a defaults.ini file in the Eclipse configuration folder: e.g. D:/Java/Eclipse/configuration/defaults.ini, if Eclipse is installed in D:/Java/Eclipse. The file should contain:

{noformat}
org.eclipse.core.runtime/line.separator=\n
org.eclipse.core.resources/encoding=UTF-8
{noformat}

In eclipse.ini (in the eclipse install folder) add the following line:

{noformat}
-plugincustomization 
D:/Java/Eclipse/configuration/defaults.ini
{noformat}

replace the path by wherever your configuration folder is.

IF YOU HAVE ALREADY CREATED A WORKSPACE:
You will have to go into Eclipse preferences -> General -> Workspaces and change the encoding and end-of-line settings.

**I believe this needs to be communicated to developers, PCs, TCs and made SOP for projects and engineering.**

There is an ant task I wrote in the norkom ant tasks folder that checks for non-UTF-8 files, should anyone want to add it to the build.

column1: CLONE - The description of the Default Normalisation rule in the WLM User Guide (7.2) does not match the implemented functionality
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The description says:

Default Rules
DESCRIPTION
This performs all the previous hard wired normalizations except upper to lower case conversion which is available using Upper To Lower.
INPUT
A comma separated list of input characters to which the default rules will not be applied.
OUTPUT
A comma separated list of output replacement tokens for the specified input characters.

In fact it does (and probably should) perform upper to lower case conversion.

It does not do replacement of the input characters, but rather passes the characters in the input list through unchanged.

Additional Note:
The implemenation of parameter is very inefficient. It parses the parameter on each invocation of the executor and does nasty stuff with converting single characters to strings, whereas it could just do instr. The input doesn't need to be comma separated as it is a list of single characters, so the only effect of using a comma is to ensure that you can't specify a comma in the list.

Attracta

column1: Inconsistant Rendering by field-formatters
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
This ticket is arising from EUR-55/CES-1927

In the mirror-deployment I created the alert A170200091030. If you have a look at the attached picture-file I'm attaching (Unexpected_Rendering.jpg) you'll see the three fields that are relevant. In one of them it display as {{cpt_ctt_inf_tx = <CAVIEDES.CRUZ@Leonardo.gr>}}. That is the expected behaviour. Two other fields use different formatters and don't escape the angle-brackets. They are incorrectly parsed by the browser and the email address is swallowed.

In the Best Matches field on the same section we see
{noformat}In WORLDCHECK: cpt_ctt_inf_tx = Free Text Match >= 85% CAVIEDES CRUZ Leonardo{noformat} and presumably that should say something like {noformat}In WORLDCHECK: cpt_ctt_inf_tx = <CAVIEDES.CRUZ@Leonardo.gr> Free Text Match >= 85% CAVIEDES CRUZ Leonardo{noformat}

And in the "All Matches" tab we see {noformat}cpt_ctt_inf_tx = Free Text Match >= 85% CAVIEDES CRUZ Leonardo{noformat} that presumably should be {noformat}cpt_ctt_inf_tx = <CAVIEDES.CRUZ@Leonardo.gr> Free Text Match >= 85% CAVIEDES CRUZ Leonardo{noformat}
||Screen Name||Field nameName||Caption||Data Field||Field Formatter||Works as expected?||
|WLM_WLMBatchAlertDetails|WLM_inputDataMemo_n_map|Input Data|INPUT_AS_MAP|Map Formatter|Yes|
|WLM_WLMBatchAlertDetails|WLM_bestMatchdata_n_bestms|Best Matches|WLM_RULE_ALERT_ID|Best Matches Field Formatter|No|
|WLM_AllMatches|WLM_matchEntries_n_match|Match Data|MATCH_ENTRIES|Match Entries Field Formatter|No|


Looking in the replacements container I see the following
|INPUT_AS_MAP|{agt_lng_nm=agt_lng_nm, agt_spn_id=agt_spn_id, bus_dom=bus_dom, byo_par_cli_lng_nm=byo_par_cli_lng_nm, cpt_ctt_inf_tx=<CAVIEDES.CRUZ@Leonardo.gr>, cty_nm=cty_nm, cur_nm=cur_nm, enr_chl_cd=enr_chl_cd, eoc_agt_cd=12341234, eoc_fnd_sor_cd=11112222, eoc_par_nb=2233445566, fif_nar_tx=fif_nar_tx, filt_entity_id=filt_entity_id, fir_nar_tx=fir_nar_tx, fnd_ord_id=fnd_ord_id, from_cmo_cd=from_cmo_cd, fsp_lng_nm=fsp_lng_nm, fsp_spn_id=fsp_spn_id, fth_nar_tx=fth_nar_tx, ifo_par_cli_lng_nm=ifo_par_cli_lng_nm, inr_rgs_nmo_nm=Viktor Anatolijevitch BOUT, inr_spn_id=inr_spn_id, nar_tx=nar_tx, organization=EBA, par_ctt_inf_tx=par_ctt_inf_tx, six_nar_tx=six_nar_tx, snd_nar_tx=snd_nar_tx, source=Source, svn_nar_tx=svn_nar_tx, thd_nar_tx=thd_nar_tx, too_cmo_cd=too_cmo_cd, trf_cpt_fir_lev_acc_tx=trf_cpt_fir_lev_acc_tx, trf_cpt_fir_lev_tx=trf_cpt_fir_lev_tx, trf_cpt_snd_lev_acc_tx=trf_cpt_snd_lev_acc_tx, trf_cpt_snd_lev_tx=trf_cpt_snd_lev_tx, trf_cpt_thd_lev_acc_tx=trf_cpt_thd_lev_acc_tx, trf_stl_ple_nm=trf_stl_ple_nm, txn_dom=txn_dom}|
|BEST_MATCH_ENTRIES|[[-20000configuration.detection.check.match.type.free.text.match.85cpt_ctt_inf_txCAVIEDES CRUZ Leonardo <CAVIEDES.CRUZ@Leonardo.gr>]]|
|WLM_RULE_ALERT_ID|92030|


It would seem the that the Map Formatter is escapting that email address so that it displays as-expected. The Best Matches Field Formatter is using an ID to retrieve the data from the database before "swallowing" the email-address. It looks like the Match Entries Field Formatter is provided the data from the section query and doesn't escape it so that it also "swallows" the email-adress.

None of those formatters seem to have a parameter that would control how that angle-bracket is handled. So the behaviour seems inconsistant. Because it displays as-expected in one field and the doesn't display in the other two our formatters are treating the same data inconsistantly. I think that is what makes this a legtimiate problem. Whatever we do or don't-do I think the formatters must be consistant.

column1: Default search indexes build into application_home/fts
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The default search settings deployed from core lead to indexes being built into a directory called "fts" in the application home.

This is undesirable as the "fts" directory is named incorrectly (e.g. still referencing fts, rather than search) and contains no files other than the indexes that are built.

I suggest modifying Core conf/search/server/se-web-elasticsearch.yml to either:
# set the path.data value to @nbp.norkom.home@/search/indexes, or
# parameterise the "fts" part of the path.data value

# View file app_home/conf/search/server/se-web-elasticsearch.yml

column1: Subject screening list section fails to render due to a null pointer when navigated by back button
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
From the UI: Subject screening list fails to render correctly if the users navigates back to the screen after navigating to alert details forcing the user to have to refresh and re-enter search terms manualy each time.

The DatasourceEntrySectionController renders the section by looping through the associated fields for the given datasource and checking to see if it has a value to display. However, the section controller only checks for it in the request parameters. These values get cleared after the user navigates to the alert details screen. Because the code presumes the request parameter to have a value, this results in a nullpointer causing the section to fail to render. The code should check for the values in the replacements container as well since the values are still present there.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
1) Go to subject screening screen. 
2) Perform a search that will generate at least one alert.
3) Navigate to alert details screen.
4) Hit back button.

Expected: Return to subject screening screen with search results and query fields populated from previous search.
Actual: List section completely fails to render, and a nullpointer stacktrace appears in norkom.log.

column1: application.xml Dropped <display-name> tag around 7.2
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Sometime around 7.0 and possibly the change to EJB 3.0, we dropped the following tags from the application.xml
{code:xml}
  <display-name>Norkom</display-name>
  <description>Norkom</description>
{code}

Looking at all check ins when this occured and the linked jiras this looks like more of an oversight than a deliberate removal.

It would be nice if this was reinstated.

As an added bonus, it would be nice if the build could dynamically generate the name based on versions etc, so we can do something like

 <display-name>NetReveal__#core.version#__#build.client.version#</display-name>
  <description>NetReveal Version #core.version# : Project Release version: #build.client.version#</description>

You then just need an ANT task to do the replacement

{code:xml}
<target name="applic.extended.modules" if="build.module.customer.extended_acq">
		<echo>Adding customer application modules to application.xml</echo>
				
	 	<loadfile property="applic-modules-customer-acq"  srcfile="${project.assets.stage1.dir}/packaging/ejb/acq/customer-acq-ejb-extension.xml.txt"/>		
		<replace file="${assembly.dir}/applic/META-INF/application.xml" value="${applic-modules-customer-acq}">
			<replacetoken><![CDATA[<!-- CUSTOMER_MODULE -->]]></replacetoken>
			<replacefilter token="#core.version#" value="${core.version}" />
			<replacefilter token="#build.client.version#" value="${stage3.release}" />
		</replace>  	
	</target>
{code}

column1: Content of <wlmresult> requires escaping
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352: the <wlmResult> generated by EXTENDED-WLM-PROCESS function fails to be processed if the content contains invalid xml that needs escaping like an ampersand
column369:
14/Mar/2017 04:06 PM;PTDYau;Refer to NORD013-1168 for detail.

A fix has temporarily been implemented in the Nordea project.

Quite simply within the ExtendedWLMRealTimeFunction class, in the dataToXml method where there is a last call to append the data within the else clause (line 144) buff.append(data);  this has been replaced with buff.append(StringEscapeUtils.escapeXml(data.toString()));

This type of escaping needs to been done in probably all other areas where we are building up an xml response message.

Derek

column1: CLONE - limit on number of fuzzy matches no longer prioritizes matches by hit count
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The InvertedFuzzyIndexer respects a limit set by filtering.index.text.in-memory.process.max.records which restricts the number of matches that the algorithm returned.

In the original code the impact of this restriction was mitigated by sorting the list of hitting ids by their hit count (that is, the number of matching words)  in reverse order; hence, the ids with the lowest hit count would be lost.

This worked well for fuzzy match where the length of the input correlates with the watch-list entry length, so the number of matching words is a good indicator. For Free Text Match, it doesn't work so well as we can match on short expressions as well as long ones, and a short expression with few hits could be better than a long one with a lot of hits. [NOTE: the limit is not implemented for Free Text Match, only Fuzzy: possibly an ommission.]

But nevertheless, it was better than nothing.

However, the PLAT-15546 change introduced updates that sorted the ids in numerical order, hence losing the original ordering on hit count. This happens within IndexHelper.retrieveInternalIdsForScoring.

PLAT-15546 implements support doing a union of candidate watch-list ids from the current list check with those of a previous list check (by an AND operator) hence reducing the number of ids that need to be scored. However, this code does a lot of work, even if there are no previous ids to intersect with. It still sorts the results.
column352:
The InvertedFuzzyIndexer respects a limit set by filtering.index.text.in-memory.process.max.records which restricts the number of matches that the algorithm returned.
In the original code the impact of this restriction was mitigated by sorting the list of hitting ids by their hit count (that is, the number of matching words) in reverse order; hence, the ids with the lowest hit count would be lost.
This worked well for fuzzy match where the length of the input correlates with the watch-list entry length, so the number of matching words is a good indicator. For Free Text Match, it doesn't work so well as we can match on short expressions as well as long ones, and a short expression with few hits could be better than a long one with a lot of hits.
But nevertheless, it was better than nothing.
However, the PLAT-15546 change introduced updates that sorted the ids in numerical order, hence losing the original ordering on hit count. This happens within IndexHelper.retrieveInternalIdsForScoring.
PLAT-15546 implements support doing a union of candidate watch-list ids from the current list check with those of a previous list check (by an AND operator) hence reducing the number of ids that need to be scored. However, this code does a lot of work, even if there are no previous ids to intersect with. It still sorts the results.
column369:
30/May/2017 06:21 PM;AManayangath;Richard,

What is the impact of this issue - is it losing potential true matches due the new sort order? Can you help me under the impact and severity of this issue?

regards,
Ashok.
column370:
31/May/2017 08:59 AM;RHome;There is a limit that can be specified on the number of matches that gets returned by the free-text-match and fuzzy-match algorithms. If the number of matches is greater than the limit then the excess matches are lost. I think this happens at the trigram phase. I don't think it is used much.

The algorithm is supposed to sort the matches in order of the number of words that hit in the expression and then discard the matches with the least number of words, hence making it less likely that you will discard a match that was 100% in favour of ones that were much lower.

This is broken in the free text matching, so potentially if an input has a lot of matches and some get discarded, it is now much more likely it will discard a true positive match and retain false positives.

I did fix this during some major changes I did for the InvertedFuzzyIndexer for performance reasons at RBI. It would be hard to fix in another way. On the assumption that eventually the RBI performance improvements might all be rolled into platform, you could postpone this ticket until then.
column371: 31/May/2017 09:17 AM;AManayangath;Thanks for the explanation Richard.

column1: Deprecated Javascript function CSSStyleSheet.removeRule
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The Javascript file: jscripts\app\util\jq_utils.js
is calling deprecated method CSSStyleSheet.removeRule() instead of CSSStyleSheet.deleteRule().

See https://developer.mozilla.org/fr/docs/Web/API/CSSStyleSheet/deleteRule for more information on these functions.

For the moment the only impact is with Firefox, the export of applications is failing because of javascript error "TypeError: waitStyleSheet.removeRule is not a function".

I know Firefox is not officially supported in 7.2 but I suppose it's a good idea to fix it in case chrome or IE stop supporting the method. Also it is quite a big issue not being able to export applications for people using Firefox (eventhough it's not officially supported).
column352: Export an application in Application builder using Firefox.
column369:
15/Mar/2017 03:48 PM;anthonylejalle;The code-change I tested:
- with current code in jscripts\app\util\jq_utils.js:
{code}waitStyleSheet.removeRule(ruleIndex);{code}
Application builder export is KO on Firefox, OK on Chrome and IE.
- with new code in jscripts\app\util\jq_utils.js:
{code}waitStyleSheet.deleteRule(ruleIndex);{code}
Application builder export is OK on Firefox, Chrome and IE (since IE9).

column1: JEP expression on case search screen doesn't work if the user is on the Case Details screen before navigating
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
JEP expression most likely doesn't work because the replacements container variables used by the JEP expression are populated on previous screens

Replacements need to be cleared when accessing All Cases Search, or the fields on All Case Search need to be renamed.

Impact is low - worst that could happen is slower performance on the search for non indexed fields in 'Other Case Attributes. However a client raised this as an issue during FAT so if a fix is possible then great! Raised as a platform ticket as the issue is re-producible on 3 different environments for different projects.

Regards,

Stephen
column352:
I was able to replicate this in 3 different environments for 3 different projects:

Login, go to Group Work > All Cases
Attempt to perform a case search using a field in the 'Other Case Attributes'.
The user receives a warning telling them that one of the 'Case Identity' attributes should be selected before searching based on the JEP expression behind the screen.

Now create a case (user is navigated to Case Details screen upon completion).
Again, go to Group Work > All Cases
Attempt to perform a case search using a field in the 'Other Case Attributes'.
No warning appears, which indicates JEP expression isn't working as intended.

column1: Inconsistent Permissions settings do not allow for seperation of functions or "least privilege" operation
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The current allocation of permissions to menu items means it is impossible to configure a separation of duties between "normal" administrators and "security" administrators.  It is also impossible to create a truly read-only role for audit users to review the system.

The menus are assigned permissions at the /Administration,  /Administration/Audit etc levels, which means that users end up with full admin priviledges or we have to build homepages and toolbars that point to the screens the users need to get to.

These are just a couple of items that I've found, I think a full review is needed.  Also, this separation of roles is a common requirement with customers and they should be packaged along with the generic admin and config users.
column352: Configure a user with /Administration/Security and /Administration/Audit/Search permissions

column1: CLONE - null pointer exception from DJ merge code
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
AIB (and PTSB) need to comply with Central Bank regulations and perform regular full_full screening. Due to DowJones mandating full list import to ensure records are up to date (as in past delta files had been faulty), 
Banks expect only alerts on changed or missed records.
Current system behaviour when full DJ file import will delete all existing records and add new records. Exclusion will not function as expected and either alert on all records or suppress too many matches (exclusion on internal_row_id or UID). also adds 1.5m records on each import..

proposed solution to implemetn WC like (partial) merge to only import changed and new records. skipping indetical records based on full row fingerprint and mark deleted (or not) all records in DB that are not in the imported file.
column352: N/A
column369:
21/Apr/2017 04:59 PM;EFitzgerald;Hi Ulrich,

This is caused when the system is trying to compare a full fingerprint to no fingerprint of a record, when using full merge import method. 
The reason for there being no fingerprint is because the old full import one would not generate one on import.

In 7.3, the Full import method was deprecated,

As such, to import a full list in 7.3 the user has one option and that is to use the full merge option  
This will build a full fingerprint and a fingerprint will alway be there to compare aginst.

As this is not an issue in product can you close this ticket?

Regards,
Edward
column370: 29/Jun/2017 02:41 PM;UBrell;deprioritse , pending review to closure/

column1: CLONE - Unable to export groups, roles and domains if they are not associated with application
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Elements groups, roles and domains associated with selected application during export are only included in the exported baseconfig file. The fix for this was provided by CE in issue EUS000048-721.

If groups, roles and domains are not linked to an application they will not get exported. Application selection on these elements is not a mandatory field and workaround to export them is to update element with application. In upgraded project like Santander when we import 6.7 baseconfig to 7.2 environment these elements will not be assigned to any application as 6.7 does not have application associated with groups, roles and domains.
column352:
1) Navigate to Administration -> Export Configuration
2) Unable to select 'unlinked' elemenets as an option for export
column369: 02/May/2017 03:54 PM;brianprall;This issue was caused by implementation of the export by application feature, as there is no way to export any applications that are NOT linked to an application.  This can be a problem for projects that are uplifting to newer versions, as they typically experience a large number of unlinked items when importing old configurations.

column1: CLONE - ExecuteProcedureJob doesn't work
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The ExecuteProcedureJob scheduled job doesn't run properly.

It creates an audit entry but there is no debug in the log indicating it ran and the procedure didn't run.

The cause is a mis-match between the name used in the application builder screen to define the job (ExecuteProcedureJob) and the name used in the spring configuration file (ExecuteProceduresJob).

This means the job executor is never found and doesn't run.

As a work-around you can update the job_to_execute column in scheduledjobs to say ExecuteProceduresJob.
column352:
The ExecuteProcedureJob scheduled job doesn't run properly.
It creates an audit entry but there is no debug in the log indicating it ran and the procedure didn't run.
The cause is a mis-match between the name used in the application builder screen to define the job (ExecuteProcedureJob) and the name used in the spring configuration file (ExecuteProceduresJob).
This means the job executor is never found and doesn't run.
As a work-around you can update the job_to_execute column in scheduledjobs to say ExecuteProceduresJob.

column370:
09/May/2017 04:00 AM;KFoo;Hi Ashok,

OCBC project is using the highlighting functionality in SWIFT alerts and there's quite some tickets raised for this functionality.
I've made some study of the highlighting position calculation and the comment above describe what I found.

I also made a new position calculation algorithm to replace the existing one but it's still require some evolution before it's set in stone.

This ticket is for you guys to aware of this issue for the highlighting functionality.

Will update on this ticket when there's update on the algorithm I've made :)

Cheers,
Kimmy

column1: CLONE - Session replication in WAS
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
There seems to be something in the product codebase that makes EIM incompatible with session replication in WebSphere (and probably with other containers too?).

http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/display/KB/Failed+to+replicate+attribute+stateContainer+com.norkom.configurator.web.screens.model.StateContainer

HSBC have been through periods of their WAS nodes going down fairly frequently (EIM is deployed over 8 nodes apparently) for various reasons. The lack of session replication has made the load balancing process in these situations a bit flaky / less then seamless; in particular this has caused complaints from groups of new users whose onboarding coincides with increased system load.

Initially it would be good to impact assess a change to make session replication in WAS possible for UCM either via database or memory-to-memory replication between nodes.

I'll attach a relevant email and a doc.
column352: Session replication support for the application.
column369:
11/May/2017 10:36 AM;CBandara;Hi Paul,

Platform team discussed this change request with HSBC UCM Architects and services teams recently. Platform provided the high-level estimate of 100 – 200 days (including design, development and QA on all supported application servers)

Services have requested to formulate a formal response regarding the integration of this feature from an Application Engineering perspective. 

They are interested in,

•	# days effort (ROM, rough order of magnitude, is fine)
•	Implementation risks
•	Impacts on application performance
•	Impacts on resource utilisation
•	Impacts on support

Given the magnitude of this work, I think it’s appropriate for Platform team to formulate this response.

Can you please let me know when you’ll be able to schedule this response ?

Thanks
Charminda.
column370:
11/May/2017 01:58 PM;CBandara;Just adding what I have found (not sure how useful they are) so far while investigating options,

h5.Option 1 - Session persistence using Database
We can use database to store session data and stateful objects.

Drawbacks - We are likely to hit scalability issues because of the amount of data we have to persist into the database. Also we will have performance issues in our application in a scenario where a node goes down and we needs to create the entire user session state from Database to use in another cluster instance.   

More info - http://docs.oracle.com/middleware/1213/wls/WBAPP/sessions.htm#WBAPP688

h5.Option 2 – Configure Application server clustering
We can replicate all the stateful components (http session data and stateful objects) across all the server instances.

Drawbacks – Because each node in the application server needs to handle the session data and use of JVM heap and frequency of garbage collection will increase. This will affect the overall performance of our application reducing the processing power available to application.

More info - https://docs.oracle.com/cd/E24329_01/web.1211/e24425/config.htm#CLUST162

h5.Option 3 – Use of In-memory cache products (e.g Oracle Coherence, Hazelcast)
We can introduce a caching tier product like Oracle Coherence to handle the http session storage and stateful state storage (if any). 

Drawbacks – New products needs to be evaluated.

More Info - http://docs.oracle.com/middleware/1213/coherence/administer-http-sessions/start.htm#COHCW109
column371: 25/May/2017 05:15 PM;Pnolan;Please note that there is no capacity available on the Base Platform team to perform any additional analysis on this. If a session replication feature is prioritised by product management for a future release, we can review the effort required for further analysis.

column1: CLONE - WebSeal SSO Breaks some Links when not server relative
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
WebSeal SSO Breaks some Links when not server relative.

When using WebSeal SSO, links are altered and rendered to inlcude junction links and cookie information.

Depending on how the url is constucted ( relavtive / server releative /absolute), the link gets broken by WebSeal inserting an additional /screen/ context where no necessary.

This is a known issue, and documented here

{noformat}
https://publib.boulder.ibm.com/tividd/td/ITAME/SC32-1359-00/en_US/HTML/am51_webseal_guide91.htm
{noformat}

And here:
{noformat}
http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/display/Eng/WebSeal

In particular:

Q10.  An image, button or web link is failing / broken in WebSeal, but works fine without WebSeal if we access the application server directly.
{noformat}

The ticket in this instance for Westpac in WPAC036-236 and WPAC036-239

The resolution in this instance which is also what was recommended in the confluence page is to add getContextPath when uploading the document.
com.norkom.cm.business.plugins.workflowactions.AddDocumentAction
 
                  entityDoc.setDocumentUrl(ContextPathHolder.getInstance().getContextPath() + "/cm/report/reportView.do?reportKey=" + docId + "&type=" + mimeType + "&fileName="+ fileName);

column1: Unable to update server state for topic WLM_CUSTOMLIST_INDEXES
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The original issue occurred as customer confirmed there were deployment done for code drop for UOBCR26 (Updates to exclusion Keywords) into their Production on earlier weekend for UOB Indonesia (ticket UOB-178).

As per Javed findings below:
When WLM Config is imported into the system the configuration is successfully imported.
However, the WLM config refresh activities are not performed even though content is available in WLM Config.
1. Content of LIST_INDEX_SSA_POPULATION table is not replaced by the system. There is no IS_DELETED column in this table, so even though the entry from the BAE environment is deleted and wlm config is promoted in UOB environment the entry remains active. 
2. Entries of all the indexes are created in LIST_INDEX table but entries of KEY_VALUE, MATCH_VALUE, SEARCH_VALUE is not getting updated correctly

Suggestion:
The system is only able to insert the entries in this table but system is not able to delete the entry during the WLM config import. Javed recommends to fix this issue either by adding IS_DELETE column in this table or completely delete the row.
column352:
1.	Add 2 entries in LIST_INDEX_SSA_POPULATION table and export wlm config from Environment-1 --> WLM config will have 2 entries --> Deploy the config in Environment-2 and note that these 2 entries are inserted in the table.
2.	Delete 1 entry  from the table and export the wlm config from Environment-1 --> WLM config will have only 1 entry now. --> Deploy the config in another Environment-2 and note that 2nd entry is not deleted. The table still contains 2 rows.

column1: Replacement container altered by report generation
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Some low level field formatter methods used during report generation add query result to the passed replacement container.
If one of the result Data_Field is used in the query behind the report (where clause), next time the query is executed it will not return correct results. This is the case if the report is generated a second time or if pagination navigation is done from the gui.
column352:
Issue reproducible on 10.210.96.69:8080/netreveal :
- Go to Search => Transaction
- Customer number : %1% , From-to date : 01.06.2015 to 16.05.2017 , Organisation Unit : RBI , Branch ID : 33000
- Click the left icon on the right on top of the list (double arrow with caption Export For Transaction Analysis)
- Observe file size 
- Click the icon again
- Observe file size, a lot smaller, a lot of transactions missing due to issue
column369:
31/May/2017 02:32 PM;MvanLaere1;I found at least two concerned field formatters/method:
com.norkom.configurator.web.screens.fields.formatter.CurrencyFieldFormatter.massageForReport(Field, Map<String, Object>, Locale, MessageSource, ReadOnlyReplacementsContainer, ApplicationContext)
com.norkom.configurator.web.screens.fields.formatter.MultiValueTextFieldFormatter.formatForReport(Field, Map<String, Object>, Map<String, List>, Locale, MessageSource, ReadOnlyReplacementsContainer, ApplicationContext)

Maybe the origin is a confusion using that the com.norkom.configurator.resources.replacements.ReplacementsContainer.ReplacementsContainer(ReadOnlyReplacementsContainer, String) that just reference the passed ReadOnlyReplacementsContainer instead of cloning it.

Unfortunately this constructor is use at a lot of places so it is probably difficult to evaluate the risk of changing its behaviour.

At project level, I preferred to explicitly clone the RC before each query execution during report generation but I don't say it is the correct solution.
In any case, I think the RC should not be populated as a side effect of a (low level) field formatter method.
If RC population is required it should be done explicitly.

This raise another question regarding explicit RC population :
- for GUI application section display, the RC is explicitly populated with the query result meaning that subsequent queries attached to a section may use the result via RC variables.
- during report generation, RC is explicitly populated 
 So in some cases the report may not generatee same result as the section display.
As I don't know the specification, I can't tell if that is a bug or not.

Marc
column370:
31/May/2017 02:40 PM;MvanLaere1;I put to P3 because ths has an effect only when query uses RC variable in a way that their content may influence the result.
I am not sure this is allowed in specification.

IN the project, the query was a bit strange::

{code:sql}
SELECT x.* FROM (
WITH getentityid as (SELECT ent.ENTITY_ID FROM RBI_AML_CAT.V_ENTITY ent 
WHERE ent.ORGUNIT_ID = [ORGUNIT_ID]
AND ent.ENTITY_SOURCE_REFERENCE_ID LIKE '[ENTITY_SOURCE_REFERENCE_ID]'
AND ent.BRANCH_CODE = '[BRANCH_CODE]'
),
getaccountid as (SELECT acc.ACCOUNT_ID FROM RBI_AML_CAT.V_ACCOUNT acc 
WHERE acc.ORGUNIT_ID = [ORGUNIT_ID]
AND acc.ACCOUNT_SOURCE_REFERENCE_ID LIKE '[ACCOUNT_SOURCE_REFERENCE_ID]'
AND acc.BRANCH_CODE = '[BRANCH_CODE]'
)SELECT tsr.*
, tsr.AMOUNT_IN_ORIGINAL_CURRENCY AS AMOUNT_ORIGINAL_CURRENCY
, tsr.AMOUNT_IN_BASE_CURRENCY AS AMOUNT_BASE_CURRENCY
, tsr.AMOUNT_IN_ACC_CURRENCY AS AMOUNT_ACCOUNT_CURRENCY 
FROM V_RB_TRANSACTION_SEARCH_RESULT tsr
WHERE [whereCondition]
AND (tsr.ENTITY_ID IN(SELECT ENTITY_ID FROM getentityid) OR '[ENTITY_SOURCE_REFERENCE_ID]' IS NULL)
AND (tsr.ACCOUNT_ID IN(SELECT ACCOUNT_ID FROM getaccountid) OR '[ACCOUNT_SOURCE_REFERENCE_ID]' IS NULL)
AND ('[reserved.EmployeeDataAccess]' = 'Y' OR tsr.EMPLOYEE_FLAG = 'N' OR tsr.EMPLOYEE_FLAG IS NULL)
) x
WHERE [whereConditionInteractiveFilter]	

{code}

As RC was altered, ENTITY_SOURCE_REFERENCE_ID  and /or ACCOUNT_SOURCE_REFERENCE_ID didn't keep the same value as entered in the search criteria section .

Marc

column1: messages.properties internationalisation interfering wtih the Screens
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
If a Case name =CDD , The Alert Details hyperlink to the Case  ‘Translates’ CDD to CDD-Customer Acceptance 
if a Case Name =ODD , the Alert Details hyperlink to the Case 'Translates' CDD-ODD.
If a Customer_name = JL White the Customer Details Screen header, the Alert tabs and the CDD Risk header ‘translated JL to Jalisco

The cause is the messages.properties as Brian pointed out to me yesterday.
CDD=CDD-Customer Acceptance
ODD=CDD-ODD
JL=Jalisco.

For the time being this is being dealt with by removing the entries from the message.properties, note that this is not a long term solution.

This is found in a lot of places in the system and I think it is not straightforward to just fix it for certain scenarios.  I believe a problem is that the key is too simple, i.e. for countries it should really be something like the country name and code concatenated together.  This would avoid most of these incorrect transformations.
column352:
Have the data contain an entry in the messages.properties.
For example a Customer_name = JL White the Customer Details Screen header, the Alert tabs and the CDD Risk header ‘translated JL to Jalisco

column1: Error in WLM BMR job (java.util.ArrayList incompatible with java.lang.String)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
BMR job is giving java.util.ArrayList incompatible with java.lang.String error in BMO Perf environment. Stacktrace: 

2017-06-01 00:09:43,459 INFO  com.norkom.wlm.business.messaging.BatchProcessingMessageProcessor - Processor:19316 received id/seq/recs:26526/19303/500
2017-06-01 00:09:43,559 WARN  com.norkom.wlm.business.facades.impl.ProcessingLogicFacadeImpl - Could not execute check 'CHK_PEP_COMP_NAMEDOB_DELTA_F': java.lang.NullPointerException
2017-06-01 00:09:43,559 ERROR com.norkom.base.business.interceptors.RuntimeExceptionInterceptor - CBP-10200
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.util.ArrayList incompatible with java.lang.String
	at com.norkom.wlm.business.dao.TransactionMapping.getFieldNameToValueMapAsString(TransactionMapping.java:166)
	at com.norkom.wlm.business.facades.impl.ProcessingLogicFacadeImpl.executeAllChecks(ProcessingLogicFacadeImpl.java:1764)
	at com.norkom.wlm.business.facades.impl.ProcessingLogicFacadeImpl.executeAllChecks(ProcessingLogicFacadeImpl.java:1422)
	at com.norkom.wlm.business.facades.impl.ProcessingLogicFacadeImpl.executeAllChecks(ProcessingLogicFacadeImpl.java:1414)

	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:37)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:611)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:291)

column352: I believe you'll need to run a batch job with a multivalue input field, you'll also need to ensure this is a 'bad record' in batch processing and then the code will error out and invoke the getFieldNameToValueMapAsString(TransactionMapping.java:166) method as a List rather than a string.  You'll see that in that method it's always assuming a String, seems like there was  a code change performed a long time ago by dkelly (see comments in the java file) to account for lists, however they didn't fully take into account all edge cases.

column1: CLONE - WLM Issues with Exception Handling in Detection Manager
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
1. Issue:
It's not possible to create and save more than one Exception Check at once.
If you save between each "or" block of the Exception, it works.

2. Issue (maybe related to the 1.)
It's not possible to clone a Detection Rule which contains more than 1 Exception Check.
If you remove all Exception checks and keep only one, it's possible to clone the Rule.
column352: see description
column369:
08/Jun/2017 04:15 PM;BYang;*Analysis:*
The first issue can be reproduced in the 69 environment. Multiple exception checks cannot be saved at once. The save operation would fail with exactly the same error message as above. See attached [^reproducible in 69.png]

This incident can even be replicated in a 7.2 OOTB env. [^reproducible in 1098 OOTB env.png].

*Plan:*
Need to check with Product on the following items:
1. It appears that multiple exception checks are not supported.
APPS-10771 Spec needs to mention that Sanctions and PEP Screens and Workflows do not support checks against multiple watchlists nor having multiple exclusion lists

2. It's implied that user can continue to add new exception condition and/or new exception checks  after creating the 1st exception block. In that sense, multiple exception block are supported.
{quote}
In the same way as you created your first exception condition, you can continue
to build on the logic contained in the Exceptions region. You can:
◆ Add a new exception condition
◆ Add a new exception check to an exception condition
{quote}
Ref: Watchlist manager UI guide 7.2 page 245

column1: Audit Log Screen on WLM Sublist has List Entry Id as BLANK
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Create a WLM Sublist without any columns as UNIQUE_KEY as Yes.
Have a column on the sublist which would be a NUMBER column : Visible as Yes and UniqueKey as No
Add data to the list using Add Row functionality.
Goto Audit Log screen from the WatchList details page using List Auditing button.
The data displayed on the WLM List Auditing page has List Entry ID as NULL.
