column1: Phoenix schema name not configurable in application
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: Code change required to allow the application administrator to configure a Phoenix schema name that will be mapped to the target HBase namespace.
column352:
1. Alpha APPS 4.5.1 build deployed on to client test environment.
2. Application configured to make Kerberos-authenticated connection to secure Hadoop cluster via Phoenix.
3. Apache Ranger rules configured to provide authenticated user with read/write access to HBase namespace: HBASE_NEXTGENAML
4. Big Data transactions dropped into waiting directory to trigger execution of scheduleconfig_aml_bd.xml schedule.
5. Services Manager sequence Daily-TRANSACTION-Phoenix-InitStructure runs, with the intention of creating TRANSACTIONS table in HBASE_NEXTGENAML.
6. Sequence instead attempts to create TRANSACTIONS table in default HBase namespace (where Ranger rules are not defined for user).

Workaround: Hard-coding Phoenix SQL scripts to pre-pend "TRANSACTIONS" with "HBASE_NEXTGENAML" schema name.
column369: 21/Jun/2017 12:27 PM;JLalor;https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-2571: Support specifying a default schema
column370:
21/Jun/2017 12:49 PM;RYoung;hi Jennifer,

The client is currently using version 4.7.0 of Phoenix, however they have confirmed they are not willing to uplift to version 4.8.0 to allow use of the fix in PHOENIX-2571.

Would it be possible to make a fix from our end i.e. prefix all Phoenix tables in the code with a variable name which we can configure at services level?

Regards,
Ross
column371: 21/Jun/2017 04:27 PM;Pnolan;Bartek, can you review this issue to see if there are any options for this? Thanks...
column372:
22/Jun/2017 09:27 AM;BNiemienionek;I would say that in order to solve this issue it would be the best to use some solution on the connection level (connection definition). According to the https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PHOENIX-2571 it's not possible to change default schema used for the connection. That's why is seems that the only way is to amend queries with schema names for each table.

As far as I know from platform perspective we are not extracting any data for the query before execution. So at this level I don't see the reasonable way to solve it in this way.

Solution will require changes in the queries that are accessing the Phoenix:
1.The option to address this issue on APPS side and use system parameter to specify the schema name that should be used in all queries for Phoenix (where needed) and use this parameter in queries. In this way the value won't be hard-coded and in queries use the RC function to get this value - this solution doesn't require PLAT changes
2. Other way is to introduce new RC function that will be used to build table name with prefix. - PLAT changes needed.
column373: 22/Jun/2017 09:31 AM;Pnolan;Jenny, can you follow up with the APPS team to see if Option 1 in Bartek's comment above is feasible? Thanks...

column1: Loader conflict error when using Phoenix full client driver
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: Standard installation guide recommends enabling "Use an isolated class loader for this shared library." property instead of disabling it. Possible this temporary workaround could introduce other issues in the application, therefore code change advised to prevent loader conflict issue that occurs when using application in this way (i.e. with full Phoenix client driver).
column352:
1. APPS 4.5.1 build deployed on to client test environment.
2. Steps taken to re-configure application to use JDBC connection to Phoenix data source instead of HTTP connection: 
   i. Remove Phoenix thin client jar (phoenix-4.10.0b-HBase-1.2-thin-client.jar) from shared_libs library
   ii. Add Phoenix full client jar (phoenix-4.7.0.2.5.0.0-1245-client.jar) to shared_libs library
   iii. Modified base_config.properties file with following properties: 

dataSourcePhoenix.driverClassName=org.apache.phoenix.jdbc.PhoenixDriver
dataSourcePhoenix.url=jdbc:phoenix:<Zookeeper quorum>:<Client nod>:<Parent Znode>:<Principal>:<Keytab file location>

   iv. Websphere application server restarted; application restarted
   v. Application fails to start up successfully. Received following error in server logs: 

[6/1/17 13:37:20:291 BST]     FFDC Exception:java.lang.LinkageError SourceId:com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.webapp.WebGroup ProbeId:131 Reporter:com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.webapp.WebGroupImpl@284659ec
java.lang.LinkageError: loading constraint violation: loader "com/ibm/ws/classloader/CompoundClassLoader@d8c50bfb" previously initiated loading for a different type with name "javax/servlet/ServletContext" defined by loader "org/eclipse/osgi/internal/baseadaptor/DefaultClassLoader@600df88d"

Workaround: On Websphere admin console, navigating to shared_libs libary object and disabling "Use an isolated class loader for this shared library.". Restarting server and application - application loads successfully.
column369:
25/Aug/2017 02:41 PM;RYoung;This looks to be caused by having multiple client drivers installed on the application classpath. 

We already have one Phoenix (thin client) driver installed in the build file:

http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/LBG_AML/CodeRepository/trunk/packaging/libs/phoenix-4.10.0-HBase-1.2-thin-client.jar

This is sufficient for our internal environments, all of which use HTTP-type connections to Phoenix. 

However, Lloyds can only use Zookeeper type connections to Phoenix, which require the use of a different jar file: 

phoenix-x.x.x.x.x-client.jar 

Note: this jar file can be found on the HDP installation directory. In our environments, for example, the file is /usr/hdp/current/phoenix-client/phoenix-4.7.0.2.5.0.0-1245-client.jar

We advise to Lloyds to put this jar file on the application classpath, the easiest way being to add to the shared_libs folder under the application directory. However, on startup of the Websphere server this causes a "loader conflict" error. 

As a workaround, we recommend going into the Webspher admin console, navigating to Enviornment -> Shared Libraries ->  "EIMSharedLibrary" and de-selecting "Use an isolated class loader for this library". Upon saving and restarting the server, the error no longer appears. 

As a long-term solution, it might be worth removing:

http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/LBG_AML/CodeRepository/trunk/packaging/libs/phoenix-4.10.0-HBase-1.2-thin-client.jar

from our code repository. Then, the client only needs to download their version of the client jar file without this conflict appearing.

column1: Network Visualization export - Options for exportFit Parameter should be changed
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The options for the exportFit parameter should be reduced to make configuration simpler and ensure the export is legible.

- 'view' option should be removed because the exported image isn't legible.
- 'chart' option should be removed to make configuration simpler because it is too similiar to 'oneToOne'.
- 'exact' and 'oneToOne' options will remain, and the new default will be one of these options.

- Ensure the parameter allowChartExport is true and the parameter exportFit is set to 'view'.
- Click export button, view exported image and verify it isn't legible.

column1: Spring context initialization Fails when done by EJB/MDB @PostConstruct annotated method
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Observed on JBoss 6+ with application build ion core 7.2. 
When there is a message in  a persistent queue (i.e.: RealTimeQueue) and filtering.build.indexes.onstartup=true, the server doesn't start.
Identified root cause is :‘java.sql.SQLException: You cannot commit during a managed transaction!’ exception.
column352:
Put message in (persistent) queue before application is started.
Set 'filtering.build.indexes.onstartup' property to true
Start application
column363:
All OCBC UI enviroment

DEV_URL:  http://iedc1nkmdevv0116:9091/netreveal/login.do 
Login/passwd: admin / password  
Unix Box	Server: iedc1nkmdevv0116 
Login/Password: root / norkom098 
Application Home: /opt/ocbc/dev/	
StartDomain: nohup ./startDomain.sh &
StopDomain: ./stopDomain.sh

QA_URL: http://iedc1nkmdevv0114:9091/netreveal/login.do  
Login/passwd: admin / password

Login/Password: root / norkom098  
Application Home: /opt/NetReveal/ocbc/qa/

StopDomain: ./stopDomain.sh
column369:
27/Jun/2017 11:33 AM;MvanLaere1;The reason is that the MDB is invoked before the spring ContextLoaderListener  servlet listener so the ApplicationContext is created by the NorkomEjb interceptor (extending  SpringBeanAutowiringInterceptor) @PostConstruct annotated method.

I Think the Ejb3 spec tell that the transaction context for @PostConstruct method is undefined but unfortunately  under JBoss  @PostConstruct annotated method is clearly called in a CMT context and @TransactionAttribut appears to have no effect. 

Depending on the application setting (e.g. filtering.build.indexes.onstartup=true) or state (LockLogic initialization having to clear locks) the Application spring  context creation may fail or be created  containing not correctly initialized beans (e.g. ScheduleJ2EE) 
More over when context creation fails, some static Bean such as ApplicationHelper still contain references to (invalid) context or beanFactory having undesirable side effect on bean creation when the context is  re-created by the ContextLoaderListener.

In Summary,  when there is a message in a persistent queue, the application is generally unable to start  (apparently looping on context creation).

A similar issue can occur during @PreDestroy and String context release. 

This is not observed in WAS (at least 8.5) ,because there is no CMT when @PostConstruct @PostDestroy annotated method. (Note that as WAS doesn’t deliver messages to MDB before the application is fully started, the spring context is always created by the ContextLoaderListener  servlet listener if any).

I didn’t test on Weblogic.

If JBoss 6+ is supported platform , that issue should be solved in product. 

I didn't find a way to  configure JBoss  so that there is no CMT during @PostConstruct so at project level, I changed NorkomElb code to suspend the CMT (if a transaction manager is accessible by JNDI lookup) during the @PostConstruct @PostDestroy  annotated methods.

Marc

http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/OCBC/CodeRepository/trunk/src-test/com/norkom/base/util/ImportWlmConfig_OCBCBANK_750_Test.java

against a schema having the tables DATA_SOURCE_,DATA_SOURCE_FIELDS,DATA_SOURCE_CHECK empty.

I fixed this creating two hashMap where I keep track of the old dataSource\DataSourceField id and the new one generated by hibernate, I also added a new transient property "found" to both DataSource and DataSource entities with is set to true\false whether the entity exists or not in the configuration.
The new method updateTinyDataSourceChecksInfo then updates the tinyDataSourceCheck info with the new DataSource and DataSourceField ids before persist the DataSourceCheck.

Cheers,
Giuseppe

column1: CLONE - The BulkProfileMergeJob does not find the Bulk profiles created by the BulkProfileJob
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The BulkProfileMergeJob does not find any of the bulk profiles created by the BulkProcessJob in the context of the Bulk Profile Extension feature.

Indeed, even though the BulkProcessJob creates at least one temporary bulk profile, the BulkProfileMergeJob never finds them and prints the following line to the log file:

25-Nov-2016 11:17:09,055 -  -  INFO  BulkProfileMergeJob:457 - Merged 0 Profiles in 0.194 sec. Speed = 0.0 profiles/sec

We can see the query being executed in DEBUG - same query returns records when run directly against the database:

29-Nov-2016 16:39:24,320 -  -  DEBUG BulkProfileMergeKeyReader:111 - 	SELECT PROFILEKEY FROM PROFILEINDEX_BULK WHERE TABLENAME = '1022_Account_Account'


The Production profile being merged to is definitely present inside the profileindex table so 0 profiles merges is not justified.

After further investigation and remote debugging, I believe I have narrowed down the issue to a change to the relevant query in the BulkProfileMergeKeyReader.java class. Indeed, as part of PLAT-15928, the original query based on a plain JDBC Statements with static SQL was replaced by a Prepared Statement with variable binding. A different query() method using Prepared Statements is being called now in the read() method, which has an additional parameter of type Object[]. And from what I could see (debugging the various layers of Spring jdbc is surprisingly difficult), the ResultSet returned by the query call is actually empty, so the processRow(ResultSet rs) RowCallbackHandler implementation method never gets called and the bulk profile keyQueue does not get populated.

Note that I tested the profile merge functionality using the original query implementation and I did get all the relevant profiles merged, so this should confirm that the issue is indeed with the new implementation using a  prepared statement; what exactly is going wrong with that new implementation is not clear to me though. Hence, probably a good place/time for CE to take over.

Also note that I reproduced the issue using a standalone server (with Hikari data source) but also under JBoss with different drivers so it doesn't seem to be caused by 'external' factors (not obvious ones anyway).

I have attached a log file showing the Bulk Profile Extension functionality running for the same business day and profiles with and then without the new prepared statement implementation of the sqlkeys query in BulkProfileMergeKeyReader.java.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
- Configure the required items to make the Bulk Operations work. For the Bulk Profile Extension, one needs to activate the scheduleconfig_bulk.xml that comes with a standard build under conf/monitoring and also create some custom db specs which do not come as standard. The items are in our environment and I can provide these if required.
- Identify some Client profiles in the profileindex table and make sure they have some transactions to reprocess on a given day.
- Lunch the Bulk Profile Extension operation from the Scenario Manager - Bulk Operations screen.
- Monitor the norkom.log and see that 0 profiles were merged even though the BulkProfileJob created the bulk temp profiles. The profileindex_bulk table contains the profiles in question.

column1: CLONE - Accuity list import reports error on wrong entity id
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
During import, the Accuity list import can fail with an error such as the one below.

However, the entity id given is wrong and is not the entity id in error. In fact, the import is at this point attempting to commit a batch and the entity id given is the id of the last entry in the batch, not the one that is failing.

This is misleading as it causes people to look at the wrong entity in the import list for the error. There is no way to determine the actual entity that actually caused the problem, other than manually checking the import file.

The error handling should detect cases where the error occurs in the batch and should either report the actual id that failed, or if this is not possible, the range of ids that the erroneous id could be in.

{noformat}
2017-07-14 08:43:35,968 ERROR com.norkom.wlm.business.facades.impl.gwl.GWLEntityListDataImporter:610 - 6558476 for listID:1020
java.sql.BatchUpdateException: ORA-01400: cannot insert NULL into ("OWNER_MVD"."GWL_ENTITY"."NAME")
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeBatch(OraclePreparedStatement.java:10401)
        at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatementWrapper.executeBatch(OracleStatementWrapper.java:230)
        at com.ibm.ws.rsadapter.jdbc.WSJdbcPreparedStatement.pmiExecuteBatch(WSJdbcPreparedStatement.java:1037)
        at com.ibm.ws.rsadapter.jdbc.WSJdbcStatement.executeBatch(WSJdbcStatement.java:843)
        at com.norkom.wlm.business.facades.impl.gwl.GWLEntityListDataImporter.insertDataBatch(GWLEntityListDataImporter.java:563)
        at com.norkom.wlm.listtransformation.gwl.GWLEntityListTransformer.endElement(GWLEntityListTransformer.java:69)
        at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.endElement(Unknown Source)
{noformat}
column352:
During import, the Accuity list import can fail with an error such as the one below.
However, the entity id given is wrong and is not the entity id in error. In fact, the import is at this point attempting to commit a batch and the entity id given is the id of the last entry in the batch, not the one that is failing.
This is misleading as it causes people to look at the wrong entity in the import list for the error. There is no way to determine the actual entity that actually caused the problem, other than manually checking the import file.
The error handling should detect cases where the error occurs in the batch and should either report the actual id that failed, or if this is not possible, the range of ids that the erroneous id could be in.

column1: CLONE - Security issue: List entries are written to the norkom.log during list loading
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
During list loading, some output in the norkom.log contains watch-list data entries.

This occurs if there is an error with the list entry.

This is a problem as some lists are private and there is access control on the lists, and this is invalidated if the list contents are output to the log anyway.

The data in the list entry should not be displayed.
See the attached screenshot for an example.

The data in the list entry should not be displayed.
See the attached screenshot for an example.

column1: Elements in the exported XML configuration file should always be sorted the same way
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi,
We are working in a project where we have multiple environments and multiple applications where one overrides the other one.
The problem we are facing is when you export the application configuration (either application configuration or workflow configuration or base configuration) the XML elements are not always sorted in the same way. Although you may find some small consistency when comes to the order of the main xml tags unfortunately most of the time all other elements are not sorted.
This makes extremely difficult to compare your exported version of configuration with the version storedin the SVN. In services we have a rule that one can commit the changes that he/she has done and it is very tedious process now to find out which changes are mine changes due to having XML elements in the exported file in different order than in the file in SVN.

It should be a failry easy fix to always use some common convention when comes to XML elements (nodes and attributes!) sorting during the export of configuration files.

And that straightforward change may make our life in Services much easier.

column352: Export any configuration file like application or workflow.

column1: CLONE - If a user is created with a 0 password expiry, then it is changed, the password expry date is null
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
If you first create a user and specify no password expiry, the password expiry date is set to null.

If you then change the expiry time to non-null (e.g, 90 days), the expiry date is still null. This causes some other problems.

Probably the password expiry date should be set to the current time plus the newly specified date (or the previous date, whichever is earlier)

column1: Default value shown in description and actual default value are different for two field parameters
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The default values for field parameters named {{operatorFrom}} and {{operatorTo}} are defined as {{>}} and {{<}} respectively in the {{application-builder.xml}}, but in the description about the same fields in same file default values are given as {{>=}} and {{<=}} respectively. 

The issue here is that in the default value for {{operatorFrom}} is taken from different places in two scenarios.
# In the Edit Field screen under application builder, the default value is taken from {{CONFIGURATOR_PARAMETERS}} table which is loaded from {{application-builder.xml}} which is {{>}}.
# In the method {{com.norkom.configurator.web.helpers.QueryFilterHelper#getOperatorForNumberRangeField}} where actual parameters are fetched for preparing the search query, the default value is taken from hard coded static variables in {{NumberRangeFieldFormatter}} class which is {{>=}}.

The second one is correct as the description of the field in {{application-builder.xml}} also says that the default value for {{operatorFrom}} is {{>=}}.

Same is applicable for {{operatorTo}}.

To fix this issue, the actual default values for {{operatorFrom}} and {{operatorTo}} should be changed to {{>=}} and {{<=}} respectively in {{application-builder.xml}}.

22/Aug/2017 05:36 PM;chriscargo;Hi,

Just to confirm that this is not about when we navigate across different screens but it is when we navigate back to the same screen but with a different alert.

Thanks,
Chris
column371:
23/Aug/2017 08:27 AM;carolinetoland;Hi Guys,
If I remember correctly, this was the behaviour we agreed on. We wanted to retain the filter within the same alert screen, and I think it was technically difficult to do this without retaining the filter between screens too? The upshot is, if you go to a different alert, you need to use the clear button to clear the filter. 

At the time we made this decision, we thought it would also save work for a user who navigates away from the alert (to find additional information to support the investigation), and then comes back again - in that instance it would be desirable to keep the filter intact. 
Paul, can you assign this ticket appropriately? I can't change it.
Regards,
Caroline.

column369:
19/Mar/2019 11:34 AM;IKCooper;Hi [~Pnolan] (since the ticket is unassigned),

The NCBC Upgrade to EIM 7.3.1.6 saw this issue yesterday when configuring LDAP replication as well. Applying the workaround listed in the LLOYDSAML ticket: 

{code}update SECURITY_PLUGINS set PLUGIN_CLASS_NAME = 'com.norkom.base.business.interfaces.impl.OneWayHashEncryption' where PLUGIN_TYPE = 'encryption';{code} 

cures but can someone please explain if this is a sensible fix, and what the repercussions of this might be?

[~GKearney], [~mauricedarley] FYI.
column370: 27/Mar/2019 07:01 PM;samtaylor;I second the comment above - we had the same issue on Slovakia Customs (EIM 7.6) and fixed it today by searching Jira for the error and finding this ticket!
column371: 28/Mar/2019 10:18 AM;Pnolan;This looks like a similar issue to [FCENG-6279|https://engineering/jira/browse/FCENG-6279], which has been resolved in the Platform 8.0 release. Changing the security plugin as described by Iain reverts to the old one-way hashing method with no salting for password encryption for new/modified passwords. There should be no functional impact to this, but the old password encryption method can be less secure in circumstances where an attacker has access to the USERS table.
column372:
29/Mar/2019 10:12 AM;IKCooper;Thanks [~Pnolan], useful to know.

We've subsequently enabled External Authentication; does this mean the actual user passwords aren't stored in EIM at all, or are they still replicated even though Authentication is not done by EIM anymore? If the former, then I guess there is little impact.
column373:
17/Apr/2019 05:29 PM;awphillips;Hi  [~Pnolan],

We hit the same issue in UCM this week (HSUCM-311) on upgrade to Platform v7.5.0.11 and were grateful for the detail in this ticket for helping reach a quick resolution via the workaround detailed above. So thanks all for recording the comments.

However given the three projects impacted by this in the past month, I thought I'd ask the question as to whether the fix in FCENG-6279 is a good candidate to be backported to affected versions to avoid further projects hitting the issue and then taking the workaround? 

Thanks, Alan

column1: Index for multivalue column including values which do not satisfy the filter condition
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
In the ANZ Sanctions solution, for a Worldcheck list group, we have 2 multivalue columns IDENTIFICATION NUMBERS and IDENTIFICATION TYPE.
The index 'wc_identification_number' is defined on the column IDENTIFICATION NUMBERS with a filter IDENTIFICATION_TYPE_NOT_BIC with condition "IDENTIFICATION TYPE in (LEI,ISIN)".
What is noticed is if a WC row having multiple IDENTIFICATION NUMBERS and IDENTIFICATION TYPE, and if any one of them is LEI or ISIN, all the values of IDENTIFICATION NUMBERS are included in the index and alert is scanned against. 

For Example, see attached screenshot. Row ID 26187 has 5 IDENTIFICATION NUMBERS, only one of them is of IDENTIFICATION TYPE - LEI or ISIN.
The expectation is that if the input matches IDENTIFICATION NUMBER - 1236523652, only then it should alert.
However, it is alerting for other 4 rows as well (21446537345, 1248, 32564, 25896).

column1: CLONE - Standalone server deployments do not come packaged with JavaMail jars
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Following the deployment of a standalone server for the Nationwide project we noticed that the functionality for intercepting inbound emails for disclosures did not work as the JavaMail jars were not packaged in the libs folder.

These should be packaged as standard I believe.
column352: See description
column369:
28/Sep/2017 10:00 AM;mauricedarley;There is already a reference to some JavaMail jars from Geronimo called geronimo-javamail_1.4_mail-1.8.2.jar.
These do not work correctly and we had to add in a new jar called javax.mail-1.5.6.jar.
Then we discovered that we also had to remove the geronimo jar to get rid of the dependency issues.
Possibly an update to the geronimo jars may be sufficient.

EDIT:
From searching online, the Geronimo jar is built on top of javaxmail 1.4(and there seems to be no further supported versions), but javaxmail 1.5 is required here.
column370:
27/Oct/2017 03:29 PM;Pnolan;We can't package the standard Java mail JARs with the platform as they are covered by the Sun licence which is legally problematic for us. The workaround was to package the Geronimo Java mail JARs (and some other Geronimo JARs), which were functionally equivalent but covered by the Apache licence instead (see PLAT-8259 for details).

If the Geronimo Java mail JARs are no longer working for some reason, we will need to upgrade those Geronimo libraries or identify a different solution for standalone packaging. Note that this only affects standalone builds - application servers have their own Java mail JARs, so we don't need to package them with standard builds.
column371:
16/Nov/2017 05:35 PM;IKhalili;As long as the standalone deployment as part of the possible solution we offer to the customer, we should look after this issue and find a feasibile solution.
We are having the same issue in LBG and we need to guarantee the standalone Batch server to be fully functional and working.

Kind Regards,
Ibrahim
column372:
17/Nov/2017 08:52 AM;SHanley;Hi [~Pnolan]

Please note that the affected version for Lloyds is 7.4.

Regards,

Stephen
column373:
23/Nov/2017 03:43 PM;EClarke;bq. We can't package the standard Java mail JARs with the platform as they are covered by the Sun licence which is legally problematic for us.

Does the same apply to the [CDDL/GPL licence|https://oss.oracle.com/licenses/CDDL+GPL-1.1] that JavaMail 1.5 is distributed under?
column374:
28/Nov/2017 05:32 PM;Pnolan;It is acceptable to package a library licensed under CDDL, but not GPL, so at first glance it appears that we cannot package the JavaMail JARs with the standalone build. The customer's copies of the JavaMail JARs could be added to the deployment on-site, but if we distribute a GPL component in a build then (legally) we are releasing our own software under GPL as well.

JavaMail is actually licensed under "GPL with classpath exception", which could be legally acceptable in certain circumstances. I will follow up with Legal to see if we can get approval for this, but I wouldn't expect a rapid decision.
column375:
09/Mar/2018 08:50 AM;SHanley;Hi All,

This issue in LBG was resolved by including JavaMail 1.4.6 on the classpath. This comes as part of RHEL7. The bug which affects Geronimo was resolved in a later minor version of JavaMail 1.4.5. Thanks to [~WShuai] for his analysis.

Regards,

Stephen
column376:
06/Apr/2018 03:54 PM;Pnolan;Stephen,

Thanks for the update (and thanks to Wang for the analysis). From a review of the [GERONIMO-6347|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/GERONIMO-6347] issue, it appears that the defect may also be resolved in the latest 1.9.0-alpha-2 release of Geronimo JavaMail 1.4. We will look into updating the standalone distribution with this version of the library, to see if it resolves the issue in the platform.
column377: 06/Apr/2018 04:00 PM;ASharma;It's also worth chekcing if we could use Apache Commons Mail https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-email/index.html in place of Geronimo
column378: 06/Apr/2018 04:22 PM;Pnolan;Commons Email is certainly worth checking. It has a compile-time dependency on JavaMail, but doesn't seem to have a runtime dependency - so it might work out well. It will require code changes, however, so I think we should start just by moving up to a newer release of Geronimo JavaMail.
column379:
11/Jul/2018 01:52 AM;RNathan;We have just hit this same issue on Westpac today, using standalone batch server.
We have moved the config and function across to the app server but looks like we need a more permanent solution to this.

column1: Expression evaluation issue (double equals sign in returned results)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When adding an Expression function for processing in Services Manager sequence if the input string contains a single '=' sign, it's converted to '==' (as shown in linked JIRA ticket). The issue was encountered in WLM_RollUp_AlertHeader sequence, by adding a WLM_CutStringBestMatches EXPRESSION function with following settings: Sequence Function Details: Include Result In Response: false Input Parameters: isJEP = true nameAndExpression0 = 'ALERT_TEXT_1|substring("[Alert.FormattedBestMatchesEntries]", 0,3900)'. The resulting processing was performed as following: jepCondition in getExpressionResult method in JEPHelper class evaluated as: 'substring("In EU list :
50_na = ADAM DEATH 4670 LAKERIDGE RD RR 1 ASHBURN ONTARIO L0B 1A0 Free Text Match >= 85% Adam
In EU list :
50_na = ADAM DEATH 4670 LAKERIDGE RD RR 1 ASHBURN ONTARIO L0B 1A0 Free Text Match >= 85% Abu Adam

", 0,3900)' result in the same method: 'In EU list :
50_na == ADAM DEATH 4670 LAKERIDGE RD RR 1 ASHBURN ONTARIO L0B 1A0 Free Text Match >= 85% Adam
In EU list :
50_na == ADAM DEATH 4670 LAKERIDGE RD RR 1 ASHBURN ONTARIO L0B 1A0 Free Text Match >= 85% Abu Adam

' The Java class performing this expression processing (ExpressionRealTimeFunction class) uses external library org.nfunk.jep, which appears to return the cut string with doubled equals sign.
column352:
1. Navigate to Services Manager/Sequence
2. Add to a chosen sequence an expression function (Function Type: EXPRESSION) performing a substring, where the input string value contains a single equals sign

column1: suppressDuplicateAlerts uses the level ID to determine if a risk level has changed, is this correct?
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Question from the client:

{code}
If there is a scenario manager configuration change either due to new release deployment or manually changed by a user or the risk model is changed for that customer, should customers who are high risk before the configuration change should get alerted as per the standard product behaviour even though no changes have happened to any of the customer account data after rescore.

From our perspective,the expected behaviour would be the customer should not be alerted as suppress duplicate alerts is enabled. However we see that alerts are generated currently.
{code}

After testing this I see confusing messages from the logs.

I turned up debugging with:
log4j.category.com.norkom.cdd.business.monitoring.score=DEBUG, cdd


Duplicating the processing model seems to make no difference to the suppression of alerts. But duplicating the risk model seems to result in new alerts but with no explanation printing as to why:

{code}
22-Sep-2017 08:58:19,997 -  -  DEBUG CDDScorePersister:2691 - Statement risk_score_Customer_CDD_INS_CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE_CONTRIB locked.
22-Sep-2017 08:58:19,997 -  -  DEBUG CDDScorePersister:2691 - Statement risk_score_Customer_CDD_INS_CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE_CONTRIB locked.
22-Sep-2017 08:58:20,009 -  -  DEBUG CDDScorePersister:2738 - CDD: Batch execution for action:[risk_score_Customer_CDD_INS_CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE_CONTRIB](tot/ok/err):44/44/0
22-Sep-2017 08:58:20,009 -  -  DEBUG CDDScorePersister:2738 - CDD: Batch execution for action:[risk_score_Customer_CDD_INS_CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE_CONTRIB](tot/ok/err):44/44/0
22-Sep-2017 08:58:20,010 -  -  DEBUG CDDScorePersister:2711 - Statement risk_score_Customer_CDD_INS_CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE_CONTRIB unLocked.
22-Sep-2017 08:58:20,010 -  -  DEBUG CDDScorePersister:2711 - Statement risk_score_Customer_CDD_INS_CDD_CUSTOMER_SCORE_CONTRIB unLocked.
22-Sep-2017 08:58:20,010 -  -  DEBUG CDDScorePersister:2061 - CDD[0] :rescoring entity:[CUST-GB-35048757] score:[340.0] riskLevel:[High] oldRiskLevel:[High] Alert:[true].
22-Sep-2017 08:58:20,010 -  -  DEBUG CDDScorePersister:2061 - CDD[0] :rescoring entity:[CUST-GB-35048757] score:[340.0] riskLevel:[High] oldRiskLevel:[High] Alert:[true].
{code}


Judging from the comment in CDDScorePersister above the method scoreChanged() there should be no alert:
{code}
    /**
     * Tests whether an Alert should be generated according to the following criteria:
     * An Alert should only be generated if the Score causes the the Risk Level to change 
     * OR
     * the Score causes the Risk Level to stay the same AND the Score value increases
     * OR
     * the Score remains the same but the contributions change including the case where the contribution element value changes  
     * @param scoreResult 
     * @return true if it is determined that an Alert should be generated, otherwise false
     */   
{code}

Does the risk level ID come into play? This would mean that when the client puts a new model into production, all their High level customers will alert again.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
- Turn on suppressDuplicateAlerts for CDD
- Score a new customer and see that their level is set to High
- Duplicate the risk model and set to production with no changes
- Rescore the same customer

Actual result:
An alert is generated for the customer even though their score, contribution or level has not changed. Is this to be expected?

column369:
03/Oct/2017 07:45 AM;KFoo;Hi Alan,

ANZ has recently create a scenario to use *Combination Counter* profile for the alert's weight and below is the issues that they encountered:
- Issue #1: *Invalid column type*
-- After some tracing, I've found out that Combination Counter returns Map as explained at the comment below
--- https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/ACB-734?focusedCommentId=23582668&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-23582668
-- and further trace shows that there's a gap between Combination Counter's and Alert creation's functionality where:
--- Combination Counter creates a Map
--- Alert Creation expecting a Double to be inserted into MON_ALERT

- Issue #2: *Batch stuck there doing nothing*
-- This issue always occurs right after Issue #1.
-- After some trace and testing, the database is having some ghost connections that is hogging the resources as explained here:
--- https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/ACB-734?focusedCommentId=23581272&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-23581272

(Note: So far, Issue #2 only occurs when the Combination Counter Issue #1 happens and nowhere else so this Issue #2 is under discussion to be ignored or not)


Cheers,
Kimmy

column1: NullPointer exception in Alert Tagging when datasourceless profile field and cross view profiling is used in scenario definition
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: "TCB0002_Change In Behavior" has been filtered from alert tagging because it causes tagging to hang when alert are generated for that scenario
column352: Create a Scenario that uses cross view profile and a datasource less profile field (i.e. LifeTime). Process to generate alert and tagging
column369:
04/Oct/2017 12:22 PM;MvanLaere1;In case datasourceless profile field and cross view profile field are used in scenario definition, a TagContributionAgenda with nulldatasource is created and so a null pointer exception occurs when the TagContributionAgenda is checked to be added to TagAgendaGroup.
This is a clearly identified case but maybe other exist.

See https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/RABO032-1080?focusedCommentId=23584159&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-23584159
for explanation.

As a TagAgendaGroup with null datasource is useless, better to filter TagContributionAgenda having null datasource out when checking to add to TagAgendaGroup. This way all potential cases will be covered. 

Marc

05/Oct/2017 02:46 PM;jonasfolgado;Hi Jonas,
I don’t think it’s a license issue… looking at the code, ScenarioLogicFacadeImpl creates a UserRightsHelper object but doesn’t set the licenceManager when initializing standalone user. It’s not an issue when launching Scenario Engine in standalone which uses Spring to initialize objects.

column370:
20/Oct/2017 03:52 PM;jonasfolgado;Hi Jonas,
It’s not common to use SM GUI in standalone for regular projects, at least I have not heard of it. column372:
20/Dec/2017 09:53 PM;DBranley;Eddie,
Could you look to get this addressed soon?  Being able to run SM from a Standalone environment is important for MB projects where we run in a separate instance without the need/overhead of JBoss or WAS.  Also, could you follow up with QA to ensure they add this to their regression testing so something like this doesn't slip through again?
thanks,
Dan
column373:
21/Dec/2017 06:13 PM;scotthays;It looks like the issue was introduced in revision 492966 for PLAT-19721 "Include Licence Key for Application Builder". That change modified the UserRightsHelper class to do a licence check as part of loading the user's org/domain roles (addPermissionDependingOnLicence()). This change expects Spring to have assigned a LicenceManager object to UserRightsHelper, which doesn't happen in Scenario Manager standalone-mode.

Standalone Scenario Manager does it's licence check in ScenarioLogicFacadeImpl.verifyLicence().

column1: CLONE - Insecure Configuration of Cookie Attributes
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The Session Cookies named are not configured to restrict access via client-side scripts.

Missing HttpOnly:
•	PD-ID (WebSEAL session token)
•	PD-S-SESSION-ID (WebSEAL session token)
•	AMWEBJCT!%2Fefcphsit1!JSESSIONID (NetReveal session token)
•	AMWEBJCT!%2Fefcphsit1!nrssotkn (NetReveal session token)

Missing Secure:
•	AMWEBJCT!%2Fefcphsit1!JSESSIONID (NetReveal session token)

The HttpOnly directive instructs the user’s browser to restrict client side scripting language such as JavaScript from accessing the cookie.

The secure directive instructs the user’s browser to send the cookie only over SSL/TLS encrypted channels. 
HttpOnly:
Session cookies are the primary target for cross-site scripting attacks. Implementing the HttpOnly attribute reduces the likelihood of a XSS attack successfully disclosing the application cookies.

Secure:
Without the Secure directive set, session cookies may be sent over unencrypted channels, allowing for the interception or logging of session tokens. An attacker may use captured tokens to gain unauthorised access to the application.
Implement the “Set-Cookie:HttpOnly “ header directive for all session cookies.
Information on how to set this attribute can be found here:
https://www.owasp.org/index.php/HttpOnly

Implement the “Set-Cookie: secure” header directive for all session cookies.
Information on how to set this attribute can be found here: https://www.owasp.org/index.php/SecureFlag

FROM RISK_LEVEL rl, ORGANIZATION_UNITS ou
WHERE rl.ORGUNIT_ID = ou.ID
AND rl.ID =  [RISK_LEVEL_ID]

column1: No option in code to create second level subquery
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Basic issue here is the query string generated with {{ASSOCIATIONS}} list column selected in any condition is incorrect. We can see that {{ASSOCIATIONS}} list column is currently mapped to a database field named {{ASSOCIATIONS}} in {{SYSTEM_PARAMETERS}} table with key {{fpfaColumn17}} and this field is mapped to a table named {{FPFA_ASSOCIATIONS_DATA}} in {{SYSTEM_PARAMETERS}} table with key {{fpfaMultiValueColumn05}}.

Hence the query string generated for the test scenario (screenshot attached) is 
{code:sql}
SELECT COUNT(fpfa.USER_ID)
FROM FPFA_DATA fpfa,
  FPFA_LIST_ROW flr
WHERE flr.LIST_DEFINITION_ID = ?
AND fpfa.IS_ACTIVE           = ?
AND flr.ROW_ID               = fpfa.ROW_ID
AND ( fpfa.ACTIVE_STATUS    IS NULL
AND fpfa.ROW_ID             IN
  (SELECT ROW_ID FROM FPFA_ASSOCIATIONS_DATA WHERE ASSOCIATIONS = ?
  )
AND fpfa.ROW_ID IN
  (SELECT ROW_ID FROM FPFA_ASSOCIATIONS_DATA WHERE ASSOCIATIONS IN ( ? , ? )
  ) )
AND fpfa.STATUS IS NULL
{code}

While investigating we found that there is no such field {{ASSOCIATIONS}} in table {{FPFA_ASSOCIATIONS_DATA}}. We also noticed that user was entering relationship texts like 'Wife', 'Brother', 'Husband' etc in the value field for the conditions with {{ASSOCIATIONS}} list column. What we can expect is that we should be using a second level subquery to include the table {{FPFA_LU_RELATIONSHIPS}} as well, because the {{NAME}} field in this table is the one that holds relationship texts given above and this table is having a relationship with the {{FPFA_ASSOCIATIONS_DATA}} table with foreign key column {{CODE}}.

Putting this all together the expected query is something like given below.

{code:sql}
SELECT COUNT(fpfa.USER_ID)
FROM FPFA_DATA fpfa,
  FPFA_LIST_ROW flr
WHERE flr.LIST_DEFINITION_ID = ?
AND fpfa.IS_ACTIVE           = ?
AND flr.ROW_ID               = fpfa.ROW_ID
AND ( fpfa.ACTIVE_STATUS    IS NULL
AND fpfa.ROW_ID             IN
  (SELECT ROW_ID
  FROM FPFA_ASSOCIATIONS_DATA
  WHERE CODE IN
    (SELECT CODE FROM FPFA_LU_RELATIONSHIPS WHERE NAME = ?
    )
  )
AND fpfa.ROW_ID IN
  (SELECT ROW_ID
  FROM FPFA_ASSOCIATIONS_DATA
  WHERE CODE IN
    (SELECT CODE FROM FPFA_LU_RELATIONSHIPS WHERE NAME IN ( ? , ? )
    )
  ) )
AND fpfa.STATUS IS NULL
{code}

But the current code doesn't have the option to add a second level subquery (for {{FPFA_LU_RELATIONSHIPS}} table in this case). 

So what we need here is to add that functionality with some configuration option to decide which table and column is to be used for second level query in such cases.

column1: Not consistent definition of CDD Risk Levels
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
According to CDD Risk Model Administration UI Guide 7.2 (chapter 2.2.2 Risk Level):

{quote}
NOTE: The risk level lookup implements the following condition:
 Low Score <= Risk Score <= High Score
 In addition, the risk level lookup implements, within the scope of one organisation unit, underflow and overflow. This means that a score higher than the highest high score will be mapped to the highest risk level even though the score is actually higher than its high score boundary. Similarly, a score lower than the lowest low score will be mapped to the lowest risk level even though the score is actually lower than its low score boundary.
 In order for the risk level lookup to always produce a result, it is necessary that the different risk levels of an organisation unit (in addition to the underflow and overflow explained above) cover contiguous score ranges. 
 This means that the low score boundary for one risk level must be equal to the high score boundary of previous risk level, such that no gaps in the score range are present. 
 This condition is enforced by the Risk Model Manager when adding, editing or deleting a risk level, as explained in the rest of this document.
{quote}

The above definition if difficult to understand (_underflow_ ..., _overflow_ ...) and does not allow to define consistent risk model. The standard configuration is the following:
||RISK_LEVEL||LOW_SCORE||HIGH_SCORE||GENERATE_ALERT||REVIEW_PERIOD||
|Standard|0|50|N|0|
|Low|50|75|N|0|
|Medium|75|100|N|0|
|High|100|150|Y|180|

We see here immediately problem with the border values: 50, 75 and 100. According to the rule 'Low Score <= Risk Score <= High Score', they would match two risk levels, what is not possible in real life. Therefore the Alert Saver decided to (consciously [= hardcoded] or by chance [= first found range]?) to select the risk level by condition: ' ... *Risk Score <= High Score*'. This observed system behaviour means, the guide rule is wrong - the implemented rule is:
Low Score {color:red}<{color} Risk Score <= High Score

Such situation generated some discussions (e.g. PLAT-19381, EFR000023-325) that do not gave a clear result.

Therefore my proposal to implement in the system (Alert Saver + Risk Model editor) and describe it properly in the guide following simple consistent rules:
* The Low Range should be the only value taken by algorithms (Alert Saver), with the condition: Low Range <= score (and / or: score < Low Range from the next risk level)
* The High Range should be for the GUI only (no edition possible). It should be a copy the Low Range from the next risk level or empty (or by default 999999 [defined via system parameter]; in the highest risk level).

The above would mean: One risk level is described by condition:
Low Range <= risk score {color:red}<{color} High Range (or no limit for empty value by highest risk level).

This would give clear consistent ranges and eliminate discussion about _underflows_ and _overflows_.
column352: 1. Generate a CDD alert with the (standard) border risk score: 50, 75 or 100.

column1: Buttons not reachable through tabbing
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
For PLAT-20463, uses of href="javascript:void(0);" were removed from buttons in specific places. 

Those buttons are anchor tags and without a href attribute they are no longer focusable by default, therefore a tabindex of 0 should be added to them to make them focusable again without disrupting the default logical tab order.
column352:

Expected: The button is focused, shown by outline.
Observed: The button is not focused and focus jumps to the next focusable item in the DOM.

column1: Swift parsing helper looks for only the starting colon of a tag name but not the ending one
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Our application currently considers that any newline starting with a colon is a new swift tag field. But for one customer we found that data fields can also be started with colon. 

In the below example from RaboBank we found that the minute component of a date time string falls to a new line along with the colon separator ("{{*:35*}}"). Parsing was failing in this case because it was considered as a start of new tag field.  

{code:xml}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<Message>
    <Id>AD-HOC-101</Id>
    <Type>SWIFT</Type>
    <Channel>Swift_IN</Channel>
    <Data><![CDATA[{1:F01RABONL2UUXXX0000001234}{2:I196RZBAATWWXXXXN}{4:
:20:RBG123456-123457
:21:ZTK-1122334-0123
:76:PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT THE
NAME OF
:77A:THE FINAL BNF SHOULD READ:
TEST MAN HOEK
..
TRUST PAYMENT CAN BE EFFECTED
NOW. THANK YOU AND BEST REGARDS.
PAYMENTS CS/GL
:11R:195
123456
9992345811
:20:ZTK-1122334-0123
:21:PA0123456789101
:75:UNABLE TO APPLY
RE: YOUR MT103 DD. 170127
AMOUNT: EUR 999,00
TRN.: PA0123456789101
WE HAVE RECEIVED THE FOLLOWING
REQUEST:
:77A:PLEASE BE OMAR DIABY
UNABLE TO APPLY THESE FUNDS
BECAUSE THE TEST'S NAME
INDICATED IN FIELD 59 IS INCORRECT.
PLEASE PROVIDE US WITH CORRECT
TEST'S NAME AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.
.
THANKING FOR YOUR REPLY TILL
03.02.2017
OTHERWISE WE WILL RECALL THE FUNDS.
PLEASE REMIT EUR 99,00
HANDLING CHARGES.
.
PLEASE ALWAYS QUOTE OUR REF:
ZTK-1122334-0123 CONCERNING THIS
CASE. .
KIND REGARDS
TEST HOEK
PAYMENT-INV./30.01.2017 09
:35
-}
]]>
    </Data>
</Message>
{code}

A proper tag as the swift structure should start with a colon, then a two digit number which is the tag name, then n optional letter which is the tag option and then finally another colon which separates a tag from its data. But we only look for starting colon, we don't consider the if the ending colon exists to validate if it is a tag or part of data string.

I've prepared a fix already for this customer in ticket CES-2148 (not tested or delivered to customer at the time of this ticket creation). Please do verify the fix. If it is good enough, then we should be retrofitting it to the coredev.
column352: Send a swift message using Hermes that contains a new line starting with a colon, but not following a tag structure.

column1: Domain hierarchy tree is incorrectly implemented for Queues.
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The domain hierarchy structure is reflected in the opposite way on the scren where we seeing all candidates/users to be subscribed to a given queue.
What we would have to do is to have a single Queue that contains Alerts from different domains (from parent domain and also from sub-domains). 
In our project we have one parent domain: Local Autrhoity Fraud and 4 subdomains (children of Local Authority Fraud):
* Buisness Rates
* Council Tax
* Housing Waiting List
* Housing

Now, we would like to have a user who is subscribed to a single queue but who can see only Alets from the sub-domain to which he has an access to. 
So , in our case we want to have a user who may only see the elements from 'Housing Waiting List' sub-domain.
The problem we encountered is that we cannot subscribe such a user to a Queue because it is not listed on the list of users possible to subscribe. 
It is because it is filtered out incorrectly as the logic behind the screens thinks that this user is not supposed to be subscribed to a queue which is in Local Authority Fraud (parent domain) as it just checks that this uses has a permission to sub-domain. 
As soon as you grant an elevated role (Queue Subscriber) on a Local Authority Fraud level to this user, he then can be subscribed to the queue BUT he will also see many more elements from different sub-domains (e.g. from Council, Business Rates) which is obviosly something we DO NOT want to have.
Now, we found out that when you subscribe that user to a queue and then REVOKE the Queue Subscriber permission on Local Authority Fraud domain and change it to be on 'Housing Waiting List' level , the user will REAMAIN subscribed to the queue and he will be able to see only Alerts matching the 'Housing Waiting List' sub-domain. So this is what is expected.

In summary,
The only problem that we see now is with the screens that lists the users who CAN be subscribed. To be precice the problems is that these screens do not list the users who have permission to sub-domains of the main Queue domain. 

This seems to be a platform bug that needs to be corrected.
See the screenshots which may help you to better understand the problem.
The names of screenshots explain what happens on given screenshot so please have a look at screenshot names too.
column352: See the screenshots attached.

Chris

column1: Restarting an application server clears-down all user sessions on all servers in a clustered deployment.

The scenario is two application servers (ServerA and ServerB) connected to the same DB

* Login on ServerB

As an aside if there an active entity-lock on ServerA the lock won't be cleared and will be orphaned.
column369:
07/Dec/2017 09:59 AM;NBresnan;A point-of-information-from-the-floor from Iain Cooper is that when Johanne made that addition in those long-ago days we had very few (possibly zero) multi-node deployments. So whatever his intent was inserting this hack it probably didn't have anything to do with multi-node deployments. And that therefore we could probably insert a filter here without any great danger of unintended-awfulness.

And as an aside perhaps it isn't really a hack per se. We don't know his other considerations that may have made him believe that this was a hack. But it seems to have stood up to twelve years of production so it doesn't seem to be so _very_ awful.

column1: Shared List Management doesn't access domains other than Top Level
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
A Shared List Management screen was added in release 7.4 (PLAT-20640), which sounds like a nice feature to allow managing shared lists outside from the Scenario Manager

The issue is that screen doesn't seem to take into account the domains that the user has access to. 
I tested it with a user that had only access to domain 'AML - Suspicious Activity', and the Shared List Management points only to 'Top Level' Domain. 
No shared lists are to be found under 'Top Level' since they always belong to lower levels.

Furthermore, the screen doesn't offer a domain selection based on user permission, which it should so a user could maintain for instance CDD and AML Shared Lists.

Lastly it would be a plus to have a dedicated permission instead of '/Scenario Manager/Default GUI' which provides access to the Top Level Scenario Manager.
column352:
- Set up a user that has only access to domain 'AML - Suspicious Activity', by using Group 'AML SA Scenario Manager Groups'
- Provide this user with permission '/Scenario Manager/Default GUI' (by adding it to role 'AML SA Scenario Manager' for instance
- Log in
- Go to 'Scenario Manager -> Shared List Management'
- the screen shows the 'Top Level' domain, even though the user has no access to it, and this domain doesn't contain/need Shared Lists

column1: Incorrect handling of multiple level of deleted permission

column352:
so the case is the following:

* client is creating a new permission tree on a dev environment
* /BAE/Netreveal/Version
* they decide for some reason the permission Versions is not needed anymore
* they decide for some reason that permission Netreveal is not needed anymore

so in the export of the application, we will have the following:

		<permission application="myToto" customised="false">
			<path><![CDATA[/BAE/Netreveal]]></path>
			<description><![CDATA[Account Buttons]]></description>
			<deleted>true</deleted>
			<is_audited>false</is_audited>
		</permission>
		<permission application="myToto" customised="false">
			<path><![CDATA[/BAE/Netreveal/Version]]></path>
			<description><![CDATA[eimHoldsAndBalances]]></description>
			<deleted>true</deleted>
			<is_audited>false</is_audited>
		</permission>
		<permission application="EIM Investigator" customised="false">
			<path><![CDATA[/BAE]]></path>
			<description><![CDATA[]]></description>
			<deleted>false</deleted>
			<is_audited>false</is_audited>
		</permission>

which will give an error about parent permission /BAE/Netreveal not existing for permission Version

column1: CLONE - CLONE - JASNR1.3.3: CatchAll field mapped to also existing xml tag nm and lglnttyidr
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
From SWIFT-MX input message, there are exact data source mapping for nm and lglnttyidr, however, these two field still got mapped to catchall. Is it because these two field (nm and lglnttyidr) have multiple possible values from the same message?
Please see attached document in details on the found evidence. This might just be a clarification instead of a defect.
column352:
Parse a SwiftMX message (DefaultSwiftMXHandler) that has two or more endElement tags with the same name and check the result paths

<TradPty>
   <PtyId>
       <AnyBIC>
          <AnyBIC>BARCGB20XXX</AnyBIC>
      </AnyBIC>
      <LglNttyIdr>THISISABADLEIFIELD32</LglNttyIdr>
   </PtyId>
</TradPty>

Check the result paths of (nested) AnyBIC and LglNttyIdr

Expected
LglNttyIdr path: "tradpty/ptyid/lglnttyIdr"

Actual
LglNttyIdr path: "tradpty/ptyid/anybic/lglnttyIdr"
column369:
12/Dec/2017 03:35 PM;GRusso;CLS raised this issue while testing a CR.

During the tests I found out that this might also happen in the core code if the Swift mx message has a nested path 
of two or more tags having the same name.

The endElement\startElement implementation of the DefaultSwiftMXHandler class, doesn't remember a sequence of two or more *endElement* tag with the same name and when there is a message having:

{code}
<TradPty>
   <PtyId>
       <AnyBIC>
          <AnyBIC>BARCGB20XXX</AnyBIC>
      </AnyBIC>
      <LglNttyIdr>THISISABADLEIFIELD32</LglNttyIdr>
   </PtyId>
</TradPty>

(nested) AnyBIC path: "tradpty/ptyid/anybic/anybic"
LglNttyIdr path: "tradpty/ptyid/lglnttyIdr"
{code}

it navigates back to the "lastIndexOf" AnyBIC tag
"tradpty/ptyid/anybic/"

then it finds the LglNttyIdr and adds it to the path ,which then results in the wrong path
"tradpty/ptyid/anybic/lglnttyIdr"

This has been fixed in the CLS project using a LinkedList to remember all the endElementName found every time the endElement method is called, and then iterating over this list in the startElement method to go back element by element.

Cheers,
Giuseppe

The Controller class init() function skips the cfg.addAnnotatedClass loading if the sessionFactory is already provided by the application server and will load classes from persistence.xml.

<value>com.norkom.monitoring.resources.model.optimization.ParameterOptimizationConfiguration</value>
<value>com.norkom.monitoring.resources.model.optimization.ParameterOptimizationConfigurationPK</value>
<value>com.norkom.monitoring.resources.model.optimization.ParameterOptimizationFitnessProgression</value>
<value>com.norkom.monitoring.resources.model.optimization.ParameterOptimizationFitnessProgressionPK</value>
<value>com.norkom.monitoring.resources.model.optimization.ParameterOptimizationHallOfFame</value>
<value>com.norkom.monitoring.resources.model.optimization.ParameterOptimizationHallOfFameParamValues</value>
<value>com.norkom.monitoring.resources.model.optimization.ParameterOptimizationHallOfFameParamValuesPK</value>
<value>com.norkom.monitoring.resources.model.optimization.ParameterOptimizationRun</value>
<value>com.norkom.monitoring.resources.model.optimization.ParameterOptimizationScenarioResults</value>
<value>com.norkom.monitoring.resources.model.optimization.ParameterOptimizationScenarioResultsPK</value>

column1: WLM List Metrics - recording list loads multiple times
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Below observed with WORLDCHECK.
The procedures populating the WLM_LIST_REPORT table insert multiple rows for same List import if any list index or index filter related to the imported list was modified by a system user with user id <> 0.

Because procedures to calculate deleted records and total inserted record use SUM of values stored in DELETED_RECORD_COUNT, the multiple insert will cause miscalcuation of all future inserted rows .
same applies to IMPORTED_ROW_COUNT , as this uses the dynamically calculated DELETED_RECORD_COUNT based on the incorrect SUM from above.

See attached example from customer production environment.
column352:
With WC (or DJ, or any other watchlist) imported, - tested with WC.
Go to respective List Manager screen
click on edit of ANY index or index filter and save unchanged. (user that is NOT admin user /with user id <> 0)
import watchlist
go to WLM Metrics screen
List duplication on the left side (selection list)
Duplication of recorded List load in List import details section
any other lios
column369:
01/Feb/2018 03:58 PM;UBrell;from watch-list-manager.xml
This SQL returns the multiple rows when different user_ids are returned
{code:sql}<parameter name="query"><![CDATA[SELECT
    MAX(LAST_UPDATED_TIMESTAMP) AS LIST_LAST_UPDATED_TIMESTAMP, LAST_UPDATED_BY
FROM (
        SELECT IMPORT_START_TIMESTAMP AS LAST_UPDATED_TIMESTAMP, IMPORTED_BY AS LAST_UPDATED_BY FROM LIST_DEFINITION WHERE ID = [LIST_ID]
        UNION
        SELECT MAX(LAST_UPDATED_TIMESTAMP) AS LAST_UPDATED_TIMESTAMP, LAST_UPDATED_BY FROM LIST_INDEX WHERE LIST_DEFINITION_ID = [LIST_ID] GROUP BY LAST_UPDATED_BY
        UNION
        SELECT MAX(LAST_UPDATED_TIMESTAMP) AS LAST_UPDATED_TIMESTAMP, LAST_UPDATED_BY FROM LIST_FILTER WHERE LIST_DEFINITION_ID = [LIST_ID] GROUP BY LAST_UPDATED_BY
    )
WHERE LAST_UPDATED_TIMESTAMP IS NOT NULL  GROUP BY LAST_UPDATED_BY]]></parameter>{code}

this SQL selects the SUM(DELETED_RECORD_COUNT) from the report table - counting duplicates as a result
{code:sql}<parameter name="query"><![CDATA[SELECT COALESCE(( (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM WC_DATA WHERE STATUS = 'D') - (SELECT SUM(DELETED_RECORD_COUNT) FROM WLM_LIST_REPORT WHERE LIST_ID = [LIST_ID]) ), 0)
AS DELETED_RECORD_COUNT FROM DUAL]]></parameter>{code}

this SQL reuses the incorrect DELETED_RECORD_COUNT value to calculate IMPORTED_ROW_COUNT
{code:sql}<parameter name="query"><![CDATA[SELECT COALESCE(((SELECT COUNT(*) FROM WC_DATA d WHERE d.LAST_UPDATED_TIMESTAMP >= (SELECT IMPORT_START_TIMESTAMP FROM LIST_DEFINITION WHERE ID = [LIST_ID] AND IS_DELETED = 0)) + [DELETED_RECORD_COUNT]), 0) 
AS IMPORTED_ROW_COUNT FROM DUAL]]></parameter>{code}

column1: DBCombinedStatement.getStatements doesn’t properly handle double quotes inside single quotes
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The parsing logic in com.norkom.common.db.DBCombinedStatement.getStatements doesn’t properly handle double quotes inside single quotes (or vice versa, but that’s less common). For instance, if you have this script:
UPDATE customers SET name_has_invalid_char = 1 WHERE customer_name LIKE ‘%”%’;
INSERT INTO invalid_names (name) SELECT name FROM customers WHERE name_has_invalid_char = 1;

The parser will not recognise any of the semicolons as statement terminators, because it thinks they appear in double quotes. The parser will process the following “tokens” (unless otherwise noted, the tokens just get appended to the statement):
|#|Token|Comment|
|1|UPDATE customers SET name_has_invalid_char = 1 WHERE customer_name LIKE| |
|2|‘|Set _insideSingleQuote_ to TRUE and append single quote to statement|
|3|%| |
|4|”|Set _insideDoubleQuote_ to TRUE (this is incorrect, because the double quotes are part of a string literal in single quotes) and append double quotes to statement| |
|5|%| |
|6|’|Set _insideSingleQuote_ to FALSE|
|7|;|Gets appended to statement instead of being interpreted as statement terminator because _insideDoubleQuote_ is TRUE|
|8|INSERT INTO invalid_names (name) SELECT name FROM customers WHERE name_has_invalid_char = 1| |
|9|;|Gets appended to statement instead of being interpreted as statement terminator because _insideDoubleQuote_ is TRUE|

Hence the two statements get parsed into a single SQL statement, which is incorrect. Probably not a very common occurrence, so not a major problem but should be fixed.

column1: CLONE - Issues with Collection Formatter Field
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Alert Triage screen is using the Collection Formatter field which is used to collect all the ALERT_KEYS into a Replacement container variable. 

Basically the Section query is expected to collate all the field value into one variable as a comma separated string. This will be added to the replacement container and used wherever required (Workflow actions).

E.g. LIST_ALERT_KEY = 20003, 20004, 20005, 20006, 20007

I created a Collection Formatter field named LIST_ALERT_KEY under 'Transaction Alert Triage' screen in NAB Dev environment. However the behaviour I found is that it updates only the last alert Key into the variable and not a comma separate string. 

[LIST_ALERT_KEY] = 20007

Attached the screenshot from the environment & RC details from both 6.1 & 7.5 environments.

Impact: Because the variable has only one Alert Key, only that alert is released when the Release Workflow action is performed.
column352:
1) Create a Section Query that will return multiple result
2) Create hidden Field to store those values
2) check the Replacement Container's value after loading the Section

column374:
23/May/2018 05:01 PM;ADuggan;Hi Gambheer
I ran a test and reviewed the code.  The code produces a variant per Rule Set, not per rule.

In your test you have three Datasource (SWIFT) Variant Rule Sets, but only one is active "Swift2-CR-LF".  
That RuleSet takes "morg..." as input and executes each of it's rules on it. The output of each rule becomes the input for the next rule. The output of the final rule of the RuleSet becomes the output of the RuleSet.

The actual cause of your problem is as follows,
When the "Afghanistan" rule is executed it's executing a "Replace Word(s) (Case Insensitive)" Action which has an implementation class WordReplaceCIExecutor.java.  The last thing WordReplaceCIExecutor.execute does before it returns the normalised value is execute,

bq. NormUtils.removeMultiSpace(inputText)

This replaces white-space (space, CR-LF, TAB, etc,) with  single spaces. So when the CR-LF rule executes the CR-LF has already been replaced with a space by the previous WordReplaceCIExecutor rule.

It appears that most of the Normalization rule Executors/Actions replace white-spaces with single spaces as their last action.

So the options appear to be,
1. If you need CRLF to be _removed_ then use the "Replace Regular Expression" action as the first rule in the rule-set.
2. Extend one of the existing Executor/Actions and remove the "NormUtils.removeMultiSpace()" call at the end of the execute method.  Then use this class where you don't want the white-space replacement.
For this you'll also need to insert an entry into the database similar to.
{quote}
INSERT INTO NORM_RULE_EXECUTOR (ID, ACTION_NAME, CLASS_NAME) VALUES(16, 'configuration.normalization.rule.executor.replace_words_ci_ws', 'com.norkom.base.util.norm.executor.WordReplaceCIWhitespaceExecutor');
{quote}

Maria & Hatta may be able to identify another solution.

Cheers
Alan

Updates today:

From: Joyce, Maria (Australia Melbourne) 
Sent: Thursday, 24 May 2018 2:31 PM
To: Duggan, Alan (IE Dublin); Cebaseva, Anna (Singapore Raffles Place); M Talib, Hatta (Malaysia Kuala Lumpur); Jat, Gambhir (Singapore)
Subject: RE: OCBCBANK-1208 Update

Update from today’s call;
Hatta, Gambhir and Maria attended.

Discussion Points:
1.	Alan’s analysis is understood by Gambhir and we agreed that new Executor classes are required here.
2.	Instead of removing completely this method call:

{code:title=NormUtils.java|borderStyle=solid}
       /*
    * replace multiple white spaces by single white space and trim
    */
    public static String removeMultiSpace (String input)
    {
            return input.replaceAll(NormConstants.MULTI_WHITESPACE_STRING, " ").trim();
    }
{code}
…

{code:title=NormConstants.java|borderStyle=solid}
public static final String MULTI_WHITESPACE_STRING = "\\s{2,}";  //2 or more white spaces
{code}
…Gambhir suggested that we keep the invocation of the method but change the logic of it as follows:.

Current Logic:
Replace each of these instances with a single space:
CR-LF 
TAB 
multi-whitespace

Proposed Logic:
Replace only these instances with a single space:
TAB 
multi-whitespace

We don’t want to replace CR-LF because the ReplaceRegularExpression Executor is still responsible for this, and will still run later on in the RuleSet Sequence.
We still want TABs and multi spaces to be replaced as usual. 

3.	CE will execute and verify these changes via local code changes followed by a suitable junit test harness.
4.	Gambhir questioned the successful result that occurred at OCBC when testing the normalisation cfg – with the CRLF working correctly as recently as April 30th.
o	He retested today and got a different result in the BAE env – we need to establish the integrity of the test.
o	It worked correctly at OCBC but did not work inside BAE test env. 


Actions:
Gambhir – to revert to OCBC about the inconsistent Test findings – we should be getting the same result as them. 
                to respond to the question about the number of Executors required.
Maria – to progress with the code change and unit test development. 
                Firstly for the  WordReplaceCIWhitespaceExecutor class.  More to follow.

Let’s reconvene tomorrow to report progress.

Thanks all,
Maria

1.	If you need CRLF to be removed then use the "Replace Regular Expression" action as the first rule in the rule-set.

For Option 2, if I’m not wrong, then those code change Alan proposed would need to be implemented for each and every type of Executor that  you intend to use BEFORE using the “Replace Regular Expression" in the normalisation config?
Here are the available Executors in the Product – I don’t know how many are being used in the OCBC cfg, Gambhir can you confirm this:

This would then shorten the time taken to deliver this to Services as we would not need to setup a full env.

column379:
24/May/2018 10:51 AM;ADuggan;*EDITED*
A tested replacement for the current regEx {code}"\\s{2,}"{code} is

{code}
"[\\s&&[^\r\n]]+"
{code}

This Regex is a set intersection. {code}[SetA&&[SetB]]{code}

*\s* Is the set of all whitespaces (Tab, Space, CR, LF, etc.)

*^\r\n* Is the set of all characters that are not CR or LF

*&&* Does a set intersection.

*+* A value from the previous set must occur at least once.

I replaced the *\{2,\}* with the *+* because the former requires at least 2 characters from the set to be matched, which means CR on it's own, or LF on it's own, won't be replaced with a space, which seems to be incorrect behaviour.

Cheers
Alan

column1: LDAP error handling incorrectly reports caught 52e as "incorrect password"
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The LdapUtil class catches various errors returned from Active Directory during replication attempts, parses the error code, and then returns an error in the NetReveal log.

The parsed message in the NetReveal log for 52e is incorrect: it reports "Incorrect Password" when this error is actually for incorrect credentials. A login attempt with a *user* that is incorrect, or doesn't exist, may also cause a 52e to be thrown.

It would also be useful to return the actual LDAP error code in the NetReveal log so this can be passed to client active directory / LDAP teams

column1: WLM alerts didn't rollback previously failed WLM screening job
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: When the Batch server encounters failure due to DB connections or any other issue that causes server halt. The server must be restarted in order to resume the services however even after server restarted we discovered that the WLM alert were generated from the failed WLM job didn't rolled back. This causes duplicate alerts after another WLM process was set to run(previously failed) as calendar_signal table still contains an entry marked as deleted='N'
column352:
1. change below properties in base_config.properties to allow commits every 10 records.
filtering.batch.processor.max_processing_row_amount=10
2. restart the server.
3. prepare customer data file that will produce some alerts. (~1000 customers)
4. load customer file
5. run below query to monitor whether WLM process has started and is in progress
{noformat} 
 select * from acq_batch_process where component_type = 'WLM' and status='in progress'
{noformat}
6. run below sql to ensure alerts have been generated before killing the server while WLM process is still running:
select * from alerting_transaction where batch_process_id in (select batch_process_id from acq_batch_process where component_type = 'WLM' and status='in progress')
7. Kill the server when above query returned at least 1 alert.
8. start the server and run below query, it is expected that 0 row is returned if rollback is working.
{noformat}
select * from alerting_transaction where batch_process_id in (select batch_process_id from acq_batch_process where component_type = 'WLM' and status='failed')
{noformat}

column1: Decode problem on profile for card
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi Team,

Client BNI encountered below issue while processing card operation file:
21-Jun-2018 10:45:45,193 -  -  WARN  ProfileStorageBase:1282 - Cannot decode Profile. Reinitializing Profile with key  6010040447165136@@Card_Card@@1023_1030
21-Jun-2018 10:45:45,206 -  -  INFO  ProfileStorageBase:1340 - Wrote Profile that cannot be decoded to archive at /apps/Detica/sdi/profilearchive/6010040447165136@@Card_Card@@1023_1030.exception.txt
21-Jun-2018 10:45:45,210 -  -  INFO  DirectProcessing:233 - verify: com.norkom.blake.exceptions.DataFlowException: com.norkom.blake.exceptions.LearnerException: Illegal ProfileData. Cannot decode for Card_Card/6010040447165136
21-Jun-2018 10:45:45,217 -  -  ERROR DirectProcessing:87 - com.norkom.blake.exceptions.DataFlowException: com.norkom.blake.exceptions.LearnerException: Illegal ProfileData. Cannot decode for Card_Card/6010040447165136
21-Jun-2018 10:45:45,217 -  -  ERROR RealTimeLogicFacadeImpl:1368 - Unable to execute function [FRDDCF-Process-CARD-OPERATION_ScoreIncommingAuthorization (SCM-SCORE - 0)]: Error procesing record. com.norkom.blake.exceptions.LearnerException Illegal ProfileData. Cannot decode for Card_Card/6010040447165136

We checked and found below article:
http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/display/KB/Profile+Corruption+when+a+ProfileField+grows+beyond+32k+bytes

Referring to ticket PLAT-13906, the issue has been resolved in 6.5.2.10. However, we are still observing the issue happen on BNI version 6.6.2.14 (Apps 3.1.2 ). 
Please refer to attachment:
- Norkom log
- log file from [APPLICATION_HOME]/profilearchive

Can you please advice if the issue has been resolved in different ticket? Please let me know if you need more information.

Thanks.

It's very hard to know unless we have the full details of what was happening.
I think it's the state that we get to when an alert is generated and on EIM we mark the alert as Blocked and the response back to FLTS moves the message from FLTS_RP_SUSPECT to ToBeInvestigated
column378:
20/Aug/2018 04:26 PM;AManayangath;Muhammad, Hariprasad,

As discussed on lync earlier today, recording number of points:

* OCBC is on Swift AA 7.2.10 with FTLS version 7.2/2.6.1. They are however still on Swift release 2017 standards. You will find out what their plans are to upgrade / test with Swift release 2018 standards.
* As of Swift 2017 standards, the UETR and SLA ID are optional fields, however if one of them is in use, the other should also be populated.  
See WLM-603 & WLM-1361 for details.
* With Swift 2018 standards, the details seems to have changed slightly and it looks like we will need to make a change in how we are handling this field (with respect the interdepency between them). New story WLM-5020 on the backlog and this will be addressed in the next Sprint (starting later this week).

regards,
Ashok.

column1: CLONE - Code injected via XSS allows an attacker to perform a variety of actions in the context of the victims browser.
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
ISG-PSA-SAS-2454 Detica NetReveal-ALM#1636_Persistent Cross Site Scripting

Pages accessible by Administrator users within the NetReveal Web Application are vulnerable to persistent cross site scripting (XSS).

Persistent or stored XSS occurs when user input is processed and stored by the application in a file or database without performing validation and subsequently presented to a user without encoding or escaping.

Persistent XSS vulnerabilities allow for the permanent injection of HTML, JavaScript or similar client side code within an application page.

ImpactDesc
Code injected via XSS allows an attacker to perform a variety of actions in the context of the victimÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s browser.

These actions may include:

Steal the authentication credentials or session information of the victim and use it to assume that users identity (via theft of session cookies or other identifying parameters).
Perform unauthorised actions within a compromised users session.
Track the attacked users operations in the website.
Transfer the unsuspecting user to a phishing site.
Display various message to the user to intimidate or mislead.
Change the design of the vulnerable page(s).
Deliver client-side exploits (i.e. browser exploits)
Access to the affected functionality is restricted.

Recommendation
Implement the following approaches for all data that is displayed to the user and accepted as input:

1. HTML Escaping:
Escape all untrusted data that is displayed to the user through HTML encoding. Apply this to all data whether displayed within HTML elements, HTML common attributes, JavaScript or CSS. A list of dangerous characters to be encoded includes: < > "  % ; ) ( & # + . { }

2. Validate Input:
Validate all input from users prior to accepting and processing the content on the server and reject or escape any input that does not meet validation rules. Define a white-list of allowed characters and input that prohibits the use of any special characters which could be used to attempt scripting. In addition, apply an expected length (15 characters) and format rules (numeric, email, credit card) for each input.

column1: CLONE - Defect on SWIFT 2018 NarrativeWithOptionsTransformer
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Services has found a possible defect with the NarrativeWithOptionsTransformer still.

When the following is used in the message:

:71D:/AGENT/AUD123123,71 TEST71D1
//test71D2
/CORCOM/USD123123,72 TEST71D3

Transformed fields are:

71_amount = 123123.71
71_amount = 123123.72
71_code = AGENT
71_code = CORCOM
71_currency = AUD
71_currency = USD
71_text = TEST71D1
test71D2
71_text = TEST71D3

Which is expected. However, when the same amount is used in both sets:

:71D:/AGENT/AUD123123,71 TEST71D1
//test71D2
/CORCOM/USD123123,71 TEST71D3

The two amount fields are transformed into a single one:

71_amount = 123123.71
71_code = AGENT
71_code = CORCOM
71_currency = AUD
71_currency = USD
71_text = TEST71D1
test71D2
71_text = TEST71D3

The same happens if the same currency is used, only a single data source field is transformed. This looks like the handling for multiple values within this transformer is broken when the same value is encountered for the equivalent data source field.
