column1: KeyGenerator - performance issues
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
During CDD processing (rescoring) we discovered that many threads been blocked by com.norkom.common.util.KeyGenerator.generateKey(KeyGenerator.java:48) refer to thread dump file for more details.
and this has caused significant performance issue due to many of the threads been blocked.
In the Service Manager on CDD-ConnectedPartyProcessingHistoryInsert sequence use sequence function CDD-ConnectedPartyProcessingHistoryInsert-KeyGenerate, it uses expression KEY|[=reserved.function.call.KeyGenerator('KEY', 'CDD_CONP_PROCESSING_HISTORY','dataSource')]
Is there any reason why we use this?
column352:
We can reproduce this on client env with ~20 millions customers. TPS around 500 and CPU usage <50%. 
1. Update the number-of-processors to 50 conf/monitoring/processing_standalone.xml
 <processing domain-code="CDD">
                <number-of-processors>50</number-of-processors>

2. Change the debug level on log4j.appender.functionstats.Threshold=DEBUG
3. run this sql to start CDD scoring process: update customer_dynamic set need_rescore_flag='Y'
4. monitor the functionstats.log using tail -f functionstats.log|grep CDD_CustomerScoring-Call-CDD-CustomerProcessingHistoryInsert
5. You should notice last column which is processing time >200ms and some of them >1000ms
6. While CDD process is running, do a thread dump using kill -3.
7. Use thread dump analyser to look for blocked threads. You should noticed lots of blocked threads waiting for KeyGenerator
8. Check the CPU usage using iostate -5 which shows CPU usage < 50% which implies CPU is not fully utilised.
column369:
29/Aug/2018 02:53 PM;hteong;Refer to attached nohup7b.out for threads dump file

On ABSA project we resolved this by disabled use of keyGenerator function instead we replaced [KEY] with SELECT
CUSTOMER_ID || [=reserved.function.call.DBCastAndToChar('NEED_RESCORE_TIMESTAMP','30')] as CUST_PROCESSING_HIST_ID 

Refer to 02_cdd_cust_processing_history.sql is sql for script that we use to change the datatype from integer to varchar2 in order to accommodate above fix.
column370:
29/Aug/2018 05:38 PM;hteong;Hi Kirti,

column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:

column369:
06/Sep/2018 09:27 AM;MvanLaere1;Hi,

After investigation on the linked ticket, I found that a configuration solution existed (see https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/LLOYDSAML-2006?focusedCommentId=23735568&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-23735568)

Nevertheless, the issue was raised because services team was unable to find the solution themselves (I has tolook at the code to find it). in fact, they understood that the problem was related to rc not cleared before workflow action but they were unable to configure rc clearing.
The reason for this is that the "clearReplacements" button parameter although defined for com.norkom.configurator.web.screens.buttons.impl.WorkflowActionButtonController in table CONFIGURATION_PARAMETERS is not taken in account by that controller.

The solution I found as to configure the 'navigateTo' parameter and put '&clearReplacementsContainer=true' as url parameter but this is not convenient because it needs to also put the 'screen=' in url parameter although this is already configured by workflow success screen.

So I think the "clearReplacements"  button parameter should be supported by WorkflowActionButtonController as done with NavigationButtonController.

Marc

column1: CLONE - Information Disclosure - Detailed Error Messages
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
ISG-PSA-SAS-2454 Detica NetReveal-ALM#1630_Information Disclosure - Detailed Error Messages

The WebSphere Application Server hosting NetReveal has not been configured to suppress stack traces in server error pages. Stack traces usually contain descriptive error messages that are intended to assist developers in troubleshooting their application errors, and may reveal sensitive information about the inner workings of the application

ImpactDesc
An attacker may be able to use the information leaked by the descriptive error message to determine the exact cause of the error, this information can help them to locate potential vulnerabilities and to develop exploits for those vulnerabilities.

Recommendation
Suppress stack traces in error pages, configure customized error pages for WebSphere Application Server:

column1: C&C applet displayed despite system parameter being disabled
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The {{command.and.control.applet.graph}} system parameter is supposed to control whether applets are displayed in C&C. 

However with IE, it appears that this setting is being ignored and the applet is being invoked if the report was saved with an applet-based chart, as is the case with the OOTB C&C reports.

So it appears that the setting is being used to control the content of the dropdown list rather than access to the applet as described in the Base Platform UI Guide:
{quote}
This Boolean parameter is used to enable or disable calls to the Graph applet...
{quote}

This shows the setting diasabled:
!^screenshot.8.jpg!

This shows the applet being called:
!^screenshot.7.jpg!

And if you click *Plot*, this shows a different type of chart being displayed:
!^screenshot.9.jpg!
column352:
# Set the applet.graph setting to true.
# Create a report with an apple-based Graph. Save it
# Set the applet.graph setting to false.
# Login with IE and open the saved report.

Applet should not be generated.

column1: CLONE - [SWIFT 2018] Defect with NarrativeStructuredTransformer for tags 72Z and 77
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
ANZ has raised a finding where the content was given as follows:

:72Z:/PHONBEN/NARRATIVE
/TELEBEN/NARRATIVE

Transforms to:

72_code=PHONBEN
TELEBEN
72_text=NARRATIVE

NARRATIVE

Seems that there is an extra carriage return embedded between the first set of code+narrative pair and the second pair for the narrative portion.

There are two issues with this behaviour:

1) The transformation doesn't align with other transformed fields introduced in SWIFT 2018, we should expect 2 pairs of 72_code and 72_text respectively for each set.
2) The carriage return (CRLF) getting embedded, one for the code, two for the narrative.
column352:
See ANZ Jira NRNA1129-760.

Test the SWIFT 2018 code changes which were developed in the latest Core Product.

column1: Classpath conflict with the free text search function and the phoenix thick driver
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Issue summarised in following comment from: BMOFCIUP-741
{panel}
Hi Kola,
I am assuming phoenix-4.7.0.2.5.3.0-37-client.jar is the thick client. I took a look at it and it has its own copy of the Groovy class (org.codehaus.groovy.control.customizers.ImportCustomizer) which it appears is not compatible with Elastic Search, I dont think the thick client will work with FTS.

Regards,
Vikram
{panel}
Short term workaround is documented here:
http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/display/apps/Search+indexer+running+in+the+standalone+mode

Can we determine if this issue is replicated in 7.7 please? Ideally we can repack the jars to eliminate the issue.

column1: CLONE - JEP Expression fail to process the data with square bracket
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Westpac reported the CUSTOMER_ADDRESSES are not able to load data when address record contains square brackets and it is due to JEP expression sequence function "Daily-CUSTOMER_ADDRESSES-Data-SetFullAddress".
Once JEP fails, _FullAddress_ will populate with null value and _FULL_ADDRESS_ (not null constraint) will fail to update or insert to the database. Below are the test scenario and result.

||#||Case||Test Data||Test Result||
|1.|If the address contains the open square bracket and close bracket.|Test 0 [reserved.userId]|Success|
|2.|If the address contains the open square bracket without close bracket.|Test 0 [reserved.userId
OR
Test 0 reserved.userId][|Fail|
|3.|If the address contains the close square bracket without open bracket.|Test 0 reserved.userId]|Success|
column352:
1. Create CUSTOMER_ADDRESS file with data that contains "[]". Sample data as CUSTOMER_ADDRESSES_20160217.txt.
2 Load the data from batch bridge
3. Address Test 0 and 1 will load successfully but Test 2 and 3 will fail
column369:
20/Dec/2018 02:51 AM;harika.kurada;Hi Kirti, Matt,

Just checking, if had a chance to look into the APPS-15298 ticket? Steps to reproduce the issue are mentioned in the ticket.

Thanks,

Harika
column370:
20/Dec/2018 10:58 AM;TKukushkina;Hi Harika,

 

Yes, we had a chance to look into this issue. This will have to be sorted out in Java code. We don't have a ready fix yet, nor the estimated date when we will have one. We will update the ticket when we have more info.

 

Kind regards,

Tatiana
column371:
20/Dec/2018 11:14 AM;JPerek;Hi Harika,

as Tatiana stated above this is a code issue and needs to be sorted in the Platform however there is no estimation made for it.

 

You can workaround this problem by turning off the "IsJEP" under the Expression function property list and change expression to something like

FullAddress|[Address] [City] [Zone] [PostalCode] [CountryCode]

Note: you shouldn't use double quoutes here.

column1: Validate DHC parameter router.dhc.domains.datasources

The dhc parameter router.dhc.domains.datasources should be validated to ensure that the Entity_View configuration is correct .

Correct format example .

{
                Wire(PaymentID)
                                [CurrentBeneficiary_CurrentBeneficiary(CrAccountSourceUniqueID)Customer_Account(AccountSourceUniqueID)]
                ACH(PaymentID)
                                [CurrentBeneficiary_CurrentBeneficiary(CrAccountSourceUniqueID)Customer_Account(AccountSourceUniqueID)Batch_Batch(UniqueBatchID)]
}

column1: Max35Text is unable to handle a CR character
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
The issue appears to be a CoreDev issue that has been identifed in this client-project. If you look at the two files [^no_xml_parse_error.xml] and [^xml_parse_error.xml] with your view set to display End-of-Line character you will see the only difference between them is that xml_parse_error.xml contains a carriage-return character where the functioning XML contains a LF.
!Carriage-Return_Vs_Line-Feed.png|thumbnail!
We are assured that CR is a valid input for this field and that our product must handle it.

If you have a look at http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/CLS_WLM/CodeRepository/branches/CS.2018-11-20.CLS-9/src-hijack/com/norkom/acquisition/business/realtime/impl/DefaultQueueAdapter.java you'll see a check-in where I tried to brute-force it. But it has been decided at a more-senior level that this will require a full investigation and an proper (elegant) fix (rather than my more rough-and-ready solution)

That input is a custom message *but* is using a standard SWIFT input. The problem here is not the custom message. The problem seems the standard-handling of the Max35Text type is insufficient to deal with the CR EoL character
{code:xml}    <xs:complexType name="TradeAgreement14">
        <xs:sequence>
            <xs:element name="TradDt" type="ISODate"/>
            <xs:element name="OrgtrRef" type="Max35Text"/>{code}
The spec for that custom message is here [^fxtr.014.001.04.xsd]. 

When trying to process a message including the character carriage return (\r), listener stops, message stays stuck in queue and norkom.log shows error:

https://connect/teamshare/Customers/CustomerSupport/Lists/Environments/DispForm.aspx?ID=727

The ASE is recreating this by placing the attached file [^xml_parse_error.xml] into queue CLS.DSCAN.OFACREQ.QUEUE from queue manager CLSPRD.CLSNET.MQM in environment iedc1nkmdevv0481.

In order to re-reproduce the issue, the message needs to be manually removed from the queue and the listener CLS.DSCAN.OFACREQ.CLSNET.PORT needs to be started over.

column1: Different timestamp causing CDD rescoring to fail
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Rescoring Customer after the TO_DATE is populated on the Customer_Account_Link table.

Expected behaviour is as follows:
- Customer is ingested with a particular Account (This will require a entry in the Customers/Accounts and Customer_Account_Link table)
- Customer is scored with Account 
- Account is closed in Bank
- Account Status is updated to Inactive and a TO_DATE is added on relationship in Customer_Account_Link table via the ingestion of the Accounts and Customer_Account_Link table
- Customer should be rescored with new cdd score as the account being closed and should not be scored
column352:
Customer_account_link ingestion

compare the timestamps between ingested record and ingestion process

column1: Infinite loop of opened connections to DB
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Infinite loop of opened connections to database occurs when user tries to open a screen for which he does not have permission.
Connection pool maxes out and we get error "Cannot open connection" in log.

Issue reproduced in 7.4 and 7.6.
column352:
Issue is reproducible when accessing a screen for which user does not have permission.
Server frozen, connection pool maxed out.

Example:
1)	Connect Netreveal using 'amlinvestigator' user.
2)	Click on the screen name on the right bottom corner (as-if you wanted to go configure the screen in application builder but this particular user does not have proper permissions to do it)

column1: Incorrect Org Unit populated in Transaction Worklist screen/Table
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Incorrect Org Unit populated in Transaction Worklist screen/Table.

Issue Description: If a real-time alert is generated for an Org Unit say 'US', then Transaction_Worklist table is populated with the 'Shared' Org unit which is the default DataSource OrgUnit. However Alert_Header and Data_Source_Swift tables has the correct Org unit populated. 
Due to this, in Transaction Worklist search results Org unit for all the alerted Transactions are displayed as 'Shared' which is misleading.

Root Cause: 
In Service Manager, sequence function query 'WLM_transactionWorklist' under sequence 'WLM_Transactions' is inserting the default Org unit from DataSource and not the alert org unit.

{noformat}
...
[Transaction.DataSource.OrganizationUnit.Id],
...
{noformat}
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
- Create an real-time alert
- Check the Transaction Worklist screen results for the org unit
- Open the alert details and check the OrgUnit
column369: 02/Jan/2019 10:12 AM;Pnolan;Reassigning WLM issue...

column1: [RNL-326] Difference between the Free Text Match 85% and Free Text Abbreviation Match 85% algorithms.
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: You will see that only 50_name generates an alert which uses FTM 59_name doesn't generate an alert which uses AFTM. More details in [^Issue algorithm.docx]
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
To recreate log on to: http://iedc1nkmdevv0585:9097/netreveal/rwa.do as admin
# go to 'Watchlist Manager' - 'Processing' - 'Single Lookup'
# select SWIFT NL as data source and then on 'Change'
# in field '50_name (t)' type in: 1-P
# in field '59_name (t) ' type in: 1-P
# make sure 'Store Alerts' is set to 'Yes' then click on 'Perform
column369: 07/Jan/2019 11:59 AM;Pnolan;Reassigning WLM issue...
column370: 07/Jan/2019 02:52 PM;RHome;Problem with the FTAM algorithm treating single letter input words as abbreviations, even if the watch-list word is also a single letter word. Hence FTM and FTAM work differently for watch-list entries such as "F A R C".
column371: 25/Jan/2019 08:53 AM;RHome;Note: I have realised that the fix for this checked-in for Rabobank might break Fuzzy Abbreviation Match and Exact Abbreviation Match in that the fix changes the abbreviation index, but the corresponding code change to handle that was only applied to the Free Text Abbreviation Match algorithm.

column1: Workflow actions on cross filters sections not working on 7.5.0.10
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Ref: PLAT-20958 (for 7.4), PLAT-21095 (for 7.4), EGB00255202-6374

For a cross filter section where a workflow button is added, populating the rowIdentifierColumn section parameter causes the section to fail to be loaded and shows an onscreen error, "Please review that there are dimensions defined for each type of chart". It also logs the error, 
{code}TypeError: e[n].replace is not a function
    at Object.n [as addCheckboxColumnToData] (2.2_pack.js:8)
    at flattenData (templatingCrossFilter1.js:115)
    at templatingCrossFilter1.js:146
    at templatingCrossFilter1.js:1197{code}

This can also happens on setting the allowMultiSelect section parameter to true, though it sometimes causes no onscreen error - however, it never creates checkboxes.

Furthermore, the workflow action button is placed at the top of the screen rather than at the top of the list section.

column1: Search Audit log is duplicate Action type for "Add Task" Mass Action.
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: When a user adds one "Task" from Assemble and View Alert Information screen, and another Task from homepage, system creates two 'Add Task' actions in dropdown of the Search Audit log.
column352:
1. Launch the QA Application login as Fraud Supervisor (wbusz7/Password1)
 2. In the homepage, under My Top 10 Alerts tab, Select checkbox of one or more Alerts of Active Status click on Mass Action icon "Create New Task Associated with Selected Alerts"
 3. Enter Description, Due Date Time, Priority, Status Reminder and click on save
 4. Add one more Task from Assemble and View Alert Information window
 5. Go to "Audit" log and select the Action dropdown as "Add Task"

Expected Result:
 Audit Log screen dropdown displays with one Add Task action.

Actual Result:
 Two Add Task actions displays.

column1: WLM Batch processing for DS_XX data sources ends with error
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Batch processing for DS_XX data sources does not work.
Alerts are  not generated, the processing is ended  with error.
*Error in Batch Process Monitor* : The Batch 'WLM_Test_DS_CN_Batch_DEV.txt - (2019/01/15 16:34:21)' has failed with error:Skip limit of '0' exceeded. Number of records failed found: 1. Please check /opt/netreveal/dnb_dev_ui/conf/wlm/batch/recovery folder for more information.
*Java error:*
java.sql.SQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException: ORA-01400: cannot insert NULL into ("DNB_UPGRADE_DEV"."WORKFLOW_WORKITEM"."DOMAIN_ID")

The direct cause of the problem is the fact that Replacement Container is populated with strange data for batch processing - a lot of variables are missing or displayed as lists. 

Batch processing for SWIFT messages is completed successfully. The same with DS_XX real time messages and  Single LookUp (tested DS_CN).

Please, find a log of the problem batch processing here: [^norkom_batch_DS.log]

column1: XML text elements double escaped on ingest.
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When an XML document that contains an XML escape sequence (via direct XML escapes, not a CDATA block) is passed into the ObjectGraph framework, then it is surrounded with CDATA tags when it is output to a string, thus changeing the content of the XML.

This becomes apparent when using the DatabaseLobQueryRealTimeFunction to ingest a claim in the standard GI pipeline, and a double-escaped version of the XML is committed to the CLAIM table.

I have attached a unit test which demonstrates this behaviour.

Unfortunately we are not able to hijack the relavent classes, as parts of the ObjectGraph framework run on a secure classloader, so we will need this built into a form that can be distributed to a number of GI clients.

Feel free to contact Ian Martin for more information.

Further details and a detailed proposed fix are avaliable in [https://engineering/jira/browse/NESD-2057. If you do not have permission to see this it can be easyly arranged.|https://engineering/jira/browse/NESD-2057,]

column1: Unable to access workflow actions under rule actions due to entity name mismatch
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
While configuring the workflow rules with entity *SM Alert*, the workflow actions defined on *Alert* entity are not accessible.

Workflow rules only work based on entity name used by workflow_workitem table. As the CDD alerts are created as SM Alert entity , we defined workflow rules using SM Alert entity. But the workflows are defined under Alert entity.

Due to this entity name mismatch , the actions are not available to configure under workflow rules.

The queries configured within the section fields as below - 
{code:java}
SELECT DISTINCT W.ID AS FIELD_KEY, W.NAME AS DISPLAY 
FROM WORKFLOW_ACTION_LINKS L, WORKFLOWS W
WHERE L.USE_IN_RULE_ACTIONS = 'Y'
AND L.WORKFLOW_ID = W.ID
AND W.CASE_MANAGEMENT_ENTITY_ID = [CM_ENTITY_ID]
ORDER BY W.NAME

SELECT W.ID AS MASTER_FIELD_KEY, A.ID AS FIELD_KEY, CASE WHEN A.RESOURCE_KEY IS NULL THEN A.NAME ELSE A.RESOURCE_KEY END AS DISPLAY 
FROM WORKFLOW_ACTION_LINKS L, WORKFLOWS W, WORKFLOW_ACTIONS a
WHERE L.USE_IN_RULE_ACTIONS = 'Y'
AND L.WORKFLOW_ID = W.ID
AND L.WORKFLOW_ACTION_ID = A.ID
AND W.CASE_MANAGEMENT_ENTITY_ID = [CM_ENTITY_ID]
AND L.DELETED = 'N'
ORDER BY W.NAME, L.DISPLAY_SEQUENCE

SELECT A.ID AS MASTER_FIELD_KEY, R.ID AS FIELD_KEY, CASE WHEN R.RESOURCE_KEY IS NULL THEN R.NAME ELSE R.RESOURCE_KEY END AS DISPLAY
FROM WORKFLOW_ACTION_LINKS L, WORKFLOWS W, WORKFLOW_ACTIONS a, WORKFLOW_ACTION_REASON_LINKS WARL, WORKFLOW_ACTION_REASONS r
WHERE L.USE_IN_RULE_ACTIONS = 'Y'
AND L.WORKFLOW_ID = W.ID
AND L.WORKFLOW_ACTION_ID = A.ID
AND WARL.WORKFLOW_ACTION_ID = A.ID
AND WARL.ACTION_REASON_ID = R.ID
AND W.CASE_MANAGEMENT_ENTITY_ID = [CM_ENTITY_ID]
AND WARL.DELETED ='N'
ORDER BY W.NAME, L.DISPLAY_SEQUENCE, WARL.DISPLAY_SEQUENCE
{code}
The simple and straight forward fix would be to remove the dependency on case management entity in the above queries.
column352:
Create workflow rule under 'SM Alert' entity

Link an expression that was created under 'SM Alert' entity.

Add Rule Action 

within rule action, try to link the CDD workflow 

Result - unable to access any of the CDD workflow as they are defined under Alert entity.

column1: CLONE - listBox_FieldName_Query is not working in 7.6
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
In section type, NewWLMSectionController, there is a parameter listBox_FieldName_Query. In older version (6.7 & 7.2 which I tested), when I put query to this, (eg customer_country_name; SELECT COUNTRY_NAME AS DISPLAY, COUNTRY_NAME AS KEY FROM COUNTRY), customer_country_name will become drop down list with country name as option.
However, in version 7.6, the drop down list is empty now.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
Login into the application
Watchlist Manager -> Subject Screening -> Watch Person Check
Datasource filed customer_country_name not displaying the list of countries dropdown
column369:
11/Feb/2019 09:39 AM;ASrivastava;The solution for this issue is provided in services ticket EMY000148-355

Solution is only implemented for, when we define query in listBox_FieldName_Query for a single datasource field

eg: customer_country_name;SELECT COUNTRY_CODE AS KEY, COUNTRY_NAME AS DISPLAY FROM COUNTRY

the above query gets a dropdown select option for field customer_country_name.

But if the query is defined for multiple field, eg for customer_country_name and customer_name at the same time like shown below

customer_country_name;SELECT COUNTRY_CODE AS KEY, COUNTRY_NAME AS DISPLAY FROM COUNTRY:customer_name;SELECT ID AS KEY, FIRST_NAME AS DISPLAY FROM USERS

Application doesn't support it and this will be considered as invalid query causing application to show query error page.

 

Please refer to page 469 under Application_builder UI guide 7.6 from below link

[https://connect/teamshare/NRPM/Solutions/Solutions%20Library/Forms/AllItems.aspx?View=%7b1EBAB09F-49EE-449D-8FB5-8D512D7CBFF8%7d&FilterField1=Platform_x0020_Release&FilterValue1=7%2E6]

column370:
18/Apr/2019 07:10 AM;KOReilly;Hi Ashok,

I was just about to raise this myself - I know of 3 clients in Australia which have this issue.

In my opinion things like editing the standard list filters, indexes and columns are standard WLM configuration items and I would have expected them to be locked down by the filtering.editable=false setting.  I am not sure of the purpose of differentiating between the list type configuration settings and the check/data source configuration settings.

I do clearly understand the need to have a setting to allow the lists data to be editable/not editable.

I assume for backwards compatibility you cannot change all of the list configuration items to be locked down by the filtering.editable=false setting.  In which case we would request a new setting "filtering.editablelistdata" or similar to be created to separate out the list data portion.

As a side note, the Watchlist Manager UI Guide (I am looking at version 7.6 so may have improved) has a very ambiguous description of these parameters which leaves the configurator without enough information to make a decision on which settings to use without testing it out to see what happens.

Cheers

Kate
column371:
18/Apr/2019 09:13 AM;AManayangath;Kate,

The 'filtering.editable' setting's original intention was to improve the system performance - by avoiding continuously polling the database. When filtering.editable is set to true, WLM works off the configuration loaded into memory (which is clearly much quicker than loading from db). This flag was later on overloaded to enable/disable editing various WLM components in. I agree that there needs to be bit more joined up thinking in this area, to separate "using cached data" vs "read only configuraiton" and finer control of various components of WLM and how they are associated to permissions and roles.  The permissions for various buttons / actions can be improved by changing out-of-the-box configuration, and should not require any code change.

There is a story in WLM backlog at the moment - WLM-4580 -  to address one (minor) aspect of this. 

CC'ing Edward.

thanks,
Ashok.

column1: Hastings UAT - UTC/Universal User Timezones resolve dates incorrectly
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi,

Hastings users have reported an issue where dates are displaying incorrectly in EIM. On the Policy Alert Details page PF__AlertDetails_Live, for example, dates in the 'Summary' section at the top of the screen, were displaying one day behind those shown in the Policy Details Overview section (same date). The Summary section reads from the ALERT_HEADER table; the Policy Details Overview section reads from the document xml; both have the same dates saved correctly.

The fields on the Summary section had 'Convert to Local Timestamp' ticked, so I tried a number of timezones, and found:
 * UTC 0:0 GMT dispalyed 1 day early
 * UTC 0:0 GMT (there were 2 of these) displyaed 1 day early
 * Universal 0:0 GMT displayed 1 day early
 * SST 11:00 GMT showed the date correctly
 * Pacific/Samoa -11:00 GMT displayed 1 day early
 * Poland 1:00 GMT showed the date correctly
 * Europe/London 0:0 GMT showed the date correctly.

I have requested that the client change their users' timezones to be Europe/London, but as UTC is the default, a number of clients will have the same issue so this should be fixed in P&C.

Thanks,

Emily

column1: Can't Delete Standard List Records
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When fingerprinting is enabled on a standard list, attempting to delete individual records within it sometimes results in an error. 

Further investigation revealed the conditions under which the error appears. Manually entered records exhibit different behavior to those loaded via a flat-file import:
 * Manually entered records can only be deleted if every field is populated with some data
 * Records imported via flat-file can only be deleted if every non-multivalue (i.e. single value) field is populated with some data. 
 ** However if these records are manually edited at all, they exhibit the same behavior as manually entered records. 

The list uses SFP on 3 columns, (Name, Alias and Country Name) and the issue is present using all fingerprinting methods (currently set on SHA256).

column369:
22/Feb/2019 02:46 PM;VSavkoor;This issue was resolved in the Fifth Third project by providing support to evaluate a Query condition on the entity before its returned from a Queue. Details are below.  The Query condition definition is defined in base_config/system parameters, but Platform should allow for the condition to be defined in the UI along with the Queue definition., and allow for more complex SQLs with RC variables.

The Query condition is defined as properties in base_config.properties or system_parameters.
 * The SQL in the Query condition should be defined as a property in base_config.properties using the following pattern: *queue.c**ondition.sql.<queue name>.* For example, _queue.condition.sql.L1_Batch_PEP_Queue=SELECT * FROM V_WR_WLM_BATCH_RT_ALERT_NEW WHERE STATUS_CODE='NEW' AND ALERT_KEY=?_

(Note that any spaces in the Queue name should be replaced with “_” (underscore), and the WHERE condition in the SQL can have one parameter (?), which will be replaced with the value of the Entity Id, such as the Alert Key during execution.)
 * Another property  can be set in base_config.properties to enable/disable the condition check per Queue. The property is *queue.**condition.enable.<queue name>.* For example, queue.condition.enable.L1_Batch_PEP_Queue=true. Note that spaces in the Queue name should be replaced with “_” (underscore). If the property is not defined or set to false, then the condition check will not be executed.

column1: Command and Control 'Channel' domain filtering doens't appear to work
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi,

We are trying to configure a new Channel in Command and Control using P&C3.1 for [NESD-2495|https://engineering/jira/browse/NESD-2495]. However, the domain filtering introduced by the channel doesn't appear to work. 

In the [Command and Control Report Builder UI Guide|https://projectshare/proj/CMSX1748/PrivatePlus/Private%20Documents/Deliverables/CMSX1748DEL012%20ISM%20FIS%20UI%20Guide%202.0/Command%20and%20Control%20Report%20Builder%20UI%20Guide%207.2.pdf], there is the following definition of a channel:
{quote}A channel is a collection of related reports for a particular organisation unit and domain
within a financial institution. A channel must be associated with a domain and an
organisation unit and is only accessible by users who are assigned to its related domain
and organisation unit.
{quote}
The Claims Fraud channel has been configured with Domain=Claims Fraud, Organisation Unit=Group. The domain hierarchy in P&C is defined as follows:
 * Claims Fraud
 ** Personal Motor
 ** Personal Property
 * Policy Fraud
 ** Motor Policy

Expected result: Only alerts (etc) with domain {{Claims Fraud}} or {{Personal Motor}} or {{Personal Property}} appear in reports generated from the {{Claims Fraud}} domain.

Actual result: An Admin user who has access to Top Level/Group receives both Claim and Policy alerts in reports generated from the Claims Fraud domain.

column1: CLONE - SIT Deployment Issues Of Swift Phase 2 Release (OCBC_SW_P2_2.0)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
There seems to be a bug with the import of customised domains. If the customised flag is set the parent ids don’t import correctly.

 

The following issues were encountered during SIT deployment of Swift Phase 2 Release (OCBC_SW_P2_2.0):
 1. CREATE SEQUENCE error from DB Script
 2. Application Config import error
 3. Norkom.log Error during application config import:
 ERROR PermissionValidator:1139 - buildDomainTree(): Two root?!!

 

All these issues were resolved by the following workaround:
 1. Removed NOSCALE from CREATE SEQUENCE
 2. Imported base config first. After successfully importing base config, re-import all config in the release including base config.
 3. Changed the hierarchy structure of WLM, CDD, and IOB. 
 Logged in to NetReveal UI, navigate to Administration->Authorisation->Domains
 Updated the hierarchy to make sure that WLM and CDD's parent is Top Level and IOB's parent is WLM.

This ticket is logged to track the issues that need to include the fix for next release.

column1: Missing highlight of hit information in the Parsed Fileds section (WLM Alerts' Details)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Missing highlight of hit information in the Parsed Fields section (a WLM Alerts' Details screen).
The problem is visible the section WLM_SwiftMessageInfo_EimInt_v46.
It is caused by the fact that the data are wrongly saved in the table ALERTED_TRANSACTION_DATA_WLM, in field AT_CONTENT - without the highlighting tags <cm> </cm>.
An alert saver does not process the text with the highlighting tags when the line which contains the hit in the message is ended with a space.
Example:
- hit / match text: _AL JABBURI Sadi Tuma Abbas_ 
- line ':50K:AL JABBURI Sadi Tuma Abbas test' will be saved in ALERTED_TRANSACTION_DATA_WLM.AT_CONTENT as
50_na <cm>AL JABBURI Sadi Tuma Abbas</cm> test -> CORRECT
- line   ':50K:AL JABBURI Sadi Tuma Abbas test ' (a space character at the end!) will be saved in the above table.field as    
50_na AL JABBURI Sadi Tuma Abbas test -> WRONG.
Please see the attached printscreen for clarification. Attached also an example SWIFT message.

Additional info: I've checked the format of SWIFT messages, eg in the 50K field all the characters are available, there is no restriction regarding a space at the end.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
1) Make sure that a test message (SWIFT for example) has a space at the end of the line which contains a hit.
For example: a line :50K: in MT SWIFT message looks like this (single quotes mark beginning and end of the text):
':50K:AL JABBURI Sadi Tuma Abbas test ' 
where AL JABBURI Sadi Tuma Abbas is a hit.
2) Process the message (real time or batch - does not matter) - alert should be generated
3) Search for your alert (Group Work > All Alerts), open the alert details, check the Parsed Fields section.
Expected result: the text:  AL JABBURI Sadi Tuma Abbas should be highlighted.
Actual result: the hit text is NOT highlighted

column1: Query Builder Issues in DUX
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Two additional issues have been found in DUX:
 * newly created data labels don't appear in query builder until the user closes the editing mode, gets back to the list of configurations, and load the configuration again; +however+, when typed in manually, data labels are acknowledged by the SM, the configuration is validated, and alerts are correctly fired
 * while scrolling down in search for values in query builder and trying to click the cursor sign, the app moves the user back to the top of the list thus not allowing to insert values into the scenario definition. Specifically, it's been observed in the data fields tab of query builder
 * in query builder, there is no option for adding peer group profiles to scenario definitions
 * in query builder, profiles do not have the option to add data labels from their corresponding data sources; for example, after creating a profile for each alert feedback record, one can only add data labels from the transaction data source
 * pls see attachment "default title pop up"; after changing parameters, updating them, and clicking 'finish editing' the pop up on the screen shot appeared and DUX froze

We use DUX on BNPP FRB and the client cannot use Java for technical reasons so it is a really vital part of the build. I attach the latest configuration we use. It's very basic for now and was created from scratch in DUX. Could this be taken care of, please?

Thank you.

 

[^Configuration_2535.zip]
column352:
Data Labels
- create a new data label for the transaction data source
- create a new profile for each transaction record
- newly created data label doesn't appear in the query builder in profiling
- click finish editing and start editing again: still, no data label in profiling (nor in detection)
- click finish editing, back to configurations, load the configuration again, start editing: the data label appears in profiling (and detection)

Scrolling Down
- go to detection
- create a scenario for each transaction record
- click definition, go to query builder, data fields, and scroll down
- in scrolled-down view, try inserting any data field a couple of times; some of these tries will result in resetting the view to the beginning of the list and not inserting the value to scenario's definition

column1: CLONE - Scenario Manager DUX generates missing value errors when updating parameter lists even though values are entered.
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When changing values within the parameter lists, SM DUX eventually generates an error indicating that no value is specified for one of the columns in the list, even though there is clearly a value entered. The column that appears in the error message is not necessarily the one we were changing the value of.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Create a copy of an existing configuration e.g. ID 1000 is the first AML processing model available after installation of a standard build.
 # Save the new configuration:
 ## Enter the new configuration.
 ## Click on ‘Start Editing’
 ## Make any change that will activate the green Update button e.g. entering text in a data label and removing it.
 ## Click on the ‘Update’ button.
 ## Click ‘Finish Editing’.
 ## Click ‘Save’ in the ‘Unsaved configuration edits’ window.
 ## Enter a comment if required and click on ‘Save’ in the ‘Save Changes’ window.
 ## Wait for the save to complete.
 # Still within the same configuration, click on ‘Start Editing’ again.
 # Go to the ‘Parameters’ tab and start modifying values for several lists e.g.:
 ## AccountParameters list: change AccountLengh to any new value. Click update. Click ‘Check Config’ and check the status displayed: if ‘Valid configuration’, go to the next parameter list, if an error appears then the issue is reproduced.
 ## CashCreditParameters list: change IndividualAmount to any new value. Click update. Click ‘Check Config’ and check the status displayed: if ‘Valid configuration’, go to the next parameter list, if an error appears then the issue is reproduced.
 ## CashDebitParameters list: changeWeekAmount1 to any new value. Click update. Click ‘Check Config’ and check the status displayed: if ‘Valid configuration’, go to the next parameter list, if an error appears then the issue is reproduced.
 # Usually after 3 or 4 lists, the error appears. Typically after sub-step 3. in the previous step.  !image-2019-03-07-16-04-33-608.png!
 Detailed error:  !image-2019-03-07-16-05-10-020.png!

In this example, the highlighted column is the one we tried to modify. We can see that there is a value entered. We can try to enter a new value, Update and Check Config again, but the error is still generated.

 
 I investigated the behaviour further and made the following observations:
 * After step 5 above, if we ignore the error and try to save the configuration anyway, the configuration then shows a Status of ‘Validation error’ and appears impossible to resolve (using the client’s words, the configuration seems ‘corrupt’ and cannot be used again).
 * Instead of saving, if we revert the last change made (allowing the config chek to pass), click on ‘Update’ and ‘Finish Editing’ + Save of configuration, we can then go back to edit the same parameter list and others without any problem (I tried more lists than the steps above and never got an error). However odd, I see this as a potential workaround (other than modifying the parameter .txt files via the export/import feature).

To try and explain this behaviour, I made the following additional key observation in the database:

With each Save of configuration (regardless of the change made), the contents of the mon_largestring_part table appears to alternate between a single record and multiple records for each parameter list. When the issue does not seem to occur, there is one record per parameter list, and when the issue occurs, there are typically 3. I saved multiple times to confirm this trend.

These are the queries I am using to see this:
{noformat}
--Records for all lists
select * from mon_largestring_part
where largestring_id in 
(select largestring_id from scenario_list_data
where scenario_list_id in (select id from scenario_list where config_id = <ID>));

--Records for specific list name
select * from mon_largestring_part where largestring_id in 
(select largestring_id from scenario_list_data
where scenario_list_id = (select id from scenario_list where config_id = 1703 and list_name = 'AccountParameters'));

{noformat}
This is the XML for one record:
{noformat}
<rowCollection>
    <row>
        <column name="sixmonthscount">4</column>
        <column name="sixmonthsamount">4</column>
        <column name="monthamount">4</column>
        <column name="view">Default</column>
        <column name="organisation">Default</column>
        <column name="type">Default</column>
    </row>
</rowCollection>

{noformat}
This is the concatenated XML when there are 3 records:
{noformat}
<rowCollection>
</rowCollection>
<rowCollection>
</rowCollection>
<rowCollection>
    <row>
        <column name="sixmonthscount">4</column>
        <column name="sixmonthsamount">4</column>
        <column name="monthamount">4</column>
        <column name="view">Default</column>
        <column name="organisation">Default</column>
        <column name="type">Default</column>
    </row>
</rowCollection>

{noformat}
Presumably, there is one extra rowCollection for the Cient view and one for the Account view in addition to the filled Default entry.

Finally, this is the XML after saving the configuration while ignoring the error:
{noformat}
<rowCollection>
    <row>
        <column name="sixmonthscount">5</column>
        <column name="sixmonthsamount">5</column>
        <column name="monthamount">5</column>
        <column name="view">Default</column>
        <column name="organisation">Default</column>
        <column name="type">Default</column>
    </row>
</rowCollection>
<rowCollection>
    <row>
        <column name="view">Default</column>
        <column name="organisation">Default</column>
        <column name="type">Default</column>
    </row>
</rowCollection>

{noformat}
Notice the second collection: it only has the 3 segments set to Default and it has no values for the 3 other columns. This to me is the reason for the error: DUX is somehow picking up that record and expecting a value but it never shows that record in the interface. My guess would be that the extra rowCollection entries are causing a mix-up in the underlying XML when the parameter value is changed: when the configuration is finally saved, instead of going back to the single record entry, we end up with a single plus the broken/incomplete record. I have no idea why we switch like that in the first place.

Out of interest, I went to check what would be displayed for the same configuration in the Java Web Start application and there we can see that it is in fact that record that is being retrieved and it highlights the missing values!

!image-2019-03-07-16-09-50-397.png!

{color:#000000}As a last step, I actually tried to fill those values and save the configuration. As far as I remember, the configuration no longer showed the error in DUX but I had to restart the server first. From here, I’m not sure what the implications are and I stopped investigating since the Java tool is not going to be used by our clients. I just wanted to document everything I tried and observed in case this helps with the root cause analysis.{color}

This error occurs when the profile configuration is updated using AML DUX screens.

Profile lifetime settings after the update - 
{code}
 <lifeTimes>
<lifeTime numberOfPeriods="52" filter="true" filterAlpha="0.8" reset="true" resetPeriod="week" standardDeviation="true" peerProfile="false"/>
 <lifeTime numberOfPeriods="15" filter="true" filterAlpha="0.8" reset="true" resetPeriod="month" standardDeviation="true" peerProfile="false"/>
</lifeTimes>
{code}
Notice the parameter filterPeriod is missing in the above. This parameter should be in there if filter = "true"

*Workaround Details:*
Updated the lifetime settings in the processingmodel.xml manually as below - 
{code}
 <lifeTimes>
 <lifeTime numberOfPeriods="52" filter="true" filterAlpha="0.8" filterPeriod="week" reset="true" resetPeriod="week" standardDeviation="true" peerProfile="false"/>
 <lifeTime numberOfPeriods="15" filter="true" filterAlpha="0.8" filterPeriod="month" reset="true" resetPeriod="month" standardDeviation="true" peerProfile="false"/>
 </lifeTimes>
{code}

Given that these scenarios will be updated by client on regular basis, we can't suggest the workaround solution to client and we need proper fix for this issue.

column1: DUX doesn't recognize setters set up in the processing model
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Setters defined in a processing model are not recognized by DUX, but displayed correctly in Java. I attach a screenshot which show the DUX message. Also, the processing model in question is attached. 

This is a crucial issue as virtual profiles and setters are required for four scenarios on the BNPP FRB project. Thanks for any help.

column369:
15/Mar/2019 04:03 PM;margaretcashman;Feedback from DUX developer > Kamil Zyjewski :: 

The problem is incorrect configuration (at least from the point of view of DUX).

Please see the attached _setter.xml_ file and analyse the differences between GIVEN (from the bug) and EXPECTED (manually corrected by me) configuration.

 

*Conclusions:*
 # *DUX expect one Virtual Field for each destination setting, not one with all values.*
 # *Definition of Setter profile field should have ‘.value’ at the end of destination’s setting value instead of some other prefix.*

 

On ( [http://10.222.17.215:8080/netreveal/loginPerform.do  ) demoDUX (|http://10.222.17.215:8080/netreveal/] I uploaded two configurations (copied form out of the box Configuration 1000):
 # Configuration 1201 with the GIVEN – _TransactionSetter_ profile field doesn’t display properly
 # Configuration 1204 with the EXPECTED – _TransactionSetter_ profile field display properly
column370:
17/Mar/2019 07:24 PM;lukasz.pacan;Thank you all for your help. 

[~kamil.zyjewski], small correction to your attachment: each virtual field should contain tags with starting number 1. For example, TransactionIncorporationDateStore element, dataType, and persistent elements all are numbered 4. I understand the error comes from copying the original file.

After the correction, configuration validates correctly. To be tested alongside with scenarios.

+One more thing+, I think setter 'customerCashIntensive' should behave differently. Namely, it stores two different values based on the same data label, CustomerCashIntensive. For transactions that satisfy this condition, the setter sets "Y", otherwise "N", however, DUX does not reflect it. It only displays 'store the value to "N" for the data label(s) NOT(CustomerCashIntensive)', presumably, because it's defined first in the processing model. In contrast, the same configuration opened in the applet does distinguish between the two in the setter profile.
column371:
22/Mar/2019 01:49 PM;lukasz.pacan;Hi All,

[~margaretcashman], [~kamil.zyjewski], I've tested the setters configurations (please see attachments; 2822 and 2823) as per our conversation on Thursday and it seems that from the perspective of the processing engine itself it does not matter which one is used. As a reminder, the problem under scrutiny here was that DUX did not display all setters which referred to the same virtual profile and thus, it wasn't sure whether they will be properly considered as scenario conditions. In our project, IsCustomerCashIntensive virtual profile were supposed to store a value depending on two setters checking CustomerCashIntensive data label. I've tested the following set ups:
 * all configurations contain virtual profiles in separate tags in the processing model (as opposed to the old java way where virtual profiles were grouped under one tag)
 * first configuration (2822) is as per above, i.e., two setters storing value in the same profile field
 ** setters NOT(CustomerCashIntensive) and CustomerCashIntensive storing value in IsCustomerCashIntensive virtual profile
 * second configuration (2823) contains an additional virtual profile
 ** setter NOT(CustomerCashIntensive) storing a value in CustomerNotCashIntensive profile and setter CustomerCashIntensive storing a value in CustomerCashIntensive profile

Results are, I'd say, positive as no matter which configuration is used setters and virtual profiles work correctly, i.e., they set and store values as expected and the profiles are correctly recognised by SM as scenario conditions. I've also productionised these two configurations both via DUX and the java applet and in every situation profile sinks, scenario states, and alerts in NetReveal worked properly.

The only difference was that DUX did not display one of the setter when 2822 was productionised (it did in Java, though) and when 2823 was productionised setters were properly displayed in both DUX and Java.

I hope the description is clear, but if not I'd be happy to paraphrase or do a call. Please let me know.

I'm also yet to check the manuals, i.e., whether the DUX version of Scenario Manager Configuratin Guide mentions and sufficiently explains the differences. I'll let you know.

Best

Lukasz
column372:
27/Mar/2019 09:05 AM;lukasz.pacan;Hi All,

Comparison of Scenario Manager UI Guide 7.6 & Scenario Manager UI Guide 7.6 DUX shows they do not differ in terms of content in the chapter about setter profiles (6.3.2.17 and 6.3.2.11 respectively). Thus, in my opinion, the DUX one should be updated and highlight the difference in configuration requirements mentioned in this ticket.

L

column1: Parameters tab crashes when additional segments are added (DUX)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi All,

when additional segments are added to a processing model, DUX crashes after trying to view the parameters tab (pls see snip1).

After an initial discussion with Kamil Zyjewski and one of his colleagues (apologies, I forgot the name), it seems an issue might be a hardcoded value for the number of segment columns displayed in the parameters tab.

Please note that the new configuration was (attached, 3038) successfully viewed, validated and set to production via the applet.

I'd be great if it could be resolved in the coming days as the delivery date is next Fri 12th Apr.

Thank you.
column352:
- add an additional segmentation level in the processing model (assuming the standard two are already there)
- view in DUX the parameters tab (if it is empty, DUX freezes when one tries to add values to newly created set of  parameters)
- try to get back to any other tab or to the list of configurations (DUX should still be frozen)
- try the following in the applet: load the configuration, add/modify parameters, set it to production
- after being productionized, the configuration should still crash while opened in DUX on the parameters list; the same for copying it and trying to modify parameters' values

column1: NR8 - error: com.detica.netreveal.common.search.InvalidConfigurationNameException: The configuration name was not recognised: EIMConfig
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi,

I installed NR8 with no customization, only out of the box config, on one app server with no elastic search.

Here are the following relevant system parameters:

 
{code:java}
- netreveal.search.config.exists = FALSE
- unified.search.enabled = FALSE
- search.enabled = TRUE
{code}
 

 

When starting the app, I'm getting the error in norkom.log whenever I try to search for something:
{code:java}
com.detica.netreveal.common.search.InvalidConfigurationNameException: The configuration name was not recognised: EIMConfig{code}
^I attach the full norkom.log (see norkom.log.zip), you'll see the full stack errors at the end of the log.^

I found that this error means that it's looking for a search config EIMConfig in the table SC_SEARCH_CONFIG.

But this table is empty. The script that inserts this search config is never called during the database installation, and there's no instructions in the install guide to activate it (database/data/search/netreveal_search_update_Oracle.sql).

Is it a bug in the documentation or in the core ? Please can you advise how I'm supposed to fix it ?

Thank you!
column352:
Install the database using the standard procedure.
 Table SC_SEARCH_CONFIG will be empty.
 Install the app server using the standard procedure.

check norkom.log whenever you search for something in UI.

column374:
29/Apr/2019 12:45 PM;CBandara;Hi

You said - "I installed NR8 with no customization, only out of the box config, on one app server with no elastic search"

V8 , will have Elastic Search as the default search provider. Netreveal search can be enabled via build time  parameters.

 

Can you let me know what you are trying to achieve (i.e which search provider) with this build?

 

Thanks

Charminda.
column375:
29/Apr/2019 01:58 PM;stephane.baudet;Hi Charminda,

I'm deploying it for a new project, codename "Golden Copy" for AXA Insurance company.

I'm building DEV, TEST and QA environments.

DEV and TEST are single nodes, running app server and database embedded in the same VM.

QA is having one vm for database, one for BATCH node, one for WEB node.

I didn't have any instructions about the search provider from the architect, and we're just looking for the easiest option. To be honest, I've never deployed ElasticSearch and have no idea how to deal with it. But when I follow the standard install guide, it's just leading to this error. Is it normal that the standard DB scripts are leading to this situation ?

Please can you advise to set up the easiest search option ? Thank you.
column376:
29/Apr/2019 03:12 PM;CBandara;Hi Stephane

 

I'm not sure about the APPS level build script properties need to be used to control the Search providers. I have added Dariusz to this Jira because I remember he was trying get this working earlier. Can you check with Darek first?

 

In our end (stage 2 ant builds), we control this with following three properties.

 

+*For ES*+

 

# Search Provider

build.module.search.provider=ElasticSearch

 

Conditions -

buildSearchClient must be true

buildSearchServer +must+ be false

 

+*For NR Search*+

 

# Search Provider

build.module.search.provider=NetRevealSearch

 Conditions -

buildSearchClient must be true

buildSearchServer must be true

 

Thanks

Charminda.
column377:
30/Apr/2019 01:28 PM;stephane.baudet;Hi Charminda,

In configuration.xml, I see we have the modules search.client and search.server. I guess it means buildSearchClient and buildSearchServer are both set to TRUE ?

In Netreveal default system parameters, I can see that netreveal.search.config.exists=false and unified.search.enabled=false, so I understand that it is set by default to standard EIM search.

So, how come the default db scripts is not creating the search config EIMConfig when running database_install.sh ? Is it normal ? I see it as a db scripts bug indeed.
column378:
30/Apr/2019 08:32 PM;CBandara;Hi Stephane

 

See the attached email (.msg file). This is what I was referring to you earlier. This may give you some useful information. 

Yes, there is a known issue with database scripts. I'll find out more details about this and get back to you soon.

 

Thanks

Charminda.
column379: 06/May/2019 08:18 AM;DTurowski;For this issue [https://engineering/jira/browse/FCENG-7378] Jira has been created.
column380:
10/May/2019 05:30 PM;stephane.baudet;Hi,

Philippe Plunkett replaced search.server by apps.search.config in configuration.xml.

So now, we are using elasticsearch if I understand well.

However, it's still not working. When trying to search something, we get an error "FTS-10034 - Search server configuration issue." in Netreveal. And there's nothing in any log (norkom.log, se*.log, SystemOut.log ...) that could give more details.

I have double-checked the config files described in the chapter 2.2.5 (Configuring Free Text Search Properties) of the install guide for Websphere, and found nothing wrong.

Would you have any idea?
column381:
13/May/2019 07:48 AM;DTurowski;[~CBandara] It looks that in the documentation there is described only the old FTS deployment. But when the *serach.server* is not present in the build then the configuration is a bit different. For example *netreveal.search.ur* parameter defined in *base_platform.properties* should be defined as: *http://<elastic_search_host>:<elastic_search_port>*

*elastic_search_host* means the server name or IP of the server where the Elastic Search server is running.

*elastic_search_port* means the port defined as *http.port* for Elastic Search server.

 

And this approach requires to start/configure external Elastic Search server because this is not built/present in the EAR file.
column382: 13/May/2019 08:23 AM;stephane.baudet;There's no instructions on how to build an external search server in the install guide, do you have a guide somewhere? Thank you.
column383: 13/May/2019 08:38 AM;stephane.baudet;UPDATE: our architect just confirmed that we must use Netreveal Search instead of Elastic Search. So I'll be back using NR search config, and I will need to deal with the issue reported formerly by this JIRA.
column384: 16/May/2019 02:30 PM;stephane.baudet;UPDATE: Emmanuel Clarke confirmed we must use ElasticSearch indeed, so we continue with ES.

On the original issue of this ticket, we are continuing to work on it, you can follow that on https://engineering/jira/browse/WLM-6577 (env setup, reproduction etc as we suspect it will require some FLTS code change to fix).

Ashok.

column1: [ELB-12] Released messages are not being received in Swift Alliance Server
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi Team,
Client ELB performed FLTS upgrade to version 7.2 and they encountered an issue for the “released” message is not being received in Swift Alliance Server. 

Referring to the flts_swift.log, we can see the message is being sent and received as below:
{noformat}
02/05/19 11:48:25 flts_to.c:415         FLTS_TO    [INFO ] - Message sent <IBLFSLBBXXXX202XYZ0001/01      >-<895>-<233550FCFFFFFC80>-<0> (timings: available:0 prepare:0 treat:141 route:15 addshm:0 total:156)
.....
02/05/19 11:54:04 from_flts.c:408       FLTS_WAI   [INFO ] - Message received <IBLFSLBBXXXX202XYZ0001/01      >-<895>-<233550FCFFFFFC80>-<0> result:1 rc:0
{noformat}

The alert is being released at 11.53AM from Norkom. However, there is no released message found in the log file. I checked there is no error found in norkom.log and flts_swift.log file.

Please refer to attachment:
* Norkom.log file
* flts_swift.log
* filter_FLTS_TO.log
* filter_FLTS_WAI.log
* filter_FLTS_FNL.log
* Message history
* Config file (config.xml, jms.properties)


Please let me know if you need more information.

Thanks

column1: CLONE - NetReveal 7.6_ST_Progression : The line graphs in the Transaction Filtering MIS and Transaction Filtering MIS alerts are incorreclty displayed
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Defect Description Details:
 
Issue 1 :- The date range of the line graphs in the Transaction Filtering MIS and Transaction Filtering MIS alerts are displayed incorrectly for a selected period of time(especially long period like more than a month)

Issue 2:- The Number of Txn per day line graph and the Total Txn Amount per day line graph does not display the Number of Txn per day and the Total Txn Amount per day when hovering over the line graphs for a any particular day

Note :- The similar issue exists for the line graphs in Transaction Filtering MIS Alerts

Expected Result:
1. The date range of the line graphs in the Transaction Filtering MIS and Transaction Filtering MIS alerts should be displayed correctly for a selected period of time(especially long period like a month)
2. The Number of Txn per day line graph and the Total Txn Amount per day line graph should display the Number of Txn per day and the Total Txn Amount per day when hovering over the line graphs for a any particular day


Actual Result:
1. The date range of the line graphs in the Transaction Filtering MIS and Transaction Filtering MIS alerts are displayed incorrectly for a selected period of time(especially long period like a month)
2. The Number of Txn per day line graph and the Total Txn Amount per day line graph does not display the Number of Txn per day and the Total Txn Amount per day when hovering over the line graphs for a any particular day
column352:
1. Login to Netreveal with valid user

column377:
12/Jun/2019 11:25 PM;olivierarnould;Hi Kieran,
I would like to answer to your last comment : 
"{color:#1f497d}Normally, we require that the state-store tables be empty before doing a migration or major upgrade. 
{color}{color:#1f497d}Who is the Solution Architect for this project? You would need to discuss this requirement with him."

The Solution architect for this project is Nizar Balish and we have started to review this point with him. 
His first answer was the same, but there is some specificities in BPCE migration which does not allow to just clear the state store table.

- BPCE represents actually 30 banks which are implemented as independent mono-org instance
- BPCE is an historic customer who knows very well our solution and especially the way of working of purgatory and pre-generated alerts. So they know this table cannot be clear unless you are migrating on a day which is an end of week and an end of month (generally 2 dates in the year fit this condition) 
As they will migrate 30 instances it will not be possible without taking the risks of not generating legitimate alerts which is functionally not authorised for AML.
 - BPCE already migrated on 2014 and at this time we were able to migrate also the pre-generated.
 - BPCE does not keep the transactions in the database so it is not possible to rebuild the profile and recreate the pregenerated alerts in the new version (which will be also very difficult for 30 banks)

We already review this point with them proposing to generate the pre-generated alerts by anticipation before the migration. However, this action will requires for them an additional work to clear the alert which are duplicated and the non legitimate alerts. So they challenge this solution due to the additional effort for them and go back to us during the last steering committee with an escalation to study a solution which reduce the impact for them.
{color}

{color:#1f497d}In parallel of this ticket we are reviewing the possible solution to not loose the pre-generated alerts in the migration but for the moment the solution are only work around which requires important effort for each migration.
{color}

{color:#1f497d}The best solution will be to solve the error we have currently with the migration of the state store and state stored data which lead to a null pointer at the first process.
This point is pretty surprising for us especially as we do not encountered any issue to migrate the profiles as long as we keep them "non extended" (whereas it was a big issue in the previous migration).
For this reason, we go back to you to understand what has potentially changed in the pre-generated table between version 6.1.2 and version 7.5 to explain if the issue we have :
 - is related to the In Core 7.5.0.8, AlertProcessor:536 is the 'if' condition  you highlighted 
 - is related to another point and if in this case the only technical solution should to decrypt the statestore data, modify them and re-encrypt (with the huge assumption it is possible).

Thanks in advance for your information on this topic. Let us know if you have any questions.
Olivier Arnould
{color}
column378:
13/Jun/2019 12:30 PM;kmackenna1;Thanks for that update, Olivier.

Raed, there follows a summary of the difference among the 6.1.2 and 7.5 state-related classes
{code:java}
state-store classes         6.1.2.124   7.5.0.12  Differences
-------------------         ---------   --------  -----------
StateChange.java            No          Yes       Implement RecordConsistency - base interface
StateChangeBase.java        No          Yes       Implement RecordConsistency - implements StateChange
StateStore.java             Yes         Yes       Hibernate-3 annotations used in 7.5 (e.g. lazy)
StateStoreData.java         Yes         Yes       Hibernate-3 annotations used in 7.5 (e.g. lazy)
StateStoreDao.java          Yes         Yes       Hibernate-3 migration - trivial changes
StateStoreMemory.java       Yes         Yes       7.5 support for RecordConsistency
StateStoreChangeBase.java   No          Yes    Implement RecordConsistency
StateStoreInsertChange.java No    Yes    Implement RecordConsistency (Memory inserts)
StateStoreUpdateChange.java No    Yes    Implement RecordConsistency (Memory updates) {code}
*Where classes exist in both Cores*

The differences merely reflect that the 7.5. version use Hibernate-3 and the equivalent translation of Hibernate mark-up from 6.1.2 to 7.5 Hibernate-3 annotations.

As such, these differences are benign and unlikely to impact this JIRA.

*Where classes exist only in 7.5*

RecordConsistency was introduced some years back, to allow actual memory objects to be rolled back in the event of a processing exception.

Again, this is extra functionality that is unlikely to impact this JIRA.

(However, it's worth asking - are there any exceptions that happen before the mentioned NPE?)

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The most expedient way to further analyse this issue would be for me to attach a debugger to your running application and reproduce the NPE. This would allow the exception to be caught in the debugger and, hopefully, trace its root-cause.

Thanks,

Kieran

column1: Hastings "Export to CSV" button disappears
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.

i,

The client has logged a ticket with us and we have also replicated the issue.

This seems to affect any screen with the export button.

For example when in group work > all alerts screen, do a search and get some results back, hover over the "Export to CSV" button and select either of the 2 options from the drop-down [!_thumb_294703.png|thumbnail!|https://engineering/jira/secure/attachment/294703/294703_search_button.PNG] , the new window will open then close and then the user will be presented with the csv file to save, but now the "export to CSV" button has disappeared from above the matching alerts [!_thumb_294704.png|thumbnail!|https://engineering/jira/secure/attachment/294704/294704_search_nobutton.PNG] .

The button will reappear if you click "Load View" and reset the view to default or if you navigate to a different page and then back or if you hit search again.

This does not happen when you click on the "Export to CSV" button itself.

Thanks

Paul

column1: Active Sessions screen continues to show users that have been terminated by Admin
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: When you terminate a user, the USER_SESSIONS table is updated with "user.killed.by.admin" in the LOGOUT_TYPE field, but the LOGOUT_DATE field remains NULL until the user tries to carry out an action in the app. However the query behind the screen only seems to filter on LOGOUT_DATE IS NULL, so the user still shows in the screen, potentially for a long time (see attached image).
column352:
1. Log in to the app from two different PCs, one at least as Admin
2. Go to the Active Sessions screen with the admin user
3. Terminate the other session
4. The terminated user stays showing in the screen until he attempts an action in the app

20/May/2019 09:50 AM;christopher.newell;Hi,

Any news on this ?

Thanks,
Chris
column371:
06/Jun/2019 11:28 AM;SHanley;Which is wrong here: the screen query by null? or the data action that updates the session without a logout date?

Stephen
column372:
06/Jun/2019 02:43 PM;christopher.newell;Hi Stephen,

The issue is that the users continue to appear on the screen after having being logged out by admin.

From what I see either of the two possibilities would fix the issue, changing the query or the data action.

Chris
column373:
06/Jun/2019 05:05 PM;SHanley;The data action parameter is still the same in V8.0:
{noformat}
UPDATE USER_SESSIONS SET LOGOUT_TYPE = 'user.killed.by.admin' where ID IN ([LIST_SESSION_ID])
{noformat}
As is the section query:
{noformat}
"SELECT 
  US.ID AS SESSION_ID,
  U.LOGIN,
  U.FIRST_NAME || ' ' || U.LAST_NAME AS USERNAME,
  US.WEB_SERVER_NAME,
  US.IP_ADDRESS,
  US.LOGIN_DATE,
  US.LOGOUT_TYPE,
CASE WHEN US.LOGOUT_DATE IS NULL THEN [=reserved.function.call.DBTimestampsIntervalInSeconds('CURRENT_TIMESTAMP', 'US.LOGIN_DATE')]/60
     ELSE [=reserved.function.call.DBTimestampsIntervalInSeconds('US.LOGOUT_DATE', 'US.LOGIN_DATE')]/60 
END AS DURATION
FROM USER_SESSIONS US, USERS U
WHERE US.USER_ID = U.ID
AND US.LOGOUT_DATE IS NULL
{noformat}

It makes sense to me that the logout date should be populated by the update action.

Stephen
column374:
07/Jun/2019 09:02 AM;christopher.newell;That seems most logical to me too, as it correctly indicates what happened, with the correct logout timestamp.

Chris

17/Jun/2019 02:18 PM;CBandara;Hi Stephen

column376:
02/Jul/2019 06:41 AM;renaldomalau;Hi All,

I have tested the behaviour of the system before and after the suggested fix by [~SHanley]:

Test Before Fix/ Current behaviour:
 # Login to netreveal in chrome as Test user, then close the browser without logout from the system. Login to NetReveal using IE as admin user, and kill Test user session.
*Actual Result:* Test user still showing in the Active Session screen. Test user will be disappear from Active session when the session is expired.
*Expected Result:* Test user will be disappear from the Active Session screen.
 # Login to netreveal in chrome as Test user. Login to NetReveal using IE as admin user => kill Test user session, and Test user is still showing in the Active Session screen. In chrome, do some activity such as click My Active Alerts link. 
*Actual Result:* in Chrome, user will be kicked out with error message: {color:#9e0025}CBP-10003 - Your session has been terminated. Please login again.{color}. In IE, refresh Active Session screen, and Test user will be disappear from Active session screen.
*Expected Result:* same as actual result

Fix applied in data action:  base_terminateSession_updateAction and base_terminateSessions_Mass_updateUserSessions.

Below is the update query to fix this issue:
{code:java}
UPDATE USER_SESSIONS SET LOGOUT_TYPE = 'user.killed.by.admin', LOGOUT_DATE=CURRENT_TIMESTAMP where ID IN ([LIST_SESSION_ID])
{code}
Test After fix applied:

 
 # Login to netreveal in chrome as Test user, then close the browser without logout from the system. Login to NetReveal using IE as admin user, and kill Test user session.
*Actual Result:* Test user will be disappear from Active Session screen. However when the session is expired, the field LOGOUT_TYPE from USER_SESSIONS will be updated to 'user.session.timed.out', when it supposed to be 'user.killed.by.admin'.
*Expected Result:* Test user will be disappear from Active Session page, and the value of field LOGOUT_TYPE from USER_SESSIONS will be  'user.killed.by.admin'.
 # Login to netreveal in chrome as Test user. Login to NetReveal using IE as admin user => kill Test user session, and Test user is disappear from the Active session screen. In chrome, do some activity such as click  My Active Alerts link.
*Actual Result:* in Chrome, user is not being kicked-out and still able to do any activity. In IE, Test user is disappear from Active Session screen.
*Expected Result:* in Chrome, user will be kicked out with error message: {color:#9e0025}CBP-10003 - Your session has been terminated. Please login again.{color}. In IE, refresh Active Session screen, and Test user will be disappear from Active session screen.
column377:
02/Jul/2019 06:49 AM;renaldomalau;Hi,

Can we modify the select query to exclude LOGOUT_TYPE 'user.killed.by.admin' instead?
{code:sql}
SELECT 
  US.ID AS SESSION_ID,
  U.LOGIN,
  U.FIRST_NAME || ' ' || U.LAST_NAME AS USERNAME,
  US.WEB_SERVER_NAME,
  US.IP_ADDRESS,
  US.LOGIN_DATE,
  US.LOGOUT_TYPE,
CASE WHEN US.LOGOUT_DATE IS NULL THEN [=reserved.function.call.DBTimestampsIntervalInSeconds('CURRENT_TIMESTAMP', 'US.LOGIN_DATE')]/60
     ELSE [=reserved.function.call.DBTimestampsIntervalInSeconds('US.LOGOUT_DATE', 'US.LOGIN_DATE')]/60 
END AS DURATION
FROM USER_SESSIONS US, USERS U
WHERE US.USER_ID = U.ID
AND US.LOGOUT_DATE IS NULL
AND LOGOUT_TYPE <> 'user.killed.by.admin'
{code}
I have tested this fix and it's worked as expected.

Thanks
column378:
02/Jul/2019 08:55 AM;SHanley;Hi Renaldo,

What environment are you testing in? If the logout_datre is set then it should not be null.

LBG do not use Google Chrome, so please test in IE only.

EDIT: I've read the comment again, and I see that there is some other process that should be killing the session and yet it's not. The reason possibly being that the cluster refresh topic does not prune sessions that have a logout date.
 
Regards,

Stephen
column380:
02/Jul/2019 09:33 AM;SHanley;[~renaldomalau] The quick and dirty fix is to add the new line to the where clause in the screen query that will specifically exclude terminated sessions. You can disregard the suggestion to modify the update action to set the logout_date. It feels like there is somewhere lower down in the code where the logout_date should be getting set but we cannot set it at the update action for the screen as it breaks the cluster topic logic.

Stephen
column381:
02/Jul/2019 09:59 AM;BNiemienionek;Hi Stephen,

 

According to the documentation for this feature ([http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=Eng&title=PLAT-20407+-+Restore+Terminate+Session+capability]) there should be another step that should update all required logout data. Maybe for some reason session.invalidate is not working as expected.

 

If I remember correctly there were two steps in session termination:
 # Mark session for termination 
 # Terminate session and populate all logout data

 

Regards,

Bartek
column382:
02/Jul/2019 10:59 AM;SHanley;Thanks [~BNiemienionek], to my untrained eye it looks like terminatedSessions actually goes nowhere in the above code snippet.

Does putting the session attributes in the map call some logic of the spring bean?

Regards,

Stephen
column383:
09/Jul/2019 08:38 AM;renaldomalau;Hi [~SHanley],

So, actually terminating a session in ui doesn't kill the session, and the session will be still alive until user performed an action or until the session timeout.

If we implement the quick fix to add checking in the where clause to exclude the terminated sessions, this probably could lead to another issue similar to CIMBMYUPG-465, which is, if *_maxConcurrentLogins_* configuration set to 1, and terminate session doesn't actually kill the session, user will still hit concurrent login error when trying to perform login.

I think we should do a proper fix instead of the quick dirty fix.

Regards,

Renaldo

column388:
22/Jul/2019 09:30 AM;renaldomalau;Hi,

Please find the respond of CE ticket as below:
{quote}Hey Renaldo,

As a heads up, we have applied the fix for the stale user session which can be replicated by manually terminating user session via session terminator. The code change has been committed over to a new work branch for this issue, [CS.2019-07-22.CES-2695|http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/LLOYDS_AML/CodeRepository/branches/CS.2019-07-22.CES-2695/].

Note that the fix also include the removal of stale sessions which is caused by server restarts. With that, can you please carry out some tests based on the following scope?
 # Before new EAR file deployment:
 -- Login using a test user, and using another admin user, terminate that user session using the session terminator. It is expected that the user session record in the USER_SESSION will remain active, and the user session instance count will remain at n+1 in the USERS table
 -- Login using a test user, and perform a server restart. After the restart, do not perform any login, you would find that the user session record in the USER_SESSION table remains active, and the session instance count in the USERS table remain at n+1.
(i) n is the current number of login

After performing the above tests, you may try to deploy the new prepared EAR file, and perform the same steps again. In both of the cases, you should see that the user sessions will be effectively terminated (has a logout reason field populated, and token field set to null), and also the session instance count will be n-1. Let us know in case if you observe the opposite.

Thanks.
{quote}
Thanks

column1: User may be locked out of the application after server restart
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When an application restart is performed, the startup process will not clear off any previously user active sessions, instead this sessions (together with entity locks, etc) will be cleared only after first successful login by any user post the restart. 

If the condition is right (maxConcurrentLogins property set to 1), users that are actively using the application when a restart occur will be locked out of the application, and when this happens, the application waits for any first successful login attempt before clearing off the stale user sessions for the affected users. Further details about this issue can be found from the following article in Confluence (read the section about server restart):
- http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/x/MwSoB
column352:
# Set the maxConcurrentLogins property to 1
# Log in to the application using a test user, this will create an active session for the user
# Restart the application
# Try to login to the application again after the restart

Expected behaviour: 
- User will be able to re-login without any issue

Actual behaviour:
- User login will fail due to max concurrent login

This ticket is a placeholder for that work.
