column1: Workflow Configrator Issue
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Issue regarding Workflow Configurator in Training Environment 4.6 -> 4.9.

 

Training Team provide training on application builder and workflow Configurator. During this training a new my cases and case details screen it built. This is further advanced in Workflow Configurator by  creating and adding a new workflow.

However old case workflow actions (assign + create disclosure) still appear along side the new actions.

 

This issue has been present since APPS 4.6, I'm currently testing on APPS 4.9.

Troubleshooting steps so far:
 * logged out and in again
 * reloaded workflows
 * reloaded applications
 * checked Workflow name
 * restarted application server
 * Cleared cache

column1: CLONE - Match Exclusion - creates duplicate Recorded Match Exclusions when variant normalisation turned on
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Duplicate Match Exclusions are being created when the sample field data flows over multiple lines and therefore invokes 'variants'.

For example, against the exclusion rule on 'aai', the following message only creates 1 Match Exclusion:
{code:java}
<Message>
<Id><![CDATA[103METWAU40XXXXN409515681098656#0#39581CF9FFFFFEFB#0]]></Id>
<Type><![CDATA[SWIFT]]></Type>
<Sequence><![CDATA[SWIFT-IN]]></Sequence>
<Data><![CDATA[{1:F01METWAU40ATSY0000000000}{2:I103METWAU40XXXXN}{3:{108:MAPS445686}}{4:
:20:014017063939393
:23B:CRED
:32A:190221USD20,
:33B:USD20,
:50K:/4060001000
GREG SMITH AND LYNETTE SMITH
794 ROAD ROAD
SYDNEY  NSW  2000
:53B:/8900560000
:56A:IRVTUS3N
:57A:CTBAAU2S
:59:/12620631
AAI
:70:/INV/RFW000001 (MY18LN-1000)
:71A:SHA
-}]]></Data>
</Message>{code}
 

But the following message, creates 2:
{code:java}
<Message>
<Id><![CDATA[103METWAU40XXXXN409515681098656#0#39581CF9FFFFFEFB#0]]></Id>
<Type><![CDATA[SWIFT]]></Type>
<Sequence><![CDATA[SWIFT-IN]]></Sequence>
<Data><![CDATA[{1:F01METWAU40ATSY0000000000}{2:I103METWAU40XXXXN}{3:{108:MAPS445686}}{4:
:20:014017063939393
:23B:CRED
:32A:190221USD20,
:33B:USD20,
:50K:/4060001000
AAI Inc
794 ROAD ROAD
SYDNEY  NSW  2000
:53B:/8900560000
:56A:IRVTUS3N
:57A:CTBAAU2S
:59:/12620631
Anna Jenkins
:70:/INV/RFW000001 (MY18LN-1000)
:71A:SHA
-}]]></Data>
</Message>{code}

Please see the attached email for screen shots of the issue.
column352: Send a test SWIFT message with the Name/Address field across > 1 line. Ensure that the variant rules in normalisation are turned on.  You will see 2 matches in the recorded match exclusions screen.  Turn off variants in normalisation, resend the message and you only get one match in the recorded match exclusions.
column369:

http://10.167.11.137:8282/netreveal/

column370:
23/May/2019 02:36 PM;AManayangath;Kate, Edward,

Isn't this expected behavior? Variants essentially creates more than one version of a search term and that might explain why there are more than one exclusion (matching the number of variants). WLM_ALERT_MATCH_DATA table may have the normalised value that's triggering each of the match and hence exclusions.

regards,
Ashok.
column371:
29/May/2019 07:00 AM;KOReilly;Hi Cian,
Can you please have a look and confirm if this is different to what you expected?
Thanks
column372:
29/May/2019 07:41 AM;ciankivlehan;Hi Ashok,

 

When an alert generates with 2 variants on the match it will only display one match on the Alert, for example you will see MS match against Mississippi (Note Mississippi is a different issue due to Message.properties which is resolved) only once in the All Matches section:

 

!image-2019-05-29-16-37-05-512.png!

 

Where this match has not created two records in the recorded match exclusion section:

!image-2019-05-29-16-39-51-636.png!

 

This will be confusing  to the users.

It would be great to either highlight that one is because of the variant rule or else only display one match as it does on the Alert Details > All Matches section.

 

Thanks,

Cian
column373:
21/Aug/2019 05:29 AM;KOReilly;Hi Ashok,

See Cian's explanation above - do you see what we mean by this?  While I understand that variants create more opportunities to generate matches, at the end of the day, the variant should still only actually generate a single match/alert for display purposes - the user doesn't need to know all of the complicated workings under-pinning the software.

Thanks

Kate

column1: CLONE - CSV Export output is truncated
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Data exported to csv file is truncated randomly.

1. Go to Group Work > Back Office > Transactions
2. Perform a search in the 'Search for Transactions' section that will result in one/multiple records in the 'List View' section.
3. Click on the Export to CSV button in the 'List View' section.
4. Open the exported csv file in notepad, you will notice that certain data fields are truncated by a few characters.
- if the exported csv file contains only one record, usually the last column's data is truncated.
- if the exported csv file contains more than one record, the truncated data location is pretty random.

column1: Match Data filed in section All Matches (WLM Alert Details - Base screen) - incorrect display for text containg spaces
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Match Data text in section All Matches in WLM Alert Details screen is wrongly displayed if the text in the field contains spaces.
 (Field WLM_AllMatchesMatchData, section WLM_AlertDetailsAllMatches_EimInt_v46)
 The message content (text with spaces) is properly processed and saved in the database but the display in the screen\section is wrong. The Match Data text is cut at some point and '&n...' is displayed instead of the full text. 
 The field WLM_AllMatchesMatchData has _displayTextLength_ parameter set to 300 and it seems that probably the length of a space character may be wrongly calculated.
 Example (details for the above Steps to Reproduce):
 - text in message: \{Under BIN LADEN Lia 21                                                         ,4480 KVINESDAL                                                    }
 - database - content of ALERT_REASON_CONTEXT.CONTEXT: 'addr = Under <cm>BIN LADEN</cm> Lia 21                                                           ,4480 KVINESDAL Free Text Match >= 90% BIN LADEN'
 - display of the above field in Match Data:
 !image-2019-06-26-10-48-40-806.png|thumbnail!
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
1) Make sure that your input message contains many space characters in the field that generates a hit in WLM.
Example input for a field in a message:
{Under BIN LADEN Lia 21                                                          ,4480  KVINESDAL                                                      }
REMARK!!!!
Please, note that JIRA cuts off spaces from the above input field. In original there are   59 space characters after Lia 21 and 53 space characters after KIVENSDAL                                                      
2) Process your message in RT (Services manager > Send Test Message) - an alert is generated
3) Go to Group Work > All Alerts (View: Watch List Manager) - open the alert, check the All Matches  section, Match data column.
The Match Data text is not displayed properly, it is cut somewhere in the middle, '&n...' is displayed instead of the full text

column371: 21/Aug/2019 01:36 PM;PVingerhoets;Hi Alan, could you assign a CE resource to retrofit this change into DNB branch? cheers
column372: 16/Sep/2019 12:16 PM;PVingerhoets;Hi Alan, would it be possible to assing a CE resource to retrofit this change? cheers
column373:
01/Oct/2019 03:23 PM;jan.jeromin;Hi,

 

The reason is:
 Fields value, before being displayed is converted to HtmlEncoding, and then cut to desired length (300 in this project).
 But during conversion to HtmlEncoding it replaces all double spaces with "&nbsp&nbsp", to maintain formatting.
 And the issue is, that it counts all of "&nbsp&nbsp" characters, and if the 300 character limit hits in between of this mark it leaves some of its characters (in this case "&...").

 

[~MDonder]
 are you sure, it is fixed in latest netreveal version, because i wasn't able to find anything in .java code?

If it is not fixed in latest core, the simplest fix is to convert double spaces to "&nbsp&nbsp" after cutting text to 300 characters in _StringUtils.truncateHtml().

 

Thanks,
 J
column374:
04/Oct/2019 10:35 AM;jan.jeromin;Hi,

As i checked, it is not fixed in 8.1+

I have fix for this issue in project hijack, with brand new unit test, feel free to use it if you are happy with this approach:
http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/DNB_UPGRADE/CodeRepository/trunk/src-hijack/com/norkom/common/util/StringUtil.java
http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/DNB_UPGRADE/CodeRepository/trunk/src-test/com/norkom/common/util/StringUtilTest.java

Regards,
J

                                                                                </DbtrTrxInf>
                                                                </Envlp>
                                                </SplmtryData>
                                </CstmrCdtTrfInitn>
                </Document>
{code}
*********************************************

Basically, the transformer will create a bunch of xpaths for all possible xpaths in the message which will evnetually look like this if you use a dump sequence in services manager:
***********************
    /cdttrftxinf/dbtracct/id/iban = NL21RABO0117300128
    /cdttrftxinf/cdtr/nm = Robert Mugabe
    /cdttrftxinf/dbtragt/fininstnid/bic = RABONL20
    /grphdr/msgid = OPF-2940001
    /cdttrftxinf/intrbksttlmamt = 20.01
    /cdttrftxinf/rmtinf/ustrd = factuur Testté
    /cdttrftxinf/pmtid/txid = OPF-2940000.1
    /cdttrftxinf/chrgbr = SLEV
    _$TRXID = 1
    /cdttrftxinf/cdtragt/fininstnid/bic = ABNANL2A
    /grphdr/ttlintrbksttlmamt = 20.01
    /grphdr/instgagt/fininstnid/bic = RABONL20
    /grphdr/nboftxs = 1
    /grphdr/sttlminf/sttlmmtd = CLRG
    /grphdr/ttlintrbksttlmamt/ccy = EUR
    /cdttrftxinf/dbtr/nm = Robert Mugabe
    /cdttrftxinf/dbtr/pstladr/adrline = [ógerstraat, Debtor Address Line 2 of 2]
    /grphdr/sttlminf/clrsys/cd = INC
    /cdttrftxinf/dbtr/pstladr/ctry = NL
    _$TRXHEADER = 1
    /grphdr/intrbksttlmdt = 2014-12-09
    /cdttrftxinf/pmtid/endtoendid = EndToEndId_ML_201412081323018262440
    /cdttrftxinf/pmtid/instrid = 290000000
    /cdttrftxinf/intrbksttlmamt/ccy = EUR
    /cdttrftxinf/pmttpinf/svclvl/cd = SEPA
    /cdttrftxinf/cdtr/pstladr/ctry = NL
    /cdttrftxinf/cdtr/pstladr/adrline = [adrës, Creditor Address Line 2 of 2]
    /cdttrftxinf/cdtracct/id/iban = NL92ABNA0400003139
    /grphdr/credttm = 2014-12-09T13:25:25
***********************


The main transformer class that we are concerned about is here:

com.norkom.acquisition.business.realtime.impl.swift.DefaultSwiftMXHandler

The transformer is concerned with 3 main parts of the message
1)	The header
2)	The payment information 
3)	The instruction information.


They all appear consecutively in the message, 

<CdtTrfTxInf>
<GrpHdr>
<PmtInf >

The issue for us, is that there is an additional set of tags called <SplmtryData>, which we just ignore.
Its perfectly valid xml as it appears in the message xsd;s  $APP_HOME/conf\swift_mx_schemas
Note: We have switched off schema validation, so we don’t actually care about the xsd.

column1: Filters are empty when returning to a search screen (eg. MM> Group Work >All Alerts)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Filters in interactive section are empty when you return to a search screen. 
For instance:  MM> Group Work >All Alerts (or All Cases).
If you filter the search results by a selected  value in one of the columns in Matching Alerts section (interactive section ),  and then use a hyper link to navigate to alert details screen (any alert from the list) and then come back to the search screen - the filter value is empty. Although the filtering by this value is still valid. 
The filter value should be displayed on return, otherwise it makes a confusion.
column352:
Steps to reproduce are based on WLM alerts search screen but it can be repeated also on other screens.
1) Make sure you have some WLM alerts, preferably for different data sources, to have any search results. 
2) Go to MM>Group Work>All Alerts, View: Watch List Manager. Search for the alerts. When displayed - in the Matching Alerts section choose a value from the drop down list in Data Source filter column. 
The chosen Data Source is displayed in the filter field and the alerts are filtered in the section.  
3) Open any alert from the displayed list (navigate to the alert details screen via hyperlink), then go back to the search screen.
Result: the list of Matching Alerts is still filtered by  the data source of your choice (correct) but the filter field Data Source in the section header is empty (wrong).
Expected result: the chosen value for Data Source is still visible on the screen.
Please refer to the attached print screens to view the example

column1: Transaction Date time-zone offset in Cross Filter section
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: The issue appear to be that the dates in this section are offset by a number of hours depending on the system timezone.  This issue relates to the cross filter field only.  The same date/time value is used in the list section and is resolving correctly here (see CorrectTimestamps screenshot).  The procedure populating the cross filter section seems to be correct and isn't doing anything strange with the date value.  However, the datetime seems to be offset in the section itself.  This appears to be configured in the backend, as I cannot see any parameters relating to local timezone within the cross filter section.
column352:
- Ensure that the local timezone of the environment is not GMT.
- Load some transactions into the environment, ensure that the time is 00:00:00 for the RUN_TIMESTAMP field, and that this timestamp is within the last six months of the system date.
- Open the EIM frontend, go to Main Menu->Back Office->Customers.
- Search for the Customer linked to the ingested transactions and open Transaction Details.
- Go to the Transactions tab and open the Customer Transactions (last 6 months) section within this.
- Notice that the transactions within the list at the bottom have incorrect Transaction Dates (see TransactionDateMismatch.PNG).
column369:
24/Jul/2019 09:22 AM;MRatajczyk;Hi Adam,

We cannot reproduce the issue.
We have tried with different time zones on different levels but without expected result.
Could you please provide detail info what timezone and where you have set?

Regards,
Mariusz

  \\ *Remote comment create date: 28/Aug/19 12:05 PM*
column370:
24/Jul/2019 11:45 AM;adam.bullock;Hi [~MRatajczyk],

Thank you for your response.  In our development environment the system timezone is set to UTC.  This is set in base_config.properties, i.e. system.default.timezone=UTC.  I believe our client has this parameter set to UTC+3.  I think this timezone setting is the one affecting the cross filter dates.  The user Time Zone parameter doesn't seem to have any effect on these dates, and these are the same regardless of who I log in as.

Let me know if you require any additional information.

Thanks,

Adam \\ *Remote comment create date: 28/Aug/19 12:05 PM*
column371:
24/Jul/2019 02:51 PM;KYadav;Hi Adam, Just spoke with Mariusz and he still cannot reproduce it using the instruction you have provided on latest builds. From product perspective we will need more details as such. Were there any customisations applied here?

 

Having said that, I see that your linked ticket is assigned to CE and that is exactly what I was going to suggest. I'll wait until that investigation is completed for next action.  

  \\ *Remote comment create date: 28/Aug/19 12:05 PM*
column372:
26/Jul/2019 11:08 AM;adam.bullock;Hi [~KYadav],

Thank you for the update.

It looks like some other projects have also experienced this issue.  CE have provided a fix for this (see EMY000148-746). 

Thanks,

Adam \\ *Remote comment create date: 28/Aug/19 12:05 PM*
column373:
30/Jul/2019 11:35 AM;KYadav;Hi Adam, I looked at the linked DOHA ticket and couldn't figure out if there was a code fix or a JBoss setting change? Can you please confirm. 

 

Thanks,

Kirti \\ *Remote comment create date: 28/Aug/19 12:05 PM*
column374:
30/Jul/2019 02:28 PM;adam.bullock;Hi [~KYadav],

I agree that this isn't clear.  I think initially a fix changing the JBoss setting was attempted, however this adversely affected the application.log time, and therefore failed to resolve the issue.   After this an engineering fix was implemented that did fix this issue, I think that this is in crucible. 

Having said that, we have tried to implement this patch ourselves and it hasn't solved this completely.  The fix seems to offset the timezone formatting by a hard-coded number of hours, however this value is incorrect for the timezone setting in our environment.  I think [~ADuggan] is looking into this further for us.

Thanks,

Adam \\ *Remote comment create date: 28/Aug/19 12:05 PM*
column375: 07/Aug/2019 11:53 AM;KYadav;Thanks Adam, is there any success? \\ *Remote comment create date: 28/Aug/19 12:05 PM*
column376:
08/Aug/2019 10:43 AM;adam.bullock;Hi [~KYadav],

[~mauricedarley] fixed this in the end.  The fix involved updating the JSON transformer file so that this timezone conversion wasn't used at all.  The list section wasn't using this conversion and it wasn't necessary in the cross filter section either.  I have attached his code to this ticket.

Thanks,

Adam \\ *Remote comment create date: 28/Aug/19 12:05 PM*

column1: 7.7 Audit Log Search screen performance issue
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Description: Audit Log Search screen performance issue - application freezing 
Screen name: base_AuditLogSearch 
1. This screen has 4 sections - *User Activity* and *System Activity* are *generic list* search sections.
2. *User Activity* and *System Activity* has a filed "*base_AuditLogEntityName*" which is "*Dynamic Combo Field Formatter*" with Query action *"base_AuditLogEntityNameCombo"* and query: "select distinct AUDIT_ENTITY_NAME display, AUDIT_ENTITY_NAME field_key from AUDIT_LOGS"
3. Both the sections are Generic List and it is using Dynamic combo filed which is creating a huge performance impact on application.

Suggestion: Update filed "*base_AuditLogEntityName*" to "*Text Field Formatter*" in both the sections;

column1: Acquisition Progress monitor - data format mismatch
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
This screen is expected to be one of the most useful for NetReveal administrators, who do not have direct access to DB or Norkom_home and want to know how system behaves. It appeared in early 6x versions and was several times amended by plenty of new sections in course of later releases. 

Unfortunately, each of this sections uses distinct date format and in some cases there are 2 different date formats in the same section 

!image-2019-08-02-17-11-18-042.png!

11. Endofday format - it comes historically from a text string and I presume we prefer nnot to change it, however it is possible to make conversion on the screen

22. Current day format - English date format

33. Latest Action Timestamp - German date format

 

We can, of course, say the format depends on local settings, but I am sure it MUST NOT appear differently on the same screen.
column352:
Login as user with admin rights
Go to Services Manager --> Acquisition Progress
column369: 07/Aug/2019 11:57 AM;Pnolan;Reassigning BatchBridge issue for review...

column1: FLTS component missing FLTS_WAIT and FLTS_FNL
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
2 issues encountered by BMO SG

1) Swift message is read and processed by Netreveal. Message has a HIT and alert generated. But in the flts_swift.log the FLTS_WAIT is missing. SAA Routing Point is at FLTS_RP_WAIT. Alert is processed and released by user, FLTS_FNL is logged but throw error "inst_nb:0 not found in rp:<FLTS_RP_SUSPECT> but somewhere else. Discarding message." It is expecting the RP has changed to FLTS_RP_SUSPECT, however due to missing FLTS_WAIT procedure, the RP is still remain at FLTS_RP_WAIT.

2) Swift message is read and processed by Netreveal. In SAA, the RP is moved to FLTS_RP_WAIT. Message has  a HIT and alert generated. The reply returns to FLTS_WAIT and update FLTS_RP_WAIT to FLTS_RP_SUSPECT. In Netreveal, the WLM alert is released by user but we don't see the FLTS_FNL procedure in swift_flts.log.

In both cases/scenarios, we don't see any error from Netreveal logs. All messages are processed and responded. But we are not sure why the FLTS_TO and FLTS_FNL procedure are missing. Appreciate your advice on what could possibly cause the issues? 

FYI, there is no filter.log due to log4j.properties set up problem. Also, the issues are gone after restarting the FLTS server/SAA server.
column352: Not able to reproduce

column1: WLM module transliteration bug
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
In WLM module during the creation process of Data Source Field of Extended Type there is an option of choosing 'Transliteration Parameter Type' of 'Parameter Column' which enables possibility to specify a individual language for each incoming record.
However, after selecting the appropriate data according to query (conditions: data_type_id = -2 and extended_type = 0 and is_deleted = 0 and data_source_id = [DATA_SOURCE_ID]) result is not saved properly (at all) in DB table 'DSF_TRF_PARAM'.
Both fields 'DS_FIELD_ID' and 'PARAM_VALUE' do not save the data entered in GUI.
As a result, transliteration is not processed.
column216: Code merge sub-tasks have been created.
column352:
1. Watchlist Manager > Administration > Data Source Manager
2. Choose Data Source
3. 'Edit Field' of 'Extended Type'
4. Choose 'Transliteration Parameter Type' > 'Parameter Column'
5. 'Next'
6. Choose field in 'Parameter Column:'
7. Check data in DB table 'DSF_TRF_PARAM'

column1: CLONE - Problems to access the variable with the same name in an array/list in a JSON message
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi Maarten, 

As we comments about the message of JSON, we noticed a problem when the variable of a list has the same name.  

 Example:

"properties": [
               {
                               "key": "code",
                               "value": "HIT"
               },
               {
                               "key": "trxId",
                               "value": "268056976"
               }
],

It is also important to make sure that we can send variables in the JSON message. This message will contain the information of alerts, lists of alerts, list of coincidences, ids, etc.

We are also concerned about the size of these variables, I understand that the environment variables have a maximum size, right? Can you tell us what it is?

Thanks in advance for your help,

Regards,
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
Configure a Workflow Action with the following Workflow Action Functions
RestJsonWorkflowAction
This function should be configured to retrieve a multivalue in the response and store it as a multivalue in the replacements container.

DatabaseAction
This should be configured to take the multivalue from the previous function and store it as multiple values in the database.

The RestJsonWorkflowAction returns a List<String> for any multivalues.  DatabaseAction expects String[] for any multivalues.

column1: RestJsonWorkflowAction org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
RestJsonWorkflowAction, as a side effect of it's initialization, updates the External Connector Parameters while the parent connector is in the hibernate cache.  As a result the changes are tracked by hibernate and written to the database when the workflow transaction commits.  This appears to be unwanted behaviour.

So either the connector parameters should be retrieved, stored in value objects and update those VOs, or the external connection object should be evicted from the hibernate cache after the parameters have be retrieved and updated so the updates are not pushed to the database.
column352:
Configure a Workflow Action with the following Workflow Action Functions
RestJsonWorkflowAction
This function should be configured to retrieve a multivalue in the response and store it as a multivalue in the replacements container.

DatabaseAction
This should be configured to take the multivalue from the previous function and store it as multiple values in the database.

When executed the following error is thrown

{code}
16-Aug-2019 18:30:15,278 - User-0 - Session-1180 ERROR RuntimeExceptionInterceptor:41 - CBP-10200
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Could not execute JDBC batch update; SQL [insert into EXTERNAL_CONNECTOR_PARAMETERS (CONNECTOR_ID, CONNECTOR_PARAM_NAME, CONNECTOR_PARAM_STATUS, CONNECTOR_PARAM_VALUE, ID) values (?, ?, ?, ?, ?)]; constraint [null]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: Could not execute JDBC batch update
{code}

column1: ( GI_2.0.0.2) 'AND' in subject's name converting to '&&' if entered in caps (GI
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When the text 'AND' is entered in the subject first or last name field in CAPS, it's converting to '&&'. If enter 'and' lower case it stays as 'and'. This is happening on the personal and corporate (name field) subject screens. Client doesn't want the AND to convert to '&&' because of searching issues. I have attached screen prints.

Just FYI: Client enters all subjects (people and companies) as personal subjects and for companies client has entered the full company name in the 'last name' field. They enter them as personal because the 'corporate' screen does not have a person org ID field which we must enter for all subjects.

 

P.S. in this scenario name field is storing as '&&' in database.

column370:
11/Sep/2019 04:36 PM;Pnolan;Adding related email...
----
 *From:* Nolan, Paul (IE Dublin) 
 *Sent:* 11 September 2019 4:35 pm
 *To:* Mehta, Nidhi (IE Dundrum)
 *Subject:* RE: PLAT-22767 : ( GI_2.0.0.2) 'AND' in subject's name converting to '&&' if entered in caps (GI

 

Nidhi,

 

The platform team are fully occupied with tasks for the EIM 8.1 release, so they have only been available for the initial investigation steps that were performed by Greg. The issue is with the parsing of JEP expressions, but the guidance from Architecture is that it will be very difficult (or maybe not possible) to distinguish between situations where the conversion is correct and where it is not correct. In any event, it is unlikely that there will be a quick resolution of this issue and it will need to be reviewed again as part of stabilisation of the 8.1 release.

 

You may need to follow up with CE if this is a priority for the customer.

 

Regards,

Paul.

 

 

*From:* Mehta, Nidhi (IE Dundrum) 
 *Sent:* 11 September 2019 3:01 pm
 *To:* Nolan, Paul (IE Dublin)
 *Subject:* PLAT-22767 : ( GI_2.0.0.2) 'AND' in subject's name converting to '&&' if entered in caps (GI

 

Hi Paul,

 

I would like to know what is status of PLAT-22767 ticket, could you please update.

 

As per Greg comment on [FCENG-10004|https://engineering/jira/browse/FCENG-10004], he mentioned that it is +not a bug+. 
 But name or address should be plain text regardless it is written in capital or small, it should not change into expression when it is in capital letter (small is working as expected).

 

I would really appreciate if you could give any information regarding this.

 

*Thanks & Regards,*

*Nidhi Mehta*
 *Application Support Engineer*
 *BAE Systems Applied Intelligence*

problem can be easily fixed by small change in procedure [WLM_Reports_MIS_TFAlerts_Procedure|http://iedc1nkmdevv0015:8080/netreveal/screen/view.do?secure=q4uyv6kZyxxTXnOhvV5ysRdMu39vl_L4NszS2c7MfDfgFdy0XeLU7NbMTpkJ11JLHW77eqpVSDZB2hi4lv0SOiqPTjOtYazfcEPvdY1p9F1smqcAcO_hRWMXZUm7W3mvNZdRciw7gTAjSK9ntJnRlR-SVUOg2iJBabV6_lJ5DugHH7Rowo_hK8BsFgZ43-vQfRxII25ycEYSYDMvrySTIzLq3ZxiEtSOCvtdmsS8Us0qL2T1v0M1-ny47OO7FHdskiAIXVYk-NiY8vcB_Sk-Ox4jZhWywZECImBqSCLkzfJKiaotsy3FdD3b_XOZu5tWnHtRN-f-i31Kiaotsy3FdLovO8rHPtiJnfjgSpq2lXID5HYEnVPvvuowiz6VoZutJAMhYbAJdSE9PGH_AvsWoT7UErFsXThzCXefuQo_mwlDPYYMt9uOjQ8LZgg0DWfQ1jV1_BpJgJouCe5g-3ueQsY1Kr4Jv0IkEzq96KVq5CdfCJGCnUxkKovYD1Xf1YlnLf8-bYayX6ojdZMERm2sNqW52UPSu4S7ZwrJOX2vRCkZu73LM4H2PhSurRYD9apQwVSmJ_6cIo40fsiUyjZn4OduUds*]:

In sql query there is line: 

[=reserved.function.call.DBTruncAndToChar('AH.WW_CREATION_TIMESTAMP')] as WW_CREATION_TIMESTAMP,

and should be:

[=reserved.function.call.DBTrunc('AH.WW_CREATION_TIMESTAMP')] as WW_CREATION_TIMESTAMP,

 

It should resolve the problem.

Please let me know if this info is enough for you and if it fixed the problem. \\ *Remote comment create date: 09/Sep/19 12:37 PM*
column373:
10/Sep/2019 08:51 AM;MDonder;Hi,

Just to explain how it works.

In procedure WLM_Reports_MIS_TFAlerts_Procedure there was incorrect DBTruncAndToChar function. It converts data to varchar and indeed shows always the datatime the same like in database.

It shouldn't be like this. We should have it as date.

After my proposed change both column will be converted to local timezone and will show the same date.

If you think that this datetime converted to local timezone is incorrect just check your settings:
 * in file base_config.properties on server there is a property system.default.timezone
 * on user details there is a timezone
 * on database (SELECT sessiontimezone FROM DUAL)

https://10.167.22.237:9445/netreveal/screen/view.do

column1: [NAB SWIFT 2019] SVBY Field in 83J Tag is not parsed by GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
83J field has a SVBY Field as per SWIFT standards.

GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer does not parse SVBY as a separate field.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
1) Process a MT304 message with Tag 83J field containing SVBY values.
eg. 
:83J:/CLRC/BLNBBY2X 
/LEIC/5493000IBP32UQZ0KL24 
/NAME/HEDGESTONE GROUP 
/SVBY/PTYA 
/TXID/NATAAU306528765826872 
2) Check the parsed fields of 83J

Expected: 83_svby field populated.

Actual: No 83_svby field. Instead this value is parsed as 83_na and 83_name.
column369:
13/Sep/2019 07:05 AM;sangarganesan;Assigning to Ed. 
Thanks. \\ *Remote comment create date: 13/Sep/19 11:22 AM*
column370:
13/Sep/2019 07:12 AM;spattabiraman;Hello Team,

This issue was raised by the Customer found during their testing.

As per the SWIFT guidelines, 83J has a SVBY Field. Refer below.

!SWIFT_guidelines_83J.png|thumbnail!

The SVBY field is not parsed as a separate field instead it is parsed as Name.

83_na and 83_name fields. Refer below.

 !83J_parsedfields.png|thumbnail! 

Please clarify.

thanks,
Sangeetha.  \\ *Remote comment create date: 13/Sep/19 11:22 AM*
column371:
06/Nov/2019 09:14 PM;AManayangath;This fix has been applied to trunk and backported to 8.0 and 7.7. 

See details on the synced WLM ticket, https://engineering/jira/browse/WLM-7524

column1: [NAB SWIFT 2019] NOSI Field in 53J Tag is not parsed by GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
53J field has a NOSI Field as per SWIFT standards.

GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer does not parse NOSI as a separate field.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
1) Process a MT304 message with Tag 53J field containing NOSI value.
eg.
:53J:/CLRC/BLNBBY2X
/LEIC/5493000IBP32UQZ0KL24
/NAME/BANCO DELTA 
ASIA SARL
/NOSI/UKWN
/TXID/NATAAU306528765826872

2) Check the parsed fields of 53J

Expected: 53_nosi field populated.

Actual: No 53_nosi field. Instead this value is parsed as 53_na and 53_name.
column369:
16/Sep/2019 03:09 AM;spattabiraman;Hello Team,

This issue was raised during NAB testing.
53J has NOSI field as per SWIFT Guidelines. Refer below.

 !SWIFT_guidelines_53J.png|thumbnail! 

But GeneralOptionJFieldExtensionTransformer does not parse this as a separate field. Instead considers it as part of name.
Refer below 

 !53J_parsedfields.png|thumbnail! 

thanks,
Sangeetha.

Thanks.

column369:
18/Sep/2019 07:30 AM;sangarganesan;Hi Ed, 

NAB noticed the parsing issue with MT300 where some of the fields are not displayed in the Parsed fields section.
Could you please have a look at this ? If needed please refer to the services ticket linked. Thanks.
column370:
18/Sep/2019 01:29 PM;EFitzgerald;Hi Sangar,

This is not related to the SWIFT 2019 updates.

This is how the product is designed.

 

The MT300 uses specific messages handlers that break a messages up in to Alerting transactions based on a combination of the Sequences in the message.

This functionality has not changed in the product.

Attached the test results here: [^NAB_MT300_Message_Handler_Test.docx] 

Thanks,
Sangar

column1: [ANZ SWIFT 2019] Parsing Exception on tag 92J
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Detailed Description 
Message processing failed due to improper parsing of value 92J. Last 4 characters of the tag 92J which is optional, if not given, processing falis.
column131: 20/Sep/2019 09:05 AM;AHMTalib;PT_PROGRAM_OPERATIONS#627 - SWIFT 2019 - Message processing failed due to improper parsing of tag 92J.msg;https://support.ai.baesystems.com/secure/attachment/22636153/PT_PROGRAM_OPERATIONS%23627+-+SWIFT+2019+-+Message+processing+failed+due+to+improper+parsing+of+tag+92J.msg
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:
Steps to Reproduce 
1. Create a message with tag :92J::GRSS/ASGHJKAH/SKFI/USD10,10
2. Processing is successful

Expected Results Message processing should be success upon giving :92J::GRSS/ASGHJKAH/SKFI/USD10,10

Actual Results Message processing is failed upon giving :92J::GRSS/ASGHJKAH/SKFI/USD10,10
column369:
20/Sep/2019 09:07 AM;AHMTalib;Reference from ANZSANC-321

 !screenshot-1.png!
column370: 20/Sep/2019 09:08 AM;AHMTalib;Linking to issue
column371:
24/Sep/2019 10:05 AM;AHMTalib;Root cause as shared by Kevin Ong

 !7.7.0.6-92J-Parsing-Issue-rootcause.PNG! 

The substring has already reached the end of "/". And there is no condition to check whether it has reached the end.

The same result occurs for both cores;
1. 7.7.0.2
2. 7.6.0.5
3. 8.0.1.2 (Suspected from the original SWIFT 2019 updates)

8.0.1.5
7.7.0.11

column1: Information Leak Issue in NetReveal v7.4
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi Platform,

The following feedback is from our client Westpac v7.4 

Westpac ISG team has identified Information Leak Issue in NetReveal application.
The web application leaks the following files from the root of the web directory:
//netreveal/build.xml
//netreveal/build.properties

From these files attackers learn the following information:

* Local deployment path
* Technologies in use (Websphere 6.1, JBoss EAP 5.1 and Subversion)

Attackers do not need to be authenticated to access these files.

IMPACT:
Attackers may use this information in combination with other vulnerabilities (for example, arbitrary file upload vectors) to form complete attack chains.

REMEDIAL ACTION REQUIRED:
Remove these files if they are unnecessary or ensure permissions are set following the principle of least permissions (end-users should not be able to access these files).

The details of the issue are attached.

column1: Match Exclusion not working when match term to be excluded and similar match term are in the same field
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
*Summary:*

Match Exclusion Rules is not working when the match term to be excluded and a similar match term are present in the same field.

*Description:*

For e.g.:  Tag 70_text has an entry called "neuberger berman kerman", where 'neuberger berman' is excluded via match exclusion. 'Kerman' is the watch list entry which is an exact match term in that tag.

Client's expectation is 'neuberger berman' must be excluded and recorded while alert should be generated for match against 'kerman'.

Actual result: No alert generated for 'kerman' and it seems like 'neuberger berman kerman' is completed excluded however it is not recorded in the recorded match exclusions screen

*Sample data:*

Input Text to be Excluded - "neuberger berman"

Text in the field - "neuberger berman kerman"

Watchlist entry - "kerman"

 

*Attachments:*
 - Sample SWIFT message

 - Debug logs for verification from Services env (for both Saving alert & exclusion as well as No Alert but save exclusion options)
column131: 28/Nov/2019 09:59 AM;RHome;Match exclusions scorer decoupling and WLM-4713. .msg;https://support.ai.baesystems.com/secure/attachment/22652189/Match+exclusions+scorer+decoupling+and+WLM-4713.+.msg
column216: Code merge sub-tasks have been created.
column352: Mentioned in the Description
column369:
26/Sep/2019 02:52 AM;sangarganesan;Hi Plat team,

Linking this Jira with the actual client Project ticket: NABSANC74-1150

Thanks.
column370: 26/Sep/2019 02:57 PM;RHome;I would try these tests on V8 as the logic is changed a bit for that release.
column371:
21/Nov/2019 11:02 AM;RHome;I have analysed this behaviour on both 7.7 and 8.1 source code.

In 8.1 all excluded matches are removed if there exists any non-excluded matches in the input (for the same watch-list entry).

In 7.7 it is more complicated. Each time a new match is found for a watch-list entry, if there exists a non-excluded match in the input and this match isn't equal to or overlapping completely the best match found so far, then the exclusions of the best match found so far are deleted.

The reason these two pieces of logic exist is as a work-around for a defect in the original match exclusions implementation (which I believe was caused by a fault in another area of code). This was defect https://engineering/jira/browse/WLM-4713. I don't believe there is any business justification for deleting these exclusions other than to avoid the defect.
column372: 21/Nov/2019 11:12 AM;RHome;See the attachment "Email regarding match exclusions issue" for a discussion of how this issue might be addressed. Note that in the email I say that this work-around was not implemented for NetReveal 8, but I was not correct and in fact it was and so the issue does occur.
column373: 28/Nov/2019 10:00 AM;RHome;Adding a second email that discusses the problem.

column1: CLONE - 663: PEN Test: Cross-Site Scripting (Stored)
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Source: 
Affected Page: /netreveal/screen/view.do (Application Builder > New Application)
Affected Parameter: APPLICATION_NAME
HTTP Method: POST
Payload: "><script>alert('In Your Face')</script>
Payload Description: Display a simple alert message whenever user navigate to the affected page.
 
Description:
Cross-site Scripting (XSS) refers to client-side code injection attack wherein an attacker can execute malicious JavaScripts (also commonly referred to as a malicious payload) into a legitimate website or web application.
 
Impact:
By storing malicious JavaScript into the application, the attacker can perform many client-side attacks like information stealing, page defacement, malicious page redirection, and so on which is entirely up to the attacker's motivation.
 
Details:
Below is the PoC to reproduce the issue:
1. Login to the application using a user with admin role, e.g. mypentadmin
2. Navigate to Application Builder > New Application
3. Submit the payload at the affected field (Refer SamplePayload.png)
4. The payload activates whenever user browses to Application Builder (Refer PayloadActivation.mp4)
 
Recommendation:
All client supplied data should be HMTL encoded at the point where it is displayed to the user. This includes request data such as query string parameters and data retrieved from storage. It is recommended that all alphanumeric characters be HTML encoded to avoid XSS. However, the following characters must be encoded: " ' &<>.

column369:
09/Oct/2019 04:30 AM;AHMTalib;Hi Paul,

Refer to  [^ASC File (PRJ82619) 05092019.xlsx] , Web Assessment(AML) worksheet, Column G, click on PayloadActivation.mp4 video.

Short version - New Application Form does not validate XSS entries and allows script based contents to be persisted into APPLICATIONS table via text box parameters.
A workaround has been provided by utilising FormUtil.encodAsHTML method within the ListSectionController. This will escape any XSS scripts that will be displayed back to the UI instead of executing it.

*Crucible*
http://proddev-svn:8070/cru/CE-1146

Appreciate PE to validate this and consider as a candidate for harvest into core.

Credits to Faisal (CSD) and Jie (Tech Consultant)

column352:
1. Enter ‘Menu’ (Either by clicking ‘Menu’ button or by pressing ‘F9’ key)
2. In ‘Menu’ drop-down choose ‘Watchlist Manager’
3. In sub-menu choose ‘Administration’
4. In sub-sub-menu choose ‘Import WLM config’
5. Choose ‘Load method’ (preferably ‘Refresh’)
6. Tick ‘Import now’
7. Click ‘Next’
8. On next screen click ‘Import’.
column369:
16/Oct/2019 10:47 AM;rudolf.andruch;As we've found out problem is caused by the java class that is looking for a nonexistent list (Standard List).

Workaround we have found:
 # Change system parameter 'filtering.wlmconfig.load.list.data' to false.
 # Import WLM config without the 'lists' folder.
column370: 17/Oct/2019 10:07 AM;adrian.feldfeber;The same problem occurred in CASA project - CASAV4-409.
column371: 17/Oct/2019 11:20 AM;kslawinski;[~adrian.feldfeber] - Please check the jdbc version driver you are using.
column372:
17/Oct/2019 11:42 AM;adrian.feldfeber;I was able to solve the issue on our site. I compared new WLM config with the last I was able to import without any problem - I found only 2 small changes in xml, so it could not be a problem, and one exclusion list with new records added. When I went to the UI and tried to delete those records I got the error. Finally I was able to delete all records through the UI but only in some strange order, looked like some records were connected? After that when I exported new WLM config I was able to load it without any error.

Is xml somehow connected with data in the lists? I thought that after the export we can change the lists before import and it will not be a problem but maybe I am wrong?
column373:
17/Oct/2019 12:48 PM;rudolf.andruch;Data for the lists is exported with WLM config and saved in lists/ folder. XML is connected with lists only by defining structure of those lists and not the data itself as far as i know.

That's why it is advised to not import list by setting the system parameter filtering.wlmconfig.load.list.data to false.

Thanks,
Ashok.

column1: CDD risk model validation function does not report missing level transition
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
In JIRA EBE000397-392 a code change was applied for PIRAEUS project. In PIRAEUS non-standard names of levels are used and we also have 2 entities (customized names too).
It appeared that in our configuration the risk model validator was throwing an error claiming we have missing transition levels where as we haven't. Marek Tomaszewski applied a fix for that and he pointed out 2 CDD issues (details in EBE000397-392).
Once we started to validate the code change it appeared that we revealed the problem with standard OOTB CDD risk model configuration (Apps 5.0.1), in which level transitions for 'ConnectedPartyCDD' are missing. Despite the fact these level transitions are missing the CDD risk model is treated as correct and does not report any issues. Once we apply Marek's fix which is entity and org unit aware, the problem with missing transitions are reported. 

Standard OOTB CDD risk model can be found here:
http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/PIRAEUS/ConfigRepository/trunk/CDD/ProductConfiguration/risk_model/cdd-risk-model.xml

PIRAEUS risk model can be found here:
http://proddev-svn/svn/norkom/APPSRoot/Projects/Services/PIRAEUS/ConfigRepository/trunk/PIR-CDD/ProductConfiguration/risk_model/cdd-risk-model.xml

Search for transitions where entity: ConnectedPartyCDD. There are none.

Despite that, the CDD configuration is validated as correct one.
column369: 17/Oct/2019 04:30 PM;kslawinski;See attached cdd risk model - it is still going to be loaded fine. Validation method will not throw any exception even if there is only one transition level defined for 'ConnectedPartyCDD' entity.

column385:
30/Oct/2019 05:00 PM;Pnolan;Thanks, Raghav. I guess that's one of the problems with using a very old version of the platform - this feature has changed significantly. In later releases, the URL encryption feature covers all of the navigation links and so prevents this type of XSS issue from occurring. In 6.1.2, however, it appears that it only covers a subset of the links so the issue is still present.

As the issue has been resolved in later releases (and as always), Engineering recommends that the customer updates to the latest version to take advantage of the defect fixes and security updates that have been applied since 6.1.2. Alternatively, the customer will need to engage with CE to have a custom fix applied directly to the project.

column1: Workflow Rules are not cluster-aware
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Workflow rules are not cluster-aware, this means that in case of deployment of the product in a cluster environment( i.e. with  +2 UI servers running) then there is an operational activity needed in order to not fire the same workflow rule several times.
This implies that in case of server failure then an additional operation is needed to make sure the running server is configured  wit the WR enabled (property *workflow.enable.rule.scheduler* set to true)
column352: Configure a Workflow rule on a cluster set of UI servers

06-11-2019 13:23:09 com.norkom.filtering.extern.dto.MTSwiftMessage.getSenderBIC(MTSwiftMessage.java:106)  WARN - SenderBIC from block {1: [RBKOXKPR] != subHeader's senderBIC:[+senderBIC+].
06-11-2019 13:23:11 com.norkom.filtering.extern.dto.MTSwiftMessage.getSenderBIC(MTSwiftMessage.java:106)  WARN - SenderBIC from block {1: [AVALUAUK] != subHeader's senderBIC:[+senderBIC+].
06-11-2019 13:23:13 com.norkom.filtering.extern.dto.MTSwiftMessage.getSenderBIC(MTSwiftMessage.java:106)  WARN - SenderBIC from block {1: [RZBRROBU] != subHeader's senderBIC:[+senderBIC+].

06/Nov/2019 03:31 PM;rpillai;Hi Ashok,

column370:
06/Nov/2019 05:21 PM;AManayangath;Hi Haobin,

Is this something you have seen in the test environments?

Looking at FLTS-JMS's MTSwiftMessage.java:106, it looks like that WARN log isn't entirely correct, it's not replacing the actual value of 'senderBIC' in the log output - only a minor issue.

Apart from the logging issue, what could be causing this - the code suggests that this WARN is output if the BIC from block1 is not the same as the subHeader's SenderBIC.

Any thoughts?

thanks,
Ashok.

PS: Added Marc as watcher, Marc any insights? Thank you!
column371:
07/Nov/2019 09:21 AM;HSong;First from the line number shown in logs, it seems the client is not using the latest FLTS-JMS release. In the latest code, the warning line should 112 instead of 106.

This log entry is just a warning and it should not prevent message from being processed successfully.

[~MvanLaere1], any thoughts? Thanks.
column372:
07/Nov/2019 09:41 AM;MvanLaere1;Hi,

 

This warn message occurs when the senderBic that has been set to the subheader by C part is not the same s the one found in the swift MT message.

Unfortunately due to the error in log statement, we don'ty know what has been set in subheader.

The subheader is build by C part in buildMTSubHeader function in convert_mesg.c.

The senderBic in the subheader is filled based on a call to FieldGetValue on adk_header for field "mesg_sender_swift_address" .

 

The subheader can be logged in C part by setting  FLTS_TO trace level to DEBUG

The parsed message can be logger in java part by setting com.norkom.filtering.extern.JMSSender to DEBUG in  log4j.properties.

 

Marc
column373:
02/Dec/2019 11:57 AM;rpillai;Hi Haobin,

 

Please close this ticket as there is no response from the client.

 

Regards

Raghav

column1: CLONE - WLM - Locking in Sanction and PEP Screening alerts
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: When a WLM alert is viewed from the application by one user (e.g. via Group Work > All Alerts > clicking on an alert in the Matching Alerts screen), the locking behaviour for that alert does not work as expected. When another user logs into the application and searches for the same WLM alert, the lock icon does not appear next to the alert in the Matching Alerts Screen. The screenshot below shows an example of the (working) locking behaviour that is not working out-of-the-box in our version of the product .

column369:
07/Nov/2019 10:47 AM;AHMTalib;Hi Paul,

*Issue*
When a WLM alert is viewed from the application by one user (e.g. via Group Work > All Alerts > clicking on an alert in the Matching Alerts screen), the locking behaviour for that alert does not work as expected. When another user logs into the application and searches for the same WLM alert, the lock icon does not appear next to the alert in the Matching Alerts Screen. The screenshot below shows an example of the (working) locking behaviour that is not working out-of-the-box in our version of the product .

Fix has been taken from 
CIMBMYUPG-477
EBE000082-427

Appreciate your assessment and consideration on this ticket for the next release.

column1: AML Default Page Removal
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: Remove or disable https://xxxxxxx/search/about.jsp from accessible.
column352: http://10.101.48.47:8080/search/about.jsp
column369:
11/Nov/2019 10:21 PM;balasekaraiadurai;Hi Paul,

Customer CIMB Malaysia spotted security finding where the page should be block or removed from access.
Now when they put their full URL https://amlp1.cimb.com/search/about.jsp the attached is displayed. This need to be block or removed.They just need to know where or how to remove it.

I have cross check in our replica environment and spotted this page appearing for all customers in Netreveal and this certainly need to be fixed.

Please check and advise 

Regards
Bala
column370: 12/Nov/2019 12:11 PM;Pnolan;Bala, this is a standard version details page for NetReveal Search so it is unclear to me why this is considered a security finding. Has the customer given details of any specific vulnerability that is caused by this page? Thanks...
column371:
13/Nov/2019 01:27 AM;balasekaraiadurai;Hi Paul,

Its not just the standard version details page as the page consist of their *environment details* and you can see the latest attached screenshot "CIMBM Screenshot.png" and such visible information could jeopardise their security policies.

Do let us know if this page/details can be removed or blocked as requested by customer.

Regards
Bala
column372: 13/Nov/2019 10:25 AM;Pnolan;Thanks, Bala. Now that I can see the full page, I agree that there is an information disclosure problem here. I will review this with Architecture and hopefully respond later this week.
column373:
13/Nov/2019 05:20 PM;Pnolan;This appears to be an issue with NetReveal Search itself. This About page should be added to the filter in the *web.xml* file in the NetReveal Search WAR file, so only authorised users would have access to the sensitive information visible in the screen.

There is unlikely to be a new patch release for NetReveal Search to resolve this, so the issue will need to be resolved directly on the project.

column1: Hastings "Export to CSV" breaks Close Alert workflow
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Hi team,

The client has logged a ticket with us and we have also replicated the issue on prod and pre-prod

This seems to affect any screen with the export button.

For example when in group work > all alerts screen, do a search and get some results back, click the "Export to CSV" button. 
 After this When assigning or closing alerts (any alert) after exporting columns to CSV an {color:#de350b}*error message*{color} occurs and you cannot proceed without logging off the system and logging on again.

!capture2.png|thumbnail!

The patch and fix from https://support.ai.baesystems.com/browse/PLAT-22624 has broken the alert workflow when the export to CSV option is used. without using the export option these errors are not noted.

 It is accurate that the current remediation is for the user to logout and log back in.

column1: [FCENG-12002] P&C 3.1 Matching Alerts "Total Reserves" is blank on some "Personal Motor" alerts
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
{panel:title=Feedback from engineering|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#f7d6c1|bgColor=#ffffce}
Upon consultation within the team, it appears that the total reserves column is a Hastings customization and not part of the OOTB. As the total reserves value is shown when the alert is opened up, this means the value for total reserves is present in the XML in the doc store and has gone through the build as expected. Therefore this appears to be an issue with the implementation for this customization. We expect that the area around the acquisition sequence that puts the data into the alert header table for use by the column needs to be looked at. We would recommend this issue is taken up with the customization owner.
{panel}
*Further investigation from PS*
{panel:bgColor=#ffffce}
Looking at 30010856027 (does not have Total Reserves in alerts screen) and 30010691914 (does have Total Reserves in alerts screen) and pulling the XML out of UEL_DOCUMENT_DATA we see that both have values mapped in the claim financial section for Total Reserves, so this does look like an issue but not a mapping one.
 EIM.ALERT_HEADER matches this aka 30010856027 is missing Total Reserves in here too, both the amount and the currency
{panel}
--------
{panel:bgColor=#ffffce}
Am suspecting a manual alerts situation.
 Seems that:
 1628 CF__uCreateAlertNGV
 1678 PF__uCreateAlertNGV
 might not have been updated.

Going via CF__uCreateAlertNGV I got to EIM_CreateAlert_WWToAlertHeader but that query seemed to update the Alert_Header table with org_unit and status codes not CLAIM_ID or CLAIM_CAUSE_CATEGORY so suspect they will be filled in somewhere else and that somewhere else needs changing. 
{panel}
--------
{panel:bgColor=#ffffce}
I've attached the Word doc *CSREQ-89.docx* that has some relevant screenshots.

I have since recreated this on a vanilla PnC 3.1.14.6 ( I realize Hastings is on PnC 3.1.14.4 at the moment but it was what was available to download) and I could recreate this on DataLab (after changing the scorecards to make it easier to find claims to raise). 

I now believe that this is an issue that exists with the EIM that is packaged, rather than a Hastings configuration issue.  I could not find where the item that lack the TOTAL_RESERVE-* as exposed parameters exists in the codebase.  That could be because either
 # I missed it
 # It's not exposed (we have seen this before),
 # It gets generated from a file that turns into this part of the workflow, but that I lack the knowledge to see.

Either way, I don't believe that it is something that I am able to change.
{panel}
Could you please review and advise?

Kind regards,

column378:
20/Feb/2020 04:47 PM;agnieszkatomaszewska;[~RRWood], could you please help on this question?

For manually created alerts, there is exactly the same configurations as for automatically created.

I've checked EIM configuration and it expects that TOTALRESERVES and TOTALRESERVESCURRENCY will be provided by doc store via such REST:

 
{noformat}
document.store.url/documents/latest/all?names=POLICYNO,VALUEOFCLAIM,CURRENCYOFCLAIM,INCIDENTDATE_CLEAN,CLAIMCAUSECATEGORY,CLAIMNO,REASONFORRECORD,CLAIMTYPECATEGORY,AMENDMENTNUMBER,AMENDMENTDATETIME_CLEAN,TOTALLOSSFLAG,INJURYCLAIMFLAG,CLAIMANTSCOUNT,INSUREDPOSTCODEAREA,TOTALRESERVES,TOTALRESERVESCURRENCY

 {noformat}

 

Can we expect that these values will be populated (and delivered to EIM) in the doc store also for documents not automatically alerted?

When checked further we found the alerts that weren't showing the Total Reserve all seem to be manually created (This is what the Audit Log screen reports:

column1: CLONE - WLM Processing batch process stuck in 'In Progress' state intermittently
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
We are facing an intermittent issue in RHB MY's production environment where:
1) The end of day batch is started and the WLM process for the end of day is executed. Typically the daily WLM process will take around 35-45 minutes to complete in RHB MY's production.
2) After > 45 minutes, the status of the WLM process is still stuck 'In Progress'. When looking at the WLM Process from the Batch Process Monitor, the Total No of Records Processed = Total No of Records. The system seems to be stuck in 'In Progress' state even though it has finished processing all the records for WLM screening.

This issue happens intermittently in production, and there are no reproduction steps available at the moment.

We need CE's help to help check in the code:
1) What is the criteria to change the state of the 'WLM Process' batch process from 'in progress' to 'succeeded'. (e.g. is it looking at specific records in DB or any 'signals' from the application)
From understanding this, we hope to find a clue on why the status never gets updated to 'succeeded'. 
2) Will errors in any of the other batch processes (e.g. CDD BatchBridge) running on the batch server prevent the 'WLM Process' from being updated to 'succeeded'.
3) Will having other processes (e.g. CDD/AML) running at the same time cause the statuses to somehow be not updated properly.
column352: The issue happens intermittently in RHB's MY production environment
column369:
22/Nov/2019 10:34 AM;AHMTalib;Hi Paul,

Regards
Hatta

column1: Swift Alerted Transaction Release/Blok Response Process Earlier Than Hit/No Hit Response In FLTS
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
NAB raised this issue from their production environment. They have observed number of transactions that are not released in SAA despite the alerted transaction has been released from Netreveal. 

NAB did some analysis, they have found this scenario and name it as "HIT DISAPPROVAL TOO EARLY". For normal scenario, a swift message will be sent to Netreveal for screening and hit/no hit response will be returned to NORKOM.TRXACQACKQUEUE  and process in FLTS_WAIT. If it is hit, alert will be generated in Netreveal. User will work on the alert and final response will be sent to NORKOM.TRXSUSPECTACKQUEUE  and process in FLTS_FINAL when user release/block the alert from Netreveal. So the sequence update is FLTS_WAIT follow by FLTS_FINAL. However, for this issue NAB user has released the message within 6 seconds and the response reaching the queue NORKOM.TRXSUSPECTACKQUEUE and processed by FLTS_FINAL quicker than the first response which is still queuing in NORKOM.TRXACQACKQUEUE. Due to that, the FLTS_FINAL thrown error and the release response fail to update SAA. 

NAB don't think that it's their environment performance issue which is caused by high volume of transactions. They would like us to review our current product design. Here is the proposal from them. It sounds doable plan, but it will involve wide range of product changes. Please share your thought from engineering point of view. 

1. Point both messages first response (hit/no hit) and final message (release/block) to same destination queue and set JMS priority. 
2. Set sequence to message body that is released from Netreveal so that FLTS will recognise the first and final response and will not process final response if the firsts response has not processed at FLTS. I believe will require logic changes at both Netreveal and FLTS. 

Enclosed is the report analysis from NAB. There are two cases, please refer to Case #1 only.
column352: Unable to reproduce. This issue is observed in NAB production environment during the peak transaction hours.

That aside, both options will require more analysis and of course possibly a lot of dev work and testing as it's a major feature change.

I will discuss this further with the PE team and get back to you, however could I request you to please investigate if/how this is managed in other clients/solutions (as in how they do not have similar issue).

thanks,
Ashok.
column373:
05/Dec/2019 09:49 AM;waichungkhoo;Hi Ashok, 

No worries and thanks for your comment.

I think it is very rare that an alert is picked up and released by user in 6 seconds from the first (hit/no hit) response is made. Therefore, we seldom see the issue happen for other customer. 

We have proposed a config change as a workaround to Services. We will modify the view to only retrieve the alert that is created more than a certain period of time, eg. 2 min. By doing this, we hope to give some buffer time for FLTS to consume the messages in NORKOM.TRXACQACKQUEUE before the alert is worked by the user. It is pending review by Services and we are not sure will customer accept the workaround. 

For a robust and longer term solution, I think PE team should review the current design and consider the scenario that happen in NAB environment. Please let us know the result after your discussion with PE team. 

Thanks.
Khoo
column374:
09/Dec/2019 11:08 AM;MvanLaere1;Hi,

 

There is a configurable wait time (<flts_from><interval wait="xx"/> ) in FLTS_WAIT to wait for the message to be routed from FLTS_RP_TO to FLTS_RP_WAIT(by FLTS_TO) but unfortunately not for FLTS_FINAL to wait for the message to be routed from FLTS_RP_WAIT to FLTS_RP_FNAL(by FLTS_WAIT) probably because it was assumed that human reaction would always be slower than FLTS_WAIT.

Observing this behaviour may indicate FLTS_WAIT is slow dequeuing the HIT/NOHIT answers or FLTS_TO is slow to route massages from FLTS_RP_TO to FLTS_RP_WAIT (because in that case FLTS_WAIT will wait).

 

Marc
column375:
10/Dec/2019 06:37 AM;waichungkhoo;Hi Marc, 

Thanks for sharing the feature. 

Yes, in this case the user release the alert quicker than message to be consumed in FLTS_WAIT. It is observed in NAB that there are large volume of message is queuing for processing during peak hours. 

Is there any conclusion from your discussion among PE? 

Khoo.

column377:
11/Feb/2020 09:44 AM;waichungkhoo;Hi Ashok, 
 We have been seeing the similar issue happened to another customer Bank Montreal Singapore (BMOSG-93) where the Hit message came after the Hit Disapproved message.
{noformat}
30/01/20 14:41:09 flts_to.c:415         FLTS_TO    [INFO ] - Message sent <IBOFAHKHXXXX202BMHK615570EX>-<2100186>-<21CD8987FFDFF425>-<0> (timings: available:15 prepare:0 treat:64 route:10 addshm:0 total:89)
30/01/20 14:42:09 from_flts.c:408       FLTS_FNL   [INFO ] - Message received <IBOFAHKHXXXX202BMHK615570EX>-<2100186>-<21CD8987FFDFF425>-<0> result:23 rc:0
30/01/20 14:42:09 from_flts.c:505       FLTS_FNL   [ERROR] - ERROR : Instance u_umid:<IBOFAHKHXXXX202BMHK615570EX> suffix:2100186 s_umid:<21CD8987FFDFF425> inst_nb:0 not found in rp:<FLTS_RP_SUSPECT> but somewhere else. Discarding message.
30/01/20 14:42:59 from_flts.c:408       FLTS_WAI   [INFO ] - Message received <IBOFAHKHXXXX202BMHK615570EX>-<2100186>-<21CD8987FFDFF425>-<0> result:1 rc:0
{noformat}
Do you think it's possible that we remove the dependency of FLTS_RP_SUSPECT on FLTS_RP_WAIT so both procedure can operate in separate stream without depend on each other. I'm not sure the reason behind the dependency but if we received a Hit Disapproved message isn't it means the message is hit already? Don't you think the dependency is not necessary? Do you think that's something we can change from product or it's a SAA requirement? It will be great that if you can share your thought. Thanks.

Please find below illustration that I taken from Swift - FLTS Component Operation Guide. Sorry for the bad drawing. 
 Hit Disapproved scenario:
 !HIT_Disapproved.jpg|thumbnail!

Hit Approved scenario:
 !HIT_Approved.jpg|thumbnail!

 

Thanks.
 Khoo

16. Screenshot the result. Should have 2 rows of records by now.
17. Open the list exported at step 4 with editor.
18. Locate the row of record of entity that copied at step 5.
19. Remove the entire row of record, and save the file.
20. Navigate to Watchlist Manager > Lists > Standard Lists
21. Select the same list at step 3.
22. Import the modified file with MERGE method.
23. Once complete, select the same list again.
24. Click on Audit Log icon, search for the entity.
25. Only 2 rows of records displayed, where the row with MANUAL action is overwritten by 'DELETED'.

column376:
23/Jan/2020 01:41 PM;EFitzgerald;Hi Waimei,

 

I believe your issue here has been addressed in product due to a different requirement.

In older releases of the product the system only tracked when an individual record version was updated.

This resulted in the behaviour that you mention above a record can be updated and then deleted.

Since 8.0 we have introduced a Entered time stamp for each record version.

This value is the data/time a record version was created and never changes. 

The last update date value will then change when and a value is updated or deleted.

In the below example you can see that the entered time stamp for one version of the record is equal to the the last updated vale of the previous. That is because the previous record was updated to the status of "History" when the new record was created. 

For the last record, you can see the update  value is different to the entered value.

That is because the record was created at time X then the last action that  was occurred to this  version of the record was that it was deleted. 

If this fix is needed a would start by looking at the below ticket.

 

Regards,

Edward

 

 

!image-2020-01-23-13-18-35-403.png|width=739,height=113!

[https://engineering/jira/browse/WLM-6020]
column377:
04/Feb/2020 04:16 AM;WKhuan;Hi Edward,

I have tested the audit log in V8, but it didn't solve the issue addressed. The timing displayed is correct, but the action and update mode is not.

The line of action = CURRENT and Update Mode = MANUAL should not be replaced by "deleted/bulk". "Current/Manual" should remain, and a new record "deleted/bulk" should be added. Moreover, delete action took place at time 04:04:45, not 04:02:52. It audit log records are not accurate in this case.

Please refer to attachment [^test_01.png] and [^test_02.png].

Regards,
Waimei

column1: Opening a lock on a Manual Alert creates entries in the ENTITY_LOCK table for multiple entities
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
In LBG entity configuration, the ALERT_HEADER table stores details for Manual Alerts, Ext Alerts and SM Alerts. 

The workflow entity configuration lists all three as separate entities, as well as a generic Alert entity. 

When any type of Alert is locked by the system, entries for all 4 types are created. This is misleading to the client, as they feel that it suggests that they have more locks present in the system than are actually there.

Scope:
https://wlm.pat2.td.com/netreveal/

Expected:
TD Wealth QA should be able to assign the alert to other users

Actual:
TD Wealth QA is NOT able to assign the alert to other users

2) Select an alert in any active status
3) Click on Assign Button

column370:
20/Dec/2019 06:47 PM;VSavkoor;The code should not rely on the configuration to be correct at all times, and should handle configuration issues gracefully and not bring the server down.

This issue could occur in production if new Users are added to the system without the right permission to workflow screens. The code should handle it and report a proper error message. A similar issue (PLAT-22364) was reported in non-workflow screens and fixed in Core platform. So there is no reason why this issue should not be fixed in Core.

[^ISO8859-15.PNG]

column371:
14/Feb/2020 08:39 AM;NBresnan;It looks like CS are going to be able to handle this without intervention from PE. But it has exposed what looks like a hard-coded limitation within the code. You can see in the following snippet that the code is hard-coded to import in {{ISO-8859-1}}.
 !WcListLogicFacadeImpl.java.png!
{{ISO-8859-1}} is a small data-set that doesn’t handle larger character-sets that contain unusual characters. It seems like this should default to {{UTF-8}} and that the input-type should be configurable using a parameter-setting. \\ *Remote comment create date: 27/Feb/20 12:04 PM*

column376:
21/Jan/2020 08:43 AM;Pnolan;Ross, the schedule for the first fixpack release will be driven by APPS. Platform 8.1 is planned for release on 27 January and APPS 8.1 is planned for release on 24 February. If any critical platform issues are detected during APPS regression testing, then fixpacks will have to be released for these before 17 February to align with the APPS schedule. If no critical issues are detected, then the first platform fixpack release will be held until shortly after the APPS 8.1 release on 24 February.

So there will be a fixpack release either at the end of February or possibly earlier, depending on APPS testing. I am going to add this issue to the platform team backlog in the meantime. \\ *Remote comment create date: 21/Jan/20 08:44 AM*

column1: Housekeeping queries are not performant
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column352:
Start application with Houskeeping job disabled and leave running to allow records in ACQ_BATCH_PROCSS, ACQ_BATCH_PROCSS_PARAMS, ACQ_BATCH_EVENT to grow to a sizeable volume (i.e. several million in ACQ_BATCH_PROCSS).

Re-enable houskeeping, and the query being run to remove records will not be able to handle the volume.
column369: 17/Jan/2020 10:21 AM;Pnolan;Reassigning Batch Bridge issue for review...
column370:
17/Jan/2020 10:31 AM;EBaggott;Is this  batch bridge problem or a  problem with an implementation taht uses batch bridge.

it seems like  the latter to me and   that  the above queryes need to be tuned and indexes etc created,  if needed.

 

Why are they trying to delete so much data,  that seems strange.

 

In any case the real underlieing problem is that some applications are logging way too much data to the  ACQ  tables,  and thatg has cause other issues in the past.  It should be looked into.
column371:
17/Jan/2020 10:32 AM;EBaggott;If it's in  a  test emv then they should just truncate the tables if it's causing them a issue.

but it's a test env so why do they need to clean up anyway?
column372:
17/Jan/2020 10:53 AM;jamescole;Hi [~EBaggott]

These tables appear to log records for every job that executes in a schedule - by default across BatchBridge, AML, CDD we seem to accumulate ~10k rows per hour.

The client is specifically trying to replicate a DR scenario where the application performing houskeeping malfunctions for a period of time, and want to test that a PROD environment would successfully be able to deal with large volumes. 

We have advised the client that the BatchCleanUp job is not designed for use with non-BAU volumes, and have devised a separate method to manually clear records with more performant queries (though it required environment downtime) which should be used in DR events. [Truncation was also not feasible due to APPS dependencies on extracting up to date params from these tables as part of AGT.]

As you have mentioned though, the queries listed above could be better tuned and indexes will help - which was the main purpose of raising this ticket. I'm not sure if that lies with PLAT or APPS however.

 

Regards,

James

column1: Fuzzy Wide Algo unable to catch some names with filtering.watchlist.matching.fuzzy.extended set to true
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Customer Names YRBIS AIR COMPANY is hitting against IRBIS AIR COMPANY with Fuzzy Wide Algorithm at 93% threshold. However when system parameter filtering.watchlist.matching.fuzzy.extended is set to “true” to turn on extended fuzzy index matching then this customer is not getting a hit.
Its only catching the matches at 100% only  like JIA JUN WENG against WENG JIA JUN

The behaviour of the Fuzzy Wide algo is completely changed after this parameter is turned on.
column352:
Customer Names YRBIS AIR COMPANY is hitting against IRBIS AIR COMPANY with Fuzzy Wide Algorithm at 93% threshold. However when system parameter filtering.watchlist.matching.fuzzy.extended is set to “true” to turn on extended fuzzy index matching then this customer is not getting a hit.
Its only catching the matches at 100% only  like JIA JUN WENG against WENG JIA JUN

The behaviour of the Fuzzy Wide algo is completely changed after this parameter is turned on.

column1: Worldcheck record is not updated
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
SUB_CATEGORY data is not sync between World Check file and Norkom for SUB-CATEGORY "SOE" and "SIE".
||Worldcheck File Column||WC_DATA Column||
|SUB-CATEGORY|OCCUPATION|

Mapping from system_parameters:
 * worldCheckColumn08 OCCUPATION|SUB-CATEGORY
 * worldCheckColumn31 SUB_CATEGORY|SUB-CATEGORY2

Import WC Premium Plus file with SUB-CATEGORY “SOE”, the result shows the value Occupation is null and Sub_Category is “Not Applicable”.
||Input WC file||USER_ID||OCCUPATION\|SUB-CATEGORY||SUB_CATEGORY\|SUB-CATEGORY2||
|SUB-CATEGORY = "PEP SN"|3053115|PEP|PEP SN|
|SUB-CATEGORY = "SOE"|3053116|{color:#ff0000}null{color}|{color:#ff0000}Not Applicable{color}|

After the code fix in CES-2755, the result shows both Occupation and Sub_Category were populated with "SOE".
 Customer deployed in test environment and perform full WC import (merge/partial merge method), they encountered issue for existing UIDs in wc_data that there is no newly record added in wc_data table. This situation is when there is no data change from WC file. The sample data refer to ticket UOB-343.

Is this an expected behaviour for the existing UID records in wc_data?
 If yes, how the fix can be apply to the existing UID records?
column352:
1. Navigate to Watchlist Manager > Lists > Worldcheck
2. From Lists section, click on Import Lists icon.
3. Choose File Details tab.
4. In World Check File field, browse file "World-Check.20191029-134512.csv".
5. In Native Alias File field, browse file "World-Check-PremiumPlus.20191029-134512.csv".
6. Select Load Method "Partial Merge".
7. Click on Import Now button.
column369:
18/Feb/2020 02:24 AM;henisepteni;Hi Ashok,

Just to follow up, do you have any comment on this case?

Regards,
 Heni
column370:
20/Feb/2020 05:51 PM;AManayangath;Hi Heni,

Sorry about the delay in getting back on this.

I had a quick look at CES-2755, and it looks like that matches the current improved code in Core. So that should be fine.

On the second part of the question, what is the WC fingerprinting configuration? Do they use Selective Fingerprinting?

I am guessing from an import point of view, the incoming record is not different / modified (as the data itself is not changing) and that's probably why it's not updating WC records which previously missed correct subcategory. Are there many records that needs updating? 

If there's a way to filter them, you could probably look into updating / emptying the fingerprint in the db for those records, and once that's done, the WC import should correctly identify these as modified records and update accordingly. This will then of course become part of delta screening etc, it might be worth checking if that's a problem.

regards,
Ashok.
column371: 20/Feb/2020 05:51 PM;AManayangath;As above.
column372:
23/Feb/2020 04:49 PM;henisepteni;Hi Ashok,

Thanks for your reply.
 In replica environment there is no WC fingerprinting configuration.
|*parameter_key*|*value*|
|filtering.worldcheck.fingerprint.columns| |
|filtering.worldcheck.list.default.fingerprint.hash.algorithm|SHA-256|

Currently we're still waiting their WC fingerprinting configuration in Production environment.

I also would like to clarify, according to the doc the default value for "filtering.worldcheck.fingerprint.columns" is null. Does it mean all columns in WC data become a fingerprint? 

 
{quote}I am guessing from an import point of view, the incoming record is not different / modified (as the data itself is not changing) and that's probably why it's not updating WC records which previously missed correct subcategory. Are there many records that needs updating?
{quote}
Yes, the issue is for the existing WC record with no changes. There are 63000 records (SOE/SIE) that need to be updated.

 
{quote}If there's a way to filter them, you could probably look into updating / emptying the fingerprint in the db for those records, and once that's done, the WC import should correctly identify these as modified records and update accordingly. This will then of course become part of delta screening etc, it might be worth checking if that's a problem.
{quote}
Yes, there's way to filter the records. Do you mean by updating any column in wc_data manually and then perform full WC import list?

Regards,

Heni
column373:
24/Feb/2020 07:10 PM;AManayangath;Heni,

Just to clarify, what needs to happen when the 63000 records gets updated with correct SOE/SIE information? Are you / client expecting them to be scanned against fresh on the next delta run, or are they just to be updated and kept in the background? Are all these 63000 records current / active (not historic versions)? If you have historic records that are linked to existing alerts, updating 'current' records only will not be of any use to alerts that was already fired. 

Also when was the last time they did a full refresh of WC list? With 63000 records to update, I wonder if it's better to consider a full list refresh (there are a number of sql steps to backup current tables, empty them, import fresh WC list, and merge historically referenced records back into the tables etc).

Just a few different thoughts.

thanks,
Ashok.
column374:
25/Feb/2020 10:19 AM;henisepteni;Hi Ashok,

Yes, we're expecting the WC records to be scanned against new/updated customer on the next delta run. Those are currently active records.
 Customer never perform full refresh as it will wipe out the data for the existing outstanding and closed alerts.
 Also according to the documentation, the "Refresh" method is not recommended in Production environment as it will have a negative impact on existing alerts and exclusion lists if they reference the deleted data.

Regards,
 Heni

column352:
use ImportExportJob to import workflow with application mapping (i.e.:import|workflow[APP1=APP2]|workflowConfig.xml)
