column369:
24/Feb/2020 02:15 PM;MvanLaere1;For junctions, the reason is that application name mapping is not supported in com.norkom.configurator.business.facades.helpers.dataload.FunctionSetJunctionReconcileContext and com.norkom.configurator.business.facades.helpers.dataload.FunctionSetRouteReconcileContext. The containsApplication and getMappedApplication don't use WorkflowDataLoader._getMappedApplicationName._

 

_For worlflow_action_functions, the reason is that getMappedApplication  in com.norkom.configurator.business.facades.helpers.dataload.workflow.ActionFunctionReconcileContext doesn't use mapped application name._

_Please not that_ _ActionFunctionReconcileContext's  containsApplication function doesn't use the application name passzed as parameter (ijhn nameà but uses the application name of_ actionFunction member instead. This is probably an error too.

Patch is for core 7.7.0.10.

Marc

{code:java}

column1: The elements in the XML configuration that we export from GUI should be sorted.
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
We often do a merge between the branches and releases and the biggest problem we encounter is the merge of XML configuration files especially:

    application configuration
    workflow configuration
    base config

It should be possible to export the XML file from GUI with the xml tags being sorted e.g. alphabetically.
This would allow us to compare and merge the changes more easily.
So far we use the XSL template to sort the files after being downloaded but this quite a cumbersome solution.
Link to the sorting/normalizing tool:
http://confluence.dublin.norkom.com/display/HSBCBankplcUK/Normalizing+the+format+of+XML+files

There are many people in the project and we would like to remind everybody to use this sorting tool on the exported XML file before that person checks the XML file to SVN.
Thus, the expectation is to sort the XML elements during the export from the GUI.

column1: CLONE - Needless use of ehcache for the normalisation framework
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Looking at the NormalizationCache class you will see that it creates an ehcache Cache with the following parameters:

size: 10,000
overflowToDisk: false.
eternal: true

It then puts precisely one object in it the cache: a holder for the all normalisation information. This object will never expire as eternal is set to true. It will never be written to disk.

When WLMN needs the normalisation information it then gets this one object out of the cache.

This is a pointless use of a cache and it would be better to simply delete it and keep a direct reference to the normalisation information instead of a direct one.

Switching the normalisation cache flag off and on simply controls whether the data is reloaded each time and put in the cache or not.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352:

column1: Improve performance of remove empty unused lists during FACTIVA Import
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74: The Factiva doesn´t load properly stopping the customer screening operations in Production.
column352:
Import a wlm config with no factiva sublists (only 'FACTIVA PFA' list)
import a full or daily  factiva 
remove empty unused lists will take hours to complete
column369:
30/Aug/2017 09:29 AM;MvanLaere1;Hi,

Basically, the issue occurs when removeEmptyUnusedLists method have to re-create lot of Factiva sublists.
This situation occurs when the imported wlm configuration doesn't contain the same factiva sub lists definitions as the one found in imported factiva files.
This can occur is the installation from where the wlm config is exported has no imported a factiva file or not imported a recent one. 
Depending on the number of missing (non empty) sub lists, the factiva import (full or daily) may take hours to complete.
The worse case is when only the main "FACTIVA PFA" list exists in imported configuration.
One easy way to reproduce the issue is to manually flag all factiva suvblists as deleted 
{code:sql}
update list_definition set is_deleted = 1 where 
worldcheck_list = 2
and is_deleted = 0
and list_definition_name != 'FACTIVA PFA';

update list_column lc set lc.is_deleted = 1 where 
.is_deleted = 0
and (select ld.is_deleted from list_definition ld where ld.id = lc.list_definition_id) = 1;

update list_index li set li.is_deleted = 1 where 
li.is_deleted = 0
and (select ld.is_deleted from list_definition ld where ld.id = li.list_definition_id) = 1;
{code}

Or import a wlm config containing no factiva sub lists (using refresh mode if available)

Then import a factiva daily file.
Note that I didn't check if the issue still exists with recent core version but I think I should still occurs when "refresh" mode is used for wlm config import.

Marc

column1: Importing Delta Configuration in SM stays in Read Only from previous configuration
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When importing a delta configuration, the loaded configuration is duplicated, and the delta is merged. That is the expected result.

The problem is when the current configuration has a Read Only restriction (it is, or was, in production). Then the Read Only restriction is not reset, and it still shows on the window header. Therefore the PM cannot be saved (menu 'File > Save Configuration' is greyed out) so it will remain "Invalid" (VALID_MODEL='0').
It requires to load again for editing the newest configuration, to be able to save it, which will eventually make it Valid.

=> During delta import, the current configuration should be duplicated into a new one, as done currently, and the Read Only restriction from the previous configuration should not be remembered
column352:
Open a SM (for instance AML SA)
Load the configuration currently in production
Import a delta configuration file
=> a new configuration is created by duplication, and the delta is merged, but the new config shows as Read Only

column1: Multiple SLF4J bindings in NR package
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When starting EIM, the SysErr for whichever server is hosting the indexing component shows the following:

{noformat}
[11/30/17 16:25:03:656 GMT] 00000055 SystemErr     R SLF4J: Class path contains multiple SLF4J bindings.
[11/30/17 16:25:03:656 GMT] 00000055 SystemErr     R SLF4J: Found binding in [wsjar:file:/opt/IBM/WebSphere85/AppServer/profiles/AppSrv02/installedApps/local
hostNode01Cell/NetReveal.ear/se-search-presentation-webapp.war/WEB-INF/lib/slf4j-log4j12-1.7.6.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class]
[11/30/17 16:25:03:656 GMT] 00000055 SystemErr     R SLF4J: Found binding in [bundleresource://243.fwk1080365339:1/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class]
[11/30/17 16:25:03:656 GMT] 00000055 SystemErr     R SLF4J: Found binding in [wsjar:file:/opt/IBM/WebSphere85/AppServer/profiles/AppSrv02/installedApps/local
hostNode01Cell/NetReveal.ear/slf4j-jcl-1.7.6.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class]
[11/30/17 16:25:03:656 GMT] 00000055 SystemErr     R SLF4J: Found binding in [wsjar:file:/opt/IBM/WebSphere85/AppServer/profiles/AppSrv02/installedApps/local
hostNode01Cell/NetReveal.ear/slf4j-log4j12-1.7.6.jar!/org/slf4j/impl/StaticLoggerBinder.class]
[11/30/17 16:25:03:656 GMT] 00000055 SystemErr     R SLF4J: See http://www.slf4j.org/codes.html#multiple_bindings for an explanation.
[11/30/17 16:25:03:659 GMT] 00000055 SystemErr     R SLF4J: Actual binding is of type [org.slf4j.impl.Log4jLoggerFactory]
{noformat}

due to the presence of the same class from 2 jars (one in core EIM, one in NR Search).

This has not had any evident adverse effect, however the fact that potentially different code may be performing the logging on different environments is not ideal. I don't know how classloading differs between app servers/Linux instances etc, so cannot quantify the risk really, but I don't believe it should be happening.
column352: Start EIM and observe SysErr logs (UCM use Websphere)

column1: [RMOTINT-139] - Format of date field "Date of Birth" will change
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
We process several lists from Accuity every day. The format of a field in one of those lists (PEP) will change. It concerns the Date of Birth (DOB) field that will be delivered in a different format from the 7th of March onwards. 

We need to know whether that will be picked up by the application, or that it will require changes before in order to correctly process the lists. 

The information we got is: 

Dear Global WatchList Customer,

Our records indicate your institution is subscribed to the Politically Exposed Persons (PEP) and/or Enhanced Due Diligence (EDD) dataset. As such, we would like to inform you of changes we are making to the formatting of dates of birth. 

To ensure dates of birth are formatted optimally for usage in the Fircosoft Filters, DOBs in the PEP and EDD list will begin to be presented in the following formats:
•	Year only = YYYY (ex. 1950) 
•	Month and Year= MM/YYYY (ex. 02/1950) 
•	Month, Day and Year = MM/DD/YYYY (01/02/1950) 
Dates of birth for new and changed records will begin to be presented in the above format from March 7th 2019. A select group of existing records will also be amended to conform to the DOB formatting described above. 

To help mitigate re-alerting the entity, version dates will not be update when DOB formatting changes are made to existing records. 

To confirm, all existing DOBs will be updated to conform with the formatting described above in the coming months. A separate communication will be sent to announce the timing and details of the additional changes.
column216: No code merge sub-tasks are required.
column352: NA
column369:
26/Feb/2019 11:14 AM;niallconnolly;Hi Anurag,

Can you help with this. The client would need an answer before the end of the week as the change will be active from the 7th of March onwards.

Thanks,

Niall
column370:
26/Feb/2019 11:18 AM;ASharma;Hi Ashok,

 

Can you respond to this query please?

 

Regards

Anurag
column371:
26/Feb/2019 12:48 PM;AManayangath;Niall,

Typical GWL configuration would have all the date fields mapped to GWL_DOBS table. There's some logic in code that handles the date string parsing into various formats and columns.

While that logic is robust, I have just ran some tests and I can see it's not handling the second case (MONTH and YEAR, 02/1950) too well. It records the incoming "02/1950" into GWL_DOBS.ORIG_DOB column, however it seems to be losing the MONTH component into the GWL_ENTITY.MONTH column, and in the GWL_DOB.DOB column.

This is based on my local testing. I would like to see if you can reproduce the same issue (and see if there are any other - although my tests of the other cases have come back fine). Once confirmed, we will have to discuss this within the team and come up with a plan to address it.

Another point is on re-alerting. Selective fingerprinting configuration decides if a record has changed or not which in turn impacts if the record will be matched against or not. Out of the box GWL fingerprinting is set to work off NAME column only. Please review what is the fingerprinting columns configured at client-site. (PS: You will see this in SYSTEM_PARAMETERS, for key 'gwl.fingerprint.columns'

thanks,
Ashok.
column373:
28/Feb/2019 04:58 PM;AManayangath;Niall,

As discussed, this is an issue that would need a code fix. However this shouldn't be an immediate concern as the Accuity list import will continue to work, and the checks are usually configured on the the YEAR component of the dob, and that value is getting captured accurately.

I can copy this story into WLM backlog, however this issue is not critical and since we are focused on critical new feature work this may not get picked up for a while. Perhaps it's worth investigating if this can be covered by CS or CE as this should be a straight forward fix in GWL import process & date parsing - there are JUnit tests to speed up the process as well. Please let me know if yourself / CS need more details on this.

thanks,
Ashok.
column374:
01/Mar/2019 08:31 AM;niallconnolly;Hi Ashok,

Thank you for the above information. I will communicate that o the customer and take it from here. Thanks for your assistance, much appreciated.

Thanks,

Niall

column1: [SHB-176] - Problem with download from Dow Jones
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
When we run the standaloneWatchlistDownload.sh we get time out. When we opened a ticket at Dow Jones they told us that they had turned of protocol TLS 1.0. 
The problem that we have is that for java 1.7 TLS 1.0 is default. 
We googel and find that we could and this to the scrip TLS_OPTS="-Dhttps.protocols=TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2" then it started to use TLS 1.2.
after that it start to work again. 
What do I need to do to get this update supported ? 

Attached the updatet standaloneWatchlistDownload.sh
column352: run the script several time
column369:
20/Mar/2019 09:36 AM;niallconnolly;Hi Ashok,

I am assigning this Plat ticket to you as discussed.

Thanks,

Niall
column370:
26/Mar/2019 03:47 PM;niallconnolly;Hi Ashok, 

Do you have any update on this ticket?

Regards,

Niall
column371:
11/Apr/2019 11:04 AM;AManayangath;Notes:

I can not find any reference to the standaloneWatchlistDownload.sh in recent WLM User Guides - I checked as far back as version 6.7.

I found an even older version of the guide - from version 6.1 - on Confluence: http://confluence/download/attachments/6553639/Watchlist_Management_User_Manual.pdf?version=1&modificationDate=1253190470000

This guide explains how that shell script was used under a section titled "14.3.1 Downloading Watchlists".

I am not sure why this has been taken out of later version of WLM User Guide, and/or IF that is still supported. I can see the shell/bat scripts are still in the product.

I will need to do some more research about updating the user guide aspect of this ticket.

thanks,
Ashok.

column1: Incorrect record counts in ACQ_BATCH_PROCESS table
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Found in the QA database jdbc:oracle:thin:@IEDC1NKMORA04:1521:PERF122.  The RECORD_COLUMN in the ACQ_BATCH_PROCESS table is increasing for Processing jobs each time the AML processing schedule runs (see attachment IncreasingRecordCounts.PNG).  However in this case, the same amount of transactions are being processed in each instance (see BatchProcessNorkomLog.PNG).  This suggests that the problem is with the table only and the amount of transactions processed does not include transactions from the previous process days. 

Doha Bank are multi-org, if that makes a difference.
column352:
- Set up a multi org environment
- Process AML for multiple days in a row
- See the ACQ_BATCH_PROCESS.RECORD_COUNT for the "Processing" job is continuously accumulating instead of showing the number for each datasource processed independently

column1: Configuring a user without /Scenario Manager/Scenario permissions causes connection spikes
column10: Core Norkom product platform, all releases.
column74:
Our client has attempted to create a user that is able to perform basic Shared List management, but without the */Scenario Manager/Scenario* effective permission.

When logging in with this user, performing certain actions which the user is not authorised to do (e.g. cancelling an attempt to create an exempt list for a shared list currently in production) will cause the application will hang.

It appears that this action is triggering some kind of nested loop which immediately opens up the max number of DB connections available (as per WAS configuration) - see DB screenshot attached. 

With our current settings, the timeout will eventually kill the connections, and the environment will return for use with the appropriate permissions warning logged in the front end - see CF-10038 screenshot attached.

Also attached is norkom.log showing the line:
_User-1180 - Session-1003 WARN  RequestUtils:200 - No FormBeanConfig found under 'viewScreen'_
repeating multiple times within the nested loop, and the subsequent timeout stack traces thrown.

Client has been advised to change their configuration and permissions setup - in the meantime we are raising this ticket should PLAT wish to prevent the way error with the above permissions setup currently manifests itself.
column75:
Front end URL: http://10.222.40.254:9080/netreveal/login.do
username: craviewonly
password: Password01$
column352:
Attached is a word doc from the client detailing the actions can be performed to replicate (including the required application-configuration.xml and base-configuration.xml attached).

When restoring the /Scenario Manager/Scenario permission, the error is no longer seen.
column369: 27/Jan/2020 04:58 PM;Pnolan;Sounds similar to [FCENG-4453|https://engineering/jira/browse/FCENG-4453], which was resolved in the 8.0.1 release
column370: 27/Jan/2020 05:06 PM;jamescole;Hi [~Pnolan]. That looks correct to me. Is there a patch available to back port for 7.6?
column371: 27/Jan/2020 05:13 PM;Pnolan;James, there are no plans to backport this change to earlier releases (including 7.6). Engineering recommends that all customers upgrade to the latest version to take advantage of defect fixes and security updates. If that is not possible in this case, you may need to follow up with CE to determine if this fix can be applied directly to the project - thanks.
column372: 27/Jan/2020 05:16 PM;jamescole;Thanks [~Pnolan]. Will action the above and advise client accordingly.
